Item.Name: Abs
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the absolute value of the specified value.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the absolute value of v.

Item.Name: ActiveClass
Item.Description: Returns the name of the active class of the document.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the name of the active document class.

Item.Name: ActLayer
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to the currently active layer in a document.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the active layer of the document.

Item.Name: ActSSheet
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the handle to the currently active worksheet.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the active worksheet.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new GetTopVisibleWS. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: ActSymDef
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to the currently active symbol.[[BR]][[BR]]If the active symbol is not in the active document, it will be imported, and the imported symbol will be returned.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the active symbol of the document.

Item.Name: Add3DPt
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] adds a vertex into a newly created 3D polygon.[[BR]][[BR]]Calls to [[name]] should be made between calls to BeginPoly3D, which initiates polygon creation, and EndPoly3D, which terminates polygon creation. A minimum of two vertices must be created to define a valid 3D polygon object, and calculations may be performed within the BeginPoly3D-EndPoly3D structure, providing additional options for vertex generation.
Item.ShortDesc: This function adds a new point to the 3-D poly being constructed. Should be called only after BeginPoly3D is called. See BeginPoly3D, EndPoly3D.
Item.Example: BeginPoly3D;[[BR]] Add3DPt(0,0,0);[[BR]] Add3DPt(2,0,0);[[BR]] Add3DPt(2,2,0);[[BR]] Add3DPt(1,3,0);[[BR]] Add3DPt(0,2,0);[[BR]] Add3DPt(0,0,0);[[BR]]EndPoly3D;[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]

Item.Name: AddCavity
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a wall cavity in a new wall object. The newly defined cavity becomes the default for all subsequently defined walls.[[BR]][[BR]]To apply a bitmap fill pattern, use positive value corresponding to the index of the bitmap pattern. To apply a vector fill pattern, use the negative of the vector fill index (index * -1). [[BR]][[BR]][[note:FillPatTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a cavity in the most recently created wall object. Cavity becomes default for all subsequent walls. This function is obsolete. Use InsertNewComponent instead.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for Version 12: This function is obsolete. Use InsertNewComponent instead. (NZH 5-9-05)
Item.Example: { Create wall object with 1" wide cavity using black pattern fill.}[[BR]]DoubLines(6");[[BR]][[name]](True, 1", 2", 2);[[BR]]Wall(0, 1, 9, 1);[[BR]][[BR]]{ Create wall object with 1" wide cavity using a custom hatch fill.}[[BR]]DoubLines(6");[[BR]][[name]](True, 1", 2", -Name2Index('My Hatch'));[[BR]]Wall(0, 1, 9, 1);[[BR]]

Param.Name: leftOffDistance
Param.Desc: Left edge offset from wall centerline.

Param.Name: rightOffDistance
Param.Desc: Right edge offset from wall centerline.

Item.Name: AddPoint
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] adds a vertex point to a newly created polygon. [[name]] is designed to be used with BeginPoly and EndPoly to define new polygon objects via VectorScript.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Adds a vertex point to a new polygon/polyline.
Item.Example: BeginPoly;[[BR]] AddPoint(0,0);[[BR]] AddPoint(2,0);[[BR]] AddPoint(2,2);[[BR]] AddPoint(1,3);[[BR]] AddPoint(0,2);[[BR]] AddPoint(0,0);[[BR]]EndPoly;[[BR]]{creates a polygon object}[[BR]][[BR]]BeginPoly;[[BR]] AddPoint(x,y);[[BR]] x := x + 1;[[BR]] y := y + 1;[[BR]] AddPoint(x,y);[[BR]] x:= x + 1;[[BR]] y := y - 1;[[BR]] AddPoint(x,y);[[BR]]EndPoly;[[BR]]{creates a polygon with vertices as calculated}

Item.Name: AddSolid
Item.Description: Function [[name]] creates a new solid addition object from the referenced source objects. If the operation succeeds, the source objects will then be contained within the newSolid object, as the primitives which define the CSG.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:SolidsResultsTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a solid addition from the referenced objects.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h1, h2, h3 :HANDLE;[[BR]] int :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] DSelectAll; BeginXtrd(0, 1); CallTool(-203); h1 := FSActLayer; EndXtrd;[[BR]] DSelectAll; BeginXtrd(0, 1); CallTool(-203); h2 := FSActLayer; EndXtrd;[[BR]] int := AddSolid(h1, h2, h3);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: obj1
Param.Desc: Handle to source object for add operation.

Param.Name: obj2
Param.Desc: Handle to source object for add operation.

Param.Name: newSolid
Param.Desc: Handle to resultant object from add operation.

Item.Name: AddSymToWall
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] inserts a specified symbol into the referenced wall.
Item.ShortDesc: Inserts a specified symbol into the referenced wall.
Item.Comments: See AddSymToWallEdge[[BR]][sd 8/13/98]

Param.Name: symbolName
Param.Desc: Name of symbol to insert in wall.

Item.Name: AddVertex3D
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] adds a 3D vertex to the referenced 3D polygon object.
Item.ShortDesc: Adds a vertex to the referenced 3D polygon.

Item.Name: AddWallPeak
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a wall peak in the referenced wall object.
Item.ShortDesc: Adds a wall peak to the referenced wall.

Item.Name: AlrtDialog
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] displays an alert dialog to the user.
Item.ShortDesc: Displays an alert message to the user.
Item.Example: AlrtDialog('No objects are selected for this operation.');

Param.Name: message
Param.Desc: The alert message to be displayed.

Item.Name: AngDialog
Item.Description: Function [[name]] displays a dialog box which requests the user to enter an angle value. The dialog automatically screens for valid numeric input, and will accept supported angle formats.
Item.ShortDesc: Displays dialog box that requests a user input angle

Item.Name: AngDialog3D
Item.Description: Function [[name]] displays a dialog box which requests the user to enter three angle values. [[name]] will accept angle values in any supported angle format.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Displays a dialog box that allows a user to input 3D angles.

Item.Name: AngularDim
Item.Description:
Procedure [[name]] creates an angular dimension in the document.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:DimFlagNote]][[BR]][[BR]]Angular Dimension

[[BR]][[fig:angdim.gif]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates angular dimensions.

Param.Name: startPt
Param.Desc: X-Y coordinates of dimension start point.

Param.Name: endPt
Param.Desc: X-Y coordinates of dimension end point

Param.Name: vert1
Param.Desc: X-Y coordinates of dimension arc center.

Param.Name: textOffsetDistance
Param.Desc: Offset from dimension arc center (radius of the dimension arc).

Param.Name: posAngle
Param.Desc: Position angle of dimension text(from start). Auto position text overrides this value.

Item.Name: Append
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] opens the specified file for writing and appends the data to the end of the file. Existing data in the file is NOT overwritten.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:FilePathNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Opens a file for writing, appending new data to end of file.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] fileName :STRING; [[BR]] major, minor, maintenance, platform :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetVersion(major, minor, maintenance, platform);[[BR]] IF platform = 1 THEN BEGIN[[BR]] fileName := 'Macintosh HD:Example.txt';[[BR]] END ELSE BEGIN[[BR]] fileName := 'C:\Example.txt';[[BR]] END;[[BR]] Append(fileName);[[BR]] WriteLn('example text');[[BR]] Close(fileName);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: fileName
Param.Desc: Name of file to open for writing.

Item.Name: Arc
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates an arc object, or a polyline object, in the active document. If [[p:1]] and [[p:2]] define a perfect square, an arc will be created, with its center point at the center of the square. If [[p:1]] and [[p:2]] define a rectangle, a polyline will be created which will represent the oval segment defined by the rectangle.
Item.ShortDesc: Draws an arc in a Vectorworks document.
Item.Example: Arc(0,0,2,2,45,90);[[BR]]{draws an 90 degree arc with a start angle of 45 degrees}[[BR]][[BR]]

Param.Name: p1
Param.Desc: Top left coordinate of bounding box of oval defining the arc.

Param.Name: p2
Param.Desc: Bottom right coordinate of bounding box of oval defining the arc.

Item.Name: ArcCos
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the arccosine (in radians) of the specified value.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the arccosine in radians.

Param.Name: v
Param.Desc: Numeric value for which to find the cosine.

Item.Name: ArcSin
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the arc sine (in radians) of the specified value.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the arcsine in radians.

Param.Name: v
Param.Desc: Numeric value for which to find the sine.

Item.Name: ArcTan
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the arc tangent (in radians) of the specified value.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the arctangent in radians.

Param.Name: v
Param.Desc: Numeric value for which to find the tangent.

Item.Name: ArcTo
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates an arc vertex with a point of intersection at the specified coordinate point.[[BR]][[BR]]The endpoints of the arc are tangent to the control segments which intersect at [[p:1]]. If a radius of 0 is passed as the parameter, the arc endpoints will be at the vertices preceding and following the arc spline vertex.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new arc spline vertex of the specified radius.
Item.Example: BeginPoly;[[BR]] LineTo(-1",2");[[BR]] LineTo(-2 1/2",1/2");[[BR]] CurveTo(-1 1/2",-1 1/2");[[BR]] LineTo(1",-1/2");[[BR]] ArcTo(1",1 1/2",1/2");[[BR]]EndPoly;[[BR]]{creates a polyline object}

Item.Name: ArrowHead
Item.Description: Obsolete procedure.
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete procedure. Replaced by Marker.
Item.Comments: Deleted this obsolete function as of 9.0.0b7 - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]][[BR]]Sets the current default arrow head style for the document. See FMarker for a description of the style value. This function has been replaced by Marker.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/13/98]

Item.Name: ArrowSize
Item.Description: Obsolete procedure.
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete procedure. Replaced by Marker.
Item.Comments: Deleted this obsolete function as of 9.0.0b7 - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]][[BR]]Sets the document default arrow head size to size in points. Legal values include 1 through 255. This function has been replaced by Marker.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/13/98]

Item.Name: AutoKey
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns TRUE if a non-modifier keyboard character has been continually depressed for longer than the system defined key repeat rate. If a keyboard character has been continually depressed, then ASCII code of the character is returned in parameter [[p:1]].[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ModifierKeyNote]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if a non-modifier key has been continually pressed. Also returns the ASCII code of the key that was pressed.
Item.Example: WHILE NOT AutoKey(keyHit) DO[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] SysBeep;[[BR]] SysBeep;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]Message('The key pressed was ',keyHit);[[BR]]

Param.Name: asciiCode
Param.Desc: The ASCII code of the key depressed.

Item.Name: BeginColumn
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a column object in a Vectorworks document using 2D object creation procedure calls to define the "template" for the column object. [[BR]][[BR]]After specifying object procedure calls to define the column, you should call EndGroup to complete the column definition and create the actual object.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a column object in a Vectorworks document.
Item.Comments: BeginColumn takes the group of objects that follow, until there is an EndGroup, and converts them into a column with height equal to column distance.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/17/98]

Item.Name: BeginFloor
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a new floor object in a Vectorworks document. [[name]] uses 2D object creation procedure calls to define the "template" for the object. [[BR]][[BR]]After specifying object procedure calls to define the floor object, you should call EndGroup to complete the column definition and create the actual object.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new floor object in a Vectorworks document.

Item.Name: BeginFolder
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a new symbol folder in a Vectorworks document. Any symbols or symbol folders created after the current call to [[name]] will be nested inside the new symbol folder. A call to EndFolder will complete the creation of the symbol folder, which is then generated in the Vectorworks document.[[BR]][[BR]]To name the new symbol folder, precede [[name]] with a call to NameObject.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new symbol folder in a Vectorworks document.
Item.Example: NameObject('Object Symbols');[[BR]]BeginFolder;[[BR]] BeginSym('Oval Symbols');[[BR]] PenSize(14);[[BR]] PenPat(2);[[BR]] FillPat(1);[[BR]] FillFore(0,0,0);[[BR]] FillBack(65535,65535,65535);[[BR]] PenFore(0,0,0);[[BR]] PenBack(65535,65535,65535);[[BR]] Oval(-1/4",1/4",3/4",-3/4");[[BR]] EndSym;[[BR]]EndFolder;[[BR]]{creates the symbol folder 'Object Symbols', which contains a symbol}

Item.Name: BeginGroup
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a new group object in a Vectorworks document. Procedure calls subsequent to [[name]] and before EndGroup will be included in the new group object. [[name]] may be called repeatedly to created nested groups of objects.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new group object.
Item.Example: BeginGroup;[[BR]] Rect(-1,1,0.5,0);[[BR]] Rect(0,1.5,1,0.5);[[BR]] Oval(-1.5,0.5,-0.5,-0.5);[[BR]]EndGroup;[[BR]]{creates a group}[[BR]][[BR]]BeginGroup;[[BR]] Rect(-1,1,0,0.5);[[BR]] Rect(-1,0.5,-0.5,0);[[BR]] BeginGroup;[[BR]] Oval(-0.5,0.5,1,0);[[BR]] Oval(0,0,1,-0.5);[[BR]] EndGroup;[[BR]]EndGroup;[[BR]]{creates a group comprised of 2 rects and 1 group}

Item.Name: BeginMesh
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] begins the efinition of a 3D mesh object in Vectorworks. Any 3D point or planar object call after [[name]] will be included in the mesh object. [[BR]][[BR]]A mesh object allows the user to select and manipulate each vertex within its wire-frame model.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new 3D mesh object.

Item.Name: BeginMXtrd
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a multiple extrude object in a Vectorworks document. [[name]] uses 2D object creation procedure calls to define the "template" for the object.[[BR]][[BR]]You should call EndMXtrd after the object creation procedures to complete the definition and generate the object in the document.[[BR]][[BR]]A multiple extrude object is a 3D object created from three or more 2D objects, which are used as defining shapes for the extruded object.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new multiple extrude object.

Param.Name: startDistance
Param.Desc: Start distance from document ground plane.

Param.Name: endDistance
Param.Desc: End distance from document ground plane.

Item.Name: BeginPoly3D
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a 3D polygon in the Vectorworks document. This procedure is used with Add3DPt and EndPoly3D to create 3D polygons. Any calls to the Add3DPt procedure after [[name]] will be included in the 3D polygon.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new 3D polygon.
Item.Example: BeginPoly3D;[[BR]] Add3DPt(0,0,0);[[BR]] Add3DPt(2,0,0);[[BR]] Add3DPt(2,2,0);[[BR]] Add3DPt(1,3,0);[[BR]] Add3DPt(0,2,0);[[BR]] Add3DPt(0,0,0);[[BR]]EndPoly3D;[[BR]][[BR]]

Item.Name: BeginPoly
Item.Description: Procedures [[name]] creates a new polygon or polyline object in a Vectorworks document. When used with vertex creation procedure calls, [[name]] and EndPoly() define the polygon object on a vertex by vertex basis.[[BR]][[BR]]A minimum of two vertices must be created, and calculations may be performed within the creation structure between vertex calls, thus allowing additional flexibility in object generation.Hidden edges may be created by using use MoveTo() or Move() between vertex calls.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new polygon or polyline object.

Item.Name: BeginRoof
Item.Description:
Procedure [[name]] creates a simple roof object in a Vectorworks document. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:RoofMiterStyleTable]][[BR]][[BR]]3-D View of Roof

[[BR]][[BR]][[fig:roof.gif]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Invokes roof creation mode.

Param.Name: p1
Param.Desc: Coordinates of roof axis start point.

Param.Name: p2
Param.Desc: Coordinates of roof axis end point.

Param.Name: vertPart
Param.Desc: Dimension of vertical miter for double miter style.

Item.Name: BeginSweep
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a three-dimensional sweep object in the Vectorworks document. A sweep object is a two-dimensional template object which has been rotated about a specified point to create a 3D object. For example, a circle of radius 1" that is swept about a point 2" to the right of the circles center wil create a sweep object resembling a donut, also known as a torus.[[BR]][[BR]]The sweep increment may also be thought of as the spacing between the duplication of radial sweep mesh lines. The "pitch", or vertical distance, is the distance that the sweep object will travel for every 360Â° of rotation. In sweep objects, the 2D template object may also be translated as it rotates, resulting in a "corkscrew" effect. The vertical movement is determined by the following equation: vertical movement = pitch * ArcAngle/360.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:Sweep2DNote]][[BR]][[fig:sweep2d.gif]][[BR]][[note:Sweep3DNote]][[BR]][[fig:sweep3d.gif]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new sweep object.

Item.Name: BeginSym
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a new symbol definition ina Vectorworks document. [[BR]][[BR]]Any objects created after a call to [[name]] will be included in the symbol definition. A call to EndSym will complete the creation of the symbol, which is then generated in the Vectorworks document.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new symbol definition.
Item.Comments: Note: normally SetOriginAbsolute(0,0) should be called before calling this. The user origin is used as the insertion point for the symbol, but it may be out of bounds, in which case the symbol is still created but the center of the document is used instead for the insertion point.

Item.Name: BeginXtrd
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a 3D extrude object in a Vectorworks document. [[name]] uses 2D object creation procedure calls to define the "template" for the object. [[BR]][[BR]]You should call EndXtrd after the object creation procedures to complete the definition and generate the extrude object in the document.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new extrude object.

Param.Name: startDistance
Param.Desc: Start distance from document ground plane.

Param.Name: endDistance
Param.Desc: End distance from document ground plane.

Item.Name: BreakWall
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a break in a wall object on the left or the right at a specified offset location.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a wall break in the most recently created wall object.
Item.Example: MoveTo(2,3);[[BR]]WallTo(7,3);[[BR]]BreakWall(3",1",True);[[BR]]{creates a right hand 1" wall break 3" from the start of the wall}

Item.Name: CallTool
Item.Description: Activates the specified Vectorworks tool for a single use. After the tool has been used Vectorworks will revert back to the previously active tool.[[BR]][[BR]]Note: [[note:SetCallToolIDTableRef]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active tool. When finished, returns to the previously active tool.
Item.Comments: Changes the active tool to that specified by toolID. Waits until the user has executed the functionality of that tool, then switches back to the previously active tool & returns.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/13/98]

Item.Name: CapsLock
Item.Description: [[name]] returns TRUE if the Caps Lock was depressed during the last user event. This function operates with the MouseDown, KeyDown, AutoKey, GetPt, GetPtL, GetLine, and GetRect calls.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if the Caps Lock key was pressed.

Item.Name: CellHasNum
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns TRUE if the specified cell of a referenced worksheet contains a value or an equation which returns a numeric value.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if cell contains a numeric result.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new IsWSCellNumber and IsWSSubrowCellNumber. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: CellHasStr
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns TRUE if the specified cell of a referenced worksheet contains a value or an equation which returns a numeric value.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if cell contains a string result.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new IsWSCellString and IsWSSubrowCellString. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: CellString
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the string of a specified cell in the active worksheet
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the string of a specified cell in the active worksheet.
Item.Comments: Returns the string representation of the current worksheet's cell specified by 'row' and 'column' numbers. [sd 8/13/98][[BR]]OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new GetWSCellString and GetWSSubrowCellString. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: CellValue
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the numeric value of a specified cell in the active worksheet. If the specified cell is not a numeric type, then this function returns 0.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the numeric value of a specified cell in the active worksheet.
Item.Comments: Returns the floating point representation of the current worksheet's cell specified by "row" and "column" numbers. If the specified cell is not a numeric type, then this function returns 0. [sd 8/13/98][[BR]]OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new GetWSCellValue and GetWSSubrowCellValue. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: CircularDim
Item.Description:
Procedure [[name]] creates a diameter or radial dimension in a Vectorworks document.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:DimFlagNote]][[BR]][[BR]]Circular Dimension

[[BR]][[fig:circdim.gif]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a radial or diameter dimension.

Param.Name: startPt
Param.Desc: X-Y coordinates of dimension start point.

Param.Name: endPt
Param.Desc: X-Y coordinates of dimension end point.

Param.Name: box1
Param.Desc: X-Y coordinates of top left corner of object bounding box

Param.Name: box2
Param.Desc: X-Y coordinates of bottom right corner of object bounding box

Param.Name: textOffsetDistance
Param.Desc: Offset distance of text from dimension line(witness leader length).

Item.Name: ClassList
Item.Description: Returns the name of the specified class in the document class list. For example, ClassList(4) will return the name of the fourth class in the list.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the name of the specified class in the document's class list.
Item.Comments: NOTE: the manual has said that ClassLIst(4) returns the 4th class in the list, but it actually was returning the 5th class. BF changed the function on 3/98 so it does return the 4th class.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: Index of class in class list (range of 1- n).

Item.Name: ClassNum
Item.Description: Returns the total number of classes in the active document.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of classes in the document.

Item.Name: ClearCavities
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] resets the default cavity style of wall objects to no cavities.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Resets the default cavity style to none.
Item.Example: DoubLines(6");[[BR]]AddCavity(True,1",2",2);[[BR]]Wall(0,1,9,1);[[BR]]ClearCavities;[[BR]]Wall(0,2,11,2);[[BR]]{creates a wall with a cavity, then creates a wall without a cavity}

Item.Name: Close
Item.Description: Procedure Close closes the specified text file.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:FilePathNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Closes a currently open text file.
Item.Example: BEGIN[[BR]] Open('MyData');[[BR]] WHILE NOT EOF('MyData') DO[[BR]] ReadLn(a,b,c,d);[[BR]] [[name]]('MyData');[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]

Item.Name: CloseSS
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] closes the referenced worksheet.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Closes the referenced worksheet.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new ShowWS. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: ColorIndexToRGB
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] converts the Vectorworks palette colors from the colors' palette position index to its red, green, and blue component values. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ColorTableNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Converts a color palette index to RGB values.
Item.Example: [[name]](45,r,g,b);[[BR]]{returns the color value components of the color at position 45}

Item.Name: Command
Item.Description: [[name]] returns TRUE if the Command key (Mac) or Control key (Windows) was depressed during the last user event. This function operates with the MouseDown, KeyDown, AutoKey, GetPt, GetPtL, GetLine, and GetRect calls.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if the Command/Control key was pressed.

Item.Name: Copy
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a substring from a specified source string.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a specified substring from a text string.

Item.Name: CopyMode
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the transfer mode for the active design layer. If a sheet layer is active, the procedure has no effect.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:XferModeTable]][[BR]][[BR]]The design layer will only be imaged with the transfer mode on systems which support it, like Windows. Setting the transfer mode to a mode other than Copy (i.e. 8, Paint mode), when the current layer transparency percentage is 0, will also automatically change the layer transparency percentage to 50. Similarly, setting the transfer mode to Copy, when the current layer transparency percentage is greater than 0, will also automatically change the layer transparency percentage to 0. This is to approximately preserve the appearance of the layer on systems that don't support transfer modes, like Quartz on the Mac.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the layer transfer mode for the active layer.
Item.Comments: Sets the layer transfer mode for the actlve layer.[[BR]][[BR]]Valid mode values are:[[BR]]8 - Copy[[BR]]9 - OR[[BR]]10 - XOR[[BR]]11 - BIC[[BR]]12 - Inverse Copy[[BR]]13 - Inverse OR[[BR]]14 - Inverse XOR[[BR]]15 - Inverse BIC[[BR]][[BR]]This procedure may also set the layer transparency to approximate the given transfer mode on systems that don't support transfer modes.

Item.Name: CopySymbol
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] will copy a symbol into the active document from a user specified source document. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:FilePathNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Copies the specified symbol from the source document into the active document.
Item.Result: Returns a BOOLEAN value indicating the success or failure of the import operation.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE CopySym;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] theSymbolName :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] theSymbolName := 'Fax';[[BR]] IF [[name]]('Object Libraries\Office Equipment.mcd', theSymbolName) [[BR]] THEN Symbol(theSymbolName, 0, 0, 0);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(CopySym);

Param.Name: filePath
Param.Desc: File path to document, relative to the application folder.

Item.Name: Cos
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the cosine of the specified value. The base value is assumed to represent an angle in radians.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the cosine of the specified value.

Param.Name: v
Param.Desc: The angle for which to find the cosine.

Item.Name: CreateLight
Item.Description: CreateLight creates a new light object in the active VectorScript document. [[BR]][[BR]]A new light objects' color is defaulted to white, and brightness is defaulted to 75%. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:LightTypeTable]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new light object.

Param.Name: castShadow
Param.Desc: Specifies whether light will cast shadow.

Item.Name: CurveThrough
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] fits a cubic spline through the specified point.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a cubic spline vertex at the specified point.

Item.Name: CurveTo
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a bezier vertex point at the specified point. Parameter [[p:1]] specifies the coordinate location of the vertex.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a bezier spline vertex at the specified point.

Item.Name: Date
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a formatted date and time string.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:DateFormatTable]][[BR]][[BR]][[note:DateStringFormatTable]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the current date and time as a string.
Item.Example: { All examples are for the date Friday, }[[BR]]{ Nov. 18, 1988 and the time 10:42:24 AM }[[BR]][[BR]][[name]](0,1);[[BR]]{returns Friday, November 18, 1988 10:42:24 AM}[[BR]][[BR]][[name]](0,0);[[BR]]{returns Friday, November 18, 1988}[[BR]][[BR]][[name]](2,2);[[BR]]{returns 10:42:24 AM}[[BR]][[BR]][[name]](2,1);[[BR]]{returns 11/18/88 10:42:24 AM}

Param.Name: dateFormat
Param.Desc: Specify how verbose or compact the resulting string is.

Param.Name: infoFormat
Param.Desc: Specify if result should contain date, time or both.

Item.Name: Deg2Rad
Item.Description: Function [[name]] converts the specified value (in degrees) to radians.
Item.ShortDesc: Converts decimal degrees into radians.

Item.Name: DelClass
Item.Description: Deletes the specified class from the active document. If there are objects in the class to be deleted, they are reassigned to the None class. [[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Deletes the specified class.

Item.Name: Delete
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] removes a substring from the specified source string.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Deletes a substring from the specified source string.
Item.Example: theStr:='A sample string';[[BR]][[name]](theStr,3,7);[[BR]]{deletes 'sample' from the string value}

Item.Name: DeleteObjs
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] deletes all selected objects on the active layer. Using this procedure when the layer display mode is Show/Snap/Modify will cause selected objects on any visible layer will be deleted.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Deletes all selected objects on the active layer.

Item.Name: DeleteWallSym
Item.Description: Function [[name]] deletes the referenced symbol from a wall object.
Item.ShortDesc: Deletes the referenced symbol from a wall.

Item.Name: DelName
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] deletes an object name from a Vectorworks document. The associated object is not affected by the name deletion.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Removes the specified name from the name list. Does not affect objects.

Item.Name: DelObject
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] deletes the referenced object from the document.
Item.ShortDesc: Deletes the referenced object.

Item.Name: DelRecord
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] removes an attached record from the referenced object.
Item.ShortDesc: Deletes the specified record from the referenced object.

Param.Name: name
Param.Desc: Name of record to be removed.

Item.Name: DelVertex
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] deletes a vertex from the referenced object. Parameter [[p:2]] specifies the vertex to be deleted.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Deletes the specified vertex of the referenced polygon/polyline.

Param.Name: vertexNum
Param.Desc: Index of vertex to be deleted.

Item.Name: DidCancel
Item.Description: Function [[name]] detects whether the Cancel button in a predefined dialog was pressed. [[name]] is intended for use with conditional statements to signal that a cancel event has occurred.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Detects selection of the Cancel button in a dialog.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] i : INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] i := IntDialog('Enter an integer:', '0');[[BR]] IF NOT DidCancel THEN BEGIN[[BR]] i := i*3;[[BR]] Message(i);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: DimArcText
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates an angular dimension object from the last arc object that was drawn using VectorScript.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates an angular dimension object from the last arc object.
Item.Comments: Creates an angular dimension object from the last arc object that was drawn using VectorScript
Item.Example: Arc(0,0,2,2,45d,90d);[[BR]]DimArcText;[[BR]]{ creates a dimension from the new arc object }

Item.Name: DimText
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] converts the most recently created line object in VectorScript to a dimension.
Item.ShortDesc: Converts most recently created line to dimension.
Item.Comments: Creates a linear dimension object from the last line object that was drawn using VectorScript.

Item.Name: Distance
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the distance between the two specified coordinate locations.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the distance between (x1,y1) and (x2,y2).

Item.Name: DistDialog
Item.Description: Function [[name]] displays a dialog box which requests the user to enter a distance value.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] automatically screens for valid numeric input.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Displays a dialog box that requests the user to input an distance.

Item.Name: DoMenu
Item.Description: Obsolete procedure.
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete procedure. See DoMenuTextByName.
Item.Comments: Deleted this obsolete function as of 9.0.0b7 - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]][[BR]]Obsolete. Non-functional in Vectorworks 8.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/17/98]

Item.Name: DoMenuText
Item.Description: Obsolete procedure.
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete procedure. See DoMenuTextByName.
Item.Comments: As of 9.0.0b7, DoMenuText will generate a runtime error if the user attempts to execute a main application menu item. It will continue to work wor worksheet menu items using the WS prefix until 10.0.0, when it will be removed completely. - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]]

Item.Name: DoMenuTextByName
Item.Description: Calls the specified Vectorworks menu command item.[[BR]][[BR]]If the item is part of a Vectorworks menu chunk, pass the position of the item within the chunk as the second parameter. For menu items that are not part of a chunk, pass 0 as the second parameter.[[BR]][[BR]]Note: [[name]] uses the internal Vectorworks menu item name to reference the menu command, and calls to this procedure will work on localized (international) versions of Vectorworks without modification. Note also that when calling VS plug-ins, you have to use the filename (which could be different from the internal plug-in name).[[BR]][[BR]][[note:DoMenuTextTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Calls the specified Vectorworks menu item.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE [[name]]Example;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] [[name]]('Print',0); {calls the print dialog}[[BR]] [[name]]('Standard Views',8); {sets view to right isometric}[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN([[name]]Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: Menu chunk item position (range of 1 - n).

Item.Name: DoubleFixedTolerance
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] is used with dimensioning procedures to define a tolerance for the most recently created dimension object.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Defines a double fixed tolerance for the most recently created dimension.
Item.Example: LinearDim(-2",2",1",2",-3",0,771,771,0.75);[[BR]][[name]](TRUE,FALSE,'','','yes','no');[[BR]]{defines a dimension with a double fixed tolerance}

Item.Name: DoubleTolerance
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] is used with dimensioning procedures to define a tolerance for the most recently created dimension.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Defines a double tolerance for the most recently created dimension.
Item.Example: LinearDim(-2",2",1",2",-3",0,771,771,0.75);[[BR]][[name]](True,False,'est. ','',1/16",1/16");[[BR]]{defines a dimension with a double tolerance}

Item.Name: DoubLines
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the line spacing width for double-line tools.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active double line width spacing.

Item.Name: DrwSize
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the drawing area of the document.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active printing page size.
Item.Example: [[name]](2,3);[[BR]]{sets the drawing size to 2 x 3 sheets}

Param.Name: rows
Param.Desc: Number of sheet rows comprising total document area.

Param.Name: columns
Param.Desc: Number of sheet columns comprising total document area.

Item.Name: Duplicate
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] copies the currently selected objects and moves them the specified offset distance.
Item.ShortDesc: Duplicates selected objects with an offset of (dX,dY).
Item.Example: Rect(0,1,1,0);[[BR]][[name]](2,0);[[BR]]{duplicates the rectangle 2 units right of the original}

Item.Name: EndFolder
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] completes symbol folder creation in VectorScript. When [[name]] is called, the any procedure calls defined since a call to BeginFolder are used to create symbols and/or symbol folders.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Completes symbol folder creation.

Item.Name: EndGroup
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] completes the creation of a new group object in a Vectorworks document. The new group object is then generated in the document.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Ends the creation of a group object and draws the object in the document.
Item.Example: BeginGroup;[[BR]]Rect(-1,1,0.5,0);[[BR]]Rect(0,1.5,1,0.5);[[BR]]Oval(-1.5,0.5,-0.5,-0.5);[[BR]][[name]];[[BR]]{creates a group object}[[BR]][[BR]]BeginGroup;[[BR]]Rect(-1,1,0,0.5);[[BR]]Rect(-1,0.5,-0.5,0);[[BR]]BeginGroup;[[BR]]Oval(-0.5,0.5,1,0);[[BR]]Oval(0,0,1,-0.5);[[BR]][[name]];[[BR]][[name]];[[BR]]{creates a group comprised of 2 rects and 1 group}

Item.Name: EndMesh
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] completes the definition of a mesh object within a Vectorworks document. On calling [[name]], the mesh is created in the document from the preceding object creation calls.[[BR]][[BR]]It is recommended to call ResetOrientation3D after 3D object creations in order to ensure that the new 3D objects will draw properly.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Ends the creation of a 3D mesh and draws the object in the document.

Item.Name: EndMXtrd
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] completes the definition of a multiple extrude object within a Vectorworks document. On calling [[name]], the object is created in the document from the preceding object creation calls.[[BR]][[BR]]It is recommended to call ResetOrientation3D after 3D object creations in order to ensure that the new 3D objects will draw properly.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Ends the creation of a multiple extrude and draws the object in the document.

Item.Name: EndPoly
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] completes the definition of a polygon or polyline object within a Vectorworks document. On calling [[name]], the object is created in the document from the preceding vertex creation calls.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Ends the creation of a polygon object and draws the object in the document

Item.Name: EndPoly3D
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] completes the definition of a multiple extrude object within a Vectorworks document. On calling [[name]], the object is created in the document from the preceding object creation calls.[[BR]][[BR]]It is recommended to call ResetOrientation3D after 3D object creations in order to ensure that the new 3D objects will draw properly.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Ends the creation of a 3D polygon and draws the object in the document.
Item.Example: BeginPoly3D;[[BR]] Add3DPt(0,0,0);[[BR]] Add3DPt(2,0,0);[[BR]] Add3DPt(2,2,0);[[BR]] Add3DPt(1,3,0);[[BR]] Add3DPt(0,2,0);[[BR]] Add3DPt(0,0,0);[[BR]][[name]];[[BR]][[BR]]

Item.Name: EndSweep
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] completes the definition of a sweep object within a Vectorworks document. On calling [[name]], the object is created in the document from the preceding object creation calls.[[BR]][[BR]]It is recommended to call ResetOrientation3D after 3D object creations in order to ensure that the new 3D objects will draw properly.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Ends the creation of a sweep object and draws the object in the document.

Item.Name: EndSym
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] completes symbol creation in VectorScript. When [[name]] is called, the any procedure calls defined since a call to BeginSym are used to create the symbol.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Completes symbol creation.

Item.Name: EndXtrd
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] completes the definition of an extrude object within a Vectorworks document. On calling [[name]], the object is created in the document from the preceding object creation calls.[[BR]][[BR]]It is recommended to call ResetOrientation3D after 3D object creations in order to ensure that the new 3D objects will draw properly.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Ends the creation of an extrude object and draws the object in the document.

Item.Name: EOF
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns TRUE if the file pointer of an open text file has reached the end of the file (EOF marker). Function [[name]] is used with Procedures Read and ReadLn to ensure proper file reading and closure. Parameter [[p:1]] specifies a text file which is open for reading or writing.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:FilePathNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if the end-of-file marker has been reached.
Item.Example: BEGIN[[BR]] Open('MyData');[[BR]] WHILE NOT [[name]]('MyData') DO[[BR]] ReadLn(a,b,c,d);[[BR]] Close('MyData');[[BR]]END;[[BR]]

Item.Name: EOLN
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns TRUE if the file pointer of an open text file has reached a carriage return within the file. Parameter [[p:1]] specifies a text file which is open for reading or writing.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE a carriage return has been reached.
Item.Example: BEGIN[[BR]] Open('MyData');[[BR]] WHILE NOT [[name]]('MyData') DO[[BR]] Read(a,b,c,d);[[BR]] Close('MyData');[[BR]]END;[[BR]]

Item.Name: EqualPt
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns whether the two specified coordinate locations are equal (i.e., the same point, to 12 significant digits).[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if the specified points are equal.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] x1, y1, x2, y2 :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] x1 := 1;[[BR]] y1 := 1;[[BR]] x2 := 1.0000000000001;[[BR]] y2 := 1.0000000000001;[[BR]] Message(EqualPt(x1, y1, x2, y2));[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: EqualRect
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns whether the two specified rectangular areas are equal. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if the specified rectangular areas are equal.

Param.Name: rectAp1
Param.Desc: Top left coordinate of rectangle A.

Param.Name: rectAp2
Param.Desc: Bottom right coordinate of rectangle A.

Param.Name: rectBp1
Param.Desc: Top left coordinate of rectangle B.

Param.Name: rectBp2
Param.Desc: Bottom right coordinate of rectangle B.

Item.Name: Exp
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the value of e to the x, where e is the base of the natural logarithms and x is the specified value.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the natural exponent of v.

Item.Name: FActLayer
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to the first object on the active layer. If the object does not exist, the function returns NIL.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the first object on the active layer.

Item.Name: FArrowHead
Item.Description: Obsolete procedure.
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete procedure. Replaced by FMarker.
Item.Comments: Deleted this obsolete function as of 9.0.0b7 - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]][[BR]]Returns the current default arrow head style for the document. See FMarker for a description of the style value. This function has been replaced by FMarker.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/14/98][[BR]]

Item.Name: FArrowSize
Item.Description: Obsolete procedure.
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete procedure. Replaced by FMaker.
Item.Comments: Deleted this obsolete function as of 9.0.0b7 - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]][[BR]]Returns the current default arrow head size for the document in points. This function has been replaced by FMarker.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/14/98]

Item.Name: FFillBack
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the current fill background color. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the active fill background color setting.

Item.Name: FFillFore
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the current fill foreground color. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the active fill foreground color setting.

Item.Name: FFillPat
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the current fill pattern setting.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:FillPatTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the current active fill pattern setting. A positive value corresponds to the index into the pattern palette. If set to a hatch, it returns the negative of the internal index of the hatch.

Item.Name: Field
Item.Description: Obsolete. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete function. See SetRField.
Item.Comments: Obsolete function maintained for compatibility with old scripts. Use "SetRField" for new scripts. See "SetRField".[[BR]][[BR]]Update the RecordNode attached to object "h" by setting the field "s2" of format "s1" to the value "s3". The object is not redrawn immediately, so don't call this for a symbol which uses the "link text to record" feature.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 9/14/98]

Item.Name: FillBack
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the active fill background color setting for the document. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active fill background color.

Param.Name: color
Param.Desc: RGB color value to set as active fill background color.

Item.Name: FillFore
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the active fill foreground color setting for the document. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active fill foreground color.

Param.Name: color
Param.Desc: RGB color value to set as active fill foreground color.

Item.Name: FillPat
Item.Description: Procedure FillPat sets the active fill pattern for the document. Any objects created after a calling this procedure will use the specified fill pattern.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:FillPatTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active fill pattern. A positive value corresponds to the index into the pattern palette. To set it to a hatch, use the negative of the internal index of the hatch.

Param.Name: patNumber
Param.Desc: Index of fill pattern to be set as document default.

Item.Name: FIn3D
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to the first component object in the referenced 3D object definition.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the first component of the referenced 3D object.

Item.Name: FInFolder
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to the first object in the referenced symbol folder. The object can be either a symbol definition or a nested symbol folder.[[BR]]If the folder is empty, the function returns NIL.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the first symbol definition within the referenced symbol folder.

Param.Name: sfHd
Param.Desc: Handle to symbol definition or symbol folder.

Item.Name: FInGroup
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to the first component object of the referenced group.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the first component object of the referenced group.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h :HANDLE;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] h := FInGroup(FSActLayer);[[BR]] WHILE h <> NIL DO BEGIN[[BR]] SetClass(h, 'None');[[BR]] h := NextObj(h);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: FInLayer
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to the first object within the referenced layer. If the layer is empty, the function returns NIL.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the first object in the referenced layer.

Item.Name: FInSymDef
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to the first component object within the referenced symbol definition.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the first component of the referenced symbol definition.

Item.Name: FLayer
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to the first layer in a Vectorworks document.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the first layer in a document.

Item.Name: FMarker
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the active marker style parameters.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:MarkerStyleNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the active marker settings - OBSOLETE procedure: Use GetDefaultBeginningMarker and/or GetDefaultEndMarker instead.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for VW2008: Use GetDefaultBeginningMarker and/or GetDefaultEndMarker instead.[[BR]]Style is an 8 bit quantity interpreted as follows:[[BR]][[BR]]Bit 0 indicates the visibility of a marker at the start of the line.[[BR]]Bit 1 indicates the visibility of a marker at the end of the line.[[BR]]Bits 2 - 7 indicate the index of the marker style to be used.[[BR]][[BR]]Size is in page-inches. Legal values are 0.0 to 2.0.[[BR]][[BR]]Angle is in degrees.[[BR]][sd 8/14/98]
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] style :INTEGER;[[BR]] size :REAL;[[BR]] ang :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] FMarker(style, size, ang);[[BR]] Message(style, ' ', size, ' ', ang);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]][[BR]]

Param.Name: size
Param.Desc: Returns marker size in inches measured in page space.

Item.Name: FndError
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns whether an error has occurred within a VectorScript subroutine. Provided as a debugging tool, [[name]] receives notification after execution of every line of code whether an error has occurred.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if a VectorScript error occurs. Used in debugging.
Item.Comments: This example isn't very helpful. JDW.[[BR]][sd 8/14/98]

Item.Name: FObject
Item.Description: Function FObject returns a handle to the first object in the active document. If the document is empty, the function returns NIL.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the first object in the active document.

Item.Name: FPenBack
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the current pen background color. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the active pen background color setting.

Item.Name: FPenFore
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the current pen foreground color of the document. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the active pen foreground color setting.

Item.Name: FPenPat
Item.Description: Deprecated - will generate error. Use FPenPatN instead.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Deprecated - will generate error. Use FPenPatN instead.
Item.Comments: Deprecated - will generate error. Use FPenPatN instead. Original description was: Function [[name]] returns the active pen pattern setting.

Item.Name: FPenSize
Item.Description: Function FPenSize returns the active pen size setting (in mils).[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the active line weight setting.

Item.Name: FSActLayer
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to the first selected object on the active layer. If no objects are selected, the function returns NIL.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the first selected object on the active layer.

Item.Name: FSObject
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the handle to the first selected object in the referenced layer. If no objects are selected, the function returns NIL.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the first selected object on the referenced layer.

Item.Name: FSymDef
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to the first symbol definition in the current document's symbol library. If the symbol library is empty, the function returns NIL.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the first symbol definition of the document.

Item.Name: Get3DCntr
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the three-dimensional center point of the referenced 3D object.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the 3D center point of the referenced object.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE IncreaseExtr;[[BR]] {This script increases extruded objects in the selection by a user requested value.}[[BR]] {by Paolo, on the VectorScript bulletin board}[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] oggetto :HANDLE;[[BR]] increaseValue :REAL;[[BR]][[BR]]FUNCTION Increase(h :HANDLE) :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] height, width, depth :REAL;[[BR]] xRot, yRot, zRot :REAL;[[BR]] p0X, p0Y, p0Z :REAL;[[BR]] p1X, p1Y, p1Z :REAL;[[BR]] result, isMirroredXY :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] {check if the obj is an extrusion}[[BR]] if (GetType(h) = 24) THEN BEGIN[[BR]] result := Get3DOrientation(h, xRot, yRot, zRot, isMirroredXY);[[BR]] Get3DCntr(h, p0X, p0Y, p0Z);[[BR]] [[BR]] SetRot3D(h, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);[[BR]] {here depth = extrusion value}[[BR]] Get3DInfo(h, height, width, depth);[[BR]] [[BR]] {I increase the depth}[[BR]] SET3DInfo(h, height, width, depth + increaseValue);[[BR]][[BR]] SET3DRot(h, xRot, yRot, zRot , 0,0,0);[[BR]] [[BR]] Get3DCntr(h, p1X, p1Y, p1Z);[[BR]] [[BR]] {move of the misplacement p0-p1}[[BR]] Move3DObj(h, p0X-p1X, p0Y-p1Y, p0Z-p1Z);[[BR]] Get3DCntr(h, p1X, p1Y, p1Z);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] increase := FALSE;[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] {ask the value to increase}[[BR]] increaseValue := RealDialog('Increase extrusions in the selection of this value','10');[[BR]] {apply to the selected set of objects}[[BR]] ForEachObjectInList(increase, 2, 0, oggetto);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(IncreaseExtr);[[BR]]

Param.Name: p
Param.Desc: Returns coordinates of object center point.

Param.Name: zValue
Param.Desc: Returns elevation of object center point.

Item.Name: Get3DInfo
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the height, width and depth values of the referenced 3D object.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns 3D dimensional information on the referenced object.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE GetBBox3D(h :HANDLE; VAR x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2 :REAL);[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] garb_r, z_span, z_center :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetBBox(h, x1, y1, x2, y2);[[BR]] Get3DInfo(h, garb_r, garb_r, z_span);[[BR]] Get3DCntr(h, garb_r, garb_r, z_center);[[BR]] z1 := z_center - (z_span / 2);[[BR]] z2 := z_center + (z_span / 2);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]

Item.Name: GetArc
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the start and sweep angle of the referenced arc or round wall.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the start angle and arc angle of the referenced arc.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE GetArcSetArcExample;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h :HANDLE;[[BR]] startAng, sweepAng :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] h := FSActLayer;[[BR]] GetArc(h, startAng, sweepAng);[[BR]] SetArc(h, startAng, sweepAng + 10);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(GetArcSetArcExample);

Item.Name: GetBBox
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the bounding box coordinates of the projection of the referenced object on the screen plane. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the bounding box of the projection of the referenced object on the screen plane.

Param.Name: p1
Param.Desc: Top left coordinate of bounding box.

Param.Name: p2
Param.Desc: Bottom right coordinate of bounding box.

Item.Name: GetBeamAngle
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the spread angle of the referenced spot light.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns beam spread angle of referenced light.

Item.Name: GetCAlign
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the alignment value of a cell in the referenced worksheet. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:CellAlignTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the alignment of a specified cell.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new GetWSCellAlignment. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: GetCellNum
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the numeric value of a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the numeric value of a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new GetWSCellValue and GetWSSubrowCellValue. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: GetCellStr
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the string value of a cell in the referenced worksheet. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the string value from a cell.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new GetWSCellString and GetWSSubrowCellString. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: GetClass
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the class assigned to the referenced object. None is returned if the object has no class assigned to it.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the class of the referenced object.

Item.Name: GetCVis
Item.Description: Returns the visibility status of the specified class.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ClassVisResultTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the visibility status of the specified class.
Item.Result: [[note:ClassVisResultTable]][[BR]]

Item.Name: GetCWidth
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the column width of a cell in the referenced worksheet. [[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the width of a specified cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new GetWSColumnWidth. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: GetDimText
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the dimension value displayed with the referenced object.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the dimension value of the referenced dimension.

Item.Name: GetFile
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] displays a standard file dialog which requests the user to select a text document.[[BR]][[BR]]It is advisable to call DidCancel after using this procedure and check that the user did not cancel the file selection process.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a path and name of a user selected file.
Item.Example: GetFile(fileName);[[BR]]IF NOT DidCancel THEN BEGIN[[BR]] Read(a,b,c);[[BR]] Close(fileName);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]{Select a file for reading via a file open dialog}[[BR]]

Item.Name: GetFillBack
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the fill background color of the referenced object. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the fill background of the referenced object.

Item.Name: GetFillFore
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the fill foreground color of the referenced object. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the fill foreground of the referenced object.

Item.Name: GetFldName
Item.Description: Returns the name of the specified field in the referenced record.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the name of the specified record field.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: Number of field whose name will be returned (in a range of 1-n).

Item.Name: GetFldType
Item.Description: Returns a constant indicating the data type of a specified field in the referenced record.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:FieldTypeConstantTable]][[BR]][[BR]][[note:ParamTypeConstantTable]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the field type of a specified record
Item.Comments: Returns a constant indicating which type of field is specified by the field number "t" of record "h". The field type constants are listed in an appendix in the vectorscript manual.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/14/98]

Item.Name: GetFName
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the current file name of the active document.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the name of the active document.

Item.Name: GetFont
Item.Description: Obsolete function.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete function. See GetTextFont.
Item.Comments: Deleted this obsolete function as of 9.0.0b7 - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]][[BR]]Returns the font ID of the font of the first character in the text block h. This function is obsolete. Use GetTextFont instead.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/14/98]

Item.Name: GetFPat
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the fill pattern of the referenced object.[[BR]][[BR]]A positive value corresponds to the index of the fill pattern on the pattern palette. A negative value corresponds to internal index of a vector fill pattern applied to the object.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:FillPatTable]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the fill pattern of the referenced object.

Item.Name: GetKeyDown
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] pauses execution of a VectorScript routine until a key is pressed by the user. When the key is pressed, the ASCII code of the key is returned.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Pauses execution, waiting for user keyboard input.

Item.Name: GetLayer
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to the layer of the referenced object. [[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the layer of the referenced object.

Item.Name: GetLightDirection
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the direction angles of the referenced light object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns direction information for the referenced light.

Item.Name: GetLightInfo
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the attributes of the referenced light object.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:LightTypeTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns attribute information for referenced light.

Item.Name: GetLightLocation
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the position of the referenced light object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns position of referenced light.

Item.Name: GetLine
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns two user selected points, and draws a temporary "rubberband" line when prompting for the second point. This cannot be used if there is a function anywhere in the calling chain.
Item.ShortDesc: Draws user interactive line and returns end point coordinates.

Param.Name: p1
Param.Desc: Returns coordinates of first user click.

Param.Name: p2
Param.Desc: Returns coordinates of second user click.

Item.Name: GetLName
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the name of the referenced layer.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the name of the referenced layer.
Item.Comments: Returns the name of the referenced layer.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/14/98]

Item.Name: GetLocPt
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the coordinate location of the referenced locus.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the X-Y coordinates of the referenced locus.

Item.Name: GetLocus3D
Item.Description: Procedure GetLocus3D returns the coordinates of the referenced 3D locus object.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the X-Y-Z coordinates of the referenced 3D locus.

Item.Name: GetLS
Item.Description: Deprecated - will generate error. Use GetLSN instead.
Item.ShortDesc: Deprecated - will generate error. Use GetLSN instead.
Item.Comments: Deprecated - will generate error. Use GetLSN instead. Original description was: Returns the line style of the referenced object.

Item.Name: GetLScale
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the scale of the referenced layer.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the scale of the referenced layer.

Item.Name: GetLVis
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the visibility of the referenced layer.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:LayerVisTable]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the visibility of the referenced layer. A value of 0 means normal visibility, a value of 2 means grayed, and a value of -1 means invisible.
Item.Example: FUNCTION GetLayerVisibility(layerHandle :handle) :INTEGER;[[BR]] {Returns the effective visibility of a layer.}[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetLayerVisibility := -1;[[BR]] IF layerHandle = ActLayer THEN GetLayerVisibility := 0 ELSE {Active layers are always visible.}[[BR]] IF (GetObjectVariableInt(ActLayer, 154) = 1) & (GetObjectVariableInt(layerHandle, 154) = 1) THEN BEGIN[[BR]] {If it's not the active layer, then the only way that it can be visible is if[[BR]] the active layer is a design layer, and so is layerHandle, and the combination[[BR]] of layer options and the layer's visibility will result in a visible layer.}[[BR]] IF (GetLayerOptions = 2) & (GetLVis(layerHandle) = 2) THEN GetLayerVisibility := 2 ELSE[[BR]] IF (GetLayerOptions = 2) & (GetLVis(layerHandle) = 0) THEN GetLayerVisibility := 2 ELSE[[BR]] IF (GetLayerOptions > 2) & (GetLVis(layerHandle) = 2) THEN GetLayerVisibility := 2 ELSE[[BR]] IF (GetLayerOptions > 2) & (GetLVis(layerHandle) = 0) THEN GetLayerVisibility := 0;[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] Message(GetLVis(GetLayerByName('Layer-1')));[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: GetLW
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the line weight of the referenced object. The value returned represents the width in mils.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the line weight(in mils) of the referenced object.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE GetLWExample;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] x, y :REAL;[[BR]] h :HANDLE;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetPt(x, y);[[BR]] h := PickObject(x, y);[[BR]] IF h <> NIL THEN Message(GetLW(h));[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(GetLWExample);[[BR]]

Item.Name: GetMouse
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] tracks and returns the current location of the cursor within the active Vectorworks document, allowing the cursor coordinates to be returned dynamically while moving the cursor onscreen.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the current X-Y coordinates of the mouse.
Item.Example: BEGIN[[BR]] WHILE NOT KeyDown(aCode) DO[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] GetMouse(CursX,CursY);[[BR]] Message('X : ',CursX,' Y : ',CursY);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]{displays the cursor coordinates as it is moved around onscreen}

Item.Name: GetName
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the object name of the referenced object. The function returns None if the object has no object name.[[BR]][[BR]]A handle to layer may not passed to this routine; to obtain a layer name, use GetLName.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the user specified name of the referenced object. If it has no name, the string "none" is returned.

Item.Name: GetObject
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to a named object. If the name does not exist, NIL is returned.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the specified named object.

Item.Name: GetOrigin
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the current origin location relative to the center of the page.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the location of the user specified origin.

Item.Name: GetPenBack
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the pen background color of the referenced object. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the pen background of the referenced object.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h :HANDLE;[[BR]] r, g, b :LONGINT;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] h := FSActLayer;[[BR]] GetPenBack(h, r, g, b);[[BR]] Message('r= ', r, ' g= ', g, ' b= ', b);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: GetPenFore
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the pen foreground color components of the referenced object. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the pen foreground of the referenced object.

Item.Name: GetPolyPt
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the coordinates of a specified vertex of the referenced object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the coordinates of the specified vertex of a referenced polygon.
Item.Example: for i := 1 to GetVertNum(thePoly) do[[BR]]begin [[BR]] GetPolyPt(thePoly, i, vertX, vertY);[[BR]]end; [[BR]]

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: Index of vertex (range of 1 to n).

Item.Name: GetPolyPt3D
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the coordinates of the specified vertex of the referenced mesh, 3D polygon, or NURBS curve object.[[BR]][[BR]]Error checking for valid index values must be provided by the programmer.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the location of the specified vertex of the referenced 3D polygon.
Item.Example: for i := 0 to (GetVertNum(thePoly) - 1) do[[BR]]begin [[BR]] GetPolyPt3D(thePoly, i, vertX, vertY, vertZ);[[BR]]end; [[BR]]

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: Index of vertex (range of 0 to n-1).

Item.Name: GetPref
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the on-off status of the specified preference item.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:PrefItemTableNote]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the on/off status of a specified preference item.

Item.Name: GetPt
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] switches the cursor to selection mode and allows the user to select a point in a Vectorworks document. This cannot be used if there is a function anywhere in the calling chain.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns user mouse click coordinates.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] pt :POINT;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetPt(pt.x, pt.y);[[BR]] Message(pt);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: GetPtL
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a temporary "rubberband" line from a specified point to the user selected end point. This cannot be used if there is a function anywhere in the calling chain.
Item.ShortDesc: Draws user interactive line from a specified point and returns coordinates of selected end point.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] pt1, pt2 :VECTOR;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetPt(pt1.x, pt1.y);[[BR]] GetPtL(pt1.x, pt1.y, pt2.x, pt2.y);[[BR]] MoveTo(pt1.x, pt1.y);[[BR]] LineTo(pt2.x, pt2.y);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: GetRecord
Item.Description: Returns the handle to a specified record attached the referenced object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the specified record.

Param.Name: cnt
Param.Desc: Index of attached record (in a range of 1 - n).

Item.Name: GetRect
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] draws a temporary "rubberband" rectangle onscreen, similar to a selection marquee. The user defines the rectangle by selecting two points which define the top left and bottom right of the rectangle. This cannot be used if there is a function anywhere in the calling chain.
Item.ShortDesc: Draws user interactive rectangle and returns corner point coordinates.

Param.Name: p1
Param.Desc: Returns coordinates of first user click.

Param.Name: p2
Param.Desc: Returns coordinates of second user click.

Item.Name: GetRot3D
Item.Description: Obsolete procedure.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete procedure. See Get3DOrientation.
Item.Comments: Deleted this obsolete function as of 9.0.0b7 - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]][[BR]]This is the old call to query 3D rotations. It was never documented & never supported returning the reflection status of the object. It has been replaced by Get3DOrientation.

Item.Name: GetRRDiam
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the horizontal and vertical diameters of the rounded corners of a rounded rectangle object.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns corner rounding values for the referenced object.

Item.Name: GetScreen
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the top-left and bottom-right corners of the display screen. These values will change as different sized screens are used. This procedure can be utilized to aid in development of dialog boxes, or as a check of screen size for sizing or displaying custom dialogs.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the display boundary coordinates of the current video device.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR [[BR]] x1, y1, x2, y2 :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetScreen(x1, y1, x2, y2);[[BR]] Message(x1,' ',y1,' ',x2,' ',y2);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: x1
Param.Desc: Returns X coordinate of top left of screen.

Param.Name: y1
Param.Desc: Returns Y coordinate of top left of screen.

Param.Name: x2
Param.Desc: Returns X coordinate of bottom right of screen.

Param.Name: y2
Param.Desc: Returns Y coordinate of bottom right of screen.

Item.Name: GetSDName
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the name of the referenced symbol definition.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the name of the referenced symbol definition.

Item.Name: GetSegPt1
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the X-Y coordinates of the start point of the referenced line, wall, or linear dimension object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the X-Y coordinates of the first point of the referenced line.

Item.Name: GetSegPt2
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the end point of the of the referenced line, wall, or linear dimension object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the X-Y coordinates of the second point of the referenced line.

Item.Name: GetSize
Item.Description: Obsolete function.
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete function. See GetTextSize.
Item.Comments: Deleted this obsolete function as of 9.0.0b7 - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]][[BR]]Returns the font size in points of the first character in the text block h. This function is obsolete. Use GetTextSize instead.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/14/98]

Item.Name: GetSpreadAngle
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the spread angle of the referenced spot light. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns light spread angle of referenced light.

Item.Name: GetStyle
Item.Description: Obsolete function.
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete function. See GetTextStyle.
Item.Comments: Deleted this obsolete function as of 9.0.0b7 - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]][[BR]]Returns the style of the first character in the text block h. This function is obsolete. Use GetTextStyle instead.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/14/98]

Item.Name: GetSymLoc
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the insertion point of the referenced symbol or plug-in object.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the X-Y location of the referenced symbol or plug-in object.

Item.Name: GetSymName
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the symbol name of a referenced symbol in a Vectorworks document.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the name of a referenced symbol.

Item.Name: GetSymRot
Item.Description: Function GetSymRot returns the rotation angle (in degrees) of the referenced symbol or plug-in object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the rotation of the referenced symbol in degrees.

Item.Name: GetText
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the text contained within the referenced text object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the text value of the referenced object.

Item.Name: GetTextFont
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the font of the referenced text object at a specified position in the string.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextIndex]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the font of the referenced object at the specified position in the string.

Item.Name: GetTextJust
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the text justification of the referenced text object.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextHorizontalAlignTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the justification of the referenced text object.

Item.Name: GetTextSize
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the text point size at a specified position within the referenced text object. 1 point = 1/72". [[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextIndex]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the text size of the referenced object at a specified position in the string.
Item.Comments: The result was previously an integer, but is now a floating point value. [9/14/98 - PCP]

Item.Name: GetTextStyle
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the text style at a specified position within the referenced text object.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextIndex]][[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextStyleTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the text style of the referenced object at a specified position in the string.

Item.Name: GetType
Item.Description: Returns the type index of the referenced screen object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the node type of the referenced screen object.
Item.Comments: Returns the node type of the referenced screen object. See GetTypeN.

Item.Name: GetUnits
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the current units settings of the document.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:UnitsFormatTable]][[BR]][[BR]]More extensive Units information is available using the GetPref routines with the selectors shown in the tables of the VectorScript Appendix.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the current unit settings of the document.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR [[BR]] fraction :LONGINT; [[BR]] display :LONGINT; [[BR]] format :INTEGER; [[BR]] upi :REAL; [[BR]] lenUnitMk :STRING;[[BR]] areaUnitMk :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetUnits(fraction, display, format, upi, lenUnitMk, areaUnitMk);[[BR]] Message(fraction, ' ', display, ' ', format, ' ', upi, ' ', lenUnitMk, ' ', areaUnitMk);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: fraction
Param.Desc: Approximate WorldCoords per drawing unit. Use GetPrefReal(150) instead.

Item.Name: GetVersion
Item.Description: Returns version information about the Vectorworks application. Parameter [[p:1]] returns the major version number of the application. Parameters [[p:2]] and [[p:3]] return minor version information. Parameter [[p:4]] returns the OS platform on which Vectorworks is running (1 = Macintosh, 2 = Windows).[[BR]][[BR]]Vectorworks 2008 has version major number 13, 2009 - 14 and so on.[[BR]][[BR]]For example:[[BR]][[BR]]Vectorworks 8.0.1 running on a Macintosh would return:[[BR]][[BR]][[p:1]]: 8[[BR]][[p:2]]: 0[[BR]][[p:3]]: 1[[BR]][[p:4]]: 1[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns version information on Vectorworks.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR [[BR]] osMajor, osMinor, osIncr :LONGINT; [[BR]] appMajor, appMinor, appMaint, platform :INTEGER;[[BR]] platformStr :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetVersion(appMajor, appMinor, appMaint, platform);[[BR]] GetOSVersion(osMajor, osMinor, osIncr);[[BR]] IF (platform = 1) [[BR]] THEN platformStr := 'MacOS'[[BR]] ELSE platformStr := 'Windows';[[BR]] Message('Vectorworks ', appMajor, '.', appMinor, '.', appMaint, ' running on ', platformStr, ' ', osMajor, '.', osMinor, '.', osIncr);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: major
Param.Desc: Returns major version number of application.

Param.Name: minor
Param.Desc: Returns minor version number of application.

Param.Name: maintenance
Param.Desc: Returns maintenance version number of application.

Item.Name: GetVertNum
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the number of vertices of the referenced polygon or polyline object.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of vertices in the referenced polygon.

Item.Name: GetView
Item.Description: Returns information about the current 3D view.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns information about the current 3D view.
Item.Comments: Returns information about the current 3D view.[[BR]]All parameters are for output:[[BR]]xAngleR, the angle the view is rotated away from the x-axis[[BR]]yAngleR, the angle the view is rotated away from the y-axis[[BR]]zAngleR, the angle the view is rotated away from the z-axis[[BR]]offsetX, Y, and Z, the center of the view[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/14/98][[BR]]
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] xAngleR, yAngelR, zAngleR, offsetX, offsetY, offsetZ :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetView(xAngleR, yAngelR, zAngleR, offsetX, offsetY, offsetZ);[[BR]] Message(xAngleR, ' ', yAngelR, ' ', zAngleR, ' ', offsetX, ' ', offsetY, ' ', offsetZ);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: xAngleR
Param.Desc: Returns X rotation angle of view.

Param.Name: yAngelR
Param.Desc: Returns Y rotation angle of view.

Param.Name: zAngleR
Param.Desc: Returns Z rotation angle of view.

Item.Name: GetWallWidth
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the default wall width setting of the document.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the active wall width setting.

Item.Name: GetZVals
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the Z (layer base elevation) and delta Z (layer thickness) values for the active layer.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the Z(base elevation) and delta Z(layer thickness) values for the active layer.
Item.Comments: Returns the Z and Delta Z values for the active layer.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/14/98]
Item.Example: PROCEDURE GetLayerHeights(layerHandle :handle; var baseElev, thickness :REAL);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetLayerElevation(layerHandle, baseElev, thickness);[[BR]] baseElev := baseElev / (25.4 / GetPrefReal(152));[[BR]] thickness := thickness / (25.4 / GetPrefReal(152));[[BR]]END;

Param.Name: zVal
Param.Desc: Layer base elevation(above document ground plane).

Item.Name: GrayLayer
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the visibility status of the active layer to grayed. Objects on grayed layers will always appear grayed when viewed from other layers.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active layer visibility to grayed.

Item.Name: GridLines
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the distance between the drawing grid lines in the document. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active display grid width.

Item.Name: Group
Item.Description: Procedures [[name]] groups selected objects in a Vectorworks document. Any selected objects on the active layer(or any selected objects in the document when in Show-Snap-Modify mode) will be included in the new group object.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Groups selected objects.

Item.Name: HAngle
