Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the angle of the referenced line or arc object.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the angle of the referenced object.

Item.Name: HArea
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the area of the referenced object.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the area of the referenced object. This function is obsolete. Use ObjArea instead.

Item.Name: HasDim
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns TRUE if a line or arc object has dimension text associated with it, otherwise it returns FALSE.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if the referenced object has dimension text.

Item.Name: HCenter
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the logical center point of the object specified in [[p:1]]. For most objects, this is the center of the bounding box. For circles, arcs, and round walls [[name]] returns the arc center of the object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the center point of the referenced object.

Item.Name: HHeight
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the height of the referenced object.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the 2D height of the referenced object.

Item.Name: HideClass
Item.Description: Sets the class visibility of the specified class to hidden (invisible) status.
Item.ShortDesc: Hides the specified class.

Item.Name: HideLayer
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the visibility status of the active layer to hidden. Objects on hidden layers will not be viewable from other layers.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Hides the active layer.

Item.Name: HLength
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the length of a line.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the length of the referenced object.

Item.Name: HMove
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] moves the referenced object a relative offset distance.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Moves the referenced object by an offset of (xOffset,yOffset).

Item.Name: HPerim
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the perimeter of the referenced object.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the perimeter of the referenced object.

Item.Name: HRotate
Item.Description: Procedure HRotate rotates the referenced object about a coordinate point location. [[p:3]] is in degrees.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Rotates the referenced object about the point (x,y).

Param.Name: center
Param.Desc: X-Y coordinates of center point of rotation.

Item.Name: HWallHeight
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the wall heights of the referenced wall object.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the start and end heights of the referenced wall.

Item.Name: HWallWidth
Item.Description: Procedure HWallWidth sets the wall width of the referenced wall object.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the width of the referenced wall.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] targetWall, sourceWall :HANDLE;[[BR]] cnt1, cnt2, cavs :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] targetWall := FSActLayer;[[BR]] MoveTo(0,0);[[BR]] WallTo(1,0);[[BR]] sourceWall := LNewObj;[[BR]] cavs := GetObjectVariableInt(sourceWall, 199);[[BR]] HWallWidth(targetWall, WallWidth(sourceWall));[[BR]] SetObjectVariableInt(targetWall, 199, cavs);[[BR]] FOR cnt2 := 0 TO cavs - 1 DO BEGIN[[BR]] SetObjectVariableBoolean(targetWall, 240 + cnt2, GetObjectVariableBoolean(sourceWall, 240 + cnt2)); {cavity is pair}[[BR]] SetObjectVariableReal (targetWall, 200 + cnt2, GetObjectVariableReal (sourceWall, 200 + cnt2)); {left offset}[[BR]] SetObjectVariableReal (targetWall, 220 + cnt2, GetObjectVariableReal (sourceWall, 220 + cnt2)); {right offset}[[BR]] SetObjectVariableLongInt(targetWall, 260 + cnt2, GetObjectVariableLongInt(sourceWall, 260 + cnt2)); {cavity fill}[[BR]] SetObjectVariableInt (targetWall, 280 + cnt2, GetObjectVariableInt (sourceWall, 280 + cnt2)); {pen weight}[[BR]] SetObjectVariableInt (targetWall, 300 + cnt2, GetObjectVariableInt (sourceWall, 300 + cnt2)); {pen style}[[BR]] END;[[BR]] ResetObject(targetWall);[[BR]] DelObject(sourceWall);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: HWidth
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the width of the referenced object.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the 2D width of the referenced object.

Item.Name: Insert
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] will insert the specified string into a destination string.
Item.ShortDesc: Inserts a specified source string into a destination string.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: Position where string is to be inserted.

Item.Name: InsertSymbol
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] places a specified symbol into a wall.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Inserts the specified symbol into the most recently created wall.
Item.Example: MoveTo(3,1);[[BR]]WallTo(5',5');[[BR]]InsertSymbol(1',False,False,True,'Door');[[BR]]{inserts the symbol 'Door' at 1' from the start point of the last wall segment}

Param.Name: symbolName
Param.Desc: Name of symbol to be inserted in wall.

Item.Name: IntDialog
Item.Description: Function [[name]] displays a dialog box which requests the user to enter an integer value. [[BR]][[BR]][[name]] automatically screens for valid numeric input.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Displays a dialog box that requests the user to input an integer number.

Item.Name: IntersectSolid
Item.Description: Function [[name]] creates a new solid intersection object from the referenced source objects.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:SolidsResultsTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a solid intersection from the referenced objects.

Param.Name: obj1
Param.Desc: Handle to source object for intersect operation.

Param.Name: obj2
Param.Desc: Handle to source object for intersect operation.

Param.Name: newSolid
Param.Desc: Handle to resultant object from intersect operation.

Item.Name: KeyDown
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns TRUE if a non-modifier keyboard character has been depressed. When TRUE is returned, the ASCII code of the character is returned.[[BR]][[BR]]Modifier keys are the Caps Lock, Command, Control, Option, and Shift keys.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if a non-modifier key has been pressed and also returns the ASCII code of the key that was pressed.
Item.Example: WHILE NOT KeyDown(keyHit) DO[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] SysBeep;[[BR]] SysBeep;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]Message('The key pressed was ',keyHit);[[BR]]{an annoying example of one use of the KeyDown function}

Item.Name: LActLayer
Item.Description: Function LActLayer returns a handle to the last object in the active layer.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the last object in the active layer.
Item.Comments: Returns a handle to the last object in the active layer.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/14/98]

Item.Name: Layer
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a new layer in a Vectorworks document. After creation, the new layer becomes the active layer of the document.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] can also be used to switch the active layer of the document. If the layer name passed to the procedure already exists, the procedure switches the active layer to the specified layer.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:LayerNameNote]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new active layer or sets the active layer of the document.
Item.Example: Layer('Ductwork-1st Floor');[[BR]]{creates a new layer named 'Ductwork-1st Floor'}[[BR]][[BR]]Layer(newLayerName);[[BR]]{creates a new layer whose name is specified in the variable}[[BR]][[BR]]Layer('Untitled-1');[[BR]]{switches to the existing layer 'Untitled-1'}

Param.Name: name
Param.Desc: Name of new or existing layer.

Item.Name: LayerRef
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] places a layer reference (layer link) into the active layer at location (0,0).[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a layer link from the specified layer at (0,0) on the active layer.
Item.Example: LayerRef('Layer-2');[[BR]]{creates a layer link of 'Layer-2' on the active layer}

Item.Name: Len
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the length of the specified string value.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the length of the specified string.

Item.Name: LFillBack
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the background fill color for the active layer. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the background fill color for the active layer.
Item.Comments: Sets the background fill color for the active layer.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/14/98]

Item.Name: LFillFore
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the foreground fill color for the active layer. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the foreground fill color for the active layer.
Item.Comments: Sets the foreground fill color for the active layer.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/14/98][[BR]]

Item.Name: LimitTolerance
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] is used with dimensioning procedures to define a tolerance for the most recently created dimension object.
Item.ShortDesc: Defines a limit tolerance for the most recently created dimension.

Item.Name: Line
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a line object in Vectorworks. The line is drawn from the current pen position(x,y) to the specified point. The point may also be thought of as the location (x+dX,y+dY), where dX and dY are x and y offsets, respectively. [[BR]][[BR]]The line object is drawn with the current default attributes unless otherwise specified.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Draws a line from the current pen position to (x+dX,y+dY).
Item.Example: Line(2,2);[[BR]]{ draws a line from the current pen location to a point }[[BR]]{ 2 horizontal and 2 vertical units away. }

Item.Name: LinearDim
Item.Description:
Procedure [[name]] creates a linear dimension in a Vectorworks document.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:DimFlagNote]][[BR]][[BR]]Linear Dimension

[[BR]][[fig:lindim.gif]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a linear dimension.

Param.Name: startPt
Param.Desc: X-Y coordinates of dimension start point.

Param.Name: endPt
Param.Desc: X-Y coordinates of dimension end point.

Param.Name: offsetDistance
Param.Desc: Offset distance of dimension line from object.

Item.Name: LineTo
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a line object in the document. [[name]] draws from the current graphics pen position to the specified coordinate location. The line object is drawn with the current default attributes unless otherwise specified in the VectorScript routine.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Draws a line from the current pen position to (X,Y).
Item.Example: LineTo(3,4);[[BR]]{draws a line from the current pen position to (3,4)}[[BR]]

Item.Name: LinkText
Item.Description: Creates a linked text field in a newly created symbol. The specified text is linked to a record field, whose value is displayed by the text object.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] must be called during symbol creation; the record to be associated with the linked text string must also exist at the time the link is created.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates linked text from the referenced text object.
Item.Example: BeginSym('Symbol #2');[[BR]] Oval(-3/4",1/2",3/4",-1/2");[[BR]] TextFont(3);[[BR]] TextSize(12.00037);[[BR]] TextJust(1);[[BR]] TextOrigin(0.8611111",0.5138889");[[BR]] BeginText;[[BR]] 'Field 9 String'[[BR]] EndText;[[BR]] LinkText(LNewObj,'Sample Format','Field 1');[[BR]]EndSym;[[BR]]Record(LNewObj,'Sample Format');[[BR]]

Param.Name: h
Param.Desc: Handle to text object that will be linked to record.

Param.Name: rec
Param.Desc: Name of record that will be linked to text string.

Param.Name: fld
Param.Desc: Name of field that will be linked to text string.

Item.Name: LLayer
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to the last layer in a Vectorworks document.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the last layer of the document.

Item.Name: Ln
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the natural logarithm of the specified value.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the natural logarithm of v.

Param.Name: v
Param.Desc: Numeric value for which to find the natural logarithm.

Item.Name: LNewObj
Item.Description: Returns a handle to the last object created by a VectorScript function call during the current script execution.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the last object created during the execution of the VectorScript command.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the most recently created object, otherwise returns NIL.
Item.Comments: [As of 8.0.0b10][[BR]][[BR]]If the object has been deleted since it was created, this function returns NIL. It is recommended that you call LNewObj immediately after the function or procedure which created the object to avoid problems.

Item.Name: LoadCell
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] inserts a value into a specified cell of the active worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Places the specified value into a worksheet cell.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new SetWSCellFormula, SetWSCellBorder, SetWSCellAlignment, SetWSColumnWidth, SetWSCellTextFormat and SetWSCellNumberFormat. [VML 01/09/01]
Item.Example: SprdSheet(0,0,3,3);[[BR]]LoadCell(1,1,'= (14 + 2) * 3');[[BR]]{ inserts a formula into a cell }[[BR]][[BR]]SprdSheet(0,0,3,3);[[BR]]LoadCell(1,1,'Window Schedule');[[BR]]{ inserts a literal into a cell }[[BR]][[BR]]

Item.Name: LObject
Item.Description: Function LObject returns a handle to the last object in the active document.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the last object in the active document.

Item.Name: Locus
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a 2D locus object at the specified coordinate location. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Draws a locus at (X,Y).
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] x, y :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] HCenter(FSActLayer, x, y);[[BR]] Locus(x, y);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: Locus3D
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a new 3D locus in the document at the specified 3D coordinate location.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Draws a 3D locus at (X,Y,Z).

Item.Name: LPenBack
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the background pen color for the active layer. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the background pen color for the active layer.
Item.Comments: Sets the background pen color for the active layer.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/14/98]

Item.Name: LPenFore
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the foreground pen color for the active layer. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the foreground pen color for the active layer.
Item.Comments: Sets the foreground pen color for the active layer.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/14/98]

Item.Name: LSActLayer
Item.Description: Function LSActLayer returns a handle to the last selected object on the active layer. If no objects are selected, the function returns NIL.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Return a handle to the last selected object on the active layer.

Item.Name: Marker
Item.Description: Marker defines a marker (arrowhead) style for the document. This marker style becomes the active style for the document.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:MarkerStyleNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new active marker style in the document - OBSOLETE procedure: Use SetDefaultBeginningMarker and/or SetDefaultEndMarker instead.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for VW2008: Use SetDefaultBeginningMarker and/or SetDefaultEndMarker instead.[[BR]]See FMarker for parameter descriptions.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/14/98]

Param.Name: size
Param.Desc: Marker size in inches measured in page space. Legal values are 0.0 to 2.0.

Item.Name: MirrorXY3D
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] mirrors the currently selected object through the XY plane.
Item.ShortDesc: This function mirrors the currently selected objects through the XY plane.

Item.Name: MouseDown
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns TRUE if a mouse down event has occurred within the active document window.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if mouse is clicked. Also returns coordinate location.

Item.Name: Move
Item.Description: Sets the position of the graphics pen in the Vectorworks document by moving a specified distance from the current pen location. [[BR]][[BR]]Horizontal and vertical offsets from the initial location. The final position of the pen at a point whose coordinates are (x+moveDX, y+moveDY).[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Moves the graphics pen from the current position to (x+dX,y+dY).
Item.Example: [[name]](6,1);[[BR]]{ moves the graphics pen 6 units to the right }[[BR]]{ and 1 unit up from the current position. }

Item.Name: Move3D
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] moves the most recently created three-dimensional object a relative distance from it's original location. The object is moved relative to its center. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Moves the most recently created 3D object relative to its current position.

Item.Name: Move3DObj
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] moves the referenced object a specified distance from its current location. Movement distances are calculated from the 3D center of the object.
Item.ShortDesc: Moves the referenced object by specified offsets.

Item.Name: MoveObjs
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] moves object(s) a specified offset distance. The last two parameters, [[p:2]] and [[p:3]], control which objects are offset by this procedure.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:MoveObjsTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Moves selected object(s) relative to their current position.
Item.Example: [[name]](3,0,FALSE,FALSE);[[BR]]{ moves selected objects on active layer 3 units to the right }[[BR]]

Param.Name: allLayers
Param.Desc: Move objects on all layers option setting.

Item.Name: MoveTo
Item.Description: Sets the position of the graphics pen in the Vectorworks document using absolute coordinate values. The parameter specifies the X-Y coordinate location where the pen should be moved.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Moves the graphics pen from the current position to (X,Y).

Item.Name: NameClass
Item.Description: Creates a new class in a Vectorworks document, which then become the active class.[[BR]]If the specified class already exists, then it will become the active class of the document.[[BR]][[BR]]Note: [[note:ClassName]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new active class or sets the active class of the document.
Item.Example: [[name]]('Revisions');[[BR]]Rect(4,4,6,6);[[BR]][[BR]]{Create a class 'Revisions' in the document}[[BR]]{The rectangle is then assigned this class }[[BR]]

Item.Name: NameList
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the specified object name from the object name list.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the specified name from the name list.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: Name list position index (in a arange of 1 - n).

Item.Name: NameNum
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the number of different object names in the active Vectorworks document.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of names in the name list.

Item.Name: NameObject
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] assigns an object name to the next object created.
Item.ShortDesc: Assigns a user specified name to the most recent VectorScript created object.

Param.Name: objName
Param.Desc: Name to be assigned to object.

Item.Name: NewField
Item.Description: Creates a new field in a specified record format. If the record does not exist, a new one is created using the specified record name.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:FieldTypeConstantTable]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Assigns a new field to the specified record.

Param.Name: recName
Param.Desc: Name of record to which field will be added.

Item.Name: NewSprdSheet
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a new worksheet in a Vectorworks document.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new worksheet in a Vectorworks document.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new CreateWS and ShowWS. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: NextDObj
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the next deselected object after the referenced object in a list. If the end of the list is reached, the function returns NIL.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the next deselected object after the referenced object.
Item.Example: handleToObject:=FObject;[[BR]]WHILE handleToObject <> NIL DO BEGIN[[BR]] SetSelect(handleToObject);[[BR]] handleToObject:=[[name]](handleToObject);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]{ selects all deselected objects }[[BR]]

Item.Name: NextLayer
Item.Description: Function NextLayer returns a handle to the next layer in the document after the referenced. If the end of the list has been reached, the function returns NIL.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the next layer after the referenced layer.
Item.Example: handleToLayer:=FLayer;[[BR]]WHILE handleToLayer <> NIL DO BEGIN[[BR]] SysBeep;[[BR]] handleToLayer:=[[name]](handleToLayer);[[BR]]END; [[BR]]{ will process through all the layers in the list }

Item.Name: NextObj
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the next object in any list . If the end of the list is reached, the function returns NIL. This procedure can be used with other handle routines such as FirstIn3D,FInGroup, FirstInSymDef, or FLayer.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the next object after the referenced object.
Item.Example: handleToObject:=FObject;[[BR]]WHILE handleToObject <> NIL DO BEGIN[[BR]] i:=i+1;[[BR]] handleToObject:=[[name]](handleToObject);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]

Param.Name: h
Param.Desc: Handle to object, group, or symbol definition.

Item.Name: NextSObj
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the next selected object in a list. If the end of the list is reached, the function returns NIL.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the next selected object after the referenced object.

Item.Name: NextSymDef
Item.Description: Function NextSymDef returns a handle to the next definition in the symbol library after the referenced symbol. If the end of the list has been reached, the function returns NIL.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the next symbol definition in the documents' symbol list.

Param.Name: symHd
Param.Desc: Handle to symbol definition in library.

Item.Name: Num2Str
Item.Description: Function [[name]] converts a REAL value to a string and returns the value.[[BR]][[BR]]Parameter [[p:1]] has a range of -1 to 10; if -1 is specified, the value will be returned in scientific notation.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Converts the specified REAL value to a string.

Item.Name: Num2StrF
Item.Description: Function [[name]] converts a specified REAL value into a string. The numeric value will be converted and displayed in the current unit settings of the drawing.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Converts the specified REAL value to a string using the current units settings.

Item.Name: NumDashStyles
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the number of available line dash patterns.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of available line dash patterns.
Item.Comments: Returns the number of available line dash patterns.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/18/98]

Item.Name: NumFields
Item.Description: Returns the number of fields in the referenced record.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of fields in the referenced record.

Item.Name: NumLayers
Item.Description: Function NumLayers returns the current number of layers within the active document.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of layers in the active document.

Item.Name: NumObj
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the number of objects on the referenced layer.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of objects on the referenced layer.

Item.Name: NumRecords
Item.Description: Returns the number of records attached to the referenced object. [[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of records attached to the referenced object.

Item.Name: NumSObj
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the number of selected objects on the referenced layer.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of selected objects on the referenced layer.

Item.Name: Open
Item.Description: Procedure Open opens a ASCII text file for reading.[[BR]][[BR]]Remember to use Close when you are finished reading or writing to a file.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:FilePathNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Opens a file for reading.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] fileName :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] UseDefaultFileErrorHandling(FALSE);[[BR]] fileName := 'Plug-Ins\Common\Data\Callout Prefs.txt';[[BR]] Open(fileName);[[BR]] AlrtDialog(Concat(GetLastFileErr));[[BR]] Close(fileName);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: fileName
Param.Desc: Name or path of file to open.

Item.Name: Option
Item.Description: [[name]] return TRUE if the Option key (Mac) or Alt key (Windows) was depressed during the last user event. This function operates with the MouseDown, KeyDown, AutoKey, GetPt, GetPtL, GetLine, and GetRect calls.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if the Option/Alt key was pressed.

Item.Name: Oval
Item.Description: Procedure Oval creates an oval object in a Vectorworks document.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Draws an oval in a Vectorworks document.

Param.Name: p1
Param.Desc: Top left coordinate of oval bounding box.

Param.Name: p2
Param.Desc: Bottom right coordinate of oval bounding box.

Item.Name: PenBack
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] set the active pen background color for the document. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active pen background color.

Param.Name: color
Param.Desc: RGB color value to be set as active pen background.

Item.Name: PenFore
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the active pen foreground color for the document. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active pen foreground color.

Param.Name: color
Param.Desc: RGB color value to be set as active pen foreground.

Item.Name: PenGrid
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the snap grid distance in the document.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active snap grid width.

Item.Name: PenLoc
Item.Description: Returns the current coordinate location of the graphics pen.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the current location of the graphics pen.

Param.Name: p
Param.Desc: The current location of the graphics pen.

Item.Name: PenPat
Item.Description: Deprecated - will generate error. Use PenPatN instead.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Deprecated - will generate error. Use PenPatN instead.
Item.Comments: Deprecated - will generate error. Use PenPatN instead.
Item.Example: PenPat(25);[[BR]]{ uses fill pattern 25 as the active pen pattern }[[BR]][[BR]]PenPat(-3);[[BR]]{ sets a linestyle as the active pen pattern }

Item.Name: PenSize
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the active line weight for the document.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active line weight setting.

Param.Name: lw
Param.Desc: Line weight (in mils). Fourteen (14) mils equals one pixel.

Item.Name: PickObject
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to an object in the document. The function receives a coordinate location, specified by parameter [[p:1]], and checks this location for the presence of an object. If an object exists at the location, the function returns a handle to the object.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the object located at the specified location.
Item.Example: FUNCTION UserObjectPick :HANDLE;[[BR]]VAR [[BR]] x, y :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetPt(x, y);[[BR]] UserObjectPick := PickObject(x, y);[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]

Param.Name: p
Param.Desc: Coordinate location to test for object.

Item.Name: Pos
Item.Description: Function [[name]] searches for a specified substring contained within in a target string.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] returns the position of the substring. If the string is not found, 0 is returned.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Searches for a specified substring within a target string. Returns the position of the substring(if found).

Item.Name: PrevDObj
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the previous deselected object in a list of objects . If the end of the object list is reached, the function returns NIL.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the next deselected object prior to the referenced object.

Item.Name: PrevLayer
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to the layer in the document preceding the referenced layer.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the next layer prior to the referenced layer.

Item.Name: PrevObj
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the object in any list which precedes the specified object. If the end of the list is reached, the function returns NIL. [[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the next object prior to the referenced object.

Param.Name: h
Param.Desc: Handle to object, group, or symbol definition.

Item.Name: PrevSObj
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the previous selected object in the list preceding the referenced object.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the next selected object prior to the referenced object.

Item.Name: PrevSymDef
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to the symbol definition in the symbol library preceding the referenced definition.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the previous symbol definition in the documents' symbol list.

Item.Name: PrimaryUnits
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] specifies the primary units settings for the active document. The primary units setting is used by the document for all measurement entry and display values in the document. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:UnitSettingTable]][[BR]][[BR]][[note:UnitsFormatTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the primary units for the active document.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] style :INTEGER;[[BR]] prec, dimPrec :LONGINT;[[BR]] format, angPrec :INTEGER;[[BR]] showMark, dispFrac :BOOLEAN;[[BR]] outStr :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] outStr := '';[[BR]] GetPrimaryUnitInfo(style, prec, dimPrec, format, angPrec, showMark, dispFrac);[[BR]] FOR style := 0 to 16 DO BEGIN[[BR]] PrimaryUnits(style, prec, dimPrec, format, angPrec, showMark, dispFrac);[[BR]] outStr := Concat(outStr, Chr(13), style, ': ', GetPrefReal(152));[[BR]] END;[[BR]] AlrtDialog(outStr);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: style
Param.Desc: Active primary unit style for document.

Item.Name: Projection
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the projection mode of a Vectorworks document.[[BR]][[BR]]Parameters [[p:3]], [[p:4]], and [[p:5]] are used only in perspective projection mode.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the view projection mode of the active document.

Param.Name: clip1
Param.Desc: Top left coordinate of clipping rectangle.

Param.Name: clip2
Param.Desc: Bottom right coordinate of clipping rectangle.

Item.Name: PtDialog
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] displays a dialog box which requests the user to enter a coordinate (point) value.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Displays a dialog box that requests the user to input X-Y coordinates.

Item.Name: PtDialog3D
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] displays a dialog box which requests the user to enter a 3D coordinate (point) value.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Displays a dialog box that allows a user to input a 3D coordinate point.

Item.Name: PtInPoly
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns TRUE if the point specified point lies within, or on, the referenced polygon or polyline object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if the point (x,y) is inside the referenced polygon.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] polyHandle :HANDLE;[[BR]] locusHandle :HANDLE;[[BR]] x, y :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CallTool(-204); polyHandle := FSActLayer;[[BR]] CallTool(-221); locusHandle := FSActLayer;[[BR]] GetLocPt(locusHandle, x, y);[[BR]] Message(PtInPoly(x, y, polyHandle));[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: PtInRect
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns whether the coordinate location is located within the specified rectangular boundary.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if the point (x,y) is located within the specified rectangular boundary.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] pointX, pointY, rect1X, rect1Y, rect2X, rect2Y :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] pointX := 1;[[BR]] pointY := 1;[[BR]] rect1X := 0;[[BR]] rect1Y := 2;[[BR]] rect2X := 2;[[BR]] rect2Y := 0;[[BR]] Message(PtInRect(pointX, pointY, rect1X, rect1Y, rect2X, rect2Y));[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: rect1
Param.Desc: Top left coordinate of rectangular area.

Param.Name: rect2
Param.Desc: Bottom right coordinate of rectangular area.

Item.Name: PutFile
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] displays a standard file dialog which requests the user to select or create a text file for output.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a path and file name of a user selected output file.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE PutFileExample;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] fileName :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] PutFile('Select the file to create:', 'New File.txt', fileName);[[BR]] Message(fileName);[[BR]] IF NOT DidCancel THEN BEGIN[[BR]] WriteLn('some text');[[BR]] Close(fileName);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(PutFileExample);

Param.Name: fileName
Param.Desc: Returns name of the user selected file.

Item.Name: Rad2Deg
Item.Description: Function [[name]] converts the specified value (in radians) to degrees.
Item.ShortDesc: Converts radians into decimal degrees.

Item.Name: RealDialog
Item.Description: Function [[name]] displays a dialog box which requests the user to enter a REAL value. [[name]] automatically screens for valid numeric input.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Displays a dialog box that requests the user to input a real number.

Item.Name: Record
Item.Description: Replaces an existing record with a new version of the same record. Parameter [[p:2]] specifies the record to be updated.
Item.ShortDesc: Deletes existing an record and replaces it with a new version of that record
Item.Comments: Delete any existing record named "s" on "h", Create new record for format named "s", attach to "h".[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/14/98]

Param.Name: s
Param.Desc: Name of record to be updated.

Item.Name: Rect
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a rectangle object in a Vectorworks document.[[BR]][[BR]]The procedure will accept coordinate definitions by either of two methods : coordinate values or distance angle values. Coordinate values are the absolute coordinate locations(in the documents' coordinate system) and are expressed as x and y values. [[BR]][[BR]]Distance-angle values are expressed as a distance and angle from the current pen position. For Rect, two distance angle pairs are required to specify the top left and bottom right of the rectangle object.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Draws a rectangle with top left at (x1,y1) and bottom right at (x2,y2).
Item.Example: [[name]](0,2,2,1);[[BR]]{creates a rectangle object by coordinate values}[[BR]][[BR]][[name]](0.5,#90,2,#0);[[BR]]{creates a rectangle object by dist-angle values}[[BR]]

Item.Name: ReDraw
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] invokes a screen redraw of newly created objects in the active Vectorworks document. If new objects are to be manipulated using procedures which operate on selected objects, a call to ReDraw should precede the selected object routines to ensure that all new objects are correctly identified.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Invokes a redraw of newly created objects.

Item.Name: ReDrawAll
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] invokes a full screen redraw of the active Vectorworks document. [[name]] is used when the document view needs to be refreshed prior to additional operation being performed in the document.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Invokes a redraw of the entire active document.

Item.Name: ResetBBox
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] forces the bounding box information for the specified object to be recomputed based on the objects' current geometry. [[BR]][[BR]]Call this procedure after modifying an object to force a redraw of the object.
Item.ShortDesc: Forces the bounding box information to be recomputed based on current geometry.
Item.Comments: Forces the bouding box information for object h to be recomputed based on current geometry.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/14/98]

Item.Name: ResetOrientation3D
Item.Description: [[name]] resets the 3D environment parameters of the active Vectorworks document. [[BR]][[BR]]Call this procedure after 3D object creation to ensure correct orientation and display of the new object in 3D space.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Updates the 3D view of the active document.

Item.Name: Rewrite
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a new ASCII text file or opens an existing one prior to writing data to the file. If the file exists, new data written to the file will overwrite any data currently within the file.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:FilePathNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new file or opens an existing one for writing.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] fileName :STRING; [[BR]] major, minor, maintenance, platform :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetVersion(major, minor, maintenance, platform);[[BR]] IF platform = 1 THEN BEGIN[[BR]] fileName := '/Example.txt';[[BR]] END ELSE BEGIN[[BR]] fileName := 'C:\Example.txt';[[BR]] END;[[BR]] ReWrite(fileName);[[BR]] WriteLn('example text');[[BR]] Close(fileName);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: RGBToColorIndex
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] converts the Vectorworks palette colors from its' red, green, and blue component values to the colors' palette position index. Parameters [[p:1]], [[p:2]], and [[p:3]] return the color components of the swatch, and parameter [[p:4]] is the palette position ID of the color swatch. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:ColorTableNote]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Converts RGB values to color palette index.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] red, green, blue :LONGINT;[[BR]] colorIndex :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetPenFore(FSActLayer, red, green, blue);[[BR]] RGBToColorIndex(red, green, blue, colorIndex);[[BR]] Message(colorIndex);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: Rotate
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] rotates the currently selected objects on the active layer. The rotation angle may be specified in any valid angle format. When a locus is selected with a group of objects, the objects are rotated around the locus. If two or more loci are selected, the objects are rotated around the center of the selected objects.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Rotates the selected object(s) by the specified amount.

Item.Name: Rotate3D
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] rotates the most recently created three-dimensional object. Rotation values are applied about the respective axes.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Rotates the most recently created 3D object.

Item.Name: RotatePoint
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] rotates selected Vectorworks objects about the specified coordinate point.
Item.ShortDesc: Rotates the selected object(s) about the specified coordinate point.

Item.Name: Round
Item.Description: Function [[name]] converts the specified REAL value to a LONGINT value. The LONGINT result is the value rounded to the nearest whole number.
Item.ShortDesc: Converts a REAL to a LONGINT by rounding to the next highest whole value.

Item.Name: RoundWall
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a counter-clockwise round wall.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a counter-clockwise round wall.
Item.Comments: Creates a round wall the that is centered on the arc specified by the the three input points.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3 :REAL;[[BR]] lineHandle :HANDLE;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetPt(x1, y1);[[BR]] GetPtL(x1, y1, x2, y2);[[BR]] MoveTo(x1, y1);[[BR]] LineTo(x2, y2);[[BR]] lineHandle := LNewObj;[[BR]] GetPtL(x2, y2, x3, y3);[[BR]] IF lineHandle <> NIL THEN DelObject(lineHandle);[[BR]] RoundWall(x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: RRect
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a rounded rectangle object in a Vectorworks document.[[BR]][[BR]]Corner definition is controlled by parameter [[p:3]], which determines the "roundness" of the rectangle corners. The X and Y components of [[p:3]] correspond to the major and minor axes of an oval defining the rectangle corner.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a rounded rectangle in a Vectorworks document.

Param.Name: Diam
Param.Desc: X and Y diameters of corner.

Item.Name: Scale
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] rescales selected objects. Scaling occurs about the center of the selected object(s).[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Scales the selected object(s).

Item.Name: SecondaryUnits
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the secondary unit parameters for the active document. The secondary units setting is used primarily for display of alternate dimensions in[[BR]]when a dual dimension standard is active. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:UnitSettingTable]][[BR]][[BR]][[note:UnitsFormatTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the secondary units for the active document.
Item.Example: SecondaryUnits(1,6,2,TRUE,TRUE); [[BR]][[BR]]{ Sets the secondary units to feet/inches with a dimension precision of 1/64, }[[BR]]{ unit mark displayed, and fractional display of units values enabled. }[[BR]]

Param.Name: style
Param.Desc: Active secondary unit style for document.

Item.Name: SelectAll
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] selects all visible objects on the active layer of a Vectorworks document. [[BR]][[BR]]If Layer Options is set to Show-Snap-Modify Others, then [[name]] will select all visible objects within the document.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Selects all objects on active layers.

Item.Name: Selected
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the selection status of the referenced object.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the selection status of the referenced object.

Item.Name: SelectSS
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] opens the referenced worksheet and makes it active.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Opens and activates the referenced worksheet.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new ShowWS. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: Set3DInfo
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the height, width and depth dimensions of the referenced object.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the the 3D size information for the referenced object.

Item.Name: Set3DRot
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] rotates the referenced 3D object about a specified 3D point. It works with the following 3D objects: extrude, multiple extrude, sweep, mesh, 3D polygon, solid, CSG solid, group, symbol, plug-in object, NURBS curve, NURBS surface.[[BR]][[BR]][[fig:3drotate.gif]][[BR]][[BR]]The difference between Set3DRot and SetRot3D is that Set3DRot adds the specified rotation to the existing rotation of the object, whereas SetRot3D does not consider the existing rotation, and merely makes the object rotation match the specified values.
Item.ShortDesc: Rotates the referenced object using the specified angles about the specified 3D center point.

Param.Name: xDistance
Param.Desc: X coordinate of center of rotation.

Param.Name: yDistance
Param.Desc: Y coordinate of center of rotation.

Param.Name: zDistance
Param.Desc: Z coordinate of center of rotation.

Item.Name: SetActSymbol
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the active symbol for a Vectorworks document.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active symbol of the document.

Item.Name: SetArc
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the start and sweep angles of the referenced arc or round wall object. Specify the angles in degrees.
Item.ShortDesc: Modifies the start and sweep angles of the referenced arc. Specify angles in degrees.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE GetArcSetArcExample;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h :HANDLE;[[BR]] startAng, sweepAng :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] h := FSActLayer;[[BR]] GetArc(h, startAng, sweepAng);[[BR]] SetArc(h, startAng, sweepAng + 10);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(GetArcSetArcExample);

Item.Name: SetBBox
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] positions objects whose geometry is defined by a bounding box. These objects currently are Image, PICT, Rectangle, Oval, Rounded Rectangle, and Worksheet Container. [[BR]][[BR]]Other objects will generate a warning if they are passed to [[name]].
Item.ShortDesc: Allows an object's bounding box to be modified.
Item.Comments: This function should be obsleted and replaced by a function which can only move objects and not corrupt other bounding boxes. [PCP][[BR]]For objects which are defined by their box, such as rectangles & ovals, this function allows that box to be changed. [sd 8/14/98]

Param.Name: p1
Param.Desc: Top left coordinate of bounding box.

Param.Name: p2
Param.Desc: Bottom right coordinate of bounding box.

Item.Name: SetBeamAngle
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the spread angle of the referenced spot light.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets beam spread angle of referenced light.

Item.Name: SetClass
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] assigns a class to the referenced object.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the class of the referenced object.

Param.Name: class
Param.Desc: Name of class to assign to object.

Item.Name: SetConstrain
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the active drawing constraints for the document. Each constraint is represented by an ASCII character identifier; these characters are assembled into a string which determines the constraints to be activated.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ConstraintIDTable]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active drawing constraints. The procedure parameter is a string comprised of constraint identifiers.
Item.Example: [[name]]('QD');[[BR]][[BR]]{activates the snap objects and smart point constraints}

Item.Name: SetCurrentObject
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the referenced object to be the current object of the document. The current object is defined as the last object created, and can be referenced by LNewObj.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the referenced object as the most recently created object.

Item.Name: SetCursor
Item.Description: Procedure SetCursor changes the appearance of the screen cursor.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:CursorTypeTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the cursor style.

Item.Name: SetDimStd
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] changes the default dimension standard of a Vectorworks document. [[BR]][[BR]]Built-in dimension standards are specified using index values of 1 thru 9, corresponding to the dimension standard preference menu. Custom dimensions are specified using indexes 0 thru -8, with 0 being the first custom dimension standard, -1 being the second, and so on.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the default dimension standard for the document.
Item.Comments: Changes the document's default dimension standard. The whichStandard parameter specifies which dimension standard to change it to. The nine built-in dimension standards are specified using indexes 1 thru 9, and correspond to the ordering in the dimension standard popup menu. Custom dimensions are specified using indexes 0 thru -8, with 0 being the first custom dimension standard, -1 being the second, and so on.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/18/98]

Item.Name: SetDimText
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] will set the dimension text of the referenced dimension to the specified value. [[BR]][[BR]]The maximum length for dimension text is 60 characters. The first 30 characters of the specified dimension text string will be displayed in the primary dimension string; the remaining characters will be displayed in the secondary dimension string, if it exists.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the dimension text of the referenced dimension to the specified value.

Item.Name: SetDSelect
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] deselects the referenced object.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Deselects the referenced object.

Item.Name: SetFillBack
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the fill background color setting of the specified object. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the fill background color of the referenced object.

Item.Name: SetFillFore
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the fill foreground color setting of the referenced object. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the fill foreground color of the referenced object.

Item.Name: SetFPat
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the fill pattern of the referenced object.[[BR]][[BR]]To apply a bitmap fill pattern, use positive value corresponding to the index of the bitmap pattern. To apply a vector fill pattern, use the negative of the vector fill index (index * -1).[[BR]][[BR]][[note:FillPatTable]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the fill pattern of the referenced object.
Item.Example: { Apply a bitmap fill pattern. }[[BR]][[name]](objectOne, 47);[[BR]][[BR]]{ Apply a vector fill. }[[BR]][[name]](objectTwo, -Name2Index('My Hatch'));[[BR]]

Item.Name: SetHDef
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] replaces the definition of the referenced "container" object with a new definition. Supported object types are worksheets, symbol definitions, and layer references.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Replaces the existing reference to an object in a symbol instance, layer link, or worksheet image with the specified reference.
Item.Example: [[name]](symbolHd,newSymDefHd);[[BR]]{updates the referenced symbol with a new definition}

Item.Name: SetLightDirection
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the direction angles of the referenced light object.
Item.ShortDesc: Modifies direction information of referenced light.

Item.Name: SetLightInfo
Item.Description: Sets the attributes of the referenced light object.
Item.ShortDesc: Modifies settings of referenced light.

Item.Name: SetLightLocation
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the location of the referenced light object.
Item.ShortDesc: Modifies position of referenced light.

Item.Name: SetLS
Item.Description: Deprecated - will generate error. Use SetLSN instead.
Item.ShortDesc: Deprecated - will generate error. Use SetLSN instead.
Item.Comments: Deprecated - will generate error. Use SetLSN instead. Original description was: Sets the linestyle of the referenced object. If the value is in the range 0 to 71, the specified fill pattern is applied as the linestyle; a value in the range of -1 to -8 will apply the specified linestyle.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] cnt :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] PushAttrs;[[BR]] TextSize(1);[[BR]] TextJust(3);[[BR]] TextVerticalAlign(3);[[BR]] FOR cnt := -10 TO 71 DO BEGIN[[BR]] TextOrigin(-2, cnt);[[BR]] CreateText(Concat(cnt));[[BR]] MoveTo(0, cnt);[[BR]] LineTo(24", cnt);[[BR]] SetLS(LNewObj, cnt);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] PopAttrs;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: SetLScale
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the scale of the referenced layer. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:ScaleCalcNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the scale of the referenced layer.
Item.Example: [[name]](HandleToLayer,96);[[BR]]{sets the referenced layer to a scale of 1/8" = 1'}

Item.Name: SetLW
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the line weight of the referenced object.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the line weight of the referenced object.

Param.Name: lw
Param.Desc: Line weight to be applied to object (in mils).

Item.Name: SetName
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] assigns a name to the referenced object.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the name of the referenced object.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h1 :HANDLE;[[BR]] SName :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] SName := 'Fred';[[BR]] h1 := CreateSphere(0, 0, 0, 1000);[[BR]] SetName(h1, SName);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: name
Param.Desc: Name to be assigned to object.

Item.Name: SetOrigin
Item.Description: Shifts the position of the document origin. The function does not modify the relative [[BR]]positions of objects in the document; the coordinate locations of objects, however, [[BR]]will change when the origin location is modified.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Shifts the position of the document origin.
Item.Example: Rect(0,0,1,1);[[BR]]SetOrigin(1,1);[[BR]][[BR]]{ Creates a rectangle with the bottom left point at coordinates (0,0), then moves the origin so that the top right point of the rectangle has coordinates (0,0). }

Item.Name: SetOriginAbsolute
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the position of the origin relative to the center of the document drawing space.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the position of the origin relative to the center of the document drawing space.

Item.Name: SetPenBack
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the pen background color of the referenced object. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the pen background color of the referenced object.

Item.Name: SetPenFore
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the pen foreground color of the referenced object. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the pen foreground color of the referenced object.
Item.Comments: Be nice if it said what color values were legal. -JDW

Item.Name: SetPolyPt
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the location a specified vertex in the referenced polygon or polyline.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the coordinates of a vertex of the referenced polygon/polyline.

Item.Name: SetPolyPt3D
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the position of the specified vertex in the referenced 3D object.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the location of the specified vertex of the referenced 3D polygon.

Param.Name: objectHd
Param.Desc: Handle to mesh or 3D poly object.

Item.Name: SetPref
Item.Description: Procedure SetPref sets the on-off status of a Vectorworks preference dialog item. Parameter [[p:1]] specifies the preference item, and parameter [[p:2]] sets the on-off status of the item.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:PrefItemTableNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the on/off state of a specified preference.

Item.Name: SetPrimaryDim
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the primary dimension options for single and dual dimensions. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets primary dimension values for both single and dual dimensions
Item.Comments: Sets dimension values that are specific to the primary portion of a dual dimension. This procedure can also be used for non-dual dimensions.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/18/98]

Param.Name: boxText
Param.Desc: Display box around dimension text flag.

Param.Name: precision
Param.Desc: Precision setting for displayed dimension value.

Item.Name: SetRecord
Item.Description: Assigns an instance of an existing record format to the referenced object . [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Assigns a record to the referenced object.

Param.Name: record
Param.Desc: Name of record to assign to object.

Item.Name: SetRField
Item.Description: Assigns a new value to an existing field of a record attached to the referenced object.
Item.ShortDesc: Assigns a value to the specified record field.
Item.Comments: Update the RecordNode attached to object "h" by setting the field "field" of record format named "record" to the value "value". The object "h" is redrawn afterward to support the symbol "link text to record" feature.[[BR]][[BR]]Replaces obsolete function "Field".[[BR]]

Param.Name: h
Param.Desc: Handle to a object with an attached record.

Param.Name: record
Param.Desc: Name of record to be updated.

Param.Name: field
Param.Desc: Name of field to be updated.

Item.Name: SetRot3D
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the rotation (in degrees) of the referenced object to the specified rotations and center. This procedure works on the following 3D objects: extrudes, multiple extrudes, and sweeps.[[BR]][[BR]][[fig:3drotate.gif]][[BR]][[BR]]The difference between Set3DRot and SetRot3D is that Set3DRot adds the specified rotation to the existing rotation of the object, whereas SetRot3D does not consider the existing rotation, and merely makes the object rotation match the specified values.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the matrix for the given object to the given rotations and center.

Item.Name: SetScale
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the drawing scale of the active layer of the document.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ScaleCalcNote]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the drawing scale of the active layer.

Item.Name: SetSecondaryDim
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the dimension options that are specific to the secondary portion of a dual dimension. This procedure can only be used for dual dimensions.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets secondary dimension values on dual dimensions
Item.Comments: Sets dimension values that are specific to the secondary portion of a dual dimension. This procedure can only be used for dual dimensions.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/18/98]

Param.Name: boxText
Param.Desc: Display box around dimension text flag.

Param.Name: precision
Param.Desc: Precision setting for displayed dimension value.

Item.Name: SetSegPt1
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the location of the start point of the referenced line or wall object.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the coordinates of the first point of the referenced line.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE ExtendLine;[[BR]]CONST[[BR]] kEXTENSION = 250mm;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE ProcessLine(lineHdl :HANDLE);[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] size :REAL;[[BR]] lineVec :VECTOR;[[BR]] arrow1,arrow2 :BOOLEAN;[[BR]] style,angle :INTEGER;[[BR]] p1X,p1Y,p2X,p2Y,lineLen :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetSegPt1(lineHdl, p1X, p1Y);[[BR]] GetSegPt2(lineHdl, p2X, p2Y);[[BR]] GetObjArrow(lineHdl, style, size, angle, arrow1, arrow2);[[BR]] IF arrow1 THEN BEGIN[[BR]] lineVec[1] := p1X - p2X;[[BR]] lineVec[2] := p1Y - p2Y;[[BR]] lineLen := Norm(lineVec);[[BR]] lineVec := (lineLen + kEXTENSION) * UnitVec(lineVec);[[BR]] p1X := p2X + lineVec[1];[[BR]] p1Y := p2Y + lineVec[2];[[BR]] SetSegPt1(lineHdl, p1X, p1Y);[[BR]] END ELSE BEGIN[[BR]] lineVec[1] := p2X - p1X;[[BR]] lineVec[2] := p2Y - p1Y;[[BR]] lineLen := Norm(lineVec);[[BR]] lineVec := (lineLen + kEXTENSION) * UnitVec(lineVec);[[BR]] p2X := p1X + lineVec[1];[[BR]] p2Y := p1Y + lineVec[2];[[BR]] SetSegPt2(lineHdl, p2X, p2Y);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] ForEachObject(ProcessLine, (((C='LineClass') & (T=LINE))));[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(ExtendLine);[[BR]]

Item.Name: SetSegPt2
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the location of the end point of the referenced line or wall object. [[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the coordinates of the second point of the referenced line.

Item.Name: SetSelect
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] selects the referenced object.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Selects the referenced object.

Item.Name: SetSpreadAngle
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the spread angle of the light object. If the light type is not a spot light, the procedure has no effect on the light.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets light spread angle of referenced light.

Item.Name: SetText
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the content of the referenced text object. The new text is assigned the font, size and style characteristics of the first character of the old text string.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the text value of the referenced object.

Item.Name: SetTextFont
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the font of a substring in the referenced text object.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the font of the specified substring in the referenced object.
Item.Example: SetTextFont(handleToText,0,5,GetFontID('Helvetica'));[[BR]][[BR]]{sets the first five characters of the referenced text string to Helvetica}[[BR]]

Item.Name: SetTextJust
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the text justification of the referenced text object. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextHorizontalAlignTable]][[BR]][[fig:textlocus.gif]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the justification of the referenced text object.

Item.Name: SetTextSize
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the text size of a specified substring in the referenced text object. Parameters [[p:2]] and [[p:3]] specify the substring start position and substring length. Parameter [[p:4]] specifies the size (in points) to be assigned to the substring.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the text size of a specified substring in the referenced object.
Item.Comments: The size parameter was previously an integer, but is now a floating point value. [9/14/98 - PCP]
Item.Example: SetTextSize(HandleToText,0,5,24);[[BR]]{set the first five characters of the referenced text string to 24 point text}[[BR]]

Item.Name: SetTextStyle
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the text style of a specified substring in the referenced text object.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextStyleTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the text style of a specified substring in the referenced object.
Item.Example: SetTextSyle(HandleToText,0,5,34);[[BR]][[BR]]{set the style of the substring text to bold and shadowed}

Item.Name: SetTool
Item.Description: Activates the specified Vectorworks tool for use. The tool remains selected as the active tool after use.[[BR]][[BR]]Note: [[note:SetCallToolIDTableRef]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active Vectorworks tool.

Item.Name: SetUnits
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets low-level unit values in a Vectorworks document. [[BR]][[BR]]If only one of the units values is to be modified, GetUnits should be called first, and the values retrieved from that call should be passed back into SetUnits. [[BR]][[BR]]To specify a standard units setting with default values, use Units. To specify a standard units setting, but with some modified values, use PrimaryUnit.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:UnitFormatsTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets low-level unit values in Vectorworks.
Item.Comments: Sets low-level unit values. If only one of the values is desired to change, GetUnits should be called first, and the values retrieved from that call should be passed back into SetUnits. If a standard unit with default values is desired, the Units procedure should be used, not this one. If a standard unit with some modified values is desired, the PrimaryUnit procedure should be called, not this one.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/18/98]

Param.Name: display
Param.Desc: Minimum display accuracy for the document.

Param.Name: squareName
Param.Desc: Squared unit label for displayed values.

Item.Name: SetVCenter
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the Vectorworks document view center.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the view center of the active document.

Item.Name: SetView
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the view of a Vectorworks document. The projection must be non-plan to modify the view.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the 3D document view orientation.

Item.Name: SetWallWidth
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the default wall width of the document.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active wall width of the document. This function is obsolete. Use SetWallPrefStyle instead.

Item.Name: SetZoom
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the zoom factor of the active Vectorworks document.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the view zoom of the active document.

Item.Name: SetZVals
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the Z (layer base elevation) and delta Z (layer thickness) for the active layer.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the Z (base elevation) and delta Z (layer thickness) values for the active layer.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] baseElevation, thickness :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] Layer('Test Layer');[[BR]] baseElevation := 1;[[BR]] thickness := 3;[[BR]] SetZVals(baseElevation, thickness);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: zDistance
Param.Desc: Layer base elevation (above document ground plane).

Item.Name: Shift
Item.Description: [[name]] returns TRUE if the Shift key was depressed during the last user event. This function operates with the MouseDown, KeyDown, AutoKey, GetPt, GetPtL, GetLine, and GetRect calls.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if the Shift key was pressed.

Item.Name: ShowClass
Item.Description: Sets the visibility of the specified class to normal (visible) status.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the specified class to visible.

Item.Name: ShowLayer
Item.Description: Procedure ShowLayer sets the visibility status of the active layer to visible. Newly created layers always defaulted to the Show mode.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active layer to visible.

Item.Name: Sin
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the sine of the specified value. The base value is assumed to represent an angle in radians.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the sine of the specified value.

Param.Name: v
Param.Desc: Numeric value for which to find the sine.

Item.Name: SingleTolerance
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] is used with dimensioning procedures to define a tolerance for the most recently created dimension.
Item.ShortDesc: Defines a single tolerance for the most recently created dimension.

Item.Name: Smooth
Item.Description: Procedure Smooth sets the smoothing type of newly created polyline or polygon objects.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:SmoothTypeTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the smoothing type of newly created polyline or polygon objects.

Item.Name: Snap
Item.Description: Obsolete procedure.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete procedure.
Item.Comments: Deleted this obsolete function as of 9.0.0b7 - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]][[BR]]Sets the state of the "Snap To Grid" and "Snap To Object" constraint as well as the "Snap To Loci" preference.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/18/98]

Item.Name: Space
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] writes a space to the current output file.
Item.ShortDesc: Writes a space character to the current output file.
Item.Example: Space(5);[[BR]]{write 5 spaces to the output file}

Item.Name: SprdAlign
Item.Description: Procedure SprdAlign determines the alignment setting within a worksheet cell. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:CellAlignTable]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active alignment of worksheet cells when loaded.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new SetWSCellAlignment. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: SprdBorder
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] determines the border settings for cells within the active worksheet.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the border style of worksheet cells when loaded.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new SetWSCellBorder. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: SprdFormat
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] determines the number format for cells within the active worksheet.[[BR]][[BR]]Values for [[p:3]] and [[p:4]] may not exceed 8 characters.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:CellFormatTable]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active numeric format of worksheet cells when loaded.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new SetWSCellNumberFormat. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: SprdSheet
Item.Description: Obsolete procedure.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete procedure. See NewSprdSheet.
Item.Comments: Deleted this obsolete function as of 9.0.0b7 - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]]OBSOLETE: see new CreateWS and ShowWS. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: SprdSize
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the number of rows and columns in the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the size of the referenced worksheet.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new GetWSRowColumnCount. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: SprdWidth
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] specifies the width of cells in a worksheet when loaded.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the width of worksheet cells when loaded.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new SetWSColumnWidth. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: Sqr
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the square of the specified value.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the square of v.

Item.Name: Sqrt
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the square root of the specified value.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the square root of v.

Param.Name: v
Param.Desc: Value for which to find the square root.

Item.Name: SrndArea
Item.Description: Function [[name]] when given a point, returns the area of the smallest polygon bounded by the selected objects.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the area of the smallest polygon bounded by a selection of objects
Item.Comments: Given a point, returns the area of the smallest polygon bounded by the selected objects. Returns nil if none can be found. [[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/18/98]

Item.Name: Str2Num
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the specified string as a numeric value.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the specified string as a numeric value.

Item.Name: StrDialog
Item.Description: Function [[name]], displays a dialog box which requests the user to enter a string value.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Displays a dialog box that requests the user to input a string.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] request, default, result :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] request := 'Enter some text...';[[BR]] default := 'the default value';[[BR]] result := StrDialog(request, default);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: SubtractSolid
Item.Description: Function [[name]] creates a new solid subtraction object from the referenced source objects.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:SolidsResultsTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a solid subtraction from the referenced objects.

Param.Name: obj1
Param.Desc: Handle to source object for subtract operation.

Param.Name: obj2
Param.Desc: Handle to source object for subtract operation.

Param.Name: newSolid
Param.Desc: Handle to resultant object from subtract operation.

Item.Name: Symbol
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] places a symbol in the document at the specified coordinate location.
Item.ShortDesc: Inserts a symbol into a document according to specified parameters.

Param.Name: rotationAngle
Param.Desc: Rotation angle of symbol, in degrees.

Item.Name: SymDefNum
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the number of symbol definitions within the active document.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of symbol definitions in the active document.

Item.Name: Tab
Item.Description: Procedure Tab writes a tab character to the current output file.
Item.ShortDesc: Writes a tab character to the current output file.
Item.Example: Tab(2);[[BR]]{writes two tabs to the output file}

Param.Name: n
Param.Desc: Number of tab characters to be written to file.

Item.Name: Tan
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the tangent of the specified value.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the tangent of the specified value.

Item.Name: TargetSprdSheet
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] selects the referenced worksheet as the active worksheet for the document. The worksheet is not opened onscreen.
Item.ShortDesc: Selects the referenced worksheet for editing.
Item.Comments: This selects a spreadsheet for use by the script. It does not open the spreadsheet. [sd 8/18/98][[BR]]OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new SetTopVisibleWS. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: TextFace
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the active text style of a Vectorworks document.[[BR]][[BR]]The text style may be one or a combination of the available styles, and should be enclosed in brackets. To specify multiple styles, each style should be separated by a comma.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active text style for the document.
Item.Comments: Make sure the docs indicate that the face must appear in set notation - check it out [PCP]
Item.Example: TextFace([Italic]);[[BR]]{set the active text style to Italic}[[BR]][[BR]]TextFace([Bold,Outline]);[[BR]]{set the active text style to bold outline}

Item.Name: TextFlip
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] flips newly created text vertically or horizontally. Parameter [[p:1]] specifies the flip effect to be applied to the text.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextFlipTable]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the flip effect to be applied to new text.

Item.Name: TextFont
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the active font for the document.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active font of the document.

Item.Name: TextJust
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the active text justification for a Vectorworks document. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextHorizontalAlignTable]][[BR]][[fig:textlocus.gif]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active text justification of the document.

Item.Name: TextOrigin
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] is used to specify the origin point (location) of a newly created text object.[[BR]][[BR]]The position of the actual text with respect to the origin is determined by the current vertical and horizontal text justification modes.[[BR]][[BR]][[fig:textlocus.gif]]
Item.ShortDesc: Specifies the insertion point of a new text string.

Item.Name: TextRotate
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the angle of a new text object.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the rotation angle of a new text object.

Param.Name: Rotation
Param.Desc: Rotation angle, in degrees, for text.

Item.Name: TextSize
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the active text size of a Vectorworks document.[[BR]][[BR]]Text size is specified in points (1 point = 1/72"). If 0 is specified, then the font size will default to 12 pt text.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active text size of the document.
Item.Comments: The size parameter is now a REAL so fractional point sizes can be specified. This should be fully compatible with existing VectorScript code. [9/14/98 - PCP] [[BR]][[BR]]Text size is in page-space and does not take drawing scale into account. [9/14/98 - PCP]
Item.Example: TextSize(18);[[BR]]{set the active text size to 18 point}

Item.Name: TextSpace
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the active spacing for a Vectorworks document. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextSpacingTable]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active text spacing for the document.
Item.Example: TextSpace(4);[[BR]]{set the active leading to double space}

Item.Name: Trunc
Item.Description: Truncates the decimal portion of the specified REAL number, returning the result as a LONGINT value.[[BR]][[BR]]Note that direct assignment of a REAL to a LONGINT will result in rounding the REAL to the nearest LONGINT, whereas Trunc always "rounds down" (if the number is positive).[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Converts a REAL to a LONGINT by dropping the fractional part.

Item.Name: Ungroup
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] ungroups selected objects in a Vectorworks document.When [[name]] is called, any selected group objects will be destroyed, reverting to the original component objects.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Ungroups selected object(s).

Item.Name: UnionRect
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns a rectangle based on the boundary enclosing the two specified rectangles.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a union of the two specified rectangular areas.

Param.Name: p5
Param.Desc: Top left coordinate of boundary rectangle.

Param.Name: p6
Param.Desc: Bottom right coordinate of boundary rectangle.

Item.Name: Units
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] specifies a standard units setting for the active document. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:UnitSettingTable]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Specifies a standard units setting for the active document

Item.Name: UprString
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] converts all characters in the specified string to upper case.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Converts the specified string to upper case.

Item.Name: ValidAngStr
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns TRUE if the specified value can be converted into a numeric angle value. If TRUE, the value (in decimal degrees) of the string is returned.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns if specified string can be converted into a angle value.
Item.Result: Returns TRUE if the specified string can be converted into a angle value.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] str :STRING;[[BR]] value :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] str := StrDialog('Enter the angle:', 'N10E');[[BR]] IF ValidAngStr(str, value) THEN Message(value);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: str
Param.Desc: String value to be checked for angle validity.

Param.Name: value
Param.Desc: Returns numeric angle value converted from input string.

Item.Name: ValidNumStr
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns TRUE if the specified string can be converted into a numeric value. If TRUE, the numeric value is returned.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns if specified string can be converted into a numeric value.
Item.Result: Returns TRUE if specified string can be converted into a numeric value.
Item.Example: CASE Item OF[[BR]]{// OK Button //}[[BR]]1:BEGIN[[BR]] IF [[name]](GetField(4),value) THEN BEGIN[[BR]] Done:=TRUE;[[BR]] replaceValue:= GetField(6);[[BR]] [[BR]] IF ItemSel(9) THEN textMode:=2;[[BR]] IF ItemSel(10) THEN textMode:=4;[[BR]] IF ItemSel(11) THEN textMode:=8;[[BR]] IF ItemSel(12) THEN layerMode:=16;[[BR]] IF ItemSel(13) THEN layerMode:=32;[[BR]] IF ItemSel(14) THEN caseMode:=1;[[BR]] END[[BR]] ELSE SysBeep;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]

Param.Name: str
Param.Desc: String value to be checked for numeric validity.

Param.Name: value
Param.Desc: Numeric value converted from input string.

Item.Name: VDelete
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] deletes the specified saved view.
Item.ShortDesc: Deletes the specified saved view.

Param.Name: name
Param.Desc: Name of view to be deleted.

Item.Name: VRestore
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] restores the specified saved view (i.e., sheet name).[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the current view to the specified saved view.

Param.Name: name
Param.Desc: Name of view to be displayed.

Item.Name: VSave
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] saves the current Vectorworks document view.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Saves the current view.

Item.Name: Wait
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] delays execution in VectorScript for a specified number of seconds.[[BR]][[BR]]When paused, a VectorScript routine stops at the point where [[name]] is encountered.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Pauses VectorScript command execution for the specified number of seconds.

Param.Name: seconds
Param.Desc: Number of seconds to pause script execution.

Item.Name: Wall
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a wall object in a Vectorworks document. The wall will adopt the current default settings for walls when created.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a wall from (x1,y1) to (x2,y2)

Item.Name: WallCap
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a wall cap on a newly created wall object.[[BR]][[BR]]Specifying nonzero values for the cap offset values will create angled wall caps.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets a wall cap on the most recently created wall object.
Item.Example: Wall(0,0,7',0);[[BR]]WallCap(True, True, False, 1.0', 0.0);[[BR]]{sets the cap status of the starting cap of the wall as flat cap, bevelled, with the right side extending 1' beyond the wall end point}

Param.Name: rightOffDistance
Param.Desc: Right extension of wall line beyond end point.

Param.Name: leftOffDistance
Param.Desc: Left extension of wall line beyond end point.

Item.Name: WallHeight
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the wall heights of the referenced wall object.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the start and end heights of the referenced wall.

Item.Name: WallPeak
Item.Description: Creates a wall peak of the specified height at a specified distance from the wall start point.[[BR]][[BR]]There is no error checking of the distance or peak height parameters; it is left to the programmer to ensure that the parameter values are valid.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a wall peak in the most recently created wall object.
Item.Example: SetZVal(0',8');[[BR]]Wall(0,0,7,0);[[BR]]WallPeak(3'-6",9'-0");[[BR]]{creates a 9' wall peak 3'-6" from the start point of the wall}[[BR]]

Param.Name: alongDistance
Param.Desc: Location of peak (measured from wall start point).

Item.Name: WallTo
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a wall object in a Vectorworks document. [[name]] begins the wall at the current graphics pen position, with the end point at the specified location.[[BR]][[BR]]To explicitly set the start point of the wall, [[name]] must be preceded by either Procedure MoveTo, LineTo, Wall, or [[name]]. The procedure automatically performs a join/cleanup operation an intersection if the previous procedure was a wall creation procedure.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a wall from the current pen position to (pX,pY).
