Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] x1, y1, x2, y2 :REAL;[[BR]] resourceID :LONGINT;[[BR]] wallStyleCnt :INTEGER;[[BR]] wallStyleName :STRING;[[BR]] wallStyleHand :HANDLE;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] resourceID := BuildResourceList(127, 113, '', wallStyleCnt);[[BR]] IF wallStyleCnt > 0 THEN BEGIN[[BR]] wallStyleName := GetNameFromResourceList(resourceID, 1);[[BR]] AlrtDialog(wallStyleName);[[BR]] wallStyleHand := ImportResourceToCurrentFile(resourceID, 1);[[BR]] SetWallPrefStyle(wallStyleName);[[BR]] END ELSE BEGIN[[BR]] SetWallWidth(3.5");[[BR]] END;[[BR]] GetPt(x1, y1);[[BR]] GetPtL(x1, y1, x2, y2);[[BR]] MoveTo(x1, y1);[[BR]] WallTo(x2, y2);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: WallWidth
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the wall width of the referenced wall object.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the width of the referenced wall.

Item.Name: YNDialog
Item.Description: Function [[name]] displays a dialog box which requests the user to select a Yes or No value. If the user selects the Yes button in the dialog box, the value returned by [[name]] is TRUE; if the user selects No, the function returns FALSE.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Displays a dialog box which requests the user to select a Yes or No value.

Item.Name: DSelectAll
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] deselects all selected visible objects on the active layer of a Vectorworks document. If Layer Options is set to Show-Snap-Modify Others, then [[name]] will deselect all selected visible objects within the document.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Deselects all objects on active layers.

Item.Name: ClosePoly
Item.Description: Procedures [[name]] set the polygon creation mode for polygon objects created in VectorScript to closed. To turn this mode off, use Procedure OpenPoly; the two modes used in conjunction will act as a toggle for the feature.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the polygon drawing mode to closed polygons.

Item.Name: OpenPoly
Item.Description: Procedures [[name]] set the polygon creation mode for polygon objects created in VectorScript to open. To turn this mode off, use Procedure ClosePoly; the two modes used in conjunction will act as a toggle for the feature.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the polygon drawing mode to open polygons.

Item.Name: LckObjs
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] locks the selected objects. When an object is locked, it[[BR]]may be copied or duplicated, but it may not be changed in any other way.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Locks the selected object(s).

Item.Name: UnLckObjs
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] unlocks the selected objects.
Item.ShortDesc: Unlocks the selected object(s).

Item.Name: Absolute
Item.Description: Sets the point designation method for VectorScript procedure calls. When this mode is active, all points specified in procedure calls are assumed to be coordinate locations within the document.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the point designation method of VectorScript.

Item.Name: Relative
Item.Description: Sets the point designation method for VectorScript procedure calls. [[BR]][[BR]]When this mode is active, all points specified in procedure calls are assumed to be X-Y offsets from the current graphics pen location. For example, the point designation (0,2) will move the graphics pen two vertical units away from its present location.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the point designation method of VectorScript.

Item.Name: FlipHor
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] horizontally mirrors selected objects about the center of the object(s). This procedure produces the same effect as the command 'Flip Horizontal' .[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Flips selected object(s) horizontally.

Item.Name: FlipVer
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] vertically mirrors selected objects about the center of the[[BR]]object(s). This procedure produce the same effect as the command 'Flip Vertical'.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Flips selected object(s) vertically.

Item.Name: Forward
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] moves the selected objects up one level in the onscreen object stacking order.[[BR]][[BR]]Objects in the document are drawn in the order in which they are created, with newer objects drawn on top of previously created objects. It is sometimes necessary to adjust this drawing, or stacking, order in order to make objects visible or create a desired effect.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Moves selected object(s) forward in the object stacking order.

Item.Name: Backward
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] moves the selected objects down one level in the onscreen object stacking order.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Moves selected object(s) backward in the object stacking order.

Item.Name: MoveFront
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] moves the selected objects to the front (top) of the onscreen object stacking order.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Moves selected object(s) to the front of the object stacking order.

Item.Name: MoveBack
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] moves the selected objects to the back (bottom) of the onscreen object stacking order.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Moves selected object(s) to the rear of the object stacking order.

Item.Name: SysBeep
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] uses the current system prompt sound to alert the user.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Invokes the system beep.

Item.Name: ClrMessage
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] closes the message palette.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Closes the message palette.

Item.Name: Suppress
Item.Description: Obsolete. Unsupported.
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete.
Item.Comments: Deleted this obsolete function as of 9.0.0b7 - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]][[BR]]In MiniCAD 7 and prior, this would allow MiniPascal execution errors to be suppressed, but I dou't think it ever worked. It is now obsolete.

Item.Name: Update
Item.Description: Obsolete. Unsupported.
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete.
Item.Comments: Deleted this obsolete function as of 9.0.0b7 - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]][[BR]]Obsolete - old custom dialog code.

Item.Name: PushAttrs
Item.Description: Stores current attribute, tool, text, and constraint settings for later retrieval as the document default settings. Document settings can be modified as needed after using this call, and the stored settings can be restored with a call to PopAttrs. Calling this function more than once (nested) is allowed. The settings will be placed on a stack, and will be retrieved by calls to PopAttrs in the correct sequence. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Saves the current document attributes state for retrieval.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] PushAttrs;[[BR]] PenFore(215);[[BR]] PenBack(5);[[BR]] PenPat(25);[[BR]] PenSize(42);[[BR]] PenPat(25);[[BR]] SetConstrain('q');[[BR]] CallTool(-201);[[BR]] PopAttrs;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: PopAttrs
Item.Description: Restores the attribute, tool, and constraint settings saved by an earlier call to PushAttrs.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Retrieves the saved document attributes state stored by PushAttrs.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] PushAttrs;[[BR]] PenFore(215);[[BR]] PenBack(5);[[BR]] PenPat(25);[[BR]] PenSize(42);[[BR]] PenPat(25);[[BR]] SetConstrain('q');[[BR]] CallTool(-201);[[BR]] PopAttrs;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: Run
Item.Description: Initiates the execution of a VectorScript command by signalling the VectorScript interpreter to execute the script source code. [[BR]][[BR]]The procedure takes a single parameter, which is the name of the VectorScript command as defined at the beginning of the source code listing.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Initiates the execution of a script..

Item.Name: Poly
Item.Description: Procedure Poly creates a polygon object in the document. Vertices of the polygon are specified by a parameter list of x1,y1 through xn,yn, which correspond to the coordinate locations of each vertex.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Draws a polygon with specified vertices.

Item.Name: NoAngleVar
Item.Description: Sets the angle designation method in VectorScript. When called, VectorScript will treat language symbols which can be interpreted as direction angles (e.g., N, S, NW, SE) as as angles, rather than as variables.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Disables angle variable support.
Item.Example: procedure test;[[BR]]var[[BR]] S : Real;[[BR]][[BR]]begin[[BR]] [[name]];[[BR]] S := 30;[[BR]] LineTo(3", #S);[[BR]] { The 'S' will be treated as the direction 'South' }[[BR]] { and line will be drawn on 270 degree angle. }[[BR]][[BR]]end;[[BR]]run(test);[[BR]]

Item.Name: WriteLn
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] outputs the specified data to an ASCII text file. The variable length parameter list specifies the data to be written to the file. [[BR]][[BR]]Parameters may be any valid data type, and data types may be mixed in a single call to the procedure. A carriage return is appended to the end of the line of data, so that the file pointer is at the beginning of a new line in the file, and any data written to the file after the procedure call will be on the new line.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:WriteLnFormatNote]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Writes a line of data to a text file. Uses character encoding and line ending appropriate for platform on which the script is running. This allows the text file to be viewed by an external text editor on that platform.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]CONST[[BR]] Vendor = 'ACME';[[BR]] Price = 123.45;[[BR]] Tax = 1.07;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] ReWrite('Output.txt');[[BR]] WriteLn('Mfr/Cost: ', Vendor, '/', Price + Tax);[[BR]] Close('Output.txt');[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: Write
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] outputs the specified data to an ASCII text file. The variable length parameter list specifies the data to be written to the file. [[BR]][[BR]]Parameters may be any valid data type, and data types may be mixed in a single call to the procedure. [[name]] leaves the file pointer positioned at the end of the last data value written to the file; any data subsequently written to the file will be appended to the end of this value.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:WriteLnFormatNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Writes data to a text file. Uses character encoding appropriate for platform on which the script is running. This allows the text file to be viewed by an external text editor on that platform.

Item.Name: BeginText
Item.Description: Procedures [[name]] creates a new text object in a Vectorworks document. All text specified between calls to [[name]] and EndText will be part of the new text object.[[BR]]Text may be specified in single quotes, or variables may be used..[[BR]][[BR]]To specify the insertion point of the new text object, use TextOrigin.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new text object.
Item.Example: { Create a multiple line text object at 0,0 }[[BR]]TextFont(GetFontID('Monaco'));[[BR]]TextSize(24);[[BR]]TextOrigin(0,0);[[BR]]BeginText;[[BR]]'This multiple line text block [[BR]]is in 24pt Monaco and was created[[BR]]by a VectorScript.'[[BR]]EndText;[[BR]]

Item.Name: ReadLn
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] will read data from a currently open text file. The variable length parameter list returns the read data in the specified parameters.[[BR]][[BR]]Supported data types include INTEGER, REAL, LONGINT, CHAR or STRING. If the procedure encounters an EOF(end-of-file) marker, an error is generated. [[name]] positions the file position pointer to the beginning of a new line after the procedure is called.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] will detect tabs as delimiters, allowing multiple string values to be assigned to variables.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Reads data from the currently open text file and moves to the beginning of the next line of data.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] fileName, value1, value2, value3 :STRING; [[BR]] major, minor, maintenance, platform :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetVersion(major, minor, maintenance, platform);[[BR]] IF platform = 1 THEN BEGIN[[BR]] fileName := '/Example.txt';[[BR]] END ELSE BEGIN[[BR]] fileName := 'C:\Example.txt';[[BR]] END;[[BR]] Open(fileName);[[BR]] ReadLn(value1, value2, value3);[[BR]] Close(fileName);[[BR]] AlrtDialog(lineOfText);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: Read
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] will read data from a currently open text file. The variable length parameter list returns the read data in the specified parameters.Supported data types include INTEGER, REAL, LONGINT, CHAR or STRING. [[BR]][[BR]]Non STRING data values must be separated by a tab or space to be correctly read into variables. If the procedure encounters an EOF(end-of-file) marker, an error is generated. [[name]] does not position the file position pointer to the beginning of a new line after the procedure is called.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] will detect tabs as delimiters, allowing multiple string values to be assigned to variables.
Item.ShortDesc: Reads data from the currently open text file.

Item.Name: Poly3D
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a three dimensional polygon in a Vectorworks document. The vertices of the polygon are specified by a list of parameters x1, y1, z1 through xn, yn, and zn, which specify the coordinate locations of each vertex.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a 3 dimensional polygon with vertices at(x1,y1,z1) thru (xn,yn,zn).

Item.Name: Message
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] displays a floating message palette onscreen. Parameters z1 thru zN specify the values to be displayed in the palette. Parameters can be any supported data type or variables.[[BR]][[BR]]If [[name]] is called and the palette is already displayed, the value in the palette will be replaced by the new information. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Displays a floating message palette with specified message. Takes any valid data type.
Item.Example: Message('Hello, world');[[BR]][[BR]]Message('The Number of objects was :',theNumber);[[BR]]{displays a string using the variable value}

Item.Name: ForEachObject
Item.Description: Calls a user defined procedure to operate on each object matching the specified search criteria. [[BR]][[BR]]The procedure subroutine specified by the callback parameter must have one parameter of type HANDLE, which is passed the handle to an object by the [[name]] call.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Executes the specified subroutine on any object matching the specified search criteria.

Param.Name: callback
Param.Desc: Name of action procedure to be applied to matching objects

Item.Name: EndText
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] completes creation of a new text object.
Item.ShortDesc: Completes creation of a new text object.

Item.Name: AngleVar
Item.Description: Sets the angle designation method in VectorScript. When called, VectorScript will treat language symbols which can be interpreted as direction angles (e.g., N, S, NW, SE) as variables rather than angles.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Enables angle variable support.
Item.Example: procedure test;[[BR]]var[[BR]] S : Real;[[BR]][[BR]]begin[[BR]] [[name]];[[BR]] S := 30;[[BR]] LineTo(3", #S);[[BR]] { The 'S' will be treated as a variable }[[BR]] { and line will be drawn on 30 degree angle. }[[BR]][[BR]]end;[[BR]]run(test);[[BR]]

Item.Name: Ord
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the corresponding ASCII number of the specified character value. Parameter [[name]] specifies the character.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the ASCII code of the specified character.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Main;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] str :STRING;[[BR]] cnt :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] str := GetText(FSActLayer);[[BR]] FOR cnt := 1 TO Len(str) DO[[BR]] AlrtDialog(Concat(Ord(Copy(str, cnt, 1))));[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Main);

Item.Name: EvalStr
Item.Description: Evaluates whether an object meets the specified search criteria. [[BR]][[BR]]When used with record criteria, it will determine whether a specific record is attached to the object; if used with record-field criteria, it will return the value of the field as a STRING.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Evaluates whether an object meets the specified search criteria.
Item.Result: If the criteria is a record-field criteria, the procedure will return the value contained within the field. All other criteria return the TRUE-FALSE state of the criteria condition.

Param.Name: h
Param.Desc: Handle of object to which the search criteria will be applied.

Item.Name: Eval
Item.Description: Evaluates whether an object meets the specified search criteria. [[BR]][[BR]]When used with record criteria, it will determine whether a specific record is attached to the object; if used with record-field criteria, it will return the value of the field as a REAL value.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Evaluates whether an object meets the specified search criteria.
Item.Result: If the criteria is a record-field criteria, the procedure will return the value contained within the field. All other criteria return the TRUE-FALSE state of the criteria condition.

Param.Name: h
Param.Desc: Handle of object to which the search criteria will be applied.

Item.Name: Concat
Item.Description: Function [[name]] combines, or concatenates, all the specified parameters in order and returns the resultant string.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Concatenates and returns the specified strings as a single string.

Item.Name: Chr
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the ASCII character corresponding to the specified numeric code. The ASCII code value must be between 1 and 255.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the character equivalent to the specified ASCII code.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] cnt :INTEGER;[[BR]] str :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] FOR cnt := 128 TO 255 DO BEGIN[[BR]] str := Concat(str, Chr(cnt));[[BR]] IF cnt MOD 32 = 0 THEN str := Concat(str, Chr(13));[[BR]] END;[[BR]] AlrtDialog(str);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: SetDashStyle
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a new linestyle in a Vectorworks document. Parameter swt defines whether the linestyle will be scaled with thickness, and parameter numPairs specifies the number of length pairs defining the linestyle.[[BR]][[BR]]The linestyle is defined by up to five black/white length pairs, which are specified in parameters b1,w1 through b5,w5. The minimum length of any given black or white parameter is 1 point, or 1/72 of an inch, and the line specification must be in pairs.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new active linestyle.

Item.Name: Ang2Vec
Item.Description: Returns a 3-dimensional vector that is defined by the specified polar angle and length values.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a vector that is defined by the specified angle and length values.
Item.Result: Returns a 3-dimensional vector.

Param.Name: angleR
Param.Desc: The angle of the vector (in degrees).

Item.Name: AngBVec
Item.Description: Returns the positive angle between the two specified vectors, in the range of 0~180 degrees.[[BR]][[BR]]When used with 3D vectors, the angle returned will be in a plane defined by the two vectors.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the positive angle between the two specified vectors, in the range of 0~180 degrees.
Item.Result: Returns a REAL value which is the angle (in degrees) between the two vectors.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] pt1, pt2, pt3, pt4 :VECTOR;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetPt(pt1.x, pt1.y);[[BR]] GetPtL(pt1.x, pt1.y, pt2.x, pt2.y);[[BR]] GetPtL(pt2.x, pt2.y, pt3.x, pt3.y);[[BR]] MoveTo(pt1.x, pt1.y);[[BR]] LineTo(pt2.x, pt2.y);[[BR]] LineTo(pt3.x, pt3.y);[[BR]] pt4 := (pt1 + pt3) / 2;[[BR]] TextOrigin(pt4.x, pt4.y);[[BR]] CreateText(Concat(AngBVec(pt1 - pt2, pt3 - pt2)));[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: Comp
Item.Description: Returns the components of a comparison of two vectors.[[BR]][[BR]]The vector component of [[p:1]] along [[p:2]] in [[p:3]], and the vector component of [[p:1]] orthogonal to [[p:2]] in [[p:4]].[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the components of a comparison of two vectors.

Param.Name: v4
Param.Desc: Component of vector 1 orthogonal to vector 2.

Item.Name: Norm
Item.Description: Returns the length, or magnitude, of the specified vector.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the length of the specified vector.
Item.Result: A REAL value which is the length of the vector.

Item.Name: Perp
Item.Description: Returns a vector which is perpendicular to the specified vector. The resultant vector will have the same magnitude as the source vector, and their scalar product will be zero. The direction of the return vector will equal Vec2Ang(Vec) - 90.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a vector which is perpendicular to the specified vector.
Item.Result: Returns a VECTOR.

Item.Name: UnitVec
Item.Description: Returns the standard unit vector of the specified vector.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the standard unit vector of the specified vector.
Item.Result: Returns a VECTOR.

Item.Name: Vec2Ang
Item.Description: Returns the angle, in degrees, of the specified vector. If [[p:1]] is a 3D vector, Vec2Ang will return the 3D angle between [[p:1]] and the X axis. If [[p:1]] is {0,0,0}, Vec2Ang returns -90.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the angle of the specified vector.
Item.Result: Returns the angle of the specified vector in degrees.

Item.Name: MenuItem
Item.Description: Obsolete.
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete. Unimplemented.
Item.Comments: Obsolete. Unimplemented.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/18/98]

Item.Name: Angle
Item.Description: Returns the angle value of a line segment or an arc. If more than one line segment or arc matches the search criteria, the function will return the sum of the matching objects' angle values.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the angles of the objects matching the search criteria.
Item.Result: If an object matches the search criteria but is not a line segment or an arc, the value 0(zero) is returned.

Item.Name: Area
Item.Description: Returns the area of an object. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the sum of all the matching object areas.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the area of the objects matching the search criteria. This function is obsolete. Use CriteriaArea or AreaN instead.
Item.Example: totalA:=Area((C='Plywood')and(L='First'));[[BR]]{returns the area of all objects in class 'Plywood' on layer 'First'}

Item.Name: BotBound
Item.Description: Returns the y-coordinate of the bounding box (bottom right corner) of an object matching the search criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the bottom value of the last matching object found.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the y-coordinate value of thebottom right corner of the object matching the search criteria.

Item.Name: Count
Item.Description: Counts all of the objects which match the search criteria.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of the objects matching the search criteria.
Item.Example: CountValue := [[name]]((FP=4)and(T='Rect'));[[BR]]{counts all rectangles with a fillpat index of 4}

Item.Name: DSelectObj
Item.Description: Deselects all objects which match the search criteria.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Deselects objects matching the search criteria.

Item.Name: Height
Item.Description: Returns the height of an object. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the sum of all the matching object heights.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the height of the objects matching the search criteria.

Item.Name: LeftBound
Item.Description: Returns the x-coordinate of the bounding box (top left corner) of an object matching the search criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the left value of the last matching object found.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the x-coordinate value of the top left corner of the object matching the search criteria.

Item.Name: Length
Item.Description: Returns the length of an object. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the sum of all the matching object lengths.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the length of the objects matching the search criteria.
Item.Example: LengthValue:=[[name]](C='CrossMembers');[[BR]]{returns the length of all objects in class 'CrossMembers'}

Item.Name: ObjectType
Item.Description: Returns the type identifier an object. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the type identifier of the last matching object will be returned.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the object type of the objects matching the search criteria.
Item.Example: TypeValue:=[[name]](N='Mystery Object');[[BR]]{returns the type of the object named 'Mystery Object'}

Item.Name: Perim
Item.Description: Returns the perimeter of an object. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the sum of the matching objects' perimeters.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the perimeter of the objects matching the search criteria.
Item.Example: PerimValue := Perim(C='Fence');[[BR]]{returns the total perimeter of all objects in the class 'Fence'}

Item.Name: RightBound
Item.Description: Returns the x-coordinate of the bounding box (bottom right corner) of an object matching the search criteria If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the sum of the coordinates of all the matching objects.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the y-coordinate value of the bottom right corner of the object matching the search criteria.

Item.Name: SelectObj
Item.Description: Selects all objects which match the search criteria.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Selects objects matching the search criteria.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] red, green, blue, color :LONGINT;[[BR]] criteria :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] red := 65535;[[BR]] green := 0;[[BR]] blue := 0;[[BR]] RGBToColorIndex(red, green, blue, color);[[BR]] Rect(0, 0, 1, 1);[[BR]] SetPenFore(LNewObj, color);[[BR]] DSelectAll;[[BR]] criteria := Concat('(INSYMBOL & INVIEWPORT & (PF=', color, '))');[[BR]] SelectObj(criteria);[[BR]] Message(criteria);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: TopBound
Item.Description: Returns the y-coordinate of the bounding box (top left corner) of an object matching the search criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the sum of the coordinates of all the matching objects.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the y-coordinate value of the top left corner of the object matching the search criteria.

Item.Name: Width
Item.Description: Returns the width of an object matching the search criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the sum of the matching object widths.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the width of the objects matching the search criteria.

Item.Name: XCenter
Item.Description: Returns the x-coordinate of the center point of an object matching the serach criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the sum of the coordinates of all the matching objects.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the x-coordinate value of the center of an object matching the search criteria.
Item.Example: XCenValue:=XCenter(N='Board');[[BR]]{returns the x-coord of the center of the named object 'Board'}

Item.Name: YCenter
Item.Description: Returns the y-coordinate of the center point of an object matching the serach criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the sum of the coordinates of all the matching objects.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the Y center coordinate value of the objects matching the search criteria.
Item.Example: YCenValue:=YCenter(N='Board');[[BR]]{returns the y-coord of the center of the named object 'Board'}

Item.Name: GetHandle
Item.Description: Obsolete procedure.
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete procedure.
Item.Comments: Deleted this obsolete function as of 9.0.0b7 - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]]

Item.Name: Show
Item.Description: Changes the object visibility to "visible" for objects matching the specified search criteria. This is for object visibilities that were hidden with Hide, HideSelectedObjects and ShowOnlySelected commands. The object will only become visible if it is also on a visible layer and class.
Item.ShortDesc: Makes objects with the specified search criteria visible.
Item.Comments: Makes objects with the specified search criteria visible if they are not already.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/18/98]

Item.Name: Hide
Item.Description: Changes the object visibility to "invisible" for objects matching the specified search criteria. Hidden objects can be made visible with Show or UnHideObjects commands. Affects only objects on visible layers and classes.
Item.ShortDesc: Makes objects with the specified search criteria invisible.
Item.Comments: Makes objects with the specified search criteria invisible if they are not already[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/18/98]

Item.Name: GetDashStyle
Item.Description: Deprecated - will generate error. Use GetDashStyleN instead.
Item.ShortDesc: Deprecated - will generate error. Use GetDashStyleN instead.
Item.Comments: Deprecated - will generate error. Use GetDashStyleN instead.

Item.Name: GrayClass
Item.Description: Sets the visibility of the specified class to grayed status.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the class visibility to grayed.

Item.Name: GetFolderPath
Item.Description: Function GetFolderPath returns the full path to the requested folder independent of localized folder names. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:FolderPath]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the full path to the requested folder independent of localized folder names.

Item.Name: SaveSheet
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] saves current view, page, class, and layer settings in a new sheet with a specified name. The saveView, saveClass and saveLayer parameters can be used to selectively not save an aspect of the view. Also after the sheet is created, the SetObjectVariableBoolean function can be used to control whether to utilize the view, page, class or layer settings.
Item.ShortDesc: Saves the current view, page, class, and layer settings in a new sheet.
Item.Comments: Saves the current view, page, class, and layer settings in a new sheet with the given name. The saveView, saveClass, and saveLayer booleans can be used to selectively not save an aspect of the view.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/18/98]
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] savedViewHandle :HANDLE;[[BR]] ovSheetSaveView :BOOLEAN;[[BR]] ovSheetSavePage :BOOLEAN;[[BR]] ovSheetSaveClass :BOOLEAN;[[BR]] ovSheetSaveLayer :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] savedViewHandle := GetObject('Untitled View');[[BR]] IF savedViewHandle <> NIL THEN BEGIN[[BR]] ovSheetSaveView := GetObjectVariableBoolean(savedViewHandle, 450);[[BR]] ovSheetSavePage := GetObjectVariableBoolean(savedViewHandle, 451);[[BR]] ovSheetSaveClass := GetObjectVariableBoolean(savedViewHandle, 452);[[BR]] ovSheetSaveLayer := GetObjectVariableBoolean(savedViewHandle, 453);[[BR]] AlrtDialog(Concat([[BR]] 'handle type: ', GetType(savedViewHandle), Chr(13),[[BR]] 'save view: ', ovSheetSaveView, Chr(13),[[BR]] 'save page: ', ovSheetSavePage, Chr(13),[[BR]] 'save class: ', ovSheetSaveClass, Chr(13),[[BR]] 'save layer: ', ovSheetSaveLayer));[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: SetSymbolOptions
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the insert and break options for the specified symbol. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:SymInsertOptionTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the insert and break options for a specified symbol
Item.Comments: Deleted this obsolete function as of 9.0.0b7 - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]][[BR]]Sets the insert and break options for the master symbol named <name>. [[BR]][[BR]]The insertMode options are:[[BR]]0 = insert on the center line of the wall[[BR]]1 = insert on the edge of the wall[[BR]][[BR]]The breakMode options are:[[BR]]1 = Full break with caps, both edges of the wall are broken and cap lines close off the two broken portions of the wall.[[BR]]2 = Full break with no caps, both edges of the wall are broken and there are no cap lines.[[BR]]3 = Half break, for edge insertions only, wall edge is broken on the same edge that the symbol is inserted on.[[BR]]4 = No break, there is no break in the wall, the symbol is drawn on top of the wall.[[BR]][[BR]]See also Get SymbolOptions[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/18/98]

Item.Name: GetSymbolOptions
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the insert and break options for the specified symbol. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:SymInsertOptionTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns insertion options from a specified symbol.
Item.Comments: Deleted this obsolete function as of 9.0.0b7 - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]][[BR]]Gets the insertion options from the master symbol named <name>.[[BR]][[BR]]See SetSymbolOptions.[[BR]][[BR]][8/18/98]

Param.Name: breakMode
Param.Desc: Returns break mode of inserted symbol.

Item.Name: AddSymToWallEdge
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] inserts a symbol in the referenced wall using the specified parameters to define placement. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:SymbolAlignTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Inserts a symbol in a wall according to specified parameters.
Item.Comments: Inserts a symbol in a wall either on the centerline, or on the edge. All parameters are used as input.[[BR]][[BR]]h = handle to the wall we are inserting into.[[BR]]alongDistance = distance along the wall from the wall starting point to the symbols insertion point.[[BR]]heightDistance = height of the symbol in 3D[[BR]]flip = sets the orientation[[BR]]right = sets the orientaion[[BR]]symbolName = the name of master symbol that gets inserted in the wall[[BR]]insertMode = 0 for centerline, 1 for left edge, 2 for right edge[[BR]][sd 8/18/98]

Param.Name: alongDistance
Param.Desc: Offset distance from wall start of insertion point.

Param.Name: symbolName
Param.Desc: Name of symbol to be inserted.

Item.Name: UndoOff
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] clears the undo table and suspends undo for the remainder of the VectorScript procedure. The undo system resumes after the procedure is completed.
Item.ShortDesc: Clears the undo table and suspends undo for the remainder of the script. It is sometimes advisable to precede UndoOff with a NonUndoableActionOK call to allow the user a chance to back out of the operation.

Item.Name: CreateSphere
Item.Description: Function [[name]] creates a new sphere object in a Vectorworks document.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a 3D sphere object.
Item.Result: The function returns a handle to the new sphere object.

Item.Name: CreateHemisphere
Item.Description: Function [[name]] creates a new hemisphere object in a Vectorworks document. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a 3D hemisphere
Item.Result: The function returns a handle to the new hemisphere object.

Item.Name: CreateCone
Item.Description: Creates a 3D cone object in a Vectorworks document.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a 3D cone
Item.Result: The function returns a handle to the new cone object.

Item.Name: GetDrawingSizeRect
Item.Description: Returns the top left and bottom right coordinates of a rectangle surrounding the entire area of the document containing objects.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the top left and bottom right coordinates of the entire drawing
Item.Comments: Returns the top left and bottom right coordinates of a rectangle surrounding the entire drawing.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/18/98]

Param.Name: p1
Param.Desc: Returns top left coordinate of drawing rectangle.

Param.Name: p2
Param.Desc: Returns bottom right coordinate of drawing rectangle.

Item.Name: GetZoom
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the percentage of the zoom factor in the current document view.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the percentage of the zoom factor in the current view.
Item.Comments: Returns the percentage of the zoom factor in the current view. (100.0 would be the value if no zooming was done).[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/18/98]

Item.Name: GetVCenter
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the Vectorworks document coordinates at the center of the drawing window.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the point at the center of the drawing window
Item.Comments: Returns the point which is in the center of the drawing window.[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/18/98]
Item.Example: PROCEDURE GetWindowSizeProc;[[BR]]CONST[[BR]] kLeftPaletteMargin = 54;[[BR]] kRightPaletteMargin = 176;[[BR]] kScrollMargin = 18;[[BR]] kTopDocumentMargin = 48;[[BR]] kRulerMargin = 16;[[BR]] kBottomDocumentMargin = 50;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] ViewCenterX, ViewCenterY :REAL;[[BR]] ViewWidth, ViewHeight :REAL;[[BR]] ScnX1, ScnY1, ScnX2, ScnY2 :REAL;[[BR]] ViewX1, ViewY1, ViewX2, ViewY2 :REAL;[[BR]] LayerScale :REAL;[[BR]] TopBottomMargin :REAL;[[BR]] LeftRightMargin :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] LayerScale := GetLScale(ActLayer);[[BR]] GetVCenter(ViewCenterX, ViewCenterY);[[BR]] GetScreen(ScnX1, ScnY1, ScnX2, ScnY2);[[BR]] TopBottomMargin := kTopDocumentMargin + kBottomDocumentMargin;[[BR]] LeftRightMargin := 0;[[BR]] IF GetPref(22) THEN begin {Left Palette Margin Turned On}[[BR]] LeftRightMargin := LeftRightMargin + kLeftPaletteMargin;[[BR]] END;[[BR]] IF GetPref(23) THEN begin {Right Palette Margin Turned On}[[BR]] LeftRightMargin := LeftRightMargin + kRightPaletteMargin;[[BR]] END;[[BR]] IF GetPref(6) THEN BEGIN {Show Rulers}[[BR]] TopBottomMargin := TopBottomMargin + kRulerMargin;[[BR]] LeftRightMargin := LeftRightMargin + kRulerMargin;[[BR]] END;[[BR]] IF GetPref(7) THEN BEGIN {Show Scroll Bars}[[BR]] TopBottomMargin := TopBottomMargin + kScrollMargin;[[BR]] LeftRightMargin := LeftRightMargin + kScrollMargin;[[BR]] END;[[BR]] ViewWidth := (ScnX2 - LeftRightMargin) * LayerScale / (72 * GetZoom / 100);[[BR]] ViewHeight := (ScnY2 - TopBottomMargin) * LayerScale / (72 * GetZoom / 100);[[BR]] ViewX1 := ViewCenterX - (ViewWidth / 2) {+ (LeftRightMargin / 2)};[[BR]] ViewX2 := ViewCenterX + (ViewWidth / 2) {- (LeftRightMargin / 2)};[[BR]] ViewY1 := ViewCenterY + (ViewHeight / 2) {- (TopBottomMargin / 2)};[[BR]] ViewY2 := ViewCenterY - (ViewHeight / 2) {+ (TopBottomMargin / 2)};[[BR]] Rect(ViewX1, ViewY1, ViewX2, ViewY2);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(GetWindowSizeProc);[[BR]]

Item.Name: IsObjectFlipped
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the flip orientation of the specified 3D object. The function returns TRUE if the object is currently flipped. [[BR]][[BR]]This function works for sweeps, extrudes, multiple extrudes, symbols, solids, layer references, and plug-in objects.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the flip orientation of 3D objects
Item.Comments: Returns true if the object is currently flipped. Works for sweeps, extrudes, mextrudes, symbols, solids, layer refs, and plug-in objects[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/19/98][[BR]]
Item.Example: FUNCTION ObjFlippedInWall(objH, wallH :HANDLE) :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] ObjFlippedInWall := ((Trunc(GetSymRot(objH)) <> Trunc(HAngle(wallH))) = IsObjectFlipped(objH)); [[BR]]END;

Param.Name: objectHand

Param.Name: recordHand

Param.Name: wallHand
Param.Desc: Returns a handle to a wall, (if this object is in a wall).

Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] symDefHandle, h :HANDLE;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE AlertMe;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] Message(GetSDName(symDefHandle));[[BR]] SetSelect(h);[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] DSelectAll;[[BR]] ClrMessage;[[BR]] symDefHandle := FSymDef;[[BR]] WHILE symDefHandle <> NIL DO BEGIN[[BR]] h := FInSymDef(symDefHandle);[[BR]] WHILE h <> NIL DO BEGIN[[BR]] IF IsLWByClass(h) THEN AlertMe;[[BR]] h := NextObj(h);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] symDefHandle := NextObj(symDefHandle);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: GetClFillFore
Item.Description: Returns the fill foreground color setting of the specified class. The color is returned as the RGB components of the color. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the fill foreground color setting of a specified class
Item.Comments: Returns the fill foreground color setting of the class named className in parameters colorRV, colorGV, and colorBV.

Item.Name: GetClFillBack
Item.Description: Returns the fill background color setting of the specified class. The color is returned as the three RGB components of the color. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the fill background color setting of a specified class
Item.Comments: Returns the fill background color setting of the class named className in parameters colorRV, colorGV, and colorBV.

Item.Name: GetClFPat
Item.Description: Returns the fill or hatch pattern of the specified class. [[BR]][[BR]]A positive return value in a range of 0 to 71 is the index of the bitmap fill pattern of the class. A negative value is the negative of the fill pattern index (index * -1).[[BR]][[BR]][[note:FillPatTable]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the fill or hatch pattern of a specified class.
Item.Comments: Returns the fill pattern of the class named className.

Item.Comments: Deprecated - will generate error. Use GetClLSN instead. Original description was: Returns the line style of a specified class.

Item.ShortDesc: Returns the line weight of a specified class.
Item.Comments: Returns the line weight of the class named className.

Item.Comments: Returns the pen foreground color setting of the class named className in parameters colorRV, colorGV, and colorBV.

Item.ShortDesc: Returns the pen background color setting of a specified class.
Item.Comments: Returns the pen background color setting of the class named className in parameters colorRV, colorGV, and colorBV.

Item.Result: True indicates that this class is set to use its graphic attributes when objects are created in this class. False indicates that the objects created in this class will get default attributes from the default global attribute settings.
Item.Comments: Returns whether the class is set to use its graphic attributes at object creation.

Item.ShortDesc: Returns whether a classes texture attributes will be used at object creation
Item.Comments: Returns whether the class is set to use its texture attributes at object creation.

Item.Name: SetClFillFore

Item.ShortDesc: Sets the fill foreground color of the specified class.
Item.Comments: Changes the fill foreground color setting of the class named className.

Item.Name: SetClFillBack
Item.Description: Sets the fill background color of the specified class. The color must be specified using the RGB components of the desired color. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the fill background color of the specified class.
Item.Comments: Changes the fill background color setting of the class named className.

Item.Name: SetClFPat

Item.ShortDesc: Sets the fill pattern of a specified class.
Item.Comments: Assigns a fill pattern to the class named className.

Item.Description: Deprecated - will generate error. Use SetClLSN instead.

Item.Description: Sets the pen foreground color of the specified class. The color must be specified using the RGB components of the desired color. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.

Item.Comments: Changes the pen foreground color setting of the class named className.

Item.ShortDesc: Sets the pen background color of the specified class.
Item.Comments: Changes the pen background color setting of the class named className.

Item.Name: SetMaximumUndoEvents
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the maximum number of undo events that can be stored in the undo table. Parameter [[p:1]] specifies the number of undos. Setting this value to zero effectively turns off undo.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the maximum number of undo events that can be stored in the undo table.
Item.Comments: Sets the maximum number of undo events that can be stored in the undo table. Setting this to zero effectively turns off undo.

Param.Name: events
Param.Desc: Number of undo events to store.

Item.Name: GetPrimaryUnitInfo
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the primary units settings for the active document. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns settings information for primary units
Item.Comments: Returns settings information for primary units.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] style :INTEGER;[[BR]] prec, dimPrec :LONGINT;[[BR]] format, angPrec :INTEGER;[[BR]] showMark, dispFrac :BOOLEAN;[[BR]] major, minor, maintenance, platform :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetVersion(major, minor, maintenance, platform);[[BR]] GetPrimaryUnitInfo(style, prec, dimPrec, format, angPrec, showMark, dispFrac);[[BR]][[BR]] CASE major of[[BR]] 8: Case style of[[BR]] 0: AlrtDialog('Custom');[[BR]] 1: AlrtDialog('Old Style Feet/Inches');[[BR]] 2: AlrtDialog('Millimeter');[[BR]] 3: AlrtDialog('Centimeter');[[BR]] 4: AlrtDialog('Inches');[[BR]] 5: AlrtDialog('Meters');[[BR]] 6: AlrtDialog('Feet/Inches');[[BR]] 7: AlrtDialog('Feet');[[BR]] END;[[BR]][[BR]] 9..11: Case style of[[BR]] 0: AlrtDialog('Custom');[[BR]] 1: AlrtDialog('Feet/Inches');[[BR]] 2: AlrtDialog('Feet');[[BR]] 3: AlrtDialog('Inches');[[BR]] 4: AlrtDialog('Millimeters');[[BR]] 5: AlrtDialog('Centimeters');[[BR]] 6: AlrtDialog('Meters');[[BR]] END;[[BR]][[BR]] 12: Case style of[[BR]] 1: AlrtDialog('Feet and Inches');[[BR]] 2: AlrtDialog('Inches');[[BR]] 3: AlrtDialog('Feet');[[BR]] 4: AlrtDialog('Yards');[[BR]] 5: AlrtDialog('Miles');[[BR]] 6: AlrtDialog('Microns');[[BR]] 7: AlrtDialog('Millimeters');[[BR]] 8: AlrtDialog('Centimeters');[[BR]] 9: AlrtDialog('Meters');[[BR]] 10: AlrtDialog('Kilometers');[[BR]] 11: AlrtDialog('Degrees');[[BR]] END;[[BR]][[BR]] END;[[BR]]END; [[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: GetSecondaryUnitInfo
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the secondary unit parameters for the active document. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns settings information for secondary units.
Item.Comments: Returns settings information for secondary units.

Item.Name: GetCustomObjectChoice
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a choice string of the specified plug-in object popup menu or radio group parameter. These parameters are displayed in the Object Info palette or the plug-in objects' creation dialog.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:CustomObjParamNote]][[BR]][[BR]]The choiceIndex parameter should be passed an integer between 1 and the number of choices, which can be determined by calling the NumCustomObjectChoices function.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a choice string for a plug-in object popup menu or radio group parameter.
Item.Result: Returns associated string of specified choice list item.
Item.Comments: Call from CustomObject scripts only. Returns a particular choice string for a popup menu or radio group parameter.

Item.Name: NumCustomObjectChoices
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the number of choice strings for a specified popup menu or radio group parameter in a plug-in object. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:CustomObjParamNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Return number of choice strings for a particular popup menu or radio group parameter.
Item.Comments: Call from CustomObject scripts only. Return number of choice strings for a particular popup menu or radio group parameter.

Item.Name: NameUndoEvent
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] names the undo event that is currently being built by VectorScript execution. Parameter [[p:1]] is the name of the undo event.
Item.ShortDesc: Names the undo event that is currently being built.
Item.Comments: Names the undo event that is currently being built.

Item.Name: IsTextureableObject
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns whether the referenced object supports texture mapping.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns whether the referenced 3D object supports textures.
Item.Result: Returns TRUE if object supports texture mapping.
Item.Comments: This function returns true if the specified 3D object can have textures attached to it.

Item.Name: GetObjExpandTexture
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns whether the referenced objects' textures have been "expanded". When a texture is expanded, different components of an object can have different textures.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns whether referenced object is displaying expanded textures.
Item.Comments: This function returns true if the object's textures are expanded. For example, if the object is a wall and this function returns true then there are three distinct textures applied to the left, center, and right polygons.

Item.Name: SetObjExpandTexture
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the "expanded" state of the referenced objects' texture. When a texture is expanded, different components of an object can have different textures.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets whether an object's texture is expanded
Item.Comments: Sets whether three or just a single texture is applied to this object (can be up to three for walls or two for roofs).

Item.Name: GetTextureShininess
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the shininess value of the referenced texture. The value is expressed as a percentage value with 0 equaling "Dull".
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the degree of shine applied to a textured object when rendered
Item.Comments: Percentage value - 0 equals 'Dull'

Item.Name: CalcVolume
Item.Description: Function [[name]] calculates the volume of the referenced solid object. The function supports only valid solids objects.
Item.ShortDesc: Calculates the volume of the referenced solid object. This function is obsolete. Use ObjVolume instead.
Item.Comments: Calculates the volume of the given object if a valid solid.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] volume, area: REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] IF FSActLayer <> NIL THEN BEGIN[[BR]] volume := CalcVolume(FSActLayer);[[BR]] area := CalcSurfaceArea(FSActLayer);[[BR]] Message('Volume ', volume, ', surface area ', area);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: CalcSurfaceArea
Item.Description: Function [[name]] calculates the surface area of the referenced solid object. The function supports only valid solids objects.
Item.ShortDesc: Calculates the surface area of the referenced solid. This function is obsolete. Use ObjSurfaceArea instead.
Item.Comments: Calculates the volume of the given object if a valid solid.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] volume, area: REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] IF FSActLayer <> NIL THEN BEGIN[[BR]] volume := CalcVolume(FSActLayer);[[BR]] area := CalcSurfaceArea(FSActLayer);[[BR]] Message('Volume ', volume, ', surface area ', area);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: SetTextureShininess
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the shininess value of the referenced texture. The value is expressed as a percentage value in a range of 0-100 with 0 equaling "Dull".[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the degree of shine applied to a textured object when rendered
Item.Comments: Percentage value - 0 equals dull

Item.Name: GetTextureTransp
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the degree of transparency applied to the referenced texture. It is expressed as a percentage with 0 creating an opaque texture.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the degree of transparency applied to a texture.
Item.Comments: Percentage value - 0 equals opaque

Item.Name: SetTextureTransp
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the degree of transparency applied to the referenced texture. The transparency value is expressed in the range of 0-100, with 0 equaling opaque and 100 equaling transparent.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the degree of transparency applied to a texture when rendered
Item.Comments: Percentage value - 0 equals opaque

Item.Name: GetTextureShader
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the LightWorks internal property reference ID for the shader attached to the referenced texture.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns LightWorks property reference for shader attached to texture.
Item.Comments: Returns LightWorks internal property ref for the shader attached to this texture.

Item.Name: SetTextureShader
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the LightWorks internal property reference ID for the shader attached to the referenced texture.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets LightWorks property reference for shader attached to texture.
Item.Comments: Sets the shader to a LightWorks internal property ref.

Item.Name: GetTextureBitmap
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the bitmap object attached to the referenced texture.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the bitmap object attached to the shader record.
Item.Result: If there is no texture applied to an object the function returns NIL.
Item.Comments: Returns the bitmap object attached to the shader record, NIL if none

Item.Name: SetTextureBitmap
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the bitmap object attached to the referenced texture. If no texture is desired then set [[p:2]] to NIL.
Item.ShortDesc: Attached the texture bitmap to a shader record.
Item.Comments: Sets the bitmap for a shader record, use NIL for no bitmap

Item.Name: GetTexBitmapOrigin
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the origin of the bitmap applied to the referenced texture bitmap. The origin is measured in pixels, with the top left corner as (0,0).[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the origin of the bitmap applied to a texture.
Item.Comments: Origin x and y are in pixels from paint node top left

Param.Name: originX
Param.Desc: Returns X coordinate of bitmap origin.

Param.Name: originY
Param.Desc: Returns Y coordinate of bitmap origin.

Item.Name: SetTexBitmapOrigin
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the origin of the bitmap applied to the referenced texture bitmap. The origin is measured in pixels, with the top left corner as (0,0).[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the origin of the bitmap applied to a texture
Item.Comments: Origin x and y are in pixels from paint node top left

Item.Name: GetTexBFeatureStart
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the "feature startpoint" of the referenced texture bitmap. The point is expressed in pixels from the top left corner of the bitmap.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the feature startpoint of a texture bitmap.
Item.Comments: X and y are in paint node pixels from top left

Param.Name: featureStartX
Param.Desc: Returns X coordinate of feature start point.

Param.Name: featureStartY
Param.Desc: Returns Y coordinate of feature start point.

Item.Name: SetTexBFeatureStart
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the "feature startpoint" of the referenced texture bitmap. The point is expressed in pixels from the top left corner of the bitmap.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the feature startpoint of a texture bitmap
Item.Comments: X and y are in paint node pixels from top left

Param.Name: featureStartX
Param.Desc: X coordinate of feature start point.

Param.Name: featureStartY
Param.Desc: Y coordinate of feature start point.

Item.Name: GetTexBFeatureEnd
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the "feature endpoint" of the referenced texture bitmap. The point is expressed in pixels from the top left corner of the bitmap.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the feature endpoint of a texture bitmap
Item.Comments: X and y are in paint node pixels from top left

Param.Name: featureEndX
Param.Desc: Returns X coordinate of feature end point.

Param.Name: featureEndY
Param.Desc: Returns Y coordinate of feature end point.

Item.Name: SetTexBFeatureEnd
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the "feature endpoint" of the referenced texture bitmap. Parameters [[p:2]] and [[p:3]] specify the end point. The point is expressed in pixels from the top left corner of the bitmap.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the feature endpoint of a texture bitmap
Item.Comments: X and y are in paint node pixels from top left

Param.Name: featureEndX
Param.Desc: X coordinate of feature end point.

Param.Name: featureEndY
Param.Desc: Y coordinate of feature end point.

Item.Name: GetTexBitFeatureSize
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the feature size of the referenced bitmap in real world inches.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns feature size in real world inches.
Item.Comments: Returns feature size in real-world inches

Item.Name: SetTexBitFeatureSize
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the feature size of the referenced bitmap. Parameter [[p:2]] specifies the size in real world inches.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the feature size in real world inches.
Item.Comments: featureSize is in real-world inches

Item.Name: GetTexBitRepHoriz
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns whether the referenced texture bitmap is set to repeat horizontally.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns if a texture bitmap is set to repeat horizontally.
Item.Result: The function returns TRUE if the texture bitmap is set to repeat.
Item.Comments: Returns TRUE if this texture bitmap repeats horizontally.

Item.Name: SetTexBitRepHoriz
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the horizontal repeat flag for the referenced texture bitmap.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets horizontal repeat flag for referenced texture bitmap.
Item.Comments: Sets the texture bitmap attribute to specify that it should repeat horizontally.

Item.Name: GetTexBitRepVert
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns whether the referenced texture bitmap is set to repeat vertically.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns if a texture bitmap is set to repeat vertically.
Item.Result: The function returns TRUE if the texture bitmap is set to repeat.
Item.Comments: Returns TRUE if this texture bitmap repeats vertically.

Item.Name: SetTexBitRepVert
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the vertical repeat flag for the referenced texture bitmap. Parameter [[p:2]] toggles vertical tiling.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets vertical repeat flag for referenced texture bitmap.
Item.Comments: Sets the texture bitmap attribute to specify that it should repeat vertically

Item.Name: GetTexBitPaintNode
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the paint node of the referenced texture bitmap.
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete as of version 12, use GetObjectVariableHandle(textureBitmap, 528) to return image node instead.
Item.Comments: Returns the paint node that contains the texture bitmap's image bits

Item.Name: SetTexBitPaintNode
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the paint node of the referenced texture bitmap.
Item.ShortDesc: Obsolete as of version 12, use SetObjectVariableHandle(textureBitmap, 528, imageNode) to set image node instead.
Item.Comments: Sets the texture bitmap's image paint node

Item.Name: GetTexSpaceKind
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the object type for texture mapping space.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextureSpaceTypeTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the object type for the referenced texture mapping space. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Returns the kind of the texture mapping space; 0 = Plane space, 1 = Sphere, 2 = Cylinder, and 3 = Algorithmic (Perimeter or Roof)

Item.Name: SetTexSpaceKind
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the object type for referenced texture mapping space.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextureSpaceTypeTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the object type for texture mapping space. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Sets the kind for the texture mapping space; 0 = Plane space, 1 = Sphere, 2 = Cylinder, and 3 = Algorithmic (Perimeter or Roof)

Item.Name: GetTexSpaceOrientU
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the vector that describes the u-axis of the referenced texture (from world space to texture space).
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the vector that describes the u-axis of the texture. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Returns the vector that describes the u-axis of the texture (from world space to texture space)

Item.Name: SetTexSpaceOrientU
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] specifies the vector that describes the u-axis of the referenced texture (from world space to texture space).
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the u-axis for the texture space (from world space to texture space) NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Sets the u-axis for the texture space (from world space to texture space)

Item.Name: GetTexSpaceOrientV
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the vector that describes the v-axis of the referenced texture (from world space to texture space).
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the vector that describes the v-axis of the texture. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Returns the vector that describes the v-axis of the texture (from world space to texture space)

Item.Name: GetTexSpaceOrientW
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the vector that describes the w-axis of the referenced texture (from world space to texture space).
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the vector that describes the w-axis of the texture NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Returns the vector that describes the w-axis of the texture (from world space to texture space)

Item.Name: SetTexSpaceOrientV
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] specifies the vector that describes the v-axis of the referenced texture (from world space to texture space).
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the v-axis for the texture space (from world space to texture space) NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Sets the v-axis for the texture space (from world space to texture space)

Item.Name: SetTexSpaceOrientW
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] specifies the vector that describes the w-axis of the referenced texture (from world space to texture space).
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the w-axis for the texture space. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Sets the w-axis for the texture space (from world space to texture space)

Item.Name: GetTexSpaceOrigin
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the offset of the referenced texture space that takes coordinates from world space to texture space.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the offset that takes coordinates from world space to texture space. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Returns the offset that takes coordinates from world space to texture space

Item.Name: SetTexSpaceOrigin
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the offset of the referenced texture space that takes coordinates from world space to texture space.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the offset that takes coordinates from world space to texture space. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Sets the offset that takes coordinates from world space to texture space

Item.Name: GetTexSpace2DOffset
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the 2D offset for the referenced texture space in real-world inches.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the 2D offset for a specified texture space in real-world inches. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Gets the 2D offset for this texture space in real-world inches.

Item.Name: SetTexSpace2DOffset
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the 2D offset for the referenced texture space in real-world inches.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the 2D offset for a texture space in real-world inches. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Sets the 2D offset for this texture space in real-world inches.

Item.Name: GetTexSpace2DScale
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the 2D scale for the referenced texture space.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the 2D scale for a texture space. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Gets the 2D scale for this texture space as a multiple of a default size of 1.

Item.Name: SetTexSpace2DScale
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the 2D scale for the referenced texture space. Parameter [[p:2]] specifies the new scale value.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the 2D scale for a specified texture space NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Sets the 2D scale for this texture space as a multiple of a default size of 1.

Item.Name: GetTexSpace2DRot
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the rotation of the referenced texture space (in degrees).
Item.ShortDesc: Returns rotation of a texture space. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Returns rotation in degrees

Item.Name: GetTexSpace2DRadius
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the radius of the referenced texture space for applicable mapping types.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the radius of the texture space for applicable mapping types. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: For applicable mapping types, gets the radius of the texture space.

Item.Name: SetTexSpace2DRot
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the rotation of the referenced texture space.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the rotation of a texture space. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Sets rotation in degrees

Item.Name: SetTexSpace2DRadius
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the radius of the referenced texture space for applicable mapping types.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the radius of the texture space, for applicable mapping types. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: For applicable mapping types, sets the radius of the texture space.

Item.Name: GetTexSpaceStartCap
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns whether the start cap of an extrude or sweep is textured.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns whether start cap of extrude or sweep is textured. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Returns whether start cap of extrude or sweep is textured

Item.Name: SetTexSpaceStartCap
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the texture status of a referenced sweep or extrude.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets whether start cap of extrude or sweep is textured NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Sets whether start cap of extrude or sweep is textured

Item.Name: GetTexSpaceEndCap
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns whether the end cap of the referenced extrude or sweep is textured.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns whether end cap of extrude or sweep is textured. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Returns whether end cap of extrude or sweep is textured

Item.Name: SetTexSpaceEndCap
Item.Description: Procedure SetTexSpaceEndCap sets whether the end cap of a referenced extrude or sweep is textured.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets whether end cap of extrude or sweep is textured. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Sets whether end cap of extrude or sweep is textured

Item.Name: GetTexSpacePartID
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the parent of the referenced texture space in an expanded object (walls or roofs).[[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextureSpaceObjs]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the parent of the referenced texture space. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Returns which part (0 = Primary, 1 = Secondary, 2 = Tertiary) of the object this space belongs to (for expanded walls and roofs).

Item.Name: SetTexSpacePartID
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the parent of the referenced texture space in an expanded object (walls or roofs).[[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextureSpaceObjs]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets expanded object (walls or roofs) parent of specified texture space. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Sets which part (0 = Primary, 1 = Secondary, 2 = Tertiary) of the object this space belongs to (for expanded walls and roofs).

Param.Name: partID
Param.Desc: Part ID of texture space parent.

Item.Name: CreateTexture
Item.Description: Function [[name]] creates a new texture object with default values.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new texture object.
Item.Comments: Creates a new texture object handle with default values

Item.Name: EditTexture
Item.Description: Function [[name]] opens the Edit Texture dialog for the referenced texture.
Item.ShortDesc: Opens the Edit Texture dialog for a specified texture.
Item.Comments: Brings up the Edit Texture dialog for this texture

Item.Name: GetTextureRef
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the texture reference ID for the referenced object. The integer returned is the internal index of the texture node used by this object. [[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: NOTE: Use GetTextureRefN with version 2010 and above.
Item.Comments: Returns the texture ref for this object, which is the internal index, or name, of the texture node used by this object. The texture is specific to the partID part of the object (0 = Primary, 1 = Secondary, or 2 = Tertiary). Walls can have three different textures and roofs can have two if they are 'expanded'. Textures may be applied by class. If resolveByClass is true then this function will return the texture ref for this object's class.

Param.Name: partID
Param.Desc: Identifies texture to be returned by part ID.

Item.Name: SetTextureRef
Item.Description: Function [[name]] sets the texture reference ID for the referenced object.
Item.ShortDesc: NOTE: Use SetTextureRefN with version 2010 and above.
Item.Comments: See GetTextureRef

Param.Name: partID
Param.Desc: Part to be assigned texture reference.

Item.Name: ResolveByClassTextureRef
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the internal index, or name, of the texture assigned to the referenced object. [[BR]][[BR]]Primary, secondary, or tertiary texture assignments can be returned for objects that support multiple textures, such as roofs or walls. For objects that do not support multiple textures, pass 0 to the [[p:2]] parameter.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ClassTextureRefTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Looks up a specified object's class and returns the class' texture ref.
Item.Comments: If the texture ref for an object is set to -1, it will use the texture of its class. This routine will look up the object's class and return the class' texture ref.

Param.Name: partID
Param.Desc: Primary, secondary, or tertiary texture ID to be returned.

Item.Name: CreateTextureBitmap
Item.Description: Function [[name]] creates a new default texture bitmap in a Vectorworks document.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new default texture bitmap.
Item.Comments: Creates a new default texture bitmap, with no paint node attached. Texture bitmap's paint node should be attached before this texture bitmap is used by MiniCAD (SetTexBitPaintNode).

Item.Name: EditTextureBitmap
Item.Description: Function [[name]] opens the Edit Texture Bitmap dialog box to the referenced texture bitmap. The function returns TRUE if texture bitmap was modified.
Item.ShortDesc: Opens the Edit Texture Bitmap dialog for a specified texture bitmap.
Item.Comments: Brings up the Edit Texture Bitmap dialog for this texture bitmap. Returns true if texture bitmap was changed by the dialog.

Item.Name: GetTextureSpace
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to the texture space attached to the referenced object(or object part).
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the texture space attached to an object. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Returns the texture space attached to this object, with the same part ID as partID. Walls may have three texture spaces attached to them if they have expanded textures, for example.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example; [[BR]]VAR[[BR]] XAxis, YAxis, ZAxis :REAL; [[BR]] hObj :HANDLE; [[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] hObj := GetTextureSpace(FSActLayer, 0); [[BR]] GetTexSpaceOrientU(hObj, XAxis, YAxis, ZAxis); [[BR]] Writeln('U', ' : ', XAxis, ' : ', YAxis, ' : ', ZAxis); [[BR]] GetTexSpaceOrientV(hObj, XAxis, YAxis, ZAxis); [[BR]] Writeln('V', ' : ', XAxis, ' : ', YAxis, ' : ', ZAxis); [[BR]] GetTexSpaceOrientW(hObj, XAxis, YAxis, ZAxis); [[BR]] Writeln('W', ' : ', XAxis, ' : ', YAxis, ' : ', ZAxis); [[BR]]END; [[BR]]RUN(Example); [[BR]]

Item.Name: DeleteTextureSpace
Item.Description: Function [[name]] deletes the texture space attached to the referenced object or object part.
Item.ShortDesc: Removes the texture space from an object. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use the Set/Get TexMap routines instead.
Item.Comments: Removes the texture space from this object. To render textures correctly, an object must have both a non-zero texture ref and a texture space attached. The reverse of this means that the texture ref for the object should be set to zero when this function is called.

Item.Name: SetDefaultTextureSpace
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the texture space for the referenced object to the Vectorworks object defaults.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the default texture space for an object. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use SetDefaultTexMapN instead.
Item.Comments: Sets texSpace to the default values for this type of object.

Item.Name: AttachDefaultTextureSpace
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] deletes any pre-existing space attached to the referenced object and creates a new one with the default object texture.
Item.ShortDesc: Deletes any pre-existing space attached to the specified object. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009, use SetDefaultTexMapN instead.
Item.Comments: Deletes any pre-existing space attached to the object (with the specified part ID), creates a new one with the default value for this type of object, and attaches the texture space to the object.

Item.Name: EditTextureSpace
Item.Description: Function [[name]] edits the mapping of a specified texture space for the referenced object. Calling this function opens the Edit Mapping dialog for textures.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Edits the mapping of a specified texture space. NOTE: Texture space routines are obsolete with version 2009.
Item.Result: Returns TRUE if the texture space was modified.
Item.Comments: Brings up the Edit Mapping dialog for the space attached to the object. Returns true if the texture space was changed by the dialog.

Item.Name: GetLayerAmbientInfo
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the attribute values for the ambient light object of the referenced layer.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the attributes of the ambient light of a layer.
Item.Comments: brightness is a percentage value

Item.Name: GetLayerAmbientColor
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the color of the ambient light of the referenced layer. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the color of the ambient light of a layer.

Item.Name: SetLayerAmbientColor
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the color for the ambient light of the referenced layer. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the color for the ambient light of a layer.

Item.Name: SetLayerAmbientInfo
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the attribute values for the ambient light object of the referenced layer.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the attributes for a layer's ambient light.
Item.Comments: brightness is a percentage value

Item.Name: GetLightColorRGB
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the RGB color values for the referenced light object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the RGB color settings for the referenced light object.
Item.Comments: Color param range is 0..65535 -DLD 8/28/98

Item.Name: SetLightColorRGB
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the RGB color values for the referenced light object.
Item.ShortDesc: Specifies the RGB color settings for the referenced light object.
Item.Comments: Color param range is 0..65535 -DLD 8/28/98

Item.Name: GetSymBrightMult
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the brightness multiplier of the referenced symbol.[[BR]][[BR]]The brightness multiplier is used for symbols that contains lights. This value is a percentage of the symbol definition's light brightness.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the brightness multiplier of the referenced symbol.
Item.Comments: This function returns the brightness multiplier used for symbols that contains lights. This value is a percentage of the symbol definition's light brightness.

Item.Name: SetSymBrightMult
Item.Description: Function [[name]] sets the brightness multiplier for the referenced symbol.[[BR]][[BR]]The brightness multiplier is used for symbols that contains lights. This value is a percentage of the symbol definition's light brightness.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the brightness multiplier of the referenced symbol.
Item.Comments: This function sets the brightness multiplier used for symbols that contains lights. This value is a percentage of the symbol definition's light brightness.

Item.Name: NumVectorFills
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the number of vector fills in the active document.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of vector fills in the active document.
Item.Comments: Returns with the number of vector fills in the active document.

Item.Name: VectorFillList
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the name of the specified vector fill definition.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the name of the specified vector fill definition from the active document.
Item.Comments: Returns the name of the specified hatch definition from the active document.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: Index ID of vector fill (in a range of 1 - n).

Item.Name: DelVectorFill
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] deletes the specified vector fill definition.
Item.ShortDesc: Deletes a specified vector fill definition.
Item.Comments: Deletes the hatch definition that has the name 'vectorFillName'

Item.Name: BeginVectorFill
Item.Description: Obsolete procedure.
Item.ShortDesc: Begins a vector fill definition.
Item.Comments: Deleted this obsolete function as of 9.0.0b7 - PCP 12-21-2000[[BR]][[BR]]Begins a hatch definition.

Param.Name: vectorFillName
Param.Desc: The name of the new vector fill.

Param.Name: pageSpace
Param.Desc: Flag specifying page space or world space option.

Param.Name: rotateInWall
Param.Desc: Flag specifying whether fill shuld be rotated in wall.

Item.Name: AddVectorFillLayer
Item.Description: Procedure AddVectorFillLayer is used to add layers to a vector fill definition. This procedure call should follow a call to BeginVectorFillN. [[BR]][[BR]]The input parameters for a vector fill layer match the inputs from the right side of the Vectorworks hatch editor dialog.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ColorTableNote]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Adds a new layer to a vector fill definition.
Item.Comments: Follows a call to BeginVectorFill. The input for the layer match the input from the right side of the hatch editor dialog.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE CreateHatch;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] hatchName :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] hatchName := 'My New Hatch';[[BR]] BeginVectorFillN(hatchName, TRUE, FALSE, 0);[[BR]] AddVectorFillLayer(0, 0, 1, 1, 0.1767767, -0.1767767, 1, 1, 255);[[BR]] EndVectorFill;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(CreateHatch);[[BR]][[BR]]

Param.Name: xRepeat
Param.Desc: X coordinate of fill repeat origin.

Param.Name: yRepeat
Param.Desc: Y coordinate of fill repeat origin.

Param.Name: xOffset
Param.Desc: X coordinate of fill offset origin.

Param.Name: yOffset
Param.Desc: Y coordinate of fill offset origin.

Param.Name: dashFactor
