Param.Desc: Dash factor of layer(percentage of fill line that is solid).

Param.Name: lineWeight
Param.Desc: Line weight of layer, in mils.

Item.Name: EndVectorFill
Item.Description: Procedure EndVectorFill ends the vector fill creation process. This procedure call must follow the BeginVectorFillN call and a variable number of AddVectorFillLayer calls.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Ends the vector fill creation process.
Item.Comments: Follows BeginVectorFill and a variable number AddVectorFillLayer calls.

Item.Name: GetVectorFillDefault
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns TRUE if the the active document contains a default vector fill, and returns the name of the vector fill pattern.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: ReturnsTRUE if the active document contains a default vector fill, and returns the name of that fill pattern.
Item.Comments: Returns true if the the active document contains a default hatch. vectorFillName contains a string with the name of the default hatch.

Item.Name: SetVectorFillDefault
Item.Description: Function [[name]] sets the default vector fill pattern for the document. The function returns TRUE if the operation was successful.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns if the active document's default hatch was succesfully set to a specified name
Item.Comments: Returns true if the active document's default hatch was succesfully set to the hatch with the name specified by vectorFillName. vectorFillName may retrun with a different name than passed in because there may be a name conflict.

Item.Name: GetVectorFill
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns if the referenced object has a vector fill assigned.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if referenced objecthas a vectorfill.
Item.Comments: Returns true if the theObj has a vectorfill. hatchName holds the name of the vector fill that theObj has.

Param.Name: hatchName
Param.Desc: Returns name of assigned vector fill pattern.

Item.Name: SetVectorFill
Item.Description: Function [[name]] assigns the specified vector fill to the referenced object. The function returns TRUE if the operation was successful.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Assigns a vector fill to an object.
Item.Comments: Returns true if theObj was assigned the hatch specified by hatchName.

Param.Name: hatchName
Param.Desc: Name of vector fill to be assigned.

Item.Name: NonUndoableActionOK
Item.Description: Function [[name]] displays a dialog informing the user that the action that is about to be performed cannot be undone. If the user selects OK, the function returns TRUE. If the "Show Undo Warnings" preference is turned off, this function just returns TRUE and does not display a dialog.
Item.ShortDesc: Posts a dialog informing the user that the action that is about to be performed is not undo-able. If the "Show Undo Warnings" preference is turned off, no dialog is presented and this function just returns true.

Item.Name: GetTextLength
Item.Description: [[name]] returns the string length of the referenced text object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the string length of the referenced text object.

Item.Name: SetSprdSortSum
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] specifies sorting and summation options for a database row in the referenced worksheet. For descending sorts, pass the column as a negative value. For no sort, pass 0 as the [[p:6]] column.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets sorting and summation options for a database row.
Item.Comments: Sets sorting and summation for a database row. The sortCol1, sortCol2, and sortCol3 values specify the primary, secondary and tertiary sorts for the database row. Pass a positive column for a descending sort; pass a negative column for an ascending sort. For no sort, pass 0 as the column. Sum works the same way.[[BR]]OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new SetWSColumnOperators. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: GetSprdSortSum
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns sorting and summation options for a database row in the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the sorting and summation options for a database row.
Item.Comments: Gets sorting for a database row. The sortCol1, sortCol2, and sortCol3 values specify the primary, secondary and tertiary sorts for the database row. For descending sorts, a positive column is returned; for ascending sorts, a negative column is returned. For no sort, 0 is returned. Sum works the same way.[[BR]]OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new GetWSColumnOperators. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: Volume
Item.Description: Returns the volume of the items matching the specified criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the sum of all the volumes of the matching objects will be returned. [[BR]][[BR]][[name]] will return only return volumes on objects which support the solids modelling functions.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the volume of the items matching the current criteria. This function is obsolete. Use CriteriaVolume or VolumeN instead.
Item.Comments: This function returns the volume of the items matching the current criteria. It will return 0 for any objects that will not work with the solids modeling functions.

Item.Name: SurfaceArea
Item.Description: Returns the surface area of the items matching the specified criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the sum of all the surface areas of the matching objects will be returned. [[BR]][[BR]][[name]] will return only return areas on objects which support the solids modelling functions.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the surface area of the items matching the current criteria. This function is obsolete. Use CriteriaSurfaceArea instead.
Item.Comments: This function returns the volume of the items matching the current criteria. It will return 0 for any objects that will not work with the solids modeling functions.

Item.Name: IsFlipped
Item.Description: Returns the number of objects meeting the criteria that are flipped.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of objects meeting the criteria that are flipped.
Item.Comments: This function returns true? if the object matching the given criteria (such as a symbol is flipped. Only certain types of objects can be flipped.[[BR]][[BR]]The change to criteria for this seems weird; does it accumulate the flipped states of the objects matching the criteria and return the sum?

Item.Name: IsNewCustomObject
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns whether the specified plug-in object is a new object, indicating that the object is being regenerated for the first time.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]New object status is useful in specifying initialization and setup data, as well as calling initialization specific subroutines. This function should only be called in plug-in objects.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns true for new objects, meaning this is the first time the regeneration script is being called.
Item.Comments: Call from CustomObject scripts only. Returns true for new objects, meaning this is the first time the regeneration script is being called.

Item.Name: GetTextVerticalAlign
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the vertical alignment of the referenced text object.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextVerticalAlignTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the vertical alignment of the referenced text object.
Item.Comments: Returns the vertical alignment of the referenced text object.

Item.Name: SetTextVerticalAlign
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the vertical alignment of the referenced text object. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextVerticalAlignTable]][[BR]][[BR]][[fig:textlocus.gif]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the vertical alignment of the referenced text object.
Item.Comments: Sets the vertical alignment of the referenced text object.

Item.Name: TextVerticalAlign
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the active text vertical alignment of a Vectorworks document. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextVerticalAlignTable]][[BR]][[BR]][[fig:textlocus.gif]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active text vertical alignment of the document.
Item.Comments: Sets the active text vertical alignment of the document.

Item.Name: Name2Index
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the internal index number for the specified object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the internal index for the object associated with the specified name.
Item.Comments: Returns the internal index for the object associated with the specified name.

Item.Name: Index2Name
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the name of the object with specified index number.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the name of the object with the specified index number.
Item.Comments: Returns the name of the object with the internal index specified.

Item.Name: GetPickObjectInfo
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to an object found at a user selected point. [[BR]][[BR]]Parameter [[p:3]] returns a handle to a sub-selectable object (e.g., a symbol in a wall) if such an object exists. Parameter [[p:4]] is currently unused, and always returns 0.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to an object at a user selected point.
Item.Comments: same as PickObject except it return the sub-selected object, if any, and a message. See Rich D. for more details.

Param.Name: p
Param.Desc: Coordinate location to test for object.

Param.Name: subH
Param.Desc: Returns handle to sub selectable object.

Param.Name: message
Param.Desc: Resereved for future use. Specify a dummy INTEGER variable.

Item.Name: GetLightFalloff
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the fall off attributes for the referenced light object. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:LightFalloffTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the fall off attributes for the referenced light.
Item.Comments: Returns the falloff functions for the light. 0 = None, 1 = Normal, 2 = Smooth, 3 = Sharp (angular falloff only).

Item.Name: SetLightFalloff
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the fall off attributes for the referenced light object.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:LightFalloffTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the fall off attributes for the referenced light.
Item.Comments: Sets the falloff functions for the light. 0 = None, 1 = Normal, 2 = Smooth, 3 = Sharp (angular falloff only).

Item.Name: ContainsLight
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns TRUE if the referenced object contains a light. This function works with container objects such as groups, symbols, layers, etc.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if the referenced container object contains a light.
Item.Comments: Returns true if object contains a light object in it. This function works for container-type objects (groups, symbols, layers, etc.).

Item.Name: CreateText
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a new text object in a Vectorworks document. The text object is created using the current pen position and default attributes.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new text object in the document.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] Txt :ARRAY [1..100] of STRING;[[BR]] Outpt :DYNARRAY[] of CHAR;[[BR]] i :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] FOR i := 1 TO 5 DO txt[i] := 'asdf';[[BR]] i := 2;[[BR]] Outpt := Txt[1];[[BR]] WHILE Txt[i] <> '' DO BEGIN[[BR]] OutPt := Concat(Outpt, Chr(13), Txt[i]);[[BR]] i := i + 1;[[BR]] END;[[BR]] Layer('Text');[[BR]] CreateText(Outpt);[[BR]] Layer('Layer-1');[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: GetFontID
Item.Description: Function [[name]] converts the string name of an available font to a font ID which can be passed to other VectorScript routines.
Item.ShortDesc: Converts the name of an available font to a font ID which can be passed to other VectorScript routines.
Item.Comments: returns -1 if the requested font is not available
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] str :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] str := StrDialog('Enter the font name:', 'Arial');[[BR]] AlrtDialog(Concat('The font ID is: ', GetFontID(str)));[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: GetFontName
Item.Description: Function [[name]] converts a system font ID to a font name.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:FontID]]
Item.ShortDesc: Converts a system font ID to a font name.
Item.Comments: returns "" if the FontID is not legal.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] str :STRING;[[BR]] cnt :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] FOR cnt := 0 to 10 DO str := Concat(str, Chr(13), GetFontName(cnt));[[BR]] AlrtDialog(str);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: GetPrefInt
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the value of a numeric Vectorworks preference setting.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:PrefItemTableNote]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the value of a specified Vectorworks preference integer setting.
Item.Result: The status of the requested preference. If the preference is a checkbox, then [[name]] returns TRUE or false. If it is a radio group or editable text item, then [[name]] returns an integer value representing that setting.
Item.Comments: Returns the status of the specified preference item. Used for preferences that return an Integer instead of a Boolean (see GetPref)

Item.Name: SetPrefInt
Item.Description: Function [[name]] sets the value of a numeric Vectorworks preference setting.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:PrefItemTableNote]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the integer value of a specified preference.
Item.Comments: Sets the value of the specified preference to the value passed. Similar to SetPref() except it works on preferences for Integer values

Item.Name: Get3DOrientation
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the 3D orientation of the referenced object.[[BR]][[BR]]If the object is mirrored, a reflection across the X-Y plane must be applied before rotating by the angles above in order to reproduce the object's orientation.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the 3D orientation of 3D objects which have an orientation. Returns FALSE for other objects.
Item.Result: [[name]] returns TRUE if a valid 3D object was passed to the procedure.

Item.Name: BeginVectorFillN
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a new vector fill definition in a Vectorworks document. The value of [[p:1]] will change only if the hatch name already exists.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ColorTableNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new vector fill..
Item.Comments: Begins a hatch definition. vectorFillName will return with a different name if the input name already is being used in the document.[[BR]][[BR]]This is a new version of BeginVectorFill which returns the actual name of the hatch in the VAR STRING.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE CreateHatch;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] hatchName :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] hatchName := 'Default Hatch';[[BR]] BeginVectorFillN(hatchName, TRUE, FALSE, 0);[[BR]] AddVectorFillLayer(0,0,1,1,0.176776695,-0.176776695,1,1,255);[[BR]] EndVectorFill;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(CreateHatch);[[BR]]

Param.Name: vectorFillName
Param.Desc: Name of new vector fill pattern.

Param.Name: pageSpace
Param.Desc: Sets page or world space for vector fill.

Param.Name: rotateInWall
Param.Desc: Sets rotate in wall option for vector fill.

Item.Name: DotProduct
Item.Description: Returns the dot product of the two specified vectors.[[BR]][[BR]]The dot product is also known as the scalar product of the two vectors, and is equivalent to the product of the magnitudes of the two vectors multiplied by the cosine of the angle between the two vectors.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the dot product of the two specified vectors.
Item.Result: Returns the scalar, or dot, product of the vectors [[p:1]] and [[p:2]].
Item.Comments: This should be used in place of the bullet/yen operator for better cross-platform operability. - PCP
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] pt1, pt2, pt3, pt4 :VECTOR;[[BR]] ang :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetPt(pt1.x, pt1.y);[[BR]] GetPtL(pt1.x, pt1.y, pt2.x, pt2.y);[[BR]] GetPtL(pt2.x, pt2.y, pt3.x, pt3.y);[[BR]] MoveTo(pt1.x, pt1.y);[[BR]] LineTo(pt2.x, pt2.y);[[BR]] LineTo(pt3.x, pt3.y);[[BR]] pt4 := (pt1 + pt3) / 2;[[BR]] {Find the angle between the vectors.}[[BR]] ang := Rad2Deg(ArcCos(DotProduct(UnitVec(pt1-pt2), UnitVec(pt3-pt2))));[[BR]] TextOrigin(pt4.x, pt4.y);[[BR]] CreateText(Concat(ang));[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: SetTextWrap
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the text wrap mode of the referenced text object.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets whether the text in the text object wraps to the margins.
Item.Comments: If this is set to false, it will cause the margin width to be recomputed and the text block to be reformatted. If it is set to true, the width remains the same, and text will be wrapped to fit the current margin. Use SetTextWidth to change the margin.[[BR]]By default, text is created with wrapping set to false.[[BR]]

Item.Name: GetTextWrap
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the text wrap mode of the referenced text object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the wrap mode of the text object.

Item.Name: SetTextWidth
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] Sets the text wrapping margin width of the referenced text object. [[BR]][[BR]]A call to [[name]] automatically activates text wrapping.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the text wrapping margin width of the text object and implicitly turns on wrapping.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]][[BR]]FUNCTION IncreaseTextWidth(h :HANDLE) :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] SetTextWidth(h, GetTextWidth(h) * 1.2);[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] ForEachObjectInLayer(IncreaseTextWidth, 2, 0, 4);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: widthDistance
Param.Desc: Text wrapping margin setting for text.

Item.Name: GetTextWidth
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the margin width of the referenced text object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the margin width of a text object.
Item.Comments: For wrapped blocks, the margin width is that set by the user. For unwrapped blocks, it is computed by VW to be the width of the longest line.

Item.Name: SetTextSpace
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the line spacing of the referenced text object.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextSpacingTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the line spacing of the referenced text object.
Item.Comments: Use SetTextLeading to set a custom line spacing.

Item.Name: GetTextSpace
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the line spacing of the referenced text object.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextSpacingTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the line spacing of the referenced text object.

Item.Name: SetTextLeading
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the line spacing of the referenced text object to a custom leading value (in points).
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the line spacing of a text object to a custom leading value (in points).

Item.Name: GetTextLeading
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the custom leading value(in points) of the referenced text object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the custom leading value of a text object (in points).
Item.Comments: If a custom value was not set, this returns -1.0.

Item.Name: TextLeading
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the default line spacing of Vectorworks to a custom leading value (in points).
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the default line spacing to a custom leading value (in points).

Item.Name: GetTextOrientation
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the position and orientation attributes of the referenced text object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the position and orientation attributes of the referenced text object.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] theText :HANDLE;[[BR]] textOriginX, textOriginY, textAng :REAL;[[BR]] textIsMirrored :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] theText := FSActLayer;[[BR]] GetTextOrientation(theText, textOriginX, textOriginY, textAng, textIsMirrored);[[BR]] Locus(textOriginX, textOriginY);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: SetTextOrientation
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the position and orientation attributes of the referenced text object.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the position and orientation attributes of the referenced text object.

Item.Name: CreateRoof
Item.Description: Function [[name]] creates a new roof object in a Vectorworks document, returning a handle to the object. To define the roof object template, use AppendRoofEdge.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:RoofMiterStyleTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Create a roof object in a Vectorworks document.
Item.Comments: Use AppendRoofVertex() to define the roof plan.[[BR]]genGableWall: Create wall object on gable ends, otherwise no wall is created.[[BR]]bearingInset is where the weight of the roof rests on the wall. This is an inset from the defining edge of the roof plan.[[BR]]miterType: 1: vertical miter, 2: horizontal miter, 3: double miter , 4: square miter[[BR]]vertMiter: Specifies vertical len of double miter.

Param.Name: bearingInsetDistance
Param.Desc: Bearing inset distance of wall into roof.

Item.Name: GetRoofAttributes
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the attributes of the referenced roof object.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:RoofMiterStyleTable]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Get the properties of the roof.
Item.Comments: genGableWall: Set to true to have a wall created at gable ends of the roof. Otherwise no object will be inserted.[[BR]]bearingInset is where the weight of the roof rests on the wall. This is an inset from the defining edge of the roof plan.[[BR]]miterType: Specify 1 for a vertical miter, 2 for horizontal miter, 3 for a double miter cut, and 4 for a square end miter cut.[[BR]]vertMiter: This is used only with the double miter type; it specifies the vertical length of the miter cut.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]var[[BR]] theRoof :HANDLE;[[BR]] genGableWall :BOOLEAN; [[BR]] bearingInset, roofThick :REAL; [[BR]] miterType :INTEGER; [[BR]] vertMiter :REAL;[[BR]]begin[[BR]] theRoof := FSActLayer;[[BR]] IF GetRoofAttributes(theRoof, genGableWall, bearingInset, roofThick, miterType, vertMiter)[[BR]] THEN Message(genGableWall, ' ', bearingInset, ' ', roofThick, ' ', miterType, ' ', vertMiter);[[BR]]end;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: SetRoofAttributes
Item.Description: Function [[name]] sets the definition attributes of a roof object in a Vectorworks document. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:RoofMiterStyleTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Set the properties of the roof.
Item.Comments: genGableWall: Set to true to have a wall created at gable ends of the roof. Otherwise no object will be inserted.[[BR]]bearingInset is where the weight of the roof rests on the wall. This is an inset from the defining edge of the roof plan.[[BR]]miterType: Specify 1 for a vertical miter, 2 for horizontal miter, 3 for a double miter cut, and 4 for a square end miter cut. vertMiter: This is used only with the double miter type; it specifies the vertical length of the miter cut.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] thickness :REAL;[[BR]] str :STRING;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE SetIt(h :HANDLE);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] IF GetObjectVariableInt(h, 172) = 1 THEN [[BR]] SetObjectVariableReal(h, 170, thickness * 25.4);[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE FindRoofFaces(h :HANDLE);[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] temp_h :HANDLE;[[BR]] roofObject :HANDLE; [[BR]] genGableWall :BOOLEAN; [[BR]] bearingInsetDistance, roofThickDistance :REAL; [[BR]] miterType :INTEGER; [[BR]] vertMiterDistance :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] IF GetType(h) = 71 THEN SetIt(h) ELSE[[BR]] IF GetRoofAttributes(h, genGableWall, bearingInsetDistance, roofThickDistance, miterType, vertMiterDistance) THEN[[BR]] SetRoofAttributes(h, genGableWall, bearingInsetDistance, thickness, miterType, vertMiterDistance);[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] thickness := RealDialog('Enter desired thickness', '10');[[BR]] str := Concat('((T=71) | (T=83)) & (L=''', GetLName(ActLayer), ''')');[[BR]] ForEachObject(FindRoofFaces, str);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: GetRoofEdge
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the definition attributes of a roof edge for the referenced roof object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns roof edge characteristics for referenced roof object.
Item.Comments: Vertices define the outline of the roof and its characteristics. Vertices must progress in a counter clock wise direction, when viewed from a top view, otherwise the roof cannot be built.[[BR]][[BR]]index: Indexs have values between 1 and NVertices (See GetRoofVertices())[[BR]]edgePt: Coordinate point for this edge[[BR]]slope: pitch of this roof edge[[BR]]projection: eave overhang[[BR]]eaveHeight: eave height

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: Index of roof edge (in a range of 1 - n).

Param.Name: vertexPt
Param.Desc: Returns coordinates of roof edge definition vertex.

Item.Name: SetRoofEdge
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the definition attributes of a roof edge for the referenced roof object.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets roof edge characteristics for referenced roof object.
Item.Comments: Vertices define the outline of the roof and its characteristics. Vertices must progress in a counter clock wise direction, when viewed from a top view, otherwise the roof cannot be built.[[BR]][[BR]]index: Indexs have values between 1 and NVertices (See GetRoofVertices())[[BR]]edgePt: Coordinate point for this edge[[BR]]slope: pitch of this roof edge[[BR]]projection: eave overhang[[BR]]eaveHeight: eave height

Item.Name: RemoveRoofEdge
Item.Description: Function [[name]] removes the specified roof edge from the referenced roof object.
Item.ShortDesc: Remove a vertex and associated attributes from a roof object.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: Index of roof edge to be removed.

Item.Name: CreateSkylight
Item.Description: Function [[name]] creates a new skylight in the referenced roof object.
Item.ShortDesc: Create a skylight in the referenced roof object.

Item.Name: GetSkylight
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the definition attributes of a specified skylight in the referenced roof object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns attributes of a skylight in the referenced roof object.
Item.Comments: skylightID: Identifier for this skylight. Value is returned by CreateSkylight().[[BR]]edgeIndex: Index to which roof face this skylight is placed. Value is one based.[[BR]]cornerOffset: Top/Plan distance from vertex referenced by 'edgeIndex' to center of skylight. This distance is parallel to the roof outline as defined by: vertex[edgeindex+1] - vertex[edgeIndex].[[BR]]perpOffset: Top/Plan distance from roof outline to center of skylight.[[BR]]symName: Skylight symbol to place in the roof.

Param.Name: edgeIndex
Param.Desc: Index of roof edge associated with skylight.

Param.Name: perpOffset
Param.Desc: Offset of skylight from roof edge.

Item.Name: SetSkylight
Item.Description: Function [[name]] sets the definition attributes of a skylight in the referenced roof object.
Item.ShortDesc: Set attributes of a specified skylight.
Item.Comments: skylightID: Identifier for this skylight. Value is returned by CreateSkylight().[[BR]]edgeIndex: Index to which roof face this skylight is placed. Value is one based.[[BR]]cornerOffset: Top/Plan distance from vertex referenced by 'edgeIndex' to center of skylight. This distance is parallel to the roof outline as defined by: vertex[edgeindex+1] - vertex[edgeIndex].[[BR]]perpOffset: Top/Plan distance from roof outline to center of skylight.[[BR]]symName: Skylight symbol to place in the roof.

Param.Name: edgeIndex
Param.Desc: Index of roof edge associated with skylight.

Param.Name: perpOffsetDistance
Param.Desc: Offset of skylight from roof edge.

Item.Name: CreateTrapeziumDormer
Item.Description: Function [[name]] creates a trapezium dormer in the referenced roof object.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a trapezium style dormer.
Item.Comments: This only creates the object, SetDormerAttributes() & SetTrapeziumAttributes() must still be called to define the attributes of the dormer.

Item.Name: GetTrapeziumAttributes
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the attributes of a trapezium dormer in the referenced roof.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the attributes of a trapezium style dormer.
Item.Comments: This will fail if the dormerID identifies a dormer of a different style, or the dormerID is not valid.[[BR]][[BR]]dormerID: Identifies the dormer for which to retrieve the information.[[BR]][[BR]]useHeight: true if the next value is the height of the dormer, if false, next value is the depth (front to back) of the dormer.[[BR]]heightDepthValue: size of the dormer, either by height or depth; determined by previous parameter.[[BR]][[BR]]bottomWidth: dimension of bottom front edge of the dormer, left to right.[[BR]][[BR]]useTopWidth: true if using a dimension to set the width of the dormer roof. False if the top width of the dormer is determined by the left and right slope. The topWidth is exclusive of leftSlope & rightSlope.[[BR]]twOrLSlope: dimension of the roof of the dormer if previous param is true, or slope of left dormer wall if false.[[BR]]rightSlope: angle of right dormer wall.[[BR]]topSlope: angle of the roof of the dormer.

Param.Name: useHeight
Param.Desc: Returns if height setting was used to created dormer.

Param.Name: useTopWidth
Param.Desc: Returns whether top width was used to create dormer.

Param.Name: leftSlope
Param.Desc: Returns left slope of dormer roof.

Param.Name: rightSlope
Param.Desc: Returns right slope of dormer roof.

Param.Name: topSlope
Param.Desc: Returns top slope of dormer roof.

Item.Name: SetTrapeziumAttributes
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the attributes of a trapezium dormer in the referenced roof.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets trapezium dormer attributes.
Item.Comments: dormerID: Identifies the which dormer for which to set the values.[[BR]][[BR]]useHeight: Set to true if the next value is the height of the dormer, otherwise set to false if the next value is the depth (front to back) of the dormer.[[BR]]heightDepthValue: Size of the dormer, either by height or depth; determined by previous parameter.[[BR]][[BR]]bottomWidth: Dimension of bottom front edge of the dormer, left to right.[[BR]][[BR]]useTopWidth: True if using a dimension to set the width of the dormer roof. False if the top width of the dormer is determined by the left and right slope. The topWidth is exclusive of leftSlope & rightSlope.[[BR]]twOrLSlope: dimension of the roof of the dormer if previous param is true, or slope of left dormer wall if false.[[BR]]rightSlope: Angle of right dormer wall.[[BR]][[BR]]topSlope: Angle of the roof of the dormer.

Param.Name: useHeight
Param.Desc: Use height setting to create dormer element.

Param.Name: useTopWidth
Param.Desc: Use top width to create dormer element.

Item.Name: CreateGableDormer
Item.Description: Function [[name]] creates a gable dormer in the referenced roof object.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a gable dormer.
Item.Comments: This only creates the object, SetDormerAttributes() & SetGableAttributes() must still be called to define the attributes of the dormer.

Item.Name: GetGableAttributes
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the attributes of a gable dormer in the referenced roof.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the attributes of a gable style dormer.
Item.Comments: This will fail if the dormerID identifies a dormer of a different style, or the dormerID is not valid.[[BR]][[BR]]dormerID: Identifies the dormer for which to retrieve the information.[[BR]][[BR]]useHeight: Set to true if the next value is the height of the dormer, if false, next value is the depth (front to back) of the dormer.[[BR]]heightDepthValue: Size of the dormer, either by height or depth; determined by previous parameter.[[BR]][[BR]]bottomWidth: Dimension of bottom front edge of the dormer, left to right.[[BR]][[BR]]leftSlope: Angle of left dormer roof.[[BR]]rightSlope: Angle of right dormer roof.[[BR]][[BR]]overhang: Distance roof projects past dormer walls.

Param.Name: useHeight
Param.Desc: Returns if height setting was used to created dormer.

Param.Name: leftSlope
Param.Desc: Returns left roof slope of dormer element.

Param.Name: rightSlope
Param.Desc: Returns right roof slope of dormer element.

Item.Name: SetGableAttributes
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the attributes of a gable dormer in the referenced roof.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the attributes of a gable style dormer.
Item.Comments: dormerID: Identifies the dormer for which to set the information.[[BR]][[BR]]useHeight: Set to true if the next value is the height of the dormer, if false, next value is the depth (front to back) of the dormer.[[BR]]heightDepthValue: Size of the dormer, either by height or depth; determined by previous parameter.[[BR]][[BR]]bottomWidth: Dimension of bottom front edge of the dormer, left to right.[[BR]][[BR]]leftSlope: Angle of left dormer roof.[[BR]]rightSlope: Angle of right dormer roof.[[BR]][[BR]]overhang: Distance roof projects past dormer walls.

Param.Name: useHeight
Param.Desc: Use height setting to create dormer element.

Item.Name: CreateShedDormer
Item.Description: Function [[name]] creates a shed dormer in the referenced roof object.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a shed style dormer.
Item.Comments: This only creates the object, SetDormerAttributes() & SetShedAttributes() must still be called to define the attributes of the dormer.

Item.Name: GetShedAttributes
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the attributes of a shed dormer in the referenced roof.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the attributes of a shed style dormer.
Item.Comments: This will fail if the dormerID identifies a dormer of a different style, or the dormerID is not valid.[[BR]][[BR]]dormerID: Identifies the dormer for which to retrieve the information.[[BR]][[BR]]useHeight: Set to true if the next value is the height of the dormer, if false, next value is the depth (front to back) of the dormer.[[BR]]heightDepthValue: Size of the dormer, either by height or depth; determined by previous parameter.[[BR]][[BR]]bottomWidth: Dimension of bottom front edge of the dormer, left to right.[[BR]][[BR]]topSlope: Angle of dormer roof.[[BR]][[BR]]overhang: Distance roof projects past dormer walls.

Param.Name: useHeight
Param.Desc: Returns if height setting was used to created dormer.

Param.Name: topSlope
Param.Desc: Returns top slope of dormer roof.

Item.Name: SetShedAttributes
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the attributes of a shed dormer in the referenced roof.
Item.ShortDesc: Set the attributes of a shed style dormer.
Item.Comments: dormerID: Identifies the dormer for which to set the information.[[BR]][[BR]]useHeight: true if the next value is the height of the dormer, if false, next value is the depth (front to back) of the dormer[[BR]]heightDepthValue: size of the dormer, either by height or depth; determined by previous parameter.[[BR]][[BR]]bottomWidth: Dimension of bottom front edge of the dormer, left to right.[[BR]][[BR]]topSlope: Angle of dormer roof.[[BR]][[BR]]overhang: Distance roof projects past dormer walls.

Param.Name: useHeight
Param.Desc: Use height setting to create dormer element.

Item.Name: CreateHipDormer
Item.Description: Function [[name]] creates a hip dormer in the referenced roof object.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a hip style dormer.
Item.Comments: This only creates the object, SetDormerAttributes() & SetHipAttributes() must still be called to define the attributes of the dormer.[[BR]][[BR]]object: is the roof object into which to add the dormer.

Item.Name: GetHipAttributes
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the attributes of a hip dormer in the referenced roof.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the attributes of a hip style dormer.
Item.Comments: This will fail if the dormerID identifies a dormer of a different style, or the dormerID is not valid.[[BR]][[BR]]dormerID: Identifies the dormer for which to retrieve the information.[[BR]][[BR]]useHeight: true if the next value is the height of the dormer, if false, next value is the depth (front to back) of the dormer[[BR]]heightDepthValue: size of the dormer, either by height or depth; determined by previous parameter[[BR]][[BR]]bottomWidth: Dimension of bottom front edge of the dormer, left to right.[[BR]][[BR]]leftSlope: Angle of left dormer roof.[[BR]]rightSlope: Angle of right dormer roof.[[BR]]frontSlope: Angle of the front dormer roof face.[[BR]][[BR]]overhang: Distance roof projects past dormer walls.

Param.Name: useHeight
Param.Desc: Returns if height setting was used to created dormer.

Item.Name: SetHipAttributes
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the attributes of a hip dormer in the referenced roof.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the attributes of a hip style dormer.
Item.Comments: dormerID: Identifies the dormer for which to set the information.[[BR]][[BR]]useHeight: Set to true if the next value is the height of the dormer, if false, next value is the depth (front to back) of the dormer.[[BR]]heightDepthValue: Size of the dormer, either by height or depth; determined by previous parameter.[[BR]][[BR]]bottomWidth: Dimension of bottom front edge of the dormer, left to right.[[BR]][[BR]]leftSlope: Angle of left dormer roof.[[BR]]rightSlope: Angle of right dormer roof.[[BR]]frontSlope: Angle of the front dormer roof face.[[BR]][[BR]]overhang: Distance roof projects past dormer walls.

Param.Name: useHeight
Param.Desc: Use height setting to create dormer element.

Param.Name: leftAngle
Param.Desc: Slope of left roof of dormer.

Param.Name: rightAngle
Param.Desc: Slope of right roof of dormer.

Param.Name: frontAngle
Param.Desc: Slope of front roof of dormer.

Item.Name: CreateBatDormer
Item.Description: Function [[name]] creates a bat dormer in the referenced roof object.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a bat style dormer.
Item.Comments: This only creates the object, SetDormerAttributes() & SetBatAttributes() must still be called to define the attributes of the dormer.[[BR]][[BR]]

Item.Name: GetBatAttributes
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the attributes of a bat dormer in the referenced roof.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the attributes of a bat style dormer.
Item.Comments: This will fail if the dormerID identifies a dormer of a different style, or the dormerID is not valid.[[BR]][[BR]]dormerID: Identifies the dormer for which to retrieve the information.[[BR]][[BR]]useHeight: Set to true if the next value is the height of the dormer, if false, next value is the depth (front to back) of the dormer.[[BR]]heightDepthValue: Size of the dormer, either by height or depth; determined by previous parameter.[[BR]][[BR]]bottomWidth: Dimension of bottom front edge of the dormer, left to right.[[BR]]baseHeight: Dimension of the bottom half of the dormer.[[BR]]topWidth: Dimension of the roof of the dormer.[[BR]][[BR]]topSlope: Angle of the dormer roof.[[BR]][[BR]]controlPoint: The distance from the side to where the curve starts. Must be less than (bottomWidth - topWidth) / 2.

Param.Name: useHeight
Param.Desc: Returns if height setting was used to created dormer.

Param.Name: topSlope
Param.Desc: Returns the slope of the bat roof.

Item.Name: SetBatAttributes
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the attributes of a bat dormer in the referenced roof.
Item.ShortDesc: Set the attributes of a bat style dormer.
Item.Comments: dormerID: Identifies the dormer for which to set the information.[[BR]][[BR]]useHeight: Set to true if the next value is the height of the dormer, if false, next value is the depth (front to back) of the dormer.[[BR]]heightDepthValue: Size of the dormer, either by height or depth; determined by previous parameter.[[BR]][[BR]]bottomWidth: Dimension of bottom front edge of the dormer, left to right..[[BR]]topWidth: Dimension of the roof of the dormer.[[BR]]baseHeight: Dimension of the bottom half of the dormer.[[BR]][[BR]]topSlope: Angle of the dormer roof.[[BR]][[BR]]controlPoint: The distance from the side to where the curve starts. Must be less than (bottomWidth - topWidth) / 2.

Param.Name: useHeight
Param.Desc: Use height setting to create dormer element.

Item.Name: RemoveRoofElement
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] removes the specified roof element from the referenced roof.
Item.ShortDesc: Removes a dormer or skylight from a roof object.
Item.Comments: id is the value returned from Create...Dormer() or CreateSkylight() routine.

Item.Name: AppendRoofEdge
Item.Description: Function [[name]] creates a new edge in the referenced roof object.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates an edge component in a roof object.
Item.Comments: Vertex is appended to the end of the list of vertices. Vertices define the outline of the roof. Vertices must progress in a counter clock wise direction, when viewed from a top view, otherwise the roof cannot be built.[[BR]][[BR]]edgePt: Coordinate point for this edge[[BR]]slope: pitch of this roof edge[[BR]]projection: eave overhang[[BR]]eaveHeight: eave height

Item.Name: GetRoofVertices
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the number of roof edges in the referenced roof object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of roof edges in a roof object.

Item.Name: GetNumRoofElements
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the number of roof elements (dormers and skylights) in the referenced roof object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of dormers and skylights in a roof object.

Item.Name: GetDormerAttributes
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the attributes of a roof element in the referenced roof.
Item.ShortDesc: Get dormer attrs
Item.Comments: This will fail if the dormerID identifies a skylight, or dormerID is not valid.[[BR]][[BR]]dormerID: Identifies the dormer for which to retrieve the information.[[BR]]edgeIndex: Index to which roof face this skylight is placed. Value is one based.[[BR]][[BR]]cornerOffset: Distance from the vertex to the center of the dormer.[[BR]]isPerpOffset: Determines the meaning of the next parameter. Set to true for the value to be the plan distance from the outline to the front of the dormer. Set to false for offsetValue to set the distance from the top of the dormer to the bearing height.[[BR]]perpOrHeightOffset: Either the distance from the outline to the front of the dormer, or from the dormer roof to the floor.[[BR]][[BR]]symName: Symbol to place in the dormer, this is the window.[[BR]]centerSymbol: Set to true to vertically center the symbol in the dormer. Doing so causes the next parameter to be ignored.[[BR]]Set to false to offset the symbol from the top of the dormer using the next parameter.[[BR]]symOffset: Distance from top of the dormer to symbol insertion point.[[BR]]

Param.Name: cornerOffset
Param.Desc: Returns offset from roof edge corner.

Param.Name: isPerpOffset
Param.Desc: Returns whether perpendicular offset was used.

Item.Name: SetDormerAttributes
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the attributes of a roof element in the referenced roof.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets dormer attributes.
Item.Comments: This will fail if the dormerID identifies a skylight, or dormerID is not valid.[[BR]][[BR]]dormerID: Identifies the dormer for which to set the information.[[BR]]edgeIndex: Index to which roof face this dormer is placed. Value is one based.[[BR]][[BR]]cornerOffset: Distance from the vertex to the center of the dormer.[[BR]]isPerpOffset: Determines the meaning of the next parameter. Set to true for the value to be the plan distance from the outline to the front of the dormer. Set to false for offsetValue to set the distance from the top of the dormer to the bearing height.[[BR]]perpOrHeightOffset: Either the distance from the outline to the front of the dormer, or from the dormer roof to the floor.[[BR]][[BR]]symName: Symbol to place in the dormer, this is the window.[[BR]]centerSymbol: Set to true to vertically center the symbol in the dormer. Doing so causes the next parameter to be ignored.[[BR]]Set to false to offset the symbol from the top of the dormer using the next parameter.[[BR]]symOffset: Distance from top of the dormer to symbol insertion point.

Item.Name: Random
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns a random number between 0.0 and 1.0.
Item.ShortDesc: Generates a random number between 0.0 and 1.0
Item.Comments: Generates a random number between 0.0 and 1.0

Item.Name: StdRead
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] will read data from a currently open text file. The variable length parameter list returns the read data in the specified parameters.[[BR]][[BR]]Supported data types include INTEGER, REAL, LONGINT, CHAR or STRING. Non STRING data values must be separated by a tab or space to be correctly read into variables. If the procedure encounters an EOF(end-of-file) marker, an error is generated. [[name]] does not position the file position pointer to the beginning of a new line after the procedure is called.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] reads data according to the Pascal language standard. This differs from the Read procedure found in VectorScript primarily when reading STRING data. [[name]] will read all characters, including tabs and spaces, as a single string value. Read will detect tabs as delimiters, allowing multiple string values to be assigned to variables.
Item.ShortDesc: Reads data from the currently open text file.

Item.Name: StdReadLn
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] will read data from a currently open text file. The variable length parameter list returns the read data in the specified parameters.[[BR]][[BR]]Supported data types include INTEGER, REAL, LONGINT, CHAR or STRING. Non STRING data values must be separated by a tab or space to be correctly read into variables. If the procedure encounters an EOF(end-of-file) marker, an error is generated. [[name]] positions the file position pointer to the beginning of a new line after the procedure is called.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] reads data according to the Pascal language standard. This differs from the ReadLn procedure found in VectorScript primarily when reading STRING data. [[name]] will read all characters, including tabs and spaces, as a single string value. ReadLn will detect tabs as delimiters, allowing multiple string values to be assigned to variables.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Reads data from a currently open text file.

Item.Name: SetDormerThick
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets dormer roof and wall thicknesses for the referenced roof.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets dormer roof and bearing wall thicknesses.

Item.Name: GetDormerThick
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns dormer roof and wall thicknesses for the referenced roof.
Item.ShortDesc: Return wall and roof thicknesses for a specified dormer.

Item.Name: SetSingularConstraint
Item.Description: Applies a parametric constraint to the referenced object. The geometry of the constraint is defined by the specified object vertices. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:ConstrainType]]
Item.ShortDesc: Applies a parametric constraint to the referenced object.
Item.Result: Returns a BOOLEAN value indicating whether the constraint was applied successfully.
Item.Comments: Sets a constraint of type typeOfConstraint on the object h. The valid values for typeOfConstraint are 4 (vertical), 5 (horizontal), 8 (distance), 9 (vertical distance), 10 (horizontal distance) and 11 (radius). vertexA and vertexB indicate which vertices of the object define the geometry to be constrained. A value of -1 indicates that a vertex parameter is not applicable. It returns false if the constraint cannot be set.

Param.Name: typeOfConstraint
Param.Desc: Type of constraint to be applied.

Item.Name: SetBinaryConstraint
Item.Description: Applies a binary parametric constraint to the referenced objects. The geometry of the constraint is defined by the specified object vertices. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:BinaryConstrainType]][[BR]][[BR]]To apply a constraint to an object within a symbol, use GetClosestPt to obtain an index to the object and pass the index to either [[p:6]] to use it as the first object or [[p:7]] to use it as the second object. In all other instances, pass 0 to both these parameters.
Item.ShortDesc: Applies a binary parametric constraint to the referenced objects.
Item.Result: Returns a BOOLEAN value indicating whether the constraint was successfully applied.
Item.Comments: Sets a constraint on h1 and h2 on the designated vertices. Valid values for typeOfConstraint are 1 (coincident), 2 (colinear), 3 (parallel), 6 (tangent), 7 (concentric), 8 (distance), 9 (horizontal distance), 10 (vertical distance), 12 (angle) and 13 (perpendicular). obj1VertA and obj1VertB indicate which vertices of the first object to use in the constraint, and obj2VertA and obj2VertB indicate which vertices of the second object to use. A value of -1 indicates that a vertex parameter is not applicable. The containedObj fields are for an index into the list of a container object such as a symbol. This can be obtained from the GetClosestPt function.

Param.Name: typeOfConstraint
Param.Desc: Type of constraint to be applied.

Param.Name: obj1VertA
Param.Desc: Vertex on first object defining constraint geometry.

Param.Name: obj1VertB
Param.Desc: Vertex on first object defining constraint geometry.

Param.Name: obj2VertA
Param.Desc: Vertex on second object defining constraint geometry.

Param.Name: obj2VertB
Param.Desc: Vertex on second object defining constraint geometry.

Param.Name: containedObj1
Param.Desc: Object index, obtained from the GetClosestPt function.

Param.Name: containedObj2
Param.Desc: Object index, obtained from the GetClosestPt function.

Item.Name: GetSingularConstraint
Item.Description: Returns the type of constraint applied to the referenced object.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ConstrainType]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the type of constraint applied to the referenced object.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the constraint if exists, otherwise returns NIL.

Param.Name: typeOfConstraint
Param.Desc: Type of constraint to be returned.

Item.Name: WritelnOnly
Item.Comments: This is a very special constant used internally by the parser. See the note for special (2) below as it applies to constants. - PCP[[BR]][[BR]]As of 8/27/99 this constant is not used any more ?

Item.Name: HUngroup
Item.Description: Decomposes the referenced group into component objects.
Item.ShortDesc: Decomposes the referenced group into component objects.

Item.Name: AddSurface
Item.Description: Creates a new surface object by combining the two referenced surface objects. If the combination is successful (if the objects overlap), it deletes the original surface objects and returns the handle of the resultant object.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new surface object by combining the two referenced surface objects.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to a new surface object.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE AddSurfaceExample;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h1, h2, h3 :HANDLE;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] DSelectAll;[[BR]] CallTool(-203);[[BR]] h1 := FSActLayer;[[BR]] DSelectAll;[[BR]] CallTool(-203);[[BR]] h2 := FSActLayer;[[BR]] h3 := AddSurface(h1, h2);[[BR]] IF h3 <> nil THEN SetFPat(h3, 5);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(AddSurfaceExample);

Item.Name: IntersectSurface
Item.Description: Creates new surface objects that are the intersection of the two referenced surface objects. The original surface objects are not modified. The new objects get "inserted" into the drawing list, after s2, and before the next object after that.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the intersection of surfaces s1 and s2 leaving s1 and s2 unmodified. If multiple intersecting surfaces exist, a group handle of those surfaces is returned.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the new surface object, or to a group containing multiple surface objects.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h1, h2, h3, h4 :HANDLE;[[BR]] pt :VECTOR;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] h1 := NIL;[[BR]] WHILE h1 = NIL DO BEGIN[[BR]] Message('Pick the first object...');[[BR]] GetPt(pt.x, pt.y);[[BR]] h1 := PickObject(pt.x, pt.y);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] h2 := NIL;[[BR]] WHILE h2 = NIL DO BEGIN[[BR]] Message('Pick the second object...');[[BR]] GetPt(pt.x, pt.y);[[BR]] h2 := PickObject(pt.x, pt.y);[[BR]] END; [[BR]][[BR]] {Capture the handle of the next object.}[[BR]] h3 := NextObj(h2);[[BR]][[BR]] {Now create the intersection surface(s).}[[BR]] h4 := IntersectSurface(h1, h2);[[BR]][[BR]] {Now find the intersection surface(s).}[[BR]] WHILE h4 <> h3 DO BEGIN[[BR]] SetFPat(h4, 3);[[BR]] h4 := NextObj(h4);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] ClrMessage;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: ClipSurface
Item.Description: Creates a new surface object by subtracting the intersection of surfaces [[p:1]] and [[p:2]] from [[p:1]].[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new surface object by subtracting the intersection of surfaces [[p:1]] and [[p:2]] from [[p:1]].
Item.Example: PROCEDURE ClipSurfaceExample;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h1, h2, h3 :HANDLE;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] DSelectAll;[[BR]] CallTool(-203);[[BR]] h1 := FSActLayer;[[BR]] DSelectAll;[[BR]] CallTool(-203);[[BR]] h2 := FSActLayer;[[BR]] ClipSurface(h1, h2);[[BR]] h3 := PrevObj(h2);[[BR]] IF h3 <> h1 THEN SetFPat(h3, 5);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(ClipSurfaceExample);[[BR]]

Item.Name: HMoveForward
Item.Description: Move the referenced object forward in the object stacking order. If [[p:2]] is TRUE, the object will be moved to the front of the stacking order.
Item.ShortDesc: Move the referenced object forward in the object stacking order. If [[p:2]] is TRUE, the object will be moved to the front of the stacking order. If not - the object will be moved in front of the next object in stacking order that it overlaps.

Param.Name: toFront
Param.Desc: Move object to front of stacking order.

Item.Name: HMoveBackward
Item.Description: Move the referenced object backward in the object stacking order. If [[p:2]] is TRUE, the object will be moved to the back of the stacking order.
Item.ShortDesc: Move the referenced object backward in the object stacking order. If [[p:2]] is TRUE, the object will be moved to the back of the stacking order. If [[p:2]] is not true, the object will be moved in back of the next object in stacking order that it overlaps.

Param.Name: toBack
Param.Desc: Move to back of stacking order.

Item.Name: GetParent
Item.Description: Returns a handle to the parent container object of the referenced object. If the object does not have a container, a handle to the objects' layer will be returned.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the parent container object of the referenced object. If the object does not have a container, a handle to the objects' layer will be returned.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the parent object or layer.

Item.Name: GetWallControlOffset
Item.Description: Returns the default wall control line offset value.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the wall control line offset value.

Item.Name: SetWallControlOffset
Item.Description: Sets the default wall control line offset value.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets wall control line offset value.

Item.Name: InsertSymbolInFolder
Item.Description: Inserts a symbol definition into the referenced symbol folder.
Item.ShortDesc: Inserts a symbol definition into the referenced symbol folder.

Item.Name: GetLayerOptions
Item.Description: Returns layer visibility setting for the active document.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:LayerClassOptions]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns layer visibility setting for the active document.
Item.Result: Returns an INTEGER indicating the layer visibility status of the document.

Item.Name: SetLayerOptions
Item.Description: Sets layer visibility setting for the active document.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:LayerClassOptions]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets layer visibility setting for the active document.

Param.Name: layerOpts
Param.Desc: New layer visibility setting for document.

Item.Name: GetClassOptions
Item.Description: Returns the class visibility setting for the active document.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:LayerClassOptions]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the class visibility setting for the active document.
Item.Result: An INTEGER value indicating the current class visibility setting for the document.

Item.Name: SetClassOptions
Item.Description: Sets class visibility setting for the active document.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:LayerClassOptions]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets class visibility setting for the active document.

Item.Name: GetLayerByName
Item.Description: Returns a handle to the specified layer.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the specified layer.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the layer.

Item.Name: RenameClass
Item.Description: Renames the specified class. [[BR]][[BR]]All objects assigned to the class being renamed are updated.
Item.ShortDesc: Renames the specified class.

Item.Name: GetTickCount
Item.Description: Returns number of ticks (1/60th second) since system startup.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns number of ticks (1/60th second) since system startup.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] tick1, tick2 :LONGINT;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] tick1 := GetTickCount;[[BR]] ForEachObject(ResetObject, (T=86));[[BR]] tick2 := GetTickCount;[[BR]] Message('Seconds elapsed equals: ', (tick2 - tick1) / 60);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]Run(Example);

Item.Name: CrossProduct
Item.Description: Returns the cross product of the two specified vectors.[[BR]][[BR]]The cross product is also known as the vector product of the two vectors. The result is a vector whose magnitude is equivalent to the product of the magnitudes of the two vectors multiplied by the sine of the smaller angle between the two vectors. The direction of the resultant vector is perpendicular to a plane formed by the two source vectors.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the cross product of the two specified vectors.
Item.Result: Returns a VECTOR which is the cross product of [[p:1]] and [[p:2]].
Item.Comments: This is provided for cross-platform compatibility.

Item.Name: GetLastFileErr
Item.Description: Returns an error code indicating whether an error occured during a file operation.[[BR]][[BR]]This function should be called after file I/O calls such as Open() or Rewrite().
Item.ShortDesc: Returns an error code indicating whether an error occured during a file operation.
Item.Example: UseDefaultFileErrorHandling(FALSE);[[BR]]Open(Concat(pathName, fileName));[[BR]]errorCode := GetLastFileErr;[[BR]]IF errorCode <> 0 THEN[[BR]] CASE errorCode OF[[BR]] 2: AlrtDialog(Concat('The file "', fileName, '" cannot be processed because the hard drive is full.'));[[BR]] 4: AlrtDialog(Concat('End of file "', fileName, '" reached prematurely.'));[[BR]] 5: AlrtDialog(Concat('The file "', fileName, '" is locked.'));[[BR]] 6: AlrtDialog(Concat('The file "', fileName, '" not found.'));[[BR]] 10: AlrtDialog(Concat('The file "', fileName, '" currently in use by another program.'));[[BR]] 13: AlrtDialog(Concat('The file path "', pathName, '" does not exist.'));[[BR]] OTHERWISE AlrtDialog(Concat('The file "',fileName,'" has encountered an undetermined error.'));[[BR]] END;[[BR]]

Item.Name: UseDefaultFileErrorHandling
Item.Description: Enables or disables file I/O alert dialogs.[[BR]][[BR]]Use this function with GetLastFileErr() to implement custom error handling for file operations.
Item.ShortDesc: Enable or disable alert dialogs when File I/O errors occur.

Param.Name: enable
Param.Desc: Status of file error dialog usage.

Item.Name: SetSymbolOptionsN
Item.Description: Sets the default class, insert options, and break options for the specified symbol. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:SymInsertOptionTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the default class, insert options, and break options for the specified symbol.
Item.Comments: Sets the insert and break options for the master symbol named <name>. [[BR]][[BR]]The insertMode options are:[[BR]]0 = insert on the center line of the wall[[BR]]1 = insert on the edge of the wall[[BR]][[BR]]The breakMode options are:[[BR]]1 = Full break with caps, both edges of the wall are broken and cap lines close off the two broken portions of the wall.[[BR]]2 = Full break with no caps, both edges of the wall are broken and there are no cap lines.[[BR]]3 = Half break, for edge insertions only, wall edge is broken on the same edge that the symbol is inserted on.[[BR]]4 = No break, there is no break in the wall, the symbol is drawn on top of the wall.[[BR]][[BR]]See also Get SymbolOptions[[BR]][[BR]][sd 8/18/98][[BR]][[BR]]The className should specify the name of a class that exists in the parent document. After a class is set, all instances of[[BR]]this symbol will be marked as members of the class.

Item.Name: GetSymbolOptionsN
Item.Description: Returns default class, insert options, and break options for the specified symbol. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:SymInsertOptionTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns default class, insert options, and break options for the specified symbol.
Item.Comments: Gets the insertion options from the master symbol named <name>.[[BR]][[BR]]See SetSymbolOptions.[[BR]][[BR]][8/18/98]

Item.Name: GetSprdSortSumColumns
Item.Description: Returns the sorting and summation options for a database row.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the sorting and summation options for a database row.
Item.Comments: Gets sorting for a database row. The sortCol1, sortCol2, and sortCol3 values specify the primary, secondary and tertiary sorts for the database row. For descending sorts, a positive column is returned; for ascending sorts, a negative column is returned For no sort, 0 is returned. Sum works the same way.[[BR]]OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new GetWSColumnOperators. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: SetSprdSortSumColumns
Item.Description: Sets the sorting and summation options for a database row.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the sorting and summation options for a database row.
Item.Comments: Sets sorting and summation for a database row. The sortCol1, sortCol2, and sortCol3 values specify the primary, secondary and tertiary sorts for the database row. Pass a positive column for a descending sort; pass a negative column for an ascending sort. For no sort, pass 0 as the column. Sum works the same way.[[BR]]OBSOLETE for Version 9: see new SetWSColumnOperators. [VML 01/09/01]

Item.Name: QTInitialize
Item.Description: Initializes QuickTime and returns the QuckTime version number.
Item.ShortDesc: Initializes QuickTime and returns the version number.
Item.Result: Returns the QuickTime version number. A value of 0 indicates QuickTime is not available.
Item.Comments: We don't support QuickTime versions less than 3.0, so this function will return 0 in that scenario.

Item.Name: QTTerminate
Item.Description: Disables QuickTime and disposes of internal QuickTime data structures.
Item.ShortDesc: Disables QuickTime and disposes of internal QuickTime data structures.

Item.Name: QTSetMovieOptions
Item.Description: Sets the QuickTime movie frame rate and key frame rate for the referenced movie stream. The standard QuickTime compression options dialog can also be optionally displayed.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the QuickTime movie frame rate and key frame rate. The standard QuickTime compression options dialog can also be optionally displayed.

Item.Name: QTGetMovieOptions
Item.Description: Retrieves the QuickTime movie frame rate and key frame rate for the referenced movie stream.
Item.ShortDesc: Retrieves the QuickTime movie frame rate and key frame rate for the referenced movie stream.

Item.Name: QTOpenMovieFile
Item.Description: Creates or opens a QuickTime movie file for writing.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates or opens a QuickTime movie file for writing.
Item.Result: An INTEGER index value identifying the open movie stream. A value of -1 indicates the stream could not be opened.

Item.Name: QTCloseMovieFile
Item.Description: Closes the specified QuickTime movie file.
Item.ShortDesc: Closes the specified QuickTime movie file.

Item.Name: QTWriteFrame
Item.Description: Captures the active document window and writes a frame to the specified QuickTime movie file.
Item.ShortDesc: Captures the active document window and writes a frame to the specified QuickTime movie file.
Item.Comments: This function will likely also draw to the screen as a pseudo-progress indicator.

Item.Name: CreateCustomObject
Item.Description: Creates a custom object instance at the specified location and angle of rotation. For the objectName, use the "internal" plug-in name (the one assigned in the plug-in editor), as opposed to the filename (which can be different).[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a custom object instance at specified location and angle of rotation.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the new object.

Param.Name: rotationAngle
Param.Desc: Rotation angle (in degrees) of object instance.

Item.Name: ForEachObjectInLayer
Item.Description: Traverses through all objects according to specified search options and applies the specified action to each object. The 'actionFunc' procedure should return false to continue with next object, or return true to stop the traversal.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ForEachLayer]]
Item.ShortDesc: Traverses through all objects according to specified search options and applies the specified action to each object.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]][[BR]]FUNCTION MakeItRed(h :HANDLE) :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] r, g, b :LONGINT;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] ColorIndexToRGB(7, r, g, b);[[BR]] SetFillBack(h, r, g, b);[[BR]]END;[[BR]] [[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] ForEachObjectInLayer(MakeItRed, 2, 0, 4);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]
Item.SpecialOverride: CHECKFEOINLAYER(procForEachObjectInLayer, MP_FEOInLayer, userProcMode, intMode, intMode, intMode);

Param.Name: actionFunc
Param.Desc: Subroutine which performs operation on found objects.

Item.Name: ForEachObjectInList
Item.Description: Processes all items in the specified list and and applies the specified action to each item.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ForEachList]]
Item.ShortDesc: Processes all items in the specified list and and applies the specified action to each item.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]CONST[[BR]] pioName = 'Complex Window 2';[[BR]] parameter = 'MeasureHeight';[[BR]] value = 'Head of Window';[[BR]] [[BR]]FUNCTION DoIt(h :HANDLE) :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] h := FInSymDef(h);[[BR]] SetRField(h, pioName, parameter, value);[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] ForEachObjectInList(DoIt, 0, 0, FSymDef);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);
Item.SpecialOverride: CHECKFEOINLIST(procForEachObjectInList, MP_FEOInList, userProcMode, intMode, intMode, handleMode);

Param.Name: actionFunc
Param.Desc: Subroutine which performs operation on found objects.

Param.Name: list
Param.Desc: Handle to first item in list.

Item.Name: Get2DPt
Item.Description: Returns the location of the specified vertex of a referenced object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the location of the specified vertex of a referenced object.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: Index of vertex to be queried.

Item.Name: GetClosestPt
Item.Description: Returns the index number of the object closest to the specified location. [[BR]][[BR]]The index value will return 0 if no vertex can be determined as closest, and will return -1 if the object does not support [[name]].[[BR]][[BR]]For container objects, [[name]] has distinct behaviors. For walls, if the closest vertex is[[BR]]is in a subobject, [[p:1]] will be set to a handle to the subobject. For symbols and plug-in objects, an index to the sub-object will be returned via parameter [[p:4]].[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] supports only 2D objects.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the vertex index of the object closest to the location.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE GetClosestPtExample;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] obj :HANDLE; [[BR]] ptX, ptY :REAL; [[BR]] index :INTEGER; [[BR]] containedObj :LONGINT;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetPt(ptX, ptY);[[BR]] obj := PickObject(ptX, ptY);[[BR]] GetClosestPt(obj, ptX, ptY, index, containedObj);[[BR]] SetPenFore(obj, 65535, 0, 0);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(GetClosestPtExample);

Item.Name: GetClosestSide
Item.Description: Returns the indices of the vertices that define the side closest to the specified location. [[BR]][[BR]][[name]] supports only 2D objects. If the object is unsupported, -1 will be returned as the index values.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the indices of the vertices that define the side closest to the specified location.

Param.Name: index1
Param.Desc: Index of first vertex of closest side.

Param.Name: index2
Param.Desc: Index of second vertex of closest side.

Item.Name: GetRField
Item.Description: Returns string description of a value in the specified record field.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns string description of a record field value.
Item.Result: Returns the field value as a variable length string.
Item.Comments: Returns a string interpretation of the field from the specified record
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]][[BR]]FUNCTION WriteFieldValues(h :HANDLE) :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] cnt :INTEGER;[[BR]] recHand :HANDLE;[[BR]] recName :STRING;[[BR]] fldName :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] recName := GetName(GetRecord(h, NumRecords(h)));[[BR]] recHand := GetObject(recName);[[BR]] FOR cnt := 1 TO NumFields(recHand) DO BEGIN[[BR]] fldName := GetFldName(recHand, cnt);[[BR]] WriteLn(fldName, ': ', GetRField(h, recName, fldName));[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] ForEachObjectInLayer(WriteFieldValues, 2, 0, 4);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: field
Param.Desc: Name of field to be queried.

Item.Name: GetPolylineVertex
Item.Description: Returns information about the specified polyline vertex.[[BR]][[BR]]Note that [[p:2]] is 1-based for Polygons and Polylines, and 0-based for 3D Polylines.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns information about the specified polyline vertex.
Item.Comments: Retrieves information about a polyline vertex. Vertex type constant values are 0 - Corner, 1 - Bezier, 2 - Cubic, 3 - Arc
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] obj :HANDLE;[[BR]] vertexNum :INTEGER;[[BR]] ptX, ptY :REAL;[[BR]] vertexType :INTEGER;[[BR]] arcRadius :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] obj := FSActLayer;[[BR]] FOR vertexNum := 1 TO GetVertNum(obj) DO BEGIN[[BR]] GetPolylineVertex(obj, vertexNum, ptX, ptY, vertexType, arcRadius);[[BR]] TextOrigin(ptX, ptY);[[BR]] CreateText(Concat('vNum: ', vertexNum, ' vType: ', vertexType, ' radius: ', arcRadius));[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: vertexNum
Param.Desc: Index of vertex to be queried.

Param.Name: arcRadius
Param.Desc: Radius of vertex corner (arc vertex only).

Item.Name: SetPolylineVertex
Item.Description: Sets the attributes of the specified polyline vertex to the specified values.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the attributes of the specified polyline vertex to the specified values.
Item.Comments: Sets the specified vertex of the referenced polyline object. Vertex type constant values are 0 - Corner, 1 - Bezier, 2 - Cubic, 3 - Arc
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]] {This will convert anything it can in the drawing to a polyline[[BR]] (including rectangles, polygons, etc.), and then it will fillet[[BR]] all of the corners with a radius of .015".}[[BR]]CONST[[BR]] kFilletRadius = .015";[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] cnt :INTEGER;[[BR]] x, y :REAL;[[BR]] vertexType :INTEGER;[[BR]] vertexRadius :REAL;[[BR]] criteria :STRING;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE FilletPolygon(h :HANDLE);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] h := ConvertToPolyline(h);[[BR]] FOR cnt := 1 to GetVertNum(h) DO BEGIN[[BR]] GetPolylineVertex(h, cnt, x, y, vertexType, vertexRadius);[[BR]] SetPolylineVertex(h, cnt, x, y, 3, kFilletRadius, TRUE);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] criteria := '(ALL)';[[BR]] ForEachObject(FilletPolygon, criteria);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: vertexNum
Param.Desc: Index (1-based) of vertex to be modified.

Param.Name: arcRadiusDistance
Param.Desc: Radius of vertex corner (arc vertex only).

Item.Name: GetPluginInfo
Item.Description: Returns the name and attached parameter record of the currently executing plug-in. Use with menu command or tool item plug-ins.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the name and attached parameter record of the currently executing plug-in.
Item.Comments: Maybe a new function class of "Plug-ins" would be more appropriate than "Objects - Custom".

Param.Name: recordHand
Param.Desc: Handle to parameter record of plug-in.

Item.Name: GetPluginFullName
Item.Description: Returns the full name of the currently executing plug-in.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the full name of the currently executing plug-in.
Item.Comments: Maybe a new function class of "Plug-ins" would be more appropriate than "Objects - Custom".[[BR]][[BR]]Note that the name returned by the related function GetPluginInfo is the 20 character name used for the Plug-in's record.

Item.Name: DeleteConstraint
Item.Description: Removes a constraint from the referenced object in the document.
Item.ShortDesc: Removes a constraint from the referenced object in the document.

Item.Name: GetBinaryConstraint
Item.Description: Returns a handle to a binary parametric constraint applied to the referenced objects.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:BinaryConstrainType]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to a binary parametric constraint applied to the referenced objects.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the constraint if exists, otherwise returns NIL.

Param.Name: constrType
Param.Desc: Type of constraint to be returned.

Param.Name: obj1
Param.Desc: Handle to first object in constraint relationship.

Param.Name: obj2
Param.Desc: Handle to second object in constraint relationship.

Param.Name: obj1VertA
Param.Desc: Vertex defining the constraint geometry of first object.

Param.Name: obj1VertB
Param.Desc: Vertex defining the constraint geometry of first object.

Param.Name: obj2VertA
Param.Desc: Vertex defining the constraint geometry of second object.

Param.Name: obj2VertB
Param.Desc: Vertex defining the constraint geometry of second object.

Item.Name: SetConstraintValue
Item.Description: Sets the referenced dimensional constraint to a new value.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the referenced dimensional constraint to a new value.

Item.Name: CreateLayout
Item.Description: Creates a new custom dialog layout. After the layout is created, control items for the dialog can be added to the layout.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new custom dialog layout.
Item.Result: Returns an index number identifying the new dialog layout.
Item.Comments: Creates a dialog with a default button, cancel button, and a help box. If you do not want a button created then pass an empty string. You can place your own default button simply by creating a button with ID 1.
Item.Example: { creates a new dialog layout }[[BR]] lEditID := CreateLayout('Edit Layer',TRUE,'OK','Cancel');[[BR]][[BR]] CreateGroupBox(lEditID,4,'',FALSE);[[BR]] CreateStaticText(lEditID,5,'Layer Name:',-1);[[BR]] CreateEditText(lEditID,6,'Layer-1',36);[[BR]][[BR]] CreateGroupBox(lEditID,7,'Visibility',TRUE);[[BR]] CreateRadioButton(lEditID,8,'Visible');[[BR]] CreateRadioButton(lEditID,9,'Grayed');[[BR]] CreateRadioButton(lEditID,10,'Hidden');[[BR]] CreateStaticText( lEditID,11,'',6); [[BR]][[BR]] CreateGroupBox(lEditID,12,'Options',TRUE);[[BR]] CreateCheckBox(lEditID,13,'Use layer colors');[[BR]] CreateCheckBox(lEditID,14,'Create link on model layer');[[BR]]

Param.Name: hasHelp
Param.Desc: Enables help text for the dialog.

Param.Name: defaultButtonName
Param.Desc: Text displayed in the default button of the dialog.

Param.Name: cancelButtonName
Param.Desc: Text displayed in the cancel button of the dialog.

Item.Name: CreateCheckBox
Item.Description: Creates a check box control in a dialog layout.
Item.ShortDesc: Create a checkbox for a dialog layout.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] result :INTEGER;[[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]END;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Example Dialog', FALSE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateCheckBox(dialog1, 4, 'Use layer colors');[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]][[BR]]

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index that will identify the control item.

Param.Name: text
Param.Desc: The display text for the control.

Item.Name: CreateEditText
Item.Description: Creates an editable text field control in a dialog layout.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates an editable text field control in a dialog layout.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] result :INTEGER;[[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]END;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Example Dialog', FALSE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateEditText(dialog1, 4, 'default text', 16);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]][[BR]]

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index that will identify the control item.

Param.Name: defaultText
Param.Desc: The default display text for the control.

Param.Name: widthInStdChar
Param.Desc: The width of the displayed text in standard character count. See GetDlgCtrlWidthStdCh.

Item.Name: CreateGroupBox
Item.Description: Creates a new group box control in a dialog layout.[[BR]][[BR]]The width of a group box is determined by the width of the longest control enclosed by the group box. The height of the group box is determined by the combined height of the enclosed controls.[[BR]][[BR]]While used primarily to contain and highlight related control items, group box controls can also be used to group controls for easier positioning. When used in this fashion, pass a blank string for the display text and set the frame display to FALSE.
Item.ShortDesc: Create a group box for a dialog layout.
Item.Comments: A group box with out frame is used for placing and moving groups of controls.[DWG 1/20/00]
Item.Example: { creates a framed group box entitled "Options" }[[BR]] CreateGroupBox(lEditID,12,'Options',TRUE);[[BR]][[BR]] CreateCheckBox(lEditID,13,'Use layer colors');[[BR]] CreateCheckBox(lEditID,14,'Create link on model layer');[[BR]]

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index that will identify the control item.

Param.Name: text
Param.Desc: The display text for the control.

Param.Name: hasFrame
Param.Desc: Displays a border for the group box.

Item.Name: CreateListBox
Item.Description: Creates a new list box control in a dialog layout.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new list box control in a dialog layout.
Item.Example: { draws a list box 25 characters wide and 7 rows high }[[BR]]CreateListBox(2,10,25,7);[[BR]]

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index that will identify the control item.

Param.Name: widthInStdChar
Param.Desc: The width of the displayed text in standard character count. See GetDlgCtrlWidthStdCh.

Param.Name: heightInLines
Param.Desc: The height of the control in characters.

Item.Name: CreatePullDownMenu
Item.Description: Creates a new pulldown menu control in a dialog layout.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new pulldown menu control in a dialog layout.

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index that will identify the control item.

Param.Name: widthInStdChar
Param.Desc: The width of the displayed text in standard character count. See GetDlgCtrlWidthStdCh.

Item.Name: CreatePushButton
Item.Description: Creates a new push button control in a dialog layout.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new push button control in a dialog layout.

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index that will identify the control item.

Param.Name: text
Param.Desc: The display text for the control.

Item.Name: CreateRadioButton
Item.Description: Creates a new radio button control in a dialog layout.[[BR]][[BR]]Radio button groups can be created by defining two or more radio buttons with consecutive index values. When defined as a button group, VectorScript will handle selection-deselection of controls within the group.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new radio button control in a dialog layout.
Item.Example: { creates a radio button with the specified label }[[BR]] CreateRadioButton(lEditID,8,'Visible');[[BR]][[BR]] CreateRadioButton(lEditID,9,'Grayed');[[BR]] CreateRadioButton(lEditID,10,'Hidden');[[BR]] CreateStaticText( lEditID,11,'',6); [[BR]]

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
