Param.Desc: The index that will identify the control item.

Param.Name: text
Param.Desc: The display text for the control.

Item.Name: CreateStaticText
Item.Description: Creates a new static text field control in a dialog layout.[[BR]][[BR]]To allow the control to size automatically to the text width, pass -1 as the width parameter of the control.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new static text field control in a dialog layout.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] result :INTEGER;[[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]END;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Example Dialog', FALSE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateEditText(dialog1, 4, 'default text', 16);[[BR]] CreateStaticText(dialog1, 5, 'default text', 16);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] SetBelowItem(dialog1, 4, 5, 0, 0);[[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index that will identify the control item.

Param.Name: text
Param.Desc: The display text for the control.

Param.Name: widthInStdChar
Param.Desc: The width of the displayed text in standard character count. See GetDlgCtrlWidthStdCh.

Item.Name: VerifyLayout
Item.Description: Checks a specified dialog layout for correct layout definition.
Item.ShortDesc: Checks a specified dialog layout for correct layout definition.
Item.Result: Returns FALSE if a problem was encountered defining the dialog, otherwise returns TRUE.
Item.Example: {verify the dialog layou is properly constructed}[[BR]] dialogOK := VerifyLayout(lEditID);[[BR]][[BR]] IF (dialogOK & rsAvailable) THEN[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] lmtestResult := RunLayoutDialog(lEditID,DriveSplashDialog);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout to be verified.

Item.Name: SetFirstLayoutItem
Item.Description: Initializes dialog control layout by placing the specified control item in the top left corner of the layout. All other controls in the layout are positioned relative to the control item placed with this function.
Item.ShortDesc: Initializes dialog control layout by placing the specified control item in the top left corner of the layout.

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout being defined.

Param.Name: firstItemID
Param.Desc: The index of the control item to be placed.

Item.Name: SetFirstGroupItem
Item.Description: Places the first item of a layout group into the specified group box control item. The control is inserted in the top left corner of the group box, and all other controls in the group are placed relative to this item.
Item.ShortDesc: Inserts the first item of a layout group into the specified group box control item.
Item.Example: SetFirstLayoutItem(lEditID,4);[[BR]][[BR]]{inserts the first control in a group box}[[BR]]SetFirstGroupItem(lEditID,4,5);[[BR]] [[BR]]SetBelowItem(lEditID,4,6,0,0);[[BR]]SetFirstGroupItem(lEditID,6,7);[[BR]]SetBelowItem(lEditID,6,8,0,0);[[BR]]

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout being defined.

Param.Name: groupID
Param.Desc: The index of the group box control accepting the first item.

Param.Name: firstItemID
Param.Desc: The index of the control item to be placed in the group box.

Item.Name: SetRightItem
Item.Description: Places the specified control item to the right of a previously inserted control item.[[BR]]Additional positioning can be performed by specifying x- and y-offsets (in pixels) from the initial insert position.
Item.ShortDesc: Places the specified control item to the right of a previously inserted control item.
Item.Comments: Use the indent and lineSpacing sparingly.[DWD 1/20/00]

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout being defined.

Param.Name: srcItemID
Param.Desc: The index of the anchor control item.

Param.Name: rightItemID
Param.Desc: The index of the control item being placed.

Item.Name: SetBelowItem
Item.Description: Places the specified control item below a previously inserted control item. Additional positioning can be performed by specifying x- and y-offsets (in pixels) from the initial insert position. Indent is in number of characters. LineSpacing is in pixels.
Item.ShortDesc: Places the specified control item below a previously inserted control item.
Item.Comments: Use the indent and lineSpacing sparingly.[DWD 1/20/00]

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout being defined.

Param.Name: srcItemID
Param.Desc: The index of the anchor control item.

Param.Name: belowtItemID
Param.Desc: The index of the control item being placed.

Item.Name: AlignItemEdge
Item.Description: Aligns the specified control item with other items having the same edge and alignment id values. To align several control items, call this function once for each item to be aligned using a common alignment id value.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:AlignItemEdgeOptions]][[BR]][[BR]]Right alignment of objects will use the object with the minimum pixel value as the alignment baseline. Bottom and left alignment of objects will use the object with the maximum pixel value as the alignment baseline.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Aligns the specified control item with other items having the same edge and alignment indexes.
Item.Comments: Aligns layout items with the same edge and alignID. whichEdge: 1=right, 2=bottom, 3=left; alignMode: resize=0, shift=1[[BR]][[BR]]Right aligned objects are lined up with the object with the minimum pixel value. Bottom and left aligned objects are lined up on the maximum pixel value.[DWD 1/20/00]
Item.Example: {aligns all items with the positioning ID of 99}[[BR]] AlignItemEdge(lEditID,4,1,99,0);[[BR]] AlignItemEdge(lEditID,6,1,99,0);[[BR]]

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout being defined.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index of the control item to be aligned.

Param.Name: whichEdge
Param.Desc: The control edge to be aligned.

Param.Name: alignID
Param.Desc: An arbitrary number used to identify the items to be aligned together.

Item.Name: SetupDialogC
Item.Description: A predefined constant value that is passed to the dialog event handler subroutine when a modern custom dialog is initially displayed onscreen.[[BR]][[BR]]This constant is usually used to determine when to execute dialog initialization and setup calls.
Item.ShortDesc: A predefined constant value that is passed to the dialog event handler subroutine when a modern custom dialog is initially displayed onscreen.[[BR]]

Item.Name: SetdownDialogC
Item.Description: A predefined constant value that is passed to the dialog event handler subroutine when a modern custom dialog is dismissed.[[BR]][[BR]]This constant is usually used to determine when to execute dialog cleanup calls prior to exiting the dialog.
Item.ShortDesc: This constant is passed to the event handler routine to signal dialog setdown.

Item.Name: CreateControl
Item.Description: Creates a new extended dialog control item. Supported extended dialog controls include image, system color palette, and slider controls.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ExtendedControlTypes]]
Item.ShortDesc: This constant is passed to the event handler routine to signal dialog setdown.
Item.Example: {open the resource file containing the graphics for the dialog}[[BR]]rsAvailable:= SetVSResourceFile('Images');[[BR]]{creates a new image control}[[BR]] CreateControl(lEditID,5,1,'SplashImage',1010);[[BR]][[BR]]{Slider Control Example}[[BR]]PROCEDURE dialog1_Main;[[BR]]CONST[[BR]] kSlider = 4;[[BR]] kLabel = 5;[[BR]] kValue = 6;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] gSlider :LONGINT;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE dialog1_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CASE item OF[[BR]] kSlider:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] GetControlData(dialog1, kSlider, gSlider);[[BR]] SetField(kValue, Concat(gSlider));[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] gSlider := 1000;[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Slider Control', False, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateControl (dialog1, kSlider, 3, '', 1000);[[BR]] CreateStaticText (dialog1, kLabel, 'Slider Value:', -1);[[BR]] CreateStaticText (dialog1, kValue, ' ', -1);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, kSlider);[[BR]] SetBelowItem (dialog1, kSlider, kLabel, 0, 0);[[BR]] SetRightItem (dialog1, kLabel, kValue, 0, 0);[[BR]] IF RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, dialog1_Handler) = 1 THEN BEGIN[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(dialog1_Main);[[BR]]

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index that will identify the control item.

Param.Name: name
Param.Desc: The display text of the control item.

Param.Name: data
Param.Desc: Initial data for the control item.

Item.Name: RunLayoutDialog
Item.Description: Displays the specified dialog and initiates the dialog event loop. The dialog event loop is specified in a procedure subroutine that is passed as a parameter to the function.
Item.ShortDesc: Displays the specified dialog and initiates the dialog event loop.
Item.Result: Returns a LONGINT value indicating the button pressed to exit the dialog.
Item.SpecialOverride: CHECKRUNLAYOUTDIALOG( funcRunLayoutDialog, MP_RunLayoutDialog, longMode, longMode, userProcMode);

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog to be displayed.

Param.Name: callback
Param.Desc: The event loop subroutine for the dialog.

Item.Name: SortArray
Item.Description: Sorts a 1-dimension array into ascending order. If the array contains handles to records, the array can be sorted by the specified field number index. If the array is an array of structures, the fieldnumber argument denotes the element in the structure on which to sort.
Item.ShortDesc: Sorts a 1-dimension array into ascending order. If the array contains handles to records, the array can be sorted by the specified field number index.
Item.Comments: [richn 1/21/00][[BR]][[BR]]Sorts first numtosort elements of single-dimensional array arraytosort into ascending order. If arraytosort is an array of records, it sorts on the fieldnumberth field of the record.

Item.Name: GetClVectorFill
Item.Description: Returns the name of the hatch pattern setting of the specified class.[[BR]][[BR]]The function return value will be TRUE if the class uses a hatch pattern, and will be FALSE if the class does not use a hatch pattern.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the name of the hatch pattern setting of the specified class.

Param.Name: hatchName
Param.Desc: Name of active hatch pattern (if it exists).

Item.Name: SetClVectorFill
Item.Description: Sets the class fill style to use the specified hatch pattern. The function return value will be TRUE if the operation was successful.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the class fill style to use the specified hatch pattern.

Item.Name: SetControlData
Item.Description: Sets the data for the specified extended control item. [[BR]][[BR]]In image controls, for example, this call can be used to set the ID of the image resource being displayed.[[BR]][[BR]]This function can only be called from within the dialog event handler subroutine.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the data for the specified extended control item.

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog control item.

Param.Name: data
Param.Desc: New data for the control item.

Item.Name: CreateCustomObjectPath
Item.Description: Creates an instance of the path custom object specified by the name argument. The vertices of the path are translated in such a way that the first vertex will be placed at the origin of the plug-in's coordinate space.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates an instance of the path custom object specified by the name argument.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the new path object.
Item.Comments: Calls DefineCustomObject() first to either find the defining FormatNode or create it. If it is created, the user will be presented with an initialization dialog. Returns handle to Object.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h :HANDLE;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CallTool(-204);[[BR]] h := CreateCustomObjectPath('Cutting Plane', FSActLayer, nil);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: path
Param.Desc: Handle to new object path polygon.

Param.Name: profileGroup
Param.Desc: Handle to new profile group object.

Item.Name: GetCustomObjectPath
Item.Description: Returns a handle to the path polygon of a path custom object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the path polygon of a path custom object.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the path polygon.

Item.Name: GetCustomObjectProfileGroup
Item.Description: Returns a handle to the profile group of a path custom object.[[BR]][[BR]]A path object has two "containers" for storing subordinate objects: the path, and the profile. As an example, if a path object is going to do an extrude along path, it will store the path in the path container, and the shape to be extruded in the profile container. The code within the object will then supply the handles to the path and the profile to the CreateExtrudeAlongPath call.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the profile group of a path custom object.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the profile group.

Item.Name: SetCustomObjectPath
Item.Description: Replaces the path of an existing path plug-in object. The path is used as-is; no translation of vertices is performed.
Item.ShortDesc: Replaces the path of an existing path plug-in object.
Item.Result: Returns TRUE if the operation was successful.

Item.Name: SetCustomObjectProfileGroup
Item.Description: Sets the profile group for a path custom object.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the profile group for a path custom object.
Item.Result: Returns TRUE if the operation was successful.

Item.Name: GetControlData
Item.Description: Returns information about the specified extended control item.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns information about the specified extended control item.

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: Index of dialog layout containing the control item.

Item.Name: GetPrefLongInt
Item.Description: Returns the value of a Vectorworks preference setting. Used with preference settings returning a LONGINT value.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:PrefItemTableNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the value of a Vectorworks preference setting.
Item.Result: Returns the value of the specified preference.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.Comments: Returns the status of the specified preference item. Used for preferences that return a long integer instead of a Boolean (see GetPref)[[BR]][[BR]]The status of the requested preference. If the preference is a checkbox, then [[name]] returns TRUE or false. If it is a radio group or editable text item, then [[name]] returns an integer value representing that setting.

Item.Name: GetPrefReal
Item.Description: Returns the value of a Vectorworks preference setting. Used with preference settings returning a REAL value.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:PrefItemTableNote]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the value of a Vectorworks preference setting.
Item.Result: Returns the value of the specified preference.
Item.Comments: Returns the status of the specified preference item. Used for preferences that return a real instead of a Boolean (see GetPref)

Item.Name: GetPrefString
Item.Description: Returns the value of a Vectorworks preference setting. Used with preference settings returning a STRING value.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:PrefItemTableNote]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the value of a Vectorworks preference setting.
Item.Result: Returns the value of the specified preference.
Item.Comments: Returns the status of the specified preference item. Used for preferences that return a string instead of a Boolean (see GetPref)

Item.Name: SetPrefLongInt
Item.Description: Sets the value of the specified Vectorworks preference setting. Used with preference settings requiring a LONGINT value.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:PrefItemTableNote]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the value of the specified Vectorworks preference setting.
Item.Comments: Sets the value of the specified preference to the value passed. Similar to SetPref() except it works on preferences for long integer values

Item.Name: SetPrefReal
Item.Description: Sets the value of the specified Vectorworks preference setting. Used with preference settings requiring a REAL value.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:PrefItemTableNote]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the value of the specified Vectorworks preference setting.
Item.Comments: Sets the value of the specified preference to the value passed. Similar to SetPref() except it works on preferences for real values

Item.Name: SetPrefString
Item.Description: Sets the value of the specified Vectorworks preference setting. Used with preference settings requiring a STRING value.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:PrefItemTableNote]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the value of the specified Vectorworks preference setting.
Item.Comments: Sets the value of the specified preference to the value passed. Similar to SetPref() except it works on preferences for string values

Item.Name: SetObjectVariableBoolean
Item.Description: Sets the ON-OFF status of a Vectorworks object property.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ObjSelectorNote]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the ON-OFF status of a Vectorworks object property.

Item.Name: SetObjectVariableInt
Item.Description: Sets the value of a Vectorworks object property. Used with properties requiring an INTEGER value.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ObjSelectorNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the value of a Vectorworks object property.

Item.Name: SetObjectVariableLongInt
Item.Description: Sets the value of a Vectorworks object property. Used with properties requiring a LONGINT value.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ObjSelectorNote]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the value of a Vectorworks object property.

Item.Name: SetObjectVariableReal
Item.Description: Sets the value of a Vectorworks object property. Used with properties requiring a REAL value.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ObjSelectorNote]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the value of a Vectorworks object property.

Item.Name: SetObjectVariableString
Item.Description: Sets the value of a Vectorworks object property. Used with properties requiring a STRING value.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ObjSelectorNote]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the value of a Vectorworks object property.

Item.Name: GetObjectVariableBoolean
Item.Description: Returns the ON-OFF status of a Vectorworks object property. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:ObjSelectorNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the ON-OFF status of a Vectorworks object property.
Item.Result: Returns a BOOLEAN value indicating the ON-OFF status of the property.

Item.Name: GetObjectVariableInt
Item.Description: Returns the value of a Vectorworks object property. Used with properties returning an INTEGER value.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ObjSelectorNote]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the value of a Vectorworks object property.
Item.Result: Returns the value of the property as an INTEGER value.

Item.Name: GetObjectVariableLongInt
Item.Description: Returns the value of a Vectorworks object property. Used with properties returning a LONGINT value.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ObjSelectorNote]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the value of a Vectorworks object property.
Item.Result: Returns the value of the property as a LONGINT value.

Item.Name: GetObjectVariableReal
Item.Description: Returns the value of a Vectorworks object property. Used with properties returning a REAL value. Always returns values in mm, regardless of document units.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ObjSelectorNote]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the value of a Vectorworks object property.
Item.Result: Returns the value of the property as a REAL value.

Item.Name: GetObjectVariableString
Item.Description: Returns the value of a Vectorworks object property. Used with properties returning a STRING value.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ObjSelectorNote]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the value of a Vectorworks object property.
Item.Result: Returns the value of the property as a STRING value.

Item.Name: VerifyLibraryRoutine
Item.Description: Verifies that a procedure or function call located in a VectorScript extension is registered and available for use in scripts.[[BR]][[BR]]Call this function prior to using any call located in a VectorScript extension to ensure successful use of the call in a script.[[BR]][[BR]](A VectorScript extension is also known as an SDK Plug-in Library. It is a plug-in that is developed using the Vectorworks SDK and the C++ language. When installed in the Plug-ins folder it provides functions that may be called from VectorScript. The [[name]] function allows the script to determine if the function is available.)
Item.ShortDesc: Verifies that a function call located in a VectorScript extension is registered and available for use in scripts.
Item.Result: Returns TRUE if the call is available, otherwise returns FALSE.

Param.Name: routineName
Param.Desc: Name of function call to be verified.

Item.Name: AddWallBottomPeak
Item.Description: Adds a peak to the bottom of the referenced wall.
Item.ShortDesc: Adds a peak to the bottom of the referenced wall.

Param.Name: offDistance
Param.Desc: Offset distance of peak from wall start.

Item.Name: NumWallPeaks
Item.Description: Returns the number of wall peaks (top and bottom) in the given wall.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of wall peaks (top and bottom) in the given wall.
Item.Result: Returns the number of peaks in the wall.

Item.Name: GetNumHoles
Item.Description: Returns the number of openings in the referenced polyline.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of openings in the referenced polyline.
Item.Result: Returns TRUE if the polyline contains openings, otherwise returns FALSE.

Param.Name: outNumHoles
Param.Desc: The number of openings in the polyline object.

Item.Name: GetHole
Item.Description: Returns a handle to a polyline defining an opening within the referenced polyline.[[BR]][[BR]]The definition polyline can be edited or queried using the standard VectorScript polyline API functions.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to a polyline defining an opening within the referenced polyline.
Item.Result: Returns TRUE if the polyline contains openings, otherwise returns FALSE.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] inPolyline :HANDLE;[[BR]] outNumHoles :INTEGER;[[BR]] inIndex :INTEGER;[[BR]] outHole :HANDLE;[[BR]] vertexNum :INTEGER;[[BR]] pX, pY :REAL;[[BR]] vertexType :INTEGER;[[BR]] arcRadius :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] inPolyline := FSActLayer;[[BR]] IF GetNumHoles(inPolyline, outNumHoles) THEN BEGIN[[BR]] FOR inIndex := 1 TO outNumHoles DO BEGIN[[BR]] if GetHole(inPolyline, inIndex, outHole) THEN BEGIN[[BR]] FOR vertexNum := 1 TO GetVertNum(outHole) DO BEGIN[[BR]] GetPolylineVertex(outHole, vertexNum, pX, pY, vertexType, arcRadius);[[BR]] WriteLn('pX: ', pX, ' pY: ', pY);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: inIndex
Param.Desc: Index number of opening definition polyline.

Item.Name: GetRoofElementType
Item.Description: Returns information on the specified roof element. The dormer type value is one of the following: 1 for Trapezium Dormer, 2 for Saddle Dormer, 3 for Shed Dormer, 4 for Slope Dormer, 5 for Bat Dormer.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns information on the specified roof element.
Item.Comments: Get the type of roof object from id.[[BR]][[BR]]dormerID: Identifies the dormer for which to retrieve the information.[[BR]]edgeIndex: Index to which roof face this skylight or dormer is placed. Value is one based.[[BR]][[BR]]isDormer: true if this object is a dormer, false if skylight[[BR]]dormerType: if it is a dormer then:[[BR]][[BR]]1 for Trapezium Dormer[[BR]]2 for Saddle Dormer[[BR]]3 for Shed Dormer[[BR]]4 for Slope Dormer[[BR]]5 for Bat Dormer

Param.Name: edgeIndex
Param.Desc: Index of roof edge associated with roof element (1-based index).

Param.Name: isDormer
Param.Desc: True if this element is a dormer, false if it is a skylight.

Item.Name: GetRoofFaceCoords
Item.Description: Returns the coordinates of the defining geometry of a roof face.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the coordinates of the defining geometry of a roof face.
Item.Comments: Returns information about old-style roof objects (single roof faces).[[BR]][[BR]]Returns roof definition axis, upslope definition point.[[BR]][[BR]]See Also GetRoofFaceAttr() for additional roof face data
Item.Example: PROCEDURE GetRoofFaceCoordsExample;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE MarkCoords(h :HANDLE);[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] beg_pt, end_pt, upslope_pt :VECTOR;[[BR]] Z :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] IF GetObjectVariableInt(h, 172) = 1 THEN BEGIN[[BR]] GetRoofFaceCoords(h, beg_pt.x, beg_pt.y, end_pt.x, end_pt.y, Z, upslope_pt.x, upslope_pt.y);[[BR]] beg_pt := beg_pt * (25.4 / GetPrefReal(152));[[BR]] end_pt := end_pt * (25.4 / GetPrefReal(152));[[BR]] upslope_pt := upslope_pt * (25.4 / GetPrefReal(152));[[BR]] Locus(beg_pt.x, beg_pt.y);[[BR]] Locus(end_pt.x, end_pt.y);[[BR]] Locus(upslope_pt.x, upslope_pt.y);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] ForEachObject(MarkCoords, (T=71));[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(GetRoofFaceCoordsExample);

Param.Name: axis1
Param.Desc: X-Y coordinates of first axis point.

Param.Name: axis2
Param.Desc: X-Y coordinates of second axis point.

Param.Name: upslope
Param.Desc: X-Y coordinates of roof upslope point.

Item.Name: ClearWallPeaks
Item.Description: Removes all wall peaks from the referenced wall.
Item.ShortDesc: Removes all wall peaks from the referenced wall.
Item.Comments: remove all peaks in this wall

Item.Name: GetWallPeak
Item.Description: Returns the coordinates of a wall peak in the referenced wall.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the coordinates of a wall peak in the referenced wall.
Item.Comments: Get xyz values of peak in wall

Item.Name: GetNumWallPeaks
Item.Description: Returns the number of peaks in the referenced wall.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of peaks in the referenced wall.
Item.Result: Returns the number of wall peaks.
Item.Comments: return number of peaks in wall

Item.Name: CreateNurbsSurface
Item.Description: Creates a new NURBS surface in the document. The surface has two directions, denoted u and v. The surface acts like a set of NURBS curves in each direction, with the number of control points and the degree specified in the parameter list. (Note that the degree parameters have to be lower than the numPts parameters.)[[BR]][[BR]]After creating the surface, you must set the location of each of the control points with NurbsSetPt3D, and when you are done call ResetBBox to make sure the bounding box is correct.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new NURBS surface in the document.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the newly created NURBS surface object if successful, otherwise returns NIL.
Item.Comments: returns a handle to the newly created NURBS surface if it succeeds, return NULL if it fails[[BR]][[BR]]Creates a NURBS surface with the number of control points and degrees as specified. Call NurbsSetPt3D() to set the control net
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h :HANDLE;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] h := CreateNurbsSurface(3, 3, 1, 1);[[BR]] NurbsSetPt3D(h, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);[[BR]] NurbsSetPt3D(h, 0, 1, 1, 0, 0);[[BR]] NurbsSetPt3D(h, 0, 2, 2, 0, 0);[[BR]] NurbsSetPt3D(h, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0);[[BR]] NurbsSetPt3D(h, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1);[[BR]] NurbsSetPt3D(h, 1, 2, 2, 1, 0);[[BR]] NurbsSetPt3D(h, 2, 0, 0, 2, 0);[[BR]] NurbsSetPt3D(h, 2, 1, 1, 2, 0);[[BR]] NurbsSetPt3D(h, 2, 2, 2, 2, 0);[[BR]] ResetBBox(h);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: numUPts
Param.Desc: The number of definition points along the u-axis of the surface.

Param.Name: numVPts
Param.Desc: The number of definition points along the v-axis of the surface.

Param.Name: uDegree
Param.Desc: Degree of the NURBS curve in the u direction.

Param.Name: vDegree
Param.Desc: Degree of the NURBS curve in the v direction.

Item.Name: CreateNurbsCurve
Item.Description: Creates a new NURBS curve in the document.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new NURBS curve in the document.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the new NURBS curve if successful, otherwise returns NIL.
Item.Comments: CreateNurbsCurve returns a handle to the newly created NURBS curve, if successful[[BR]][[BR]]Creates a NURBS curve with a single fit or control point , if it succeeds, return nil if it fails
Item.Example: PROCEDURE NewNurbsCurve;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] nC :HANDLE;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] nC := CreateNurbsCurve(0, 0, 0, true, 2);[[BR]] AddVertex3D(nC, 1, 1, 0);[[BR]] AddVertex3D(nC, 2, 0, 0);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(NewNurbsCurve);[[BR]]

Param.Name: first
Param.Desc: Coordinates of the first point in the curve definiton.

Param.Name: byCtrlPts
Param.Desc: Create curve by control points (not interpolation).

Param.Name: degree
Param.Desc: The degree of the NURBS curve.

Item.Name: NurbsCurveGetNumPieces
Item.Description: Returns the number of pieces that compose the referenced NURBS curve.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of pieces that compose the referenced NURBS curve.
Item.Result: An INTEGER count of the pieces composing the curve.

Item.Name: NurbsGetNumPts
Item.Description: Returns the number of points for segment of the referenced NURBS curve, or the number of points of the referenced NURBS surface in the u- or v-direction.[[BR]][[BR]]For NURBS curves, the index indicates which segment of the curve is to be queried. The index is zero based (0 to number of segments - 1).[[BR]][[BR]]For NURBS surfaces, specify an index of 1 to indicate u-direction, and an index of 0 to indicate v-direction when querying the surface object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of points for segment of the referenced NURBS curve, or the number of points of the referenced NURBS surface in the u- or v-direction.
Item.Result: The number of control points as a LONGINT value.
Item.Comments: this function will work for both nurbs curves and nurbs surfaces.

Param.Name: objectHd
Param.Desc: Handle to NURBS curve or surface.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: Index of curve segment (NURBS curve) or direction index (NURBS surface).

Item.Name: NurbsGetPt3D
Item.Description: Returns the coordinates of a point in the referenced NURBS curve or surface.[[BR]][[BR]]The index is zero based (0 to number of points - 1).
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the coordinates of a point in the referenced NURBS curve or surface.
Item.Comments: this function will work for both nurbs curves and nurbs surfaces. [[BR]][[BR]]Gets the index2 vertex of the indexe1 piece of the given NURBS curve or the index1 U and index2 V control point of the surfaces.

Param.Name: objectHd
Param.Desc: Handle to NURBS curve or surface.

Param.Name: index1
Param.Desc: Index of point in NURBS curve, or u-coordinate of point location in NURBS surface.

Param.Name: index2
Param.Desc: V-coordinate of point location in NURBS surface.

Item.Name: NurbsSetPt3D
Item.Description: Sets the coordinates of a point in the referenced NURBS curve or surface.[[BR]][[BR]]The index is zero based (0 to number of points - 1).[[BR]][[BR]]For a nurbs curve, index1 is the piece number of the nurbs curve. Index2 is the vertex number within that piece. NurbsCurveGetNumPieces will give you the number of pieces inside of the nurbs curve (1-based). NurbsGetNumPts will give you the number of points inside of a piece.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the coordinates of a point in the referenced NURBS curve or surface.
Item.Comments: this function will work for both nurbs curves and nurbs surfaces.[[BR]][[BR]]set the indexed vertex of the indexed point of the given nurbs curve or the indexed (index2)control point of the surfaces in either the U (index 1= 1)or V(index1 =0) direction

Param.Name: objectHd
Param.Desc: Handle to NURBS curve or surface.

Param.Name: index1
Param.Desc: Index of point in NURBS curve, or u-coordinate of point location in NURBS surface.

Param.Name: index2
Param.Desc: V-coordinate of point location in NURBS surface.

Item.Name: NurbsDelVertex
Item.Description: Deletes a point in the referenced NURBS curve or surface.[[BR]][[BR]]The index is zero based (0 to number of points - 1).
Item.ShortDesc: Deletes a point in the referenced NURBS curve or surface.
Item.Comments: this function will work for both nurbs curves and nurbs surfaces.DelObject should be used to completely remove a NURBS curve or surface from the drawing. It deletes the index2 point of the index1 piece for nurbs curve or It deletes an entire index2 row (index1 = 1) or column (index1 = 0)of points

Param.Name: objectHd
Param.Desc: Handle to NURBS curve or surface.

Param.Name: index1
Param.Desc: Index of point in NURBS curve, or U-index of a point in NURBS surface.

Param.Name: index2
Param.Desc: V-index of point in NURBS surface.

Item.Name: NurbsGetWeight
Item.Description: Returns the weight of a point in a NURBS curve or surface.[[BR]][[BR]]For NURBS curves, [[p:2]] corresponds to the segment of the curve to be queried, and [[p:3]] corresponds to the index of the point in the segment.[[BR]][[BR]]For NURBS surfaces, [[p:2]] corresponds to the u-index and [[p:3]] corresponds to the v-index of the surface.[[BR]][[BR]]The index is zero based (0 to number of points - 1).
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the weight of a point in a NURBS curve or surface.
Item.Comments: this function will work for both nurbs curves and nurbs surfaces.

Param.Name: objectHd
Param.Desc: Handle to NURBS curve or surface.

Param.Name: index1
Param.Desc: Segment of curve to be queried (NURBS curve), or u-index (NURBS surface).

Param.Name: index2
Param.Desc: Index of point (NURBS curve) or v-index (NURBS surface).

Item.Name: NurbsSetWeight
Item.Description: Sets the weight of a point in a NURBS curve or surface.[[BR]][[BR]]For NURBS curves, [[p:2]] corresponds to the segment of the curve to be queried, and [[p:3]] corresponds to the index of the point in the segment.[[BR]][[BR]]For NURBS surfaces, [[p:2]] corresponds to the u-index and [[p:3]] corresponds to the v-index of the surface.[[BR]][[BR]]The index is zero based (0 to number of points - 1).
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the weight of a point in a NURBS curve or surface.
Item.Comments: this function will work for both nurbs curves and nurbs surfaces

Param.Name: objectHd
Param.Desc: Handle to NURBS curve or surface.

Param.Name: index1
Param.Desc: Segment of curve to be queried (NURBS curve), or u-index (NURBS surface).

Param.Name: index2
Param.Desc: Index of point (NURBS curve) or v-index (NURBS surface).

Item.Name: NurbsCurveType
Item.Description: Returns the curve type of a segment of the referenced NURBS curve.[[BR]][[BR]]The index is zero based (0 to number of segments - 1).
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the curve type of a segment of the referenced NURBS curve.
Item.Result: Returns a BOOLEAN indicating whether the curve is created by fit point (TRUE) or by control point (FALSE).

Item.Name: NurbsNumKnots
Item.Description: Returns the number of knots for the referenced NURBS curve or surface. If the object is a curve, then index indicates the segment of the curve to consider. If the object is a surface, then the index indicates the U direction (for index = 1) or the V direction (for index = 0).
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of knots for the referenced NURBS curve or surface.
Item.Comments: /this function will work for both nurbs curves and nurbs surfaces.[[BR]]returns the number of knots for the indexed piece of the given nurbs curve. or number of U knot vector (index=1) or V knot vector (index=0) of the given nurbs surface

Param.Name: objectHd
Param.Desc: Handle to NURBS curve or surface.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: Index of curve, or U/V choice for surface.

Item.Name: NurbsDegree
Item.Description: Returns the degree of a segment in a NURBS curve or surface.[[BR]][[BR]]For NURBS curves, the index indicates which segment of the curve is to be queried. The index is zero based (0 to number of segments - 1).[[BR]][[BR]]For NURBS surfaces, specify an index of 1 to indicate u-direction, and an index of 0 to indicate v-direction when querying the surface object.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the degree of a segment in a NURBS curve or surface.
Item.Result: The degree of the segment as an INTEGER value.

Param.Name: objectHd
Param.Desc: Handle to NURBS curve or surface.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: Index of curve segment (NURBS curve) or direction index (NURBS surface).

Item.Name: NurbsKnot
Item.Description: Returns the specified knot in a NURBS curve or surface.[[BR]][[BR]]For NURBS curves, [[p:2]] corresponds to the segment of the curve to be queried, and [[p:3]] corresponds to the knot in the segment.[[BR]][[BR]]For NURBS surfaces, [[p:2]] corresponds to the u- or v-direction of the surface (u=1, v=0), and [[p:3]] corresponds to the knot index. [[BR]][[BR]]The index is zero based (0 to number of knots - 1).
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the specified knot in a NURBS curve or surface.
Item.Comments: this function will work for both nurbs curves and nurbs surfaces

Param.Name: objectHd
Param.Desc: Handle to NURBS curve or surface.

Param.Name: index1
Param.Desc: Segment of curve to be queried (NURBS curve), or direction (NURBS surface).

Param.Name: index2
Param.Desc: Index of segment or direction knot.

Item.Name: NurbsSetKnot
Item.Description: Sets the specified knot in a NURBS curve or surface.[[BR]][[BR]]For NURBS curves, [[p:2]] corresponds to a segment of the curve, and [[p:3]] corresponds to the knot in the segment.[[BR]][[BR]]For NURBS surfaces, [[p:2]] corresponds to the u- or v-direction of the surface and [[p:3]] corresponds to the knot.[[BR]][[BR]]The index is zero based (0 to number of knots - 1).
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the specified knot in a NURBS curve or surface.
Item.Comments: this function will work for both nurbs curves and nurbs surfaces

Param.Name: objectHd
Param.Desc: Handle to NURBS curve or surface.

Param.Name: index1
Param.Desc: Segment of curve to be queried (NURBS curve), or direction (NURBS surface).

Param.Name: index2
Param.Desc: Index of segment or direction knot.

Item.Name: CreateExtrudeAlongPath
Item.Description: Creates a new path extrude object in the document. The profile defines the shape of the cross-section, and is extruded along the path to generate the resulting object.[[BR]][[BR]]The path argument must be a handle to a NURBS Curve object (type 111). The profile argument must be a handle to an object of one of the following types: NURBS Curve, Polygon, Polyline, Arc, Rectangle, Rounded Rectangle, Line, Oval.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new path extrude object in the document.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the new path extrude if successful, otherwise returns NIL.
Item.Comments: The following objects are supported as profile objects:[[BR]][[BR]]Line 2[[BR]]Box 3[[BR]]Oval 4[[BR]]Polygon 5[[BR]]Arc 6[[BR]]Freehand 8[[BR]]R Rect 13[[BR]]Polyline 21[[BR]]3D Poly 25[[BR]]NURBS Curve 111[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]

Item.Name: CreateTaperedExtrude
Item.Description: Creates a new tapered extrude object in the document.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new tapered extrude object in the document.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the new tapered extrude if successful, otherwise returns NIL.

Param.Name: profileH
Param.Desc: Handle to object defining profile geometry.

Item.Name: GetRoofFaceAttrib
Item.Description: Returns information on the referenced roof face object.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:RoofMiterStyleTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns information on the referenced roof face object.
Item.Comments: Returns information about old-style roof objects (single roof faces).[[BR]][[BR]]Returns slope, edge miter style, miter dimensions, and thickness of roof object.[[BR]][[BR]]See Also GetRoofFaceCoord() for additional roof face data
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE ShowRoofFaceAttrib(roofFace :HANDLE);[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] roofRise, roofRun :REAL; [[BR]] miterType, holeStyle :INTEGER; [[BR]] vertPart, thickness :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] IF GetObjectVariableInt(roofFace, 172) = 1 THEN BEGIN[[BR]] GetRoofFaceAttrib(roofFace, roofRise, roofRun, miterType, holeStyle, vertPart, thickness);[[BR]] Message('roofRise: ', roofRise,[[BR]] ', roofRun: ', roofRun,[[BR]] ', miterType: ', miterType,[[BR]] ', holeStyle: ', holeStyle,[[BR]] ', vertPart: ', vertPart,[[BR]] ', thickness: ', thickness);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] ForEachObject(ShowRoofFaceAttrib, ((SEL=TRUE)&(T=71)));[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: GetArrayDimensions
Item.Description: Returns the dimensions of the specified array.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the dimensions of the specified array.
Item.Comments: Works for both regular and dynamic arrays. Returns 0 for column dimensions of the array is 1-dimensional.

Item.Name: HasConstraint
Item.Description: Returns whether the referenced object has a parametric constraint .
Item.ShortDesc: Returns whether the referenced object has a parametric constraint .

Item.Name: SetViewVector
Item.Description: Sets the view direction of the active document.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the view direction of the active document.

Item.Name: CreateEditInteger
Item.Description: Creates an editable text field control for INTEGER and LONGINT values.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] is intended specifically for entry of numeric values; the control returns values in a numeric format, and supports calculations within the control field.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates an editable text field for INTEGER and LONGINT values.
Item.Comments: Edits long ints, does math, get and set values with get and set integer calls[DWD 11/20/00]
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] result :INTEGER;[[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]END;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Example Dialog', FALSE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateEditInteger(dialog1, 4, 123, 16);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index that will identify the control item.

Param.Name: widthInStdChar
Param.Desc: The width of the displayed text in standard character count. See GetDlgCtrlWidthStdCh.

Item.Name: CreateEditReal
Item.Description: Creates an editable text field control for REAL values.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] is intended specifically for entry of numeric values; the control returns values in a numeric format, and supports calculations within the control field.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:EditRealFieldTypes]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates an editable text field control for REAL values.
Item.Comments: Edits reals, does math, get and set values with get and set real calls. There are 5 edit real types: 1 - Real, regular old real type; 2 - Angle, vs input and output is always in degrees but the user can use what ever they want; 3 - Dimension, usually an offset this a distance that is not tied to the origin; 4 - 4- CoordinateX, this is an exact x location on the drawing; 5-CoordinateY, this is an exact y location on the drawing. There are separate x and y controls to account for changes the user may make to the origin. I think Z coordinates should use the offset mode, but I need to check with mark on this one. Darick
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] result :INTEGER;[[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]END;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Example Dialog', FALSE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateEditReal(dialog1, 4, 3, 123, 16);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index that will identify the control item.

Param.Name: editRealType
Param.Desc: The type of REAL value being accepted.

Param.Name: widthInStdChar
Param.Desc: The width of the displayed text in standard character count. See GetDlgCtrlWidthStdCh.

Item.Name: GetEditInteger
Item.Description: Returns the numeric value from the specified INTEGER numeric edit field control.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the numeric value from the specified numeric edit field.
Item.Result: A BOOLEAN value indicating the success of the operation.
Item.Comments: does math, returns false for any error in conversion

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index of the control item.

Param.Name: value
Param.Desc: The value contained in the field.

Item.Name: GetEditReal
Item.Description: Returns the numeric value from the specified REAL numeric edit field control.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the numeric value from the specified numeric edit field control.
Item.Result: A BOOLEAN value indicating the success of the operation.
Item.Comments: does math, handles units, returns false for any error in conversion. For an explanation of editRealType, see the CreateEditReal call
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(var item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE InvalidValue(controlID :INTEGER);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] item := -1;[[BR]] SelField(controlID);[[BR]] SysBeep;[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CASE item OF[[BR]] SetupDialogC: SetEditReal(dialogID, 11, 3, elevation);[[BR]] 1: IF NOT(GetEditReal(dialogID, 11, 3, elevation)) [[BR]] THEN InvalidValue(11);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index of the control item.

Param.Name: editRealType
Param.Desc: The type of REAL value being returned.

Param.Name: value
Param.Desc: The value contained in the field.

Item.Name: SetEditInteger
Item.Description: Sets the numeric value of the specified INTEGER numeric edit field control.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the numeric value of the specified INTEGER numeric edit field control.

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index of the control item.

Param.Name: value
Param.Desc: The new value for the field.

Item.Name: SetEditReal
Item.Description: Sets the numeric value of the specified REAL numeric edit field control.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:EditRealFieldTypes]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the numeric value of the specified REAL numeric edit field control.

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index of the control item.

Param.Name: editRealType
Param.Desc: The type of REAL value displayed in the field.

Param.Name: value
Param.Desc: The new value for the field.

Item.Name: SetVSResourceFile
Item.Description: Sets the active resource file for a script. The resource file is opened for the duration of script execution.[[BR]][[BR]]The name of the resource file should be specified without the file extension.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active resource file for a script.
Item.Result: A BOOLEAN value indicating the success of the file open operation.
Item.Comments: Specify the file name without an extension. However, the file must exist in the plug-ins folder WITH an extension. Use .rsr on Windows and .rsrc on the Mac.

Param.Name: fileName
Param.Desc: The name of the resource file to be opened.

Item.Name: GetResourceString
Item.Description: Returns the specified resource string from a resource file.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the specified resource string from a resource file.

Param.Name: theString
Param.Desc: The string contained within the resource.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: The index of the string resource.

Item.Name: FormatTextDialog
Item.Description: Displays the text formatting dialog and returns the selected text formatting options.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextStyleTable]][[BR]][[BR]][[note:FormatTextMask]]
Item.ShortDesc: Displays text formatting dialog and returns the selected options
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR [[BR]] font :STRING; [[BR]] style :INTEGER;[[BR]] size :REAL;[[BR]] spacing :INTEGER; [[BR]] leading :REAL;[[BR]] hAlign :INTEGER;[[BR]] vAlign :INTEGER;[[BR]] disable :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] {Set some dialog defaults.}[[BR]] font := 'Arial';[[BR]] style := 1;[[BR]] size := 12;[[BR]] spacing := 2;[[BR]][[BR]] {Bit values for disableMask: [[BR]] 1: font[[BR]] 2: size[[BR]] 4: spacing[[BR]] 8: style[[BR]] 16: hAlign[[BR]] 32: vAlign}[[BR]] disable := 32;[[BR]][[BR]] {Now get the user's selections.}[[BR]] FormatTextDialog(font, style, size, spacing, leading, hAlign, vAlign, disable);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: fontName
Param.Desc: The name of the selected font.

Param.Name: style
Param.Desc: The selected style options. 0 for plain text. Bit 1 is on for bold, bit 2 for italic, bit 3 for underline, bit 4 for outline and bit 5 for shadow.

Param.Name: spacing
Param.Desc: The selected spacing option. 0 for custom leading, 2 for single spacing, 3 for 1 1/2 spacing and 4 for double spacing.

Param.Name: leading
Param.Desc: The selected leading value (in points) for custom spacing or -1 for a standard spacing.

Param.Name: hAlignment
Param.Desc: The selected horizontal alignment options. 0 for general justify (used only on worksheets), 1 for left, 2 for center and 3 for right.

Param.Name: vAlignment
Param.Desc: The selected vertical alignment options. 1 for top, 2 for top baseline, 3 for center, 4 for bottom baseline and 5 for bottom.

Param.Name: disableMask
Param.Desc: Disables controls on the dialog. Bit 1 disables font name, bit 2 size, bit 3 spacing, bit 4 style, bit 5 h align, bit 6 v align.

Item.Name: CreateWS
Item.Description: Creates a new worksheet in a Vectorworks document.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new worksheet in a Vectorworks document.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the new worksheet.
Item.Comments: Creates a new worksheet object with the specified name and number of rows and columns.[[BR]]If the name is in use, a legal available name based on the specified name will be used instead.[[BR]]The number of rows must be >= 1 and <= 4094.[[BR]]The number of columns must be >= 1 and <= 256.[[BR]]NOTE: To create an on-drawing worksheet object, pass a worksheet handle to CreateWSImage.

Param.Name: rows
Param.Desc: The number of rows in the worksheet.

Param.Name: columns
Param.Desc: The number of columns in the worksheet.

Item.Name: CreateWSImage
Item.Description: Creates an in-document image of the specified worksheet. The specified point location is the top left corner of the image object.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates an in-document image of the specified worksheet.

Param.Name: location
Param.Desc: X-Y coordinate location of image object.

Item.Name: RecalculateWS
Item.Description: Recalculates all formulas for the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Recalculates all formulas for the referenced worksheet.

Item.Name: GetWSImage
Item.Description: Returns a handle to the on-drawing object (image) of the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the on-drawing object (image) of the referenced worksheet.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE of the worksheet image object.

Item.Description: Sets the display status of the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the display status of the referenced worksheet.

Item.ShortDesc: Returns display status of referenced worksheet.
Item.Result: Returns a BOOLEAN indicating the current visibility of the worksheet.

Item.ShortDesc: Returns the on-screen location of the referenced worksheets' window.

Param.Name: left
Param.Desc: Y-coordinate of top left corner of worksheet window.

Param.Name: bottom
Param.Desc: X-coordinate of bottom right corner of worksheet window.

Param.Name: right
Param.Desc: Y-coordinate of bottom right corner of worksheet window.

Item.Description: Sets the on-screen location and dimensions of the referenced worksheets' window.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the on-screen location and dimensions of the referenced worksheets' window.

Param.Name: top

Param.Name: left
Param.Desc: Y-coordinate of top left corner of worksheet window.

Param.Name: bottom
Param.Desc: X-coordinate of bottom right corner of worksheet window.

Param.Name: right
Param.Desc: Y-coordinate of bottom right corner of worksheet window.

Item.Description: Returns the number of rows and columns in the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of rows and columns in the referenced worksheet.

Item.Name: GetTopVisibleWS
Item.Description: Returns a handle to topmost visible worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to topmost visible worksheet.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the worksheet whose window is at the top of the window stacking order.

Item.Name: SetTopVisibleWS
Item.Description: Brings the referenced worksheet to the front of any open worksheet windows.
Item.ShortDesc: Brings the referenced worksheet to the front of any open worksheet windows.

Item.Name: IsWSCellNumber
Item.Description: Determines if a cell in the referenced worksheet contains a numeric value. The cell is referenced by its row-column position in the worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Determines if a cell in the referenced worksheet contains a numeric value.
Item.Result: A BOOLEAN value indicating whether the value is numeric.

Param.Name: row
Param.Desc: Row of cell to be queried.

Param.Name: column
Param.Desc: Column of cell to be queried

Item.Name: IsWSCellString
Item.Description: Determines if a cell in the referenced worksheet contains a string value. The cell is referenced by its row-column position in the worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Determines if a cell in the referenced worksheet contains a string value.
Item.Result: A BOOLEAN value indicating whether the value is a string.

Param.Name: row
Param.Desc: Row of cell to be queried.

Param.Name: column
Param.Desc: Column of cell to be queried.

Item.Name: GetWSCellString
Item.Description: Returns the displayed string value of a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the displayed string value of a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.Comments: Gets the specified worksheet cell's displayed string.[[BR]]If the cell contains a string, the displayed string IS that string.[[BR]]If the cell contains a number, the displayed string is that number PLUS any formatting applied to that number.[[BR]]Use IsWSCellString and/or MP_IsWSCellNumber to determine what type of value the cell actually contains. [[BR]]Use GetWSCellValue to retrieve actual numerical value without formatting from a cell that contains a number.

Param.Name: row
Param.Desc: Row of cell to be queried.

Param.Name: column
Param.Desc: Column of cell to be queried.

Param.Name: cellString
Param.Desc: The string value contained in the worksheet cell.

Item.Name: GetWSCellValue
Item.Description: Returns the displayed numeric value of a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the displayed numeric value of a cell in the referenced worksheet.

Param.Name: row
Param.Desc: Row of cell to be queried.

Param.Name: column
Param.Desc: Column of cell to be queried.

Param.Name: cellValue
Param.Desc: Numeric value contained in worksheet cell.

Item.Name: GetWSCellFormula
Item.Description: Returns the formula from a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the formula from a cell in the referenced worksheet.

Param.Name: row
Param.Desc: Row of cell to be queried.

Param.Name: column
Param.Desc: Column of cell to be queried.

Item.Name: SetWSCellFormula
Item.Description: Inserts a formula into a cell of the referenced worksheet.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] allows a formula to be inserted into a rectangular range of cells. To insert a formula into a single cell, specify identical values for the top/bottom and left/right range boundaries.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] triggers a worksheet recalculation if the AutoRecalc flag is set.[[BR]]It is best to turn off that flag before using [[name]] repeatedly or in a loop and restore the flag after all operations are done (see GetWSAutoRecalcState and SetWSAutoRecalcState). [[BR]]At the end, the worksheet should be recalculated by calling RecalculateWS.
Item.ShortDesc: Inserts a formula into a cell of the referenced worksheet.
Item.Comments: Sets specified formula string in specified worksheet cell(s).[[BR]]If the 0 column is specified, a database row is created and the formula set as the database row criteria.
Item.Example: { inserts a formula into a single cell }[[BR]]SetWSCellFormula(h,4,2,4,2,'=3*2');[[BR]][[BR]]{ inserts a formula into a range of cells }[[BR]]SetWSCellFormula(h,1,1,2,10,'<empty>');[[BR]][[BR]]{ creates a database sub-row for the record 'Part Info' }[[BR]]SetWSCellFormula(h,2,0,2,0,'=DATABASE(R IN [''PART INFO''])');[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////[[BR]][[BR]]{Save the current AutoRecalc state}[[BR]]state := GetWSAutoRecalcState(h);[[BR]][[BR]]{Turn off worksheet Auto Recalculation}[[BR]]SetWSAutoRecalcState(h,false);[[BR]][[BR]]FOR i := 1 TO numCols DO[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]SetWSCellFormula (h, 1, i, 1, i, Num2Str (0, i));[[BR]]SetWSCellFormula (h, 2, i, 2, i , Num2Str (0, i));[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]{Restore AutoRecalc state}[[BR]]SetWSAutoRecalcState(h, state);[[BR]][[BR]]{Now recalculate the worksheet}[[BR]]RecalculateWS(h);[[BR]]

Param.Name: topRow
Param.Desc: Top row of cell insertion range.

Param.Name: leftColumn
Param.Desc: Leftmost column of cell insertion range.

Param.Name: bottomRow
Param.Desc: Bottom row of cell insertion range.

Param.Name: rightColumn
Param.Desc: Rightmost column of cell insertion range.

Param.Name: formula
Param.Desc: Formula to be inserted into cell range.

Item.Name: GetWSCellAlignment
Item.Description: Returns the horizontal alignment setting of a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the horizontal alignment setting of a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.Comments: Alignment constants:[[BR]]General = 0[[BR]]Left = 1[[BR]]Center = 2[[BR]]Right = 3

Param.Name: row
Param.Desc: Row of cell to be queried.

Param.Name: column
Param.Desc: Column of cell to be queried.

Item.Name: SetWSCellAlignment
Item.Description: Sets the horizontal alignment of a cell in the referenced worksheet.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] allows a formula to be inserted into a rectangular range of cells. To set the alignment of a single cell, specify identical values for the top/bottom and left/right range boundaries.[[BR]][[BR]]Alignment index values for worksheet cells correspond to the horizontal alignment index values for text used by VectorScript.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the horizontal alignment of a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.Comments: Horizontal alignment constants:[[BR]]General = 0[[BR]]Left = 1[[BR]]Center = 2[[BR]]Right = 3

Item.Name: GetWSCellNumberFormat
Item.Description: Returns the numeric formatting of a cell in the referenced worksheet.[[BR]][[BR]]Specific index values for numeric formats and accuracy are listed in the Appendix.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the numeric formatting of a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.Comments: Number Format constants:[[BR]]style value meaning of accuracy[[BR]]General = 0[[BR]]FixDecimal = 1 number of decimal places[[BR]]DecwCommas = 2 number of decimal places[[BR]]Scientific = 3 number of decimal places[[BR]]Fractional = 4 largest displayed denominator[[BR]]Dimension = 5 [[BR]]Angle = 6 corresponds to angular accuracy in units dialog[[BR]]Date = 7 [[BR]]Conditonal = 8

Param.Name: row
Param.Desc: Row of cell to be queried.

Param.Name: column
Param.Desc: Column of cell to be queried.

Item.Name: SetWSCellNumberFormat
Item.Description: Sets the numeric formatting of a cell in the referenced worksheet.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] allows numeric formatting to be set for a rectangular range of cells. To set the formatting of a single cell, specify identical values for the top/bottom and left/right range boundaries.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:WorksheetNumberFormatTable]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the numeric formatting of a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.Comments: Number Format constants:[[BR]]style value meaning of accuracy[[BR]]General = 0[[BR]]FixDecimal = 1 number of decimal places[[BR]]DecwCommas = 2 number of decimal places[[BR]]Scientific = 3 number of decimal places[[BR]]Fractional = 4 largest displayed denominator[[BR]]Dimension = 5 [[BR]]Angle = 6 corresponds to angular accuracy in units dialog[[BR]]Date = 7 [[BR]]Conditonal = 8

Item.ShortDesc: Sets the specified width for the specified worksheet columns.

To set the formatting of a single cell, specify identical values for the top/bottom and left/right range boundaries.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:TextStyleTable]][[BR]]

Item.Name: SetWSCurrentCell
Item.Description: Sets the active cell of the referenced worksheet.

Item.Comments: Sets the specified cell to be the worksheet's current cell. [[BR]]If specified cell is not contained within currently specified worksheet range, current selection is changed to single cell selection.

Item.Name: IsValidWSCell
Item.Description: Returns TRUE if a specified cell is within the valid range of the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns TRUE if a specified cell is within the valid range of the referenced worksheet.
Item.Result: A BOOLEAN value indicating whether the cell is in the valid range of the worksheet.
Item.Comments: Determines if specified cell is valid for the specified worksheet.[[BR]]NOTE: A determination that a cell is valid only means that the specified cell falls within a range of 0 to the current number of worksheet rows and 0 to the current number of worksheet columns. A valid cell does not imply that every worksheet SDK function will accept that cell. The user should always note any specific cell and cell range restrictions of a call they may use.

Item.Name: IsValidWSRange
Item.Description: Returns whether the specified range is within the valid range of the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns whether the specified range is within the valid range of the referenced worksheet.
Item.Result: A BOOLEAN value indicating whether the range is valid.
Item.Comments: Determines if specified range is valid for the specified worksheet.[[BR]]NOTE: A determination that a range is valid only means that the specified range falls within a range of 0 to the current number of worksheet rows and 0 to the current number of worksheet columns. A valid range does not imply that every worksheet SDK function will accept that range. The user should always note any specific cell and cell range restrictions of a call they may use.

Item.Name: IsWSDatabaseRow

Param.Name: dialogType
Param.Desc: Index of dialog to be displayed.

Item.Name: ClearWSCell
Item.Description: Clears content and resets attributes of a cell in the referenced worksheet.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] allows a rectangular range of cells to be reset. To reset a single cell, specify identical values for the top/bottom and left/right range boundaries.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Clears contents and attributes from specified worksheet cells.

Item.ShortDesc: Returns a handle to the worksheet being displayed by a worksheet image object.

Item.Description: Identifies what NNA products and product packages are available in the current product installation.[[BR]][[BR]]Obsolete as of 10. Use GetEnabledModules instead.

Item.Name: WriteLnMac
Item.Description: Writes a line of data to a text file using Macintosh character encoding for extended ASCII characters (128-255). This allows extended character data to be properly read and displayed by Vectorworks on Windows systems (Vectorworks by default uses Macintosh encoding for extended character values).[[BR]][[BR]]The line of data written to file is terminated with a return character combination appropriate for the platform on which the file is being written.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Writes a line of data to a text file using Macintosh character encoding. This allows the file to be read back in as a VectorScript on any platform.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]CONST[[BR]] Vendor = 'ACME';[[BR]] Price = 123.45;[[BR]] Tax = 1.07;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] Open('Output.txt');[[BR]] WriteLnMac('Mfr/Cost: ', Vendor, '/', Price + Tax);[[BR]] Close('Output.txt');[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: WriteMac
Item.Description: Outputs the specified data to an ASCII text file. The variable length parameter list specifies the data to be written to the file. [[BR]][[BR]]Parameters may be any valid data type, and data types may be mixed in a single call to the procedure. [[name]] leaves the file pointer positioned at the end of the last data value written to the file; any data subsequently written to the file will be appended to the end of this value.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:WriteLnFormatNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Writes data to a text file. Uses Macintosh character encoding. This allows the file to be read back in as a VectorScript on any platform.

Item.Name: NurbsCurveEvalPt
Item.Description: This procedure determines the point on the nurbs curve at the given u value in the indexed piece.[[BR]][[BR]]The index is zero based (0 to number of knots - 1). The u value can range from 0 to the value of the last knot in the curve segment.
Item.ShortDesc: This procedure determines the point on the nurbs curve at the given U value in the indexed piece.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: Segment of curve to be queried.

Param.Name: u
Param.Desc: Parameter between the minimum and maximum knot value.

Param.Name: p
Param.Desc: Location of the u point on the curve.

Item.Name: NurbsSurfaceEvalPt
Item.Description: This procedure determines the point on the nurbs surface at the given u,v values.[[BR]][[BR]]The u vand v values can range from 0 to the value of the last knot in each direction.
Item.ShortDesc: This procedure determines the point on the nurbs surface at the given U,V values.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE LocusSurface;[[BR]]{ Create a surface, then put loci on it }[[BR]]CONST[[BR]] uMaxIndex = 16; { 17 points, 0 - 16 }[[BR]] vMaxIndex = 16; { 17 points, 0 - 16 }[[BR]] uDegree = 3; [[BR]] vDegree = 4;[[BR]] xMin = -3;[[BR]] xMax = 3;[[BR]] yMin = -3;[[BR]] yMax = 3;[[BR]] zMax = 3;[[BR]] numLoci = 17;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] surfaceH : HANDLE;[[BR]] x,y,z,u,v : REAL;[[BR]] i,j : INTEGER;[[BR]] numKnotsU, numKnotsV : INTEGER;[[BR]] maxFoundU, maxFoundV : REAL;[[BR]] uStep, vStep : REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] { Create a Nurbs Surface }[[BR]] [[BR]] surfaceH := CreateNurbsSurface(uMaxIndex + 1, vMaxIndex + 1, uDegree, vDegree);[[BR]] IF surfaceH <> NIL THEN BEGIN[[BR]] FOR i := 0 TO uMaxIndex DO BEGIN[[BR]] FOR j := 0 TO vMaxIndex DO BEGIN[[BR]] x := xMin + (xMax - xMin) * (i / uMaxIndex);[[BR]] y := yMin + (yMax - yMin) * (j / vMaxIndex);[[BR]] z := Cos(i - uMaxIndex / 2) *[[BR]] Cos(j - vMaxIndex / 2) * [[BR]] zMax / (1 + x*x + y*y);[[BR]] NurbsSetPt3D(surfaceH, i, j, x,y,z);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]] ResetBBox(surfaceH);[[BR]] [[BR]] { Add Loci }[[BR]] [[BR]] { Find number of knots in each direction }[[BR]] numKnotsU := NurbsNumKnots(surfaceH, 1);[[BR]] numKnotsV := NurbsNumKnots(surfaceH, 0);[[BR]] [[BR]] { Find the u and v real values that correspond the knots with the [[BR]] maximum u and v indices. }[[BR]] NurbsKnot(surfaceH, 1, numKnotsU - 1, maxFoundU); [[BR]] NurbsKnot(surfaceH, 0, numKnotsV - 1, maxFoundV); [[BR]] [[BR]] Message(numKnotsU, ' ', numKnotsV);[[BR]] [[BR]] { Create 3D loci along each direction }[[BR]] uStep := maxFoundU / (numLoci - 1);[[BR]] vStep := maxFoundV / (numLoci - 1);[[BR]] [[BR]] u := 0;[[BR]] WHILE u <= maxFoundU DO BEGIN[[BR]] v := 0;[[BR]] WHILE v <= maxFoundV DO BEGIN[[BR]] NurbsSurfaceEvalPt(surfaceH, u, v, x,y,z);[[BR]] Locus3D(x,y,z);[[BR]] v := v + vStep;[[BR]] END;[[BR]] u := u + uStep;[[BR]] END;[[BR]] [[BR]] { Set View }[[BR]] Projection(0,0,9.76,-4.88,4.88,4.88,-4.88);[[BR]] SetView(#-45.0d,#-35.26438968275d,#-30.0d,0,0,0);[[BR]] RedrawAll;[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]Run(LocusSurface);

Param.Name: u
Param.Desc: Parameter between the minimum and maximum knot value in U direction.

Param.Name: v
Param.Desc: Parameter between the minimum and maximum knot value in V direction.

Param.Name: p
Param.Desc: Location of the u,v point on the surface.

Item.Name: SetParameterVisibility
Item.Description: For plug-in objects, this procedure sets whether or not the specified parameter is visible on the Object Info Palette. This routine is used inside plug-in object regeneration scripts to set their parameter visibility. This visibility is an object instance property.
Item.ShortDesc: For plug-in objects, this procedure determines whether or not the specified parameter is visible on the Object Info Palette.

Param.Name: inPlugin
Param.Desc: Handle to the currently executing plug-in object.

Param.Name: inParameterName
Param.Desc: Name of parameter, as it appears in the plug-in editor's parameter list.

Param.Name: inSetVisible
Param.Desc: The new visibility state for the parameter specified.

Item.Name: EnableParameter
Item.Description: For plug-in objects, this procedure sets whether or not the specified parameter is enabled on the Object Info Palette. This routine is used inside plug-in object regeneration scripts to set their parameter enable state. This state is an object instance property.
Item.ShortDesc: For plug-in objects, this procedure determines whether or not the specified parameter in the Object Info Palette is editable.

Param.Name: inPlugin
Param.Desc: Handle to the currently executing plug-in object.

Param.Name: inParameterName
Param.Desc: Name of parameter, as it appears in the plug-in editor's parameter list.

Item.Description: Returns the string specified by stringIndex. The strings are created using the "Strings" button in the plug-in editor.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the string specified by stringIndex.
Item.Result: The requested string.

Param.Name: stringIndex
Param.Desc: The index of the string as represented in the plug-in editor.

Item.Name: LineLineIntersection
Item.Description: Returns intersection point of the two specified lines. [[p:5]] is true if the lines are parallel. [[p:6]] is true if the intersection is on both lines.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns intersection point of the two specified lines. parallel and coll return whether a parallel or collinear condition exists.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] pt1, pt2, pt3, pt4, pt5 :POINT;[[BR]] parallel, intOnLines :BOOLEAN; [[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CallTool(-201); [[BR]] GetSegPt1(FSActLayer, pt1.x, pt1.y); [[BR]] GetSegPt2(FSActLayer, pt2.x, pt2.y); [[BR]] CallTool(-201); [[BR]] GetSegPt1(FSActLayer, pt3.x, pt3.y); [[BR]] GetSegPt2(FSActLayer, pt4.x, pt4.y); [[BR]] LineLineIntersection(pt1, pt2, pt3, pt4, parallel, intOnLines, pt5); [[BR]] Locus(pt5.x, pt5.y);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: l1start
Param.Desc: Start point of the first line

Param.Name: l1end
Param.Desc: End point of the first line

Param.Name: l2start
Param.Desc: Start point of the second line

Param.Name: l2end
Param.Desc: End point of the second line

Param.Name: parallel
Param.Desc: On return, true if the lines are parellel, false otherwise

Param.Name: intOnLines
Param.Desc: On return, true if the lines intersect

Param.Name: sectpt
Param.Desc: On return, point of intersection of the lines, if the lines intersect

Item.Name: LineEllipseIntersect
Item.Description: Calculates the intersection between the specified line and ellipse.
Item.ShortDesc: Calculates the intersection between the specified line and ellipse.
Item.Comments: On return, int1 and int2 are the two possible points of intersection. legal1 and legal2 indicate if the intersections are actually valid.

Param.Name: int1
Param.Desc: On return, first point of intersection, if found

Param.Name: legal1
Param.Desc: On return, second point of intersection, if found

Param.Name: int2
Param.Desc: On return, indicates that int1 is a valid point of intersection

Param.Name: legal2
Param.Desc: On return, indicates that int2 is a valid point of intersection

Item.Name: EllipseEllipseIntersect
Item.Description: Calculates the intersections between the two specified ellipses.
Item.ShortDesc: Calculates the intersections between the two specified ellipses.
Item.Result: Returns the number of valid intersection points. If the return value is n, the first n points are valid. For example, if the return value is 1, the int1 parameter contains a valid point of intersection, and int2, int3, and int4 are invalid. If the return value is 3, int1, int2, and int3 contain valid points, and int4 is invalid.
Item.Comments: On return, int1, int2, int3, and int4 contain the points of intersection. Return value indicates which intersections are legal.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h1, h2 :HANDLE;[[BR]] upperLeft1, lowerRight1 :POINT;[[BR]] upperLeft2, lowerRight2 :POINT;[[BR]] int1, int2, int3, int4 :POINT;[[BR]] num :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CallTool(-205); h1 := FSActLayer;[[BR]] CallTool(-205); h2 := FSActLayer;[[BR]] GetBBox(h1, upperLeft1.x, upperLeft1.y, lowerRight1.x, lowerRight1.y);[[BR]] GetBBox(h2, upperLeft2.x, upperLeft2.y, lowerRight2.x, lowerRight2.y);[[BR]] num := EllipseEllipseIntersect(upperLeft1, lowerRight1, upperLeft2, lowerRight2, int1, int2, int3, int4);[[BR]] Message(num);[[BR]] Locus(int1.x, int1.y);[[BR]] Locus(int2.x, int2.y);[[BR]] Locus(int3.x, int3.y);[[BR]] Locus(int4.x, int4.y);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: upperLeft1
Param.Desc: Upper-left point of the first ellipse

Param.Name: lowerRight1
Param.Desc: Lower-right point of the first ellipse

Param.Name: upperLeft2
Param.Desc: Upper-left point of the second ellipse

Param.Name: lowerRight2
Param.Desc: Lower-right point of the second ellipse

Param.Name: int1
Param.Desc: On return, first point of intersection, if found

Param.Name: int2
Param.Desc: On return, second point of intersection, if found

Param.Name: int3
Param.Desc: On return, third point of intersection, if found

Param.Name: int4
Param.Desc: On return, fourth point of intersection, if found

Item.Name: WallFootPrint
Item.Description: Returns the handle of a polyline representing the footprint of a wall.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the handle of a polyline representing the footprint of a wall.
Item.Result: Returns the handle of a polyline representing the footprint of a wall.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE GetWallFootPrint;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h1, h2 :HANDLE;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] h1 := FSActLayer;[[BR]] h2 := WallFootPrint(h1);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(GetWallFootPrint);[[BR]]

Item.Name: GetMarker
Item.Description: Returns marker information on the referenced object.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns marker information on the referenced object.This function supercedes GetArrowHeads. size is the number of 1/16384 ths of an inch for the marker.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for VW2008: Use GetObjBeginningMarker and/or GetObjEndMarker instead.[[BR]]For a one inch marker pass in a size value equal to 16384. If you pass NIL for the obj parameter, this call will set the marker defaults for this document. angle must be in range 0 to 90 degrees.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE CheckMarker;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h: HANDLE;[[BR]] MarkerStyle: INTEGER;[[BR]] StartMark, EndMark: BOOLEAN;[[BR]] Size: REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] h := FSActLayer;[[BR]] GetMarker(H, StartMark, EndMark, MarkerStyle, Size);[[BR]] Message('StartMark: ', StartMark, ' EndMark:', EndMark, ' MarkerStyle:', MarkerStyle, ' Size:', Size);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(CheckMarker);[[BR]]

Param.Name: start
Param.Desc: True if a marker is visible at start of object.

Param.Name: end
Param.Desc: True if a marker is visible at end of object.

Param.Name: style
Param.Desc: Marker style:[[BR]]0 - Filled Arrow Marker[[BR]]1 - Empty Arrow Marker[[BR]]2 - Open Arrow Marker[[BR]]3 - Filled Ball Marker[[BR]]4 - Empty Ball Marker[[BR]]5 - Slash Marker[[BR]]6 - Cross Marker

Item.Name: SetMarker
Item.Description: Specifies marker information for the referenced object - OBSOLETE procedure: Use SetObjBeginningMarker and/or SetObjEndMarker instead.
Item.ShortDesc: Specifies marker information for the referenced object - OBSOLETE procedure: Use SetObjBeginningMarker and/or SetObjEndMarker instead.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for VW2008: Use SetObjBeginningMarker and/or SetObjEndMarker instead.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] MoveTo(0, 0);[[BR]] LineTo(100, 0);[[BR]] SetMarker(LNewObj, TRUE, FALSE, 2, 10000);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: start
Param.Desc: True if a marker is visible at start of object.

Param.Name: end
Param.Desc: True if a marker is visible at end of object.

Param.Name: style
Param.Desc: Marker style:[[BR]]0 - Filled Arrow Marker[[BR]]1 - Empty Arrow Marker[[BR]]2 - Open Arrow Marker[[BR]]3 - Filled Ball Marker[[BR]]4 - Empty Ball Marker[[BR]]5 - Slash Marker[[BR]]6 - Cross Marker

Item.Name: GetRoundingBase
Item.Description: Gets the rounding base (1, 2.5, or 5) for the display, primary units, and secondary units.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the rounding base (1, 2.5, or 5) for the display, primary units, and secondary units.
Item.Example: FUNCTION DisplayAccuracy :REAL;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dec_prec :REAL;[[BR]] frac_prec :REAL;[[BR]] display :INTEGER; [[BR]] primary :INTEGER; [[BR]] secondary :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetRoundingBase(display, primary, secondary);[[BR]] dec_prec := 1 / (10 ^ GetPrefLongInt(169));[[BR]] IF display = 1 THEN dec_prec := dec_prec * 2.5 ELSE[[BR]] IF display = 2 THEN dec_prec := dec_prec * 5;[[BR]] frac_prec := 1 / (2 ^ GetPrefLongInt(171));[[BR]] IF NOT GetPref(168) THEN DisplayAccuracy := dec_prec[[BR]] ELSE IF GetPref(175) THEN DisplayAccuracy := Min(dec_prec, frac_prec)[[BR]] ELSE DisplayAccuracy := frac_prec;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]

Param.Name: display
Param.Desc: Rounding base for the display units

Param.Name: primary
Param.Desc: Rounding base for the primary units

Param.Name: secondary
Param.Desc: Rounding base for the secondary units

Item.Name: AddListBoxTabStop
Item.Description: Adds a tab stop to a Layout Manager list box. The last parameter is the tab stop, in characters. This function should be called in the dialog handler, as opposed to the dialog definition procedure. This function will clear all data in the list control.
Item.ShortDesc: Adds a tab stop to a Layout Manager list box. The last parameter is the tab stop, in characters. Call this function from the dialog handler.
Item.Comments: The last parameter is the tab stop, in characters. This function should be called in the dialog handler, as opposed to the dialog definition procedure. This function will clear all data in the list control.

Item.ShortDesc: Removes the last tab stop from a Layout Manager list box.

Item.ShortDesc: Gets the elevation and thickness of the specified layer.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h :HANDLE; [[BR]] baseElev, thickness :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] h := FLayer;[[BR]] WHILE h <> NIL DO BEGIN[[BR]] GetLayerElevation(h, baseElev, thickness);[[BR]] thickness := thickness / (25.4 / GetPrefReal(152));[[BR]] AlrtDialog(Concat('layer name: ', GetLName(h), ', baseElev: ', baseElev, ', thickness: ', thickness));[[BR]] h := NextLayer(h);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);
