Item.Name: GetLocalizedPluginName
Item.Description: Get the localized name of a plug-in given its universal name. [[BR]][[BR]]When Vectorworks plug-ins are localized by distributors in other countries, their names are translated to the appropriate language. The plug-in file stores both the original universal name and this translated localized name. The translated name is displayed by the Vectorworks user interface instead of the original name. If a script needs to display the name of a plug-in in a dialog or message then it should call this function to determine the localized name. (Note that scripts will use the universal name to specify a plug-in when the name is not being displayed to the user.) [[BR]][[BR]]If the plug-in has not been localized, then this function will return the universal name.
Item.ShortDesc: Get the localized name of a plug-in given its universal name.
Item.Result: Returns true if the specified plug-in exists, and false if it is not found.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]TYPE[[BR]] plugin = STRUCTURE[[BR]] universalName :STRING;[[BR]] localizedName :STRING;[[BR]] params :ARRAY[1..99,1..2] OF STRING;[[BR]] popups :ARRAY[1..99,1..99] OF STRING;[[BR]] END;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] plugins :ARRAY[1..99] OF plugin;[[BR]] cnt1, cnt2, cnt3, pluginCnt :INTEGER;[[BR]] str1, str2, str3, str4 :STRING;[[BR]] boo :BOOLEAN;[[BR]] int1, int2 :INTEGER;[[BR]] [[BR]]PROCEDURE GetInfo(h :HANDLE);[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] recHand :HANDLE;[[BR]] recName :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] recHand := GetRecord(h, NumRecords(h));[[BR]] recName := GetName(recHand);[[BR]] FOR cnt1 := 1 TO pluginCnt DO [[BR]] IF recName = plugins[cnt1].universalName [[BR]] THEN cnt1 := pluginCnt + 2;[[BR]] IF cnt1 < pluginCnt + 2 THEN BEGIN[[BR]] boo := GetLocalizedPluginName(recName, str2);[[BR]] pluginCnt := pluginCnt + 1;[[BR]] plugins[pluginCnt].universalName := recName;[[BR]] plugins[pluginCnt].localizedName := str2;[[BR]] FOR cnt2 := 1 TO NumFields(recHand) DO BEGIN[[BR]] str1 := GetFldName(recHand, cnt2);[[BR]] int1 := GetFldType(recHand, cnt2);[[BR]] boo := GetLocalizedPluginParameter(recName, str1, str2);[[BR]] plugins[pluginCnt].params[cnt2, 1] := str1;[[BR]] plugins[pluginCnt].params[cnt2, 2] := str2;[[BR]] IF int1 = 8 THEN BEGIN[[BR]] FOR cnt3 := 1 TO NumCustomObjectChoices(recName, str1) DO BEGIN[[BR]] str3 := GetCustomObjectChoice(recName, str1, cnt3);[[BR]] boo := GetPluginChoiceIndex(recName, str1, str3, int2);[[BR]] boo := GetLocalizedPluginChoice(recName, str1, int2, str4);[[BR]] plugins[pluginCnt].popups[cnt2, cnt3] := Concat(str3, Chr(9), str4);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] pluginCnt := 0;[[BR]] ForEachObject(GetInfo, (T=86));[[BR]] FOR cnt1 := 1 TO pluginCnt DO BEGIN[[BR]] WriteLn(plugins[cnt1].universalName, Chr(9), plugins[cnt1].localizedName);[[BR]] cnt2 := 1;[[BR]] WHILE plugins[cnt1].params[cnt2, 1] <> '' DO BEGIN[[BR]] WriteLn(' ', plugins[cnt1].params[cnt2, 1], Chr(9), plugins[cnt1].params[cnt2, 2]);[[BR]] cnt3 := 1;[[BR]] WHILE plugins[cnt1].popups[cnt2, cnt3] <> '' DO BEGIN[[BR]] WriteLn(' ', plugins[cnt1].popups[cnt2, cnt3]);[[BR]] cnt3 := cnt3 + 1;[[BR]] END;[[BR]] cnt2 := cnt2 + 1;[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: outName
Param.Desc: The localized name of the plug-in

Item.Name: GetLocalizedPluginParameter
Item.Description: Get the localized name of a plug-in parameter.[[BR]][[BR]]When Vectorworks plug-ins are localized by distributors in other countries, their parameter names are translated to the appropriate language. The plug-in file stores both the original universal name and this translated localized name for each parameter. The translated name is displayed by the Vectorworks user interface instead of the original name. If a script needs to display the name of a plug-in parameter in a dialog or message then it should call this function to determine the localized name. (Note that scripts will use the universal name to specify a plug-in parameter when the name is not being displayed to the user.) [[BR]][[BR]]If the plug-in has not been localized, then this function will return the universal name of the parameter.
Item.ShortDesc: Get the localized name of a plug-in parameter given the universal name of plug-in and universal name of parameter.
Item.Result: Returns true if the specified plug-in exists, and false if it is not found.

Item.Name: GetLocalizedPluginChoice
Item.Description: Returns true with outChoice as specified by [[p:1]], [[p:2]] and [[p:3]]. Each of the input names are universal names.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns true with outChoice as specified by inPluginName, nParameterName and inChoiceIndex. Each of the input names are universal names.
Item.Result: Returns true if the function call succeeded.

Param.Name: inPluginName
Param.Desc: The universal name of the plug-in.

Param.Name: inParameterName
Param.Desc: The universal name of the parameter.

Param.Name: inChoiceIndex
Param.Desc: The index of the requested choice. ( range is 1 to n)

Item.Name: GetPluginChoiceIndex
Item.Description: Returns true with outIndex as specified by [[p:1]]and [[p:2]]. Each of the input names are universal names.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns true with outIndex as specified by [[p:1]]and [[p:2]]. Each of the input names are universal names.
Item.Result: Returns true if the function succeeded.

Param.Name: inPluginName
Param.Desc: The universal name of the plug-in.

Param.Name: inParameterName
Param.Desc: The universal name of the parameter.

Param.Name: inChoiceName
Param.Desc: The universal name of the choice.

Param.Name: outIndex
Param.Desc: The index of the requested choice. ( range is 1 to n)

Item.Name: CreateEditTextBox
Item.Description: Creates a scrolling multiline editable text field in a dialog layout.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a scrolling multiline editable text field in a dialog layout.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] result :INTEGER;[[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]END;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Example Dialog', FALSE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateEditTextBox(dialog1, 4, 'default text', 24, 16);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The id of the text box control.

Param.Name: widthInStdChar
Param.Desc: The width of the displayed text in standard character count. See GetDlgCtrlWidthStdCh.

Param.Name: heightInLines
Param.Desc: Height of the control in lines.

Item.Name: CreateGradient
Item.Description: Creates a new gradient resource.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new gradient resource.
Item.Result: Returns a handle to a new gradient resource if successful, otherwise the function returns nil.
Item.Comments: This function creates a default gradient with 2 color spots: a white color spot at position, 0.0, and a black color spot at position, 1.0.[[BR]]A gradient resource must always have at least 2, but no more than 32767 color spots.[[BR]]NOTE: if the specified name already exists, a unique nmae will be created by adding a number suffix to the specified name.[[BR]]

Param.Name: name
Param.Desc: A user-specified name by which the newly created gradient will be identified.

Item.Name: ShowGradientEditorDialog
Item.Description: Displays the gradient editor dialog for the specified gradient. [[BR]][[BR]]To create and edit a new gradient resource, pass in a handle variable initialized to nil. If successful, the handle variable will be initialized with the handle to the new gradient resource.
Item.ShortDesc: Displays the gradient editor dialog for the specified gradient.
Item.Example: ShowGradientEditorDialog(gradientHandle);[[BR]]{ displays the specified gradient resource in the editor }[[BR]][[BR]]newGradientHandle := nil;[[BR]]ShowGradientEditorDialog(newGradientHandle);[[BR]]{ creates a new gradient resource and displays it in the editor }

Param.Name: gradient
Param.Desc: The gradient resource to display in the editor dialog; nil if a new gradient is to be created.

Item.Name: GetNumGradientSegments
Item.Description: Gets the number of segments in the gradient.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the number of segments in the gradient.
Item.Result: Returns the number of segments in the gradient if successful; 0 otherwise.
Item.Comments: Note: a gradient must always have at least 2 segments.

Param.Name: gradient
Param.Desc: The gradient from which to get the number of segments.

Item.Name: InsertGradientSegment
Item.Description: Inserts a new segment into the gradient and initializes its data to the specified values.[[BR]][[BR]]A segment consists of a single color spot and the single midpoint immediately to the right of the color spot.
Item.ShortDesc: Inserts a new segment into the gradient and initializes its data to the specified values.
Item.Result: Returns the index of the newly created segment; 0 otherwise.[[BR]][[BR]]Note: segment indexes begin with 1.
Item.Example: index := InsertGradientSegment(gradientHandle, 0.35, 0.4, 255, 255, 255);[[BR]]{ inserts a white color spot at position, 0.35, with a midpoint position of 0.4 }

Param.Name: gradient
Param.Desc: Gradient into which a segment is to be inserted.

Param.Name: spotPosition
Param.Desc: Position of the segment's color spot relative to left-most point of the gradient. [[BR]](position >= 0.0 and position <= 1.0)

Param.Name: midpointPosition
Param.Desc: Position of the segment's midpoint relative to color spot immediately to left. [[BR]](position >= 0.0 and position <= 1.0)

Param.Name: red
Param.Desc: Red component of the color spot's color. [[BR]](red >= 0 and red <= 255)

Param.Name: green
Param.Desc: Green component of the color spot's color. [[BR]](green >= 0 and green <= 255)

Param.Name: blue
Param.Desc: Blue component of the color spot's color. [[BR]](blue >= 0 and blue <= 255)

Item.Name: RemoveGradientSegment
Item.Description: Removes the specified segment from the specified gradient.
Item.ShortDesc: Removes the specified segment from the specified gradient.
Item.Example: RemoveGradientSegment (gradientHandle, 4);[[BR]]{ removes the segment with index 4 }

Param.Name: gradient
Param.Desc: Gradient from which to remove a segment.

Param.Name: segmentIndex
Param.Desc: Index of segment to be removed.[[BR]](segment indexes begin with 1)

Item.Description: Returns whether a layer is workgroup referenced, and if so, the path to the source document is returned.

Item.Name: OpenURL
Item.Description: Opens a web page or file using the default browser or appropriate application (e.g. Adobe Acrobat). Returns a boolean indicating the success of the operation.[[BR]][[BR]]The URL (Uniform Resource Locator) is a pointer to a resource on the World Wide Web. It specifies both the protocol and location of the document to open. For files on the local computer, the URL should begin with file:// protocol specifier. For web pages, the URL should begin with http://. The URL should use forward slashes / to separate parts of the path. [[BR]][[BR]]There are some platform differences to be aware of. Windows will accept either \ or / as the path separators. MacOS X requires that file:// URLs begin with /Volumes/ before the drive name. Also, currently the MacOS X implementation of OpenURL does not accept spaces in the URL. Spaces should be replaced with the escape code %20 before calling this function.[[BR]][[BR]]Note: The function GetFolderPath returns a string with separators specific for the platform it is running on (: on Mac and \ on Windows). If your script calls this function to assemble a local file:// URL then you will have to replace the : separators with / characters. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Opens a URL using the default browser or Adobe Acrobat. Returns a boolean indicating the success of the operation.
Item.Example: { Open a webpage. }[[BR]] status := [[name]]('http://www.vectorworks.net');[[BR]][[BR]] { Open an HTML file on MacOS X. }[[BR]] status := [[name]]('file:///Volumes/MyMacXHD/Documents/My%20Files/Test.html');[[BR]] [[BR]] { Open a PDF file in Acrobat on MacOS X. }[[BR]] status := [[name]]('file:///Volumes/MyMacXHD/Documents/My%20Files/VSLG11.pdf');[[BR]][[BR]] { Open a PDF file in Acrobat on MacOS 9. }[[BR]] status := [[name]]('file:///MyMac9HD/My Files/VSLG11.pdf');[[BR]] [[BR]] { Open a PDF file in Acrobat on Windows. }[[BR]] status := [[name]]('file:///C:/My Files/VSLG11.pdf';[[BR]] [[BR]]

Param.Name: URLname
Param.Desc: The Uniform Resource Locator for the web page or file to open.

Item.Name: ConvertToNURBS
Item.Description: This function converts the input object into a new NURBS object or a group of NURBS objects in the document.
Item.ShortDesc: This function converts the input object into a new NURBS object or a group of NURBS objects in the document.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h :handle;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CallTool(-204);[[BR]] h := FSActLayer;[[BR]] h := ConvertToNURBS(h, false);[[BR]] h := CreateOffsetNurbsObjectHandle(h, 1);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: keepOrig
Param.Desc: Leave the original object in the drawing.

Item.Name: CreateSurfacefromCurvesNetwork
Item.Description: This function will create a NURBS surface from a network of selected intersecting curves in the document
Item.ShortDesc: This function will create a NURBS surface from a network of selected intersecting curves in the document

Item.Name: CreateLoftSurfaces
Item.Description: Creates NURBS surfaces by interpolating a group of cross-section curves. The nurbs curves are lofted in the order in which they were added to the group.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates NURBS surfaces by interpolating a group of cross-section curves. The nurbs curves are lofted in the order in which they were added to the group.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h, groupHand :HANDLE;[[BR]] bRule, bClose, bSolid :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] BeginGroup;[[BR]][[BR]] h := CreateNurbsCurve(-PLENGTH/2, 0, 0, true, 1);[[BR]] AddVertex3D(h, -PLENGTH/2,PHEIGHT,0);[[BR]] AddVertex3D(h, PLENGTH/2,PHEIGHT,0);[[BR]] AddVertex3D(h, PLENGTH/2,0,0);[[BR]][[BR]] h := CreateNurbsCurve(-PLENGTH/2-POFFSET,0,pWidth, true, 1);[[BR]] AddVertex3D(h, -PLENGTH/2-POFFSET, PHEIGHT+POFFSET, pWidth);[[BR]] AddVertex3D(h, PLENGTH/2+POFFSET, PHEIGHT+POFFSET, pWidth);[[BR]] AddVertex3D(h, PLENGTH/2+POFFSET, 0, pWidth);[[BR]][[BR]] EndGroup;[[BR]] groupHand := LNewObj;[[BR]] bRule := TRUE;[[BR]] bClose := FALSE;[[BR]] bSolid := FALSE;[[BR]] groupHand := CreateLoftSurfaces(groupHand, bRule, bClose, bSolid);[[BR]] SetRot3D(LNewObj,#90d,#0d,#0d,0,0,0);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: GetNurbsObjectDistanceFromPoint
Item.Description: Returns the distance from the input point to the input NURBS Object [[p:1]].
Item.ShortDesc: This function will return the distance from the input point to the input NURBS Object h.

Item.Name: CreateOffsetNurbsObjectHandle
Item.Description: Returns a handle to a NURBS object that is offset from the given NURBS object [[p:1]] by the offset distance.
Item.ShortDesc: This function will return a handle to a NURBS object that is offset from the given NURBS object h by the offset distance.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h :handle;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CallTool(-204);[[BR]] h := FSActLayer;[[BR]] h := ConvertToNURBS(h, false);[[BR]] h := CreateOffsetNurbsObjectHandle(h, 1);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: GetPolyBreakGeometry
Item.Description: If the break, in theWall at the specified break index, references a polyBreak object then a copy of the polybreak is converted into a polyline object.

Item.Description: Available in Architect only. Takes the given polyline and uses it to set a polybreak at the given breakIndex.
Item.ShortDesc: Available in Architect only.Takes the given polyline and uses it to set a polybreak at the given breakIndex.
Item.Comments: The input polyline must be a stand alone object not in the drawing or any other list

Item.Name: MoveWallByOffset
Item.Description: Available in Architect only. Moves the wall perpendicular to its definition line by the specified offset and maintains all wall connections. Wall movement may be constrained by the surrounding geometry so the actual amount of the offset is returned.
Item.ShortDesc: Available in Architect only. Moves the wall perpendicular to its definition line by the specified offset, and maintains all wall connections Offset < 0 left of wall & Offset > 0 right of wall
Item.Result: The actual amount the wall was moved is passed back in the offset parameter.

Param.Name: theWall
Param.Desc: A handle to the wall to move.

Param.Name: offset
Param.Desc: The distance to move the given wall. Negative offsets move the wall to the left and positive offsets move the wall to the right. The actual amount the wall was moved is returned in this field.

Item.Name: JoinWalls
Item.Description: This function provides a VectorScript interface to the Wall Join Tool. The parameters [[p:3]] and [[p:4]] are used to specify the pick points that determine which ends of the walls are to be joined, similar to the points requested by the Wall Join Tool.
Item.ShortDesc: Join Modifier Types: kTWallJoin = 1, kLWallJoin = 2, kXWallJoin = 3, kAutoWallJoin = 4

Param.Name: firstWall
Param.Desc: The first wall of the join operation. For T joins this is the wall that is extended to meet the second wall.

Param.Name: secondWall
Param.Desc: The second wall of the join operation.

Param.Name: firstWall
Param.Desc: The first and second wall points are used to clarify corner joins.

Param.Name: secondWall
Param.Desc: The first and second wall points are used to clarify corner joins.

Param.Name: joinModifier
Param.Desc: Specifies the type of join: T-join = 1, L-join = 2, X-join = 3, and auto join = 4.

Param.Name: capped
Param.Desc: True for capped joins, false for un-capped joins.

Param.Name: showAlerts
Param.Desc: Show an alert dialog if the join operation fails.

Item.Name: ReverseWallSides
Item.Description: Switch the left and right side of a wall by reversing the direction of the wall. This is an interface to the button with the same name on the Object Info palette.
Item.ShortDesc: Switch the left and right side of a wall by reversing the direction of the wall. This is an interface to the button with the same name on the Object Info palette.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE ReverseWallSidesExample;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] center_pt, start_pt, end_pt :VECTOR;[[BR]] h :HANDLE;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] center_pt.x := 0;[[BR]] center_pt.y := 0;[[BR]] start_pt.x := 100;[[BR]] start_pt.y := 0;[[BR]] end_pt.x := 0;[[BR]] end_pt.y := 100;[[BR]] RoundWall(center_pt.x, center_pt.y, start_pt.x, start_pt.y, end_pt.x, end_pt.y);[[BR]] h := LNewObj;[[BR]] ReverseWallSides(h);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(ReverseWallSidesExample);

Param.Name: theWall
Param.Desc: Handle to the wall to operate on.

Item.Name: SetParent
Item.Description: Removes the object from its current container and places it within the given container. For example, SetParent can be used to put the referenced object into a group, or into a symbol definition, or to change the layer of the referenced object.
Item.ShortDesc: Removes the object from its current container and places it within the given container.
Item.Comments: This function will fail if obj is being moved from a non-regenerable list of a plug-in to a regenrable list of a plug-in
Item.Example: PROCEDURE SetParentExample;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h1, h2 :HANDLE;[[BR]] boo :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] h1 := FSActLayer;[[BR]] h2 := NextObj(h1);[[BR]] boo := SetParent(h2, h1);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(SetParentExample);

Item.Name: ArcByCenter
Item.Description: Creates an arc using a center point, the radius, a start angle, and a sweep.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates an arc using a center point, the radius, a start angle, and a sweep.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] x, y, radius, startAngle, sweepAngle :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetPt(x, y);[[BR]] radius := 3;[[BR]] startAngle := 0;[[BR]] sweepAngle := 90;[[BR]] ArcByCenter(x, y, radius, startAngle, sweepAngle);[[BR]] AlrtDialog(Concat(GetType(LNewObj)));[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: GetOSVersion
Item.Description: Returns the version of the current operating system.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the version of the current operating system.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE ShowVersionInfo;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] osMajor, osMinor, osIncr :LONGINT;[[BR]] vwMajor, vwMinor, vwMaint, platform: INTEGER;[[BR]] str :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] str := '';[[BR]] GetOSVersion(osMajor, osMinor, osIncr);[[BR]] GetVersion(vwMajor, vwMinor, vwMaint, platform);[[BR]] If platform = 1 then BEGIN[[BR]] str := Concat(str, 'Platform: Macintosh', chr(13));[[BR]] IF osMajor = 0 THEN osMajor := 10;[[BR]] str := Concat(str, 'OS Version: ', osMajor, '.', osMinor, '.', osIncr, chr(13));[[BR]] end else if platform = 2 then BEGIN[[BR]] str := Concat(str, 'Platform: Windows', chr(13));[[BR]] IF (osMajor = 4) & (osMinor = 10) THEN str := Concat(str, 'OS Version: 98 SE', chr(13)) ELSE [[BR]] IF (osMajor = 5) & (osMinor = 1) THEN str := Concat(str, 'OS Version: XP', chr(13)) ELSE [[BR]] str := Concat(str, 'OS Version: ', osMajor, '.', osMinor, '.', osIncr, chr(13));[[BR]] END;[[BR]] str := Concat(str, 'VW Version: ', vwMajor, '.', vwMinor, '.', vwMaint);[[BR]] AlrtDialog(str);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(ShowVersionInfo);

Item.Description: Update the specified object using the current settings and parameter values. This will reset the bounding box of the object. If the object is in a wall, then the wall is reset also. [[BR]][[BR]]An object of any type may be passed to this function to have its boundary reset. The following object types will be reset in a way that is appropriate for each type: Plug-in Object, Symbol Definition, Wall, Roof Container, Bitmap, Picture, Dimension, Extrude, Multiple Extrude, Sweep, Polygon, Polyline, Worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Updates the object for any changes in parameters (e.g. resetting bounding box, rebuilding wall groups, etc.)

Item.Name: GetClassArrow
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the arrow style parameters for the indicated class.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the class arrow settings - OBSOLETE procedure: Use GetClassBeginningMarker and/or GetClassEndMarker instead.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for VW2008: Use GetClassBeginningMarker and/or GetClassEndMarker instead.[[BR]]Style indicates the index of the arrow style to be used.[[BR]][[BR]]Size is in page-inches. Legal values are 0.0 to 2.0.[[BR]][[BR]]Angle is in degrees.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE ShowNoneClassArrowValues;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] style :INTEGER;[[BR]] size :REAL;[[BR]] ang :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetClassArrow('None', style, size, ang);[[BR]] Message(style, ' ', size, ' ', ang);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(ShowNoneClassArrowValues);

Param.Name: size

Item.ShortDesc: Sets the class arrow settings - OBSOLETE procedure: Use SetClassBeginningMarker and/or SetClassEndMarker instead.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for VW2008: Use SetClassBeginningMarker and/or SetClassEndMarker instead.[[BR]]Style indicates the index of the arrow style to be used.[[BR]][[BR]]Size is in page-inches. Legal values are 0.0 to 2.0.[[BR]][[BR]]Angle is in degrees.

Item.Name: GetObjArrow
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns the arrow style parameters for the indicated object.[[BR]]

Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for VW2008: Use GetObjBeginningMarker and/or GetObjEndMarker instead.[[BR]]Style indicates the index of the arrow style to be used.[[BR]][[BR]]Size is in page-inches. Legal values are 0.0 to 2.0.[[BR]][[BR]]Angle is in degrees.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE ShowObjArrowValues;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] style :INTEGER;[[BR]] size :REAL;[[BR]] ang :INTEGER;[[BR]] start :BOOLEAN;[[BR]] endPt :BOOLEAN;[[BR]] obj :HANDLE;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] obj := FSActLayer;[[BR]] GetObjArrow(obj, style, size, ang, start, endPt);[[BR]] Message(style, ' ', size, ' ', ang, ' ', start, ' ', endPt);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(ShowObjArrowValues);

Param.Name: size
Param.Desc: Returns arrow size in inches measured in page space.

Param.Name: end

Item.Comments: OBSOLETE for VW2008: Use SetObjBeginningMarker and/or SetObjEndMarker instead.[[BR]]Style indicates the index of the arrow style to be used.[[BR]][[BR]]Size is in page-inches. Legal values are 0.0 to 2.0.[[BR]][[BR]]Angle is in degrees.

Param.Name: start

Param.Name: end

Item.Name: GetActiveSerialNumber
Item.Description: Gets the currently active serial number.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the currently active serial number.

Item.Name: GetCurrentMode
Item.Description: Returns the current application protection mode.[[BR]][[BR]]Return values:[[BR]]0 - Mode Not Set[[BR]]1 - Full Mode[[BR]]2 - Demo Mode[[BR]]4 - Education Mode[[BR]]8 - Student Mode[[BR]]16 - Viewer Mode[[BR]]32 - Unlicensed Mode[[BR]]64 - Banner Mode[[BR]]128 - Watermark New Files Mode[[BR]]256 - Print Watermark Mode[[BR]]512 - Save Educational File Format Mode[[BR]]1024 - Open Educational File Format Mode[[BR]]2048 - Vector Script Export Mode[[BR]]4096 - Beta Serial Number Mode
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the current application protection mode.
Item.Example: Procedure TestMode;[[BR]][[BR]]Var[[BR]]vwMode : LongInt;[[BR]]ModeCheck : Boolean;[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]FUNCTION BitCheck(largeNum, smallNum :LONGINT) :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]{Returns true if smallNum is a power of 2 present in largeNum.}[[BR]][[BR]]VAR[[BR]]bit :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]BitCheck := FALSE;[[BR]]bit := 15;[[BR]]while bit > -1 do BEGIN[[BR]]if largeNum >= (2 ^ bit) then BEGIN[[BR]]largeNum := largeNum - (2 ^ bit);[[BR]]IF (2 ^ bit) = smallNum THEN BEGIN[[BR]]BitCheck := TRUE;[[BR]]bit := 0;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]bit := bit - 1;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]Begin[[BR]]vwMode := GetCurrentMode;[[BR]]{Educational or Student version}[[BR]]ModeCheck := (BitCheck(vwMode, 4)) | (BitCheck(vwMode, 8));[[BR]][[BR]]AlrtDialog(Concat(vwMode,':',ModeCheck));[[BR]]End;[[BR]][[BR]]Run (TestMode)[[BR]]

Item.Name: GetEnabledModules
Item.Description: Determines which combination of product modules are currently enabled. [[BR]][[BR]]This function returns a LONGINT value which contains a bit for each possible product module. If a module is enabled, then the corresponding bit will be set to 1. If that module is disabled, then its bit will be 0. The table below contains selectors that can be used to interpret the results of this function. To determine if a module is enabled, do a bitwise "and" operation with the selector and the value returned by this function. See the usage example below.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ProductModules]][[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns a bitfield indicating which product modules are currently enabled.
Item.Result: A LONGINT bitfield value with a bit for each possible product module.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE testModules;[[BR]][[BR]]{----------------------------------------------------------}[[BR]]FUNCTION bittest(value, mask :LONGINT) :BOOLEAN; [[BR]]VAR [[BR]] bit :INTEGER; [[BR]]BEGIN [[BR]] bittest := FALSE; [[BR]] bit := 31; { 2 ^ 31 is high order bit of a LONGINT argument. }[[BR]] WHILE ((bit > -1) & (bittest = false)) DO BEGIN [[BR]] IF value >= (2 ^ bit) THEN BEGIN [[BR]] value := value - (2 ^ bit); [[BR]] IF (2 ^ bit) = mask THEN bittest := TRUE; [[BR]] END; [[BR]] bit := bit - 1; [[BR]] END; [[BR]]END; [[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]{----------------------------------------------------------}[[BR]]FUNCTION IsModuleEnabled(whichModule :LONGINT) :BOOLEAN; [[BR]]VAR [[BR]] enabledModules :LONGINT; [[BR]]BEGIN [[BR]] enabledModules := GetEnabledModules; [[BR]] IsModuleEnabled := bittest(enabledModules, whichModule)[[BR]]END; [[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] IF IsModuleEnabled(4) & IsModuleEnabled(1) THEN BEGIN[[BR]] { Landmark and Renderworks are both enabled. } [[BR]] { ... }[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(testModules);[[BR]][[BR]]

Item.Name: DisableModules
Item.Description: Disables modules. The modules parameter is a bitfield indicating which modules to disable.
Item.ShortDesc: Disables modules. The modules parameter is a bitfield indicating which modules to disable.

Param.Name: modules
Param.Desc: This modules parameter is a LONGINT value which contains a bit for each possible product module. If a module is enabled, then the corresponding bit is set to 1. If that module is disabled, then its bit is 0. The table below contains selectors that can be used to interpret the results of this function. To determine if a module is enabled, do a bitwise "and" operation with the selector and the value returned by this function. See the usage example below.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ProductModules]]

Item.Name: AddHole
Item.Description: [[name]] uses a [[p:2]] to create a hole inside [[p:1]]. Upon success, [[p:1]] is converted to polyline. [[p:2]] is unchanged.
Item.ShortDesc: AddHole uses holeTemplate to create a hole inside objectToGetHole. Upon success, objectToGetHole is converted to polyline. holeTemplate is unchanged.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE AddHoleExample;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h1, h2 :HANDLE;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CallTool(-204);[[BR]] h1 := FSActLayer;[[BR]] CallTool(-204);[[BR]] h2 := FSActLayer;[[BR]] IF AddHole(h1, h2) THEN SetFPat(h1, 3);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(AddHoleExample);[[BR]]

Param.Name: objectToGetHole
Param.Desc: A 2D object to be cut by [[p:2]].

Param.Name: holeTemplate
Param.Desc: A 2D object to cut a hole out of [[p:1]].

Item.Name: MakePolygon
Item.Description: MakePolygon creates a 2D Polygon using inSourceObject. Does not delete inSourceObject.
Item.ShortDesc: MakePolygon creates a 2D Polygonalized copyof inSourceObject. The source object is duplicated and converted using the conversion resolution specified in the Vectorworks preferences is used.
Item.Result: A polygonalized copy of inSourceObject
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h :HANDLE;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CallTool(-204);[[BR]] h := FSActLayer;[[BR]] h := MakePolygon(h);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: inSourceObject
Param.Desc: inSource object should be a 2D object that can be polygonalized.

Item.Name: Products3D
Item.Description: Returns the products of inertia of a 3D object for the xy, yz, and zx planes passing through a point at the center of gravity of the object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the products of inertia of a 3D object for the xy, yz, and zx planes passing through a point at the center of gravity of the object.
Item.Result: Returns true if the function succeeds.

Param.Name: object
Param.Desc: The object from which to calculate the Products

Param.Name: lxy
Param.Desc: Theh product of inertia with respect to the YZ and XZ planes passing through the center of mass of [[p:1]].

Param.Name: lyz
Param.Desc: Theh product of inertia with respect to the XZ and XY planes passing through the center of mass of [[p:1]].

Param.Name: lzx
Param.Desc: Theh product of inertia with respect to the XY and YZ planes passing through the center of mass of [[p:1]].

Item.Name: Moments3D
Item.Description: Returns the moments of inertia of a 3D object about the x, y, and z axes of a point at the center of gravity of the object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the moments of inertia of a 3D object about the x, y, and z axes of a point at the center of gravity of the object.
Item.Result: Returns true if the function succeeded.

Param.Name: object
Param.Desc: The object for which to find the 3D moments.

Param.Name: lxx
Param.Desc: The moment of inertia relative to the x-axis passing through the center of mass of [[p:1]]

Param.Name: lyy
Param.Desc: The moment of inertia relative to the y-axis passing through the center of mass of [[p:1]]

Param.Name: lzz
Param.Desc: The moment of inertia relative to the z-axis passing through the center of mass of [[p:1]]

Item.Name: Centroid3D
Item.Description: Returns the center of gravity of a 3D object. The function returns TRUE if the values were found.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the center of gravity of a 3D object. The function returns TRUE if the values were found.
Item.Result: Returns true if the function succeeds.

Param.Name: object
Param.Desc: The objectt from whci to calculate the center of gravity

Param.Name: xCG
Param.Desc: The x component of the center of gravity.

Param.Name: yCG
Param.Desc: The y component of the center of gravity.

Param.Name: zCG
Param.Desc: The z component of the center of gravity.

Item.Name: MakePolyline
Item.Description: Creates a polyline using inSourceObject. inSourceObject is unchanged.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a polyline using inSourceObject. inSourceObject is unchanged.
Item.Result: A polyline representation of [[p:1]].
Item.Comments: Creates a polyline from inSourceObject. inSourceObject is unchanged.

Param.Name: inSourceObject
Param.Desc: The 2D object from which to make a polyline.

Item.Name: CreateContourCurves
Item.Description: Creates contour curves for a solid object given the delta, point on plane and plane normal. If delta is 0, only 1 curve is created, where the specified plane intersects the selected solid.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates contour curves for a solid object given delta, point on plane and plane normal.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to a group containing NURBS curves representing the contours.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] inSourceObject :HANDLE; [[BR]] delta :REAL; [[BR]] ptOnPlaneX, ptOnPlaneY, ptOnPlaneZ :REAL; [[BR]] normalX, normalY, normalZ :REAL;[[BR]] h :HANDLE;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] inSourceObject := FSActLayer;[[BR]] delta := 0; {number of slices}[[BR]] ptOnPlaneX := 0;[[BR]] ptOnPlaneY := 0;[[BR]] ptOnPlaneZ := 610;[[BR]] normalX := 0;[[BR]] normalY := 0;[[BR]] normalZ := 1;[[BR]] h := CreateContourCurves(inSourceObject, delta, ptOnPlaneX, ptOnPlaneY, ptOnPlaneZ, normalX, normalY, normalZ);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: ptOnPlane
Param.Desc: Point on plane used to define contours

Item.Name: CreateCustomObjectN
Item.Description: Creates a custom object instance at specified location and angle of rotation. The calling function can also set whether the pref dialog should appear.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a custom object instance at specified location and angle of rotation. The calling function can also set whether the pref dialog should appear.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h :HANDLE;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] h := CreateCustomObjectN('Door', 0, 0, 0, False);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: rotationAngle
Param.Desc: Rotation angle (in degrees) of object instance.

Item.Name: CombineIntoSurface
Item.Description: Creates a polyline from the bounded selection surrounding the inIncludedPoint.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a polyline from the bounded selection surrounding the inIncludedPoint.

Param.Name: pt
Param.Desc: A point within the bounded selection.

Item.Name: CreateStaticHatch
Item.Description: Creates a static hatch using inHatchName inside the bounded selection surrounding the point. rotationAngle determines the rotation of the result.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a static hatch inside the bounded selection surrounding the point. rotationAngle determines the rotation of the result. Operates just as the menu item Hatch...
Item.Result: A group of lines in the pattern as specified.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h:HANDLE;[[BR]] x,y:REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]GetPt(x,y);[[BR]]h := CreateStaticHatch('Default Hatch', x, y, 0);[[BR]]DSelectAll;[[BR]]SetSelect(h);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: inHatchName
Param.Desc: The name of the hatch definition to use for the hatch.

Param.Name: p
Param.Desc: A point inside the bounds defined by the current selection

Param.Name: rotationAngle
Param.Desc: An angle that specifies an offset angle. Zero degress is due East.

Item.Name: GetPointAndParameterOnNurbsCurveAtGivenLength
Item.Description: Gets point, parametric parameter, and curve index of specified location along a NURBS Curve.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets point, parametric parameter, and curve index of specified location along a NURBS Curve.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] inNurbCurve :HANDLE;[[BR]] inPercentOfLength :REAL;[[BR]] pX, pY, pZ :REAL;[[BR]] outParam :REAL;[[BR]] outIndex :LONGINT;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CallTool(-325);[[BR]] inNurbCurve := FSActLayer;[[BR]] inPercentOfLength := .5;[[BR]] IF GetPointAndParameter(inNurbCurve, inPercentOfLength, pX, pY, pZ, outParam, outIndex) THEN BEGIN[[BR]] Locus3D(pX, pY, pZ);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: inPercentOfLength
Param.Desc: Specify location on curve as percent of total length. (0 - 1)

Param.Name: outIndex
Param.Desc: 0-based index of piece for piecewise NURBS curve.

Item.Name: CreateShaderRecord
Item.Description: Creates a shader record of the desired family (1 = color, 2 = reflectivity, 3 = transparency, 4 = bump) and prototype (constants depend on family value).[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ShaderFamilyColor]][[BR]][[note:ShaderFamilyReflective]][[BR]][[note:ShaderFamilyTransparency]][[BR]][[note:ShaderFamilyBump]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a shader record of the desired family and prototype. ttaches the shader record to the parent texture, will delete any existing records with the same family.

Param.Name: texture
Param.Desc: The shader record will be attached to this texture.

Param.Name: family
Param.Desc: The kind of shader to create (1 = color, 2 = reflectivity, 3 = transparency, 4 = bump)

Param.Name: prototype
Param.Desc: The specific shader within the family (constants depend on the family value).

Item.Name: GetShaderRecord
Item.Description: Returns the shader record of the specified family (1 = color, 2 = reflectivity, 3 = transparency, 4 = bump), if one is attached to the texture.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the shader record of the specified family (1 = color, 2 = reflectivity, 3 = transparency, 4 = bump), if one is attached to the texture.

Param.Name: texture
Param.Desc: Get the shader record attached to this texture.

Param.Name: family
Param.Desc: The kind of shader to retrieve (1 = color, 2 = reflectivity, 3 = transparency, 4 = bump).

Item.Name: SetShaderRecord
Item.Description: Sets the texture's shader record to this record. Will delete any records of the same family if they are already attached to the texture.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the texture's shader record to this record. Will delete any records of the same family if they are already attached to the texture.
Item.Comments: [[BR]]DELETE THIS RECORD! -DLD 12/3/2002

Item.Name: EditShaderRecord
Item.Description: Brings up the edit shader dialog for this shader. Returns true if the user pressed the OK button to dismiss the dialog.
Item.ShortDesc: Brings up the edit shader dialog for this shader. Returns true if the user pressed the OK button to dismiss the dialog.

Item.Name: CreateTextureBitmapN
Item.Description: Creates a texture bitmap object for the chosen shader record. Brings up dialog to choose the image file. Returns nil if user clicked Cancel or if the shader is not an image-based shader.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a texture bitmap object for the chosen shader record. Brings up dialog to choose the image file. Returns nil if user clicked Cancel or if the shader is not an image-based shader.

Item.Name: GetTextureSize
Item.Description: Returns the texture size in real-world inches.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the texture size in real-world inches.

Item.Name: SetTextureSize
Item.Description: Sets the texture size in real-world inches.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the texture size in real-world inches.

Item.Name: CreateListBoxN
Item.Description: Creates a new list box control in a dialog layout. With isMultipleSelect true, the list supports multiple selection.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new list box control in a dialog layout. With isMultipleSelect true, the list supports multiple selection.
Item.Example: { draws a muliple selection list box 25 characters wide and 7 rows high }[[BR]]CreateListBoxN(2,10,25,7, true);[[BR]]

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index that will identify the control item.

Param.Name: widthInStdChar
Param.Desc: The width of the displayed text in standard character count. See GetDlgCtrlWidthStdCh.

Param.Name: heightInLines
Param.Desc: The height of the control in characters.

Param.Name: isMultipleSelect
Param.Desc: Does the list support multiple selection

Item.Name: GetDistanceAlongNurbsCurve
Item.Description: Gets distance between a point at parameter1 on the curve piece index1 and another point at parameter2 on the curve piece with index2
Item.ShortDesc: Gets distance between a point at parameter1 on the curve piece index1 and another point at parameter2 on the curve piece with index2
Item.Comments: if there is only one piece in the inNurbsCurve, both inParameter1index and inParameter2index should be 0.

Item.Name: PrintUsingPrintDialog
Item.Description: Available in Industry Series products only. Prints the active document. The Print Dialog will be displayed. The PageSetup dialog will be displayed, before the print dialog, if the existing print settings are not valid for the current printer.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:PrintReturnValues]]
Item.ShortDesc: Available in Industry Series products only. Prints the active document. The Print Dialog will be displayed. The PageSetup dialog will be displayed, before the print dialog, if needed.

Item.Name: PrintWithoutUsingPrintDialog
Item.Description: Available in Industry Series products only. Prints the active document. Neither the Print Dialog nor the PageSetup dialog will be displayed. This function can fail with certain printers if PrintUsingPrintDialog had not previously been called for the active document.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:PrintReturnValues]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Available in Industry Series products only. Prints the active document. Neither the Print Dialog nor the PageSetup dialog will be displayed.

Item.Name: CreateStaticHatchFromObject
Item.Description: Creates a static hatch using inHatchName inside the bounds of the inObj. The pX , pY and rotationAngle arguments determine the hatch origin and rotation used to generate the result.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a static hatch using inHatchName inside the bounds of inObj.
Item.Result: A group of lines in a hatch pattern as specified.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h:HANDLE;[[BR]] x,y:REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]GetPt(x,y);[[BR]]h := CreateStaticHatchFromObject(FSActLayer,'Default Hatch', x, y, 0);[[BR]]DSelectAll;[[BR]]SetSelect(h);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: inObj
Param.Desc: An object used as the boundary for the output.

Param.Name: inHatchName
Param.Desc: The name of the hatch definition

Param.Name: p
Param.Desc: A point specifying the origin of the output

Param.Name: rotationAngle
Param.Desc: An angle specifying an offset angle to use to create the output

Item.Name: CreateTabControl
Item.Description: Creates a tab control within a dialog. The tab control manages the display of multiple panes of information and provides tab buttons that allow the user to swtich between panes. [[BR]][[BR]]To create a tab control in a dialog, first define a group for each tab pane. Add other controls to the groups and arrange them. Then call [[name]] with an id. Finally, call CreateTabPane for each pane providing the id of the group that defines that pane. [[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a tab control.
Item.Example: Procedure TabControls;[[BR]][[BR]]const[[BR]] kTabControlID = 10;[[BR]] kTabPaneID1 = 20;[[BR]] kTabPaneID2 = 30;[[BR]] kTabPaneID3 = 40;[[BR]] [[BR]]var[[BR]] dlogID, result : LONGINT;[[BR]] [[BR]]Procedure DialogProc(VAR item: LONGINT; data: LONGINT);[[BR]]begin[[BR]] case item of[[BR]] SetupDialogC:[[BR]] begin[[BR]] result := 0;[[BR]] end;[[BR]][[BR]] end;[[BR]]end;[[BR]][[BR]]begin[[BR]] dlogID := CreateLayout('Sample Tab Dialog', false, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]][[BR]] { Tab Group 1 }[[BR]] CreateGroupBox(dlogID, kTabPaneID1, 'Tab 1', FALSE);[[BR]] [[BR]] CreatePushButton(dlogID, 21, 'Button 1');[[BR]] SetFirstGroupItem(dlogID, kTabPaneID1, 21); [[BR]] CreatePushButton(dlogID, 22, 'Button 2');[[BR]] SetBelowItem(dlogID, 21, 22, 0, 0);[[BR]] CreatePushButton(dlogID, 23, 'Button 3');[[BR]] SetBelowItem(dlogID, 22, 23, 0, 0);[[BR]] [[BR]] [[BR]] { Tab Group 2 }[[BR]] CreateGroupBox(dlogID, kTabPaneID2, 'Tab 2', FALSE);[[BR]] [[BR]] CreatePushButton(dlogID, 31, 'Button 4');[[BR]] SetFirstGroupItem(dlogID, kTabPaneID2, 31);[[BR]] CreatePushButton(dlogID, 32, 'Button 5');[[BR]] SetRightItem(dlogID, 31, 32, 0, 0);[[BR]] CreatePushButton(dlogID, 33, 'Button 6');[[BR]] SetRightItem(dlogID, 32, 33, 0, 0);[[BR]] [[BR]] [[BR]] { Tab Group 3 }[[BR]] CreateGroupBox(dlogID, kTabPaneID3, 'Tab 3', FALSE);[[BR]] [[BR]] CreatePushButton(dlogID, 41, 'Button 7');[[BR]] SetFirstGroupItem(dlogID, kTabPaneID3, 41);[[BR]] CreatePushButton(dlogID, 42, 'Button 8');[[BR]] SetRightItem(dlogID, 41, 42, 0, 0);[[BR]] CreatePushButton(dlogID, 43, 'Button 9');[[BR]] SetBelowItem(dlogID, 42, 43, 0, 0);[[BR]] [[BR]][[BR]] { Create tab control 1 }[[BR]] [[name]](dlogID, kTabControlID);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dlogID, kTabControlID);[[BR]] [[BR]] { Add the tab panes to tab control }[[BR]] CreateTabPane(dlogID, kTabControlID, kTabPaneID1);[[BR]] CreateTabPane(dlogID, kTabControlID, kTabPaneID2);[[BR]] CreateTabPane(dlogID, kTabControlID, kTabPaneID3);[[BR]] [[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dlogID, DialogProc);[[BR]]end;[[BR]]Run(TabControls);

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The id of the dialog that contains this Tab control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The id of the Tab control.

Item.Name: CreateTabPane
Item.Description: Creates a tab pane within a tab control on a dialog.[[BR]][[BR]]To define a tab pane, create a group control and add items to the group. Arrange the items within the group. Then call [[name]] to add a new tab pane to a tab control. Specify the group that defines the layout of that tab pane.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a tab pane within a tab control. groupID is the ID of the group that contains the controls which will appear on this tab pane.
Item.Example: { Create tab control }[[BR]] CreateTabControl(dlogID, kTabControlID);[[BR]] [[BR]] { Add the tab panes to tab control }[[BR]] CreateTabPane(dlogID, kTabControlID, kTabPaneID1);[[BR]] CreateTabPane(dlogID, kTabControlID, kTabPaneID2);[[BR]] CreateTabPane(dlogID, kTabControlID, kTabPaneID3);[[BR]]

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The id of the Tab Control to which this tab pane will be added.

Param.Name: groupID
Param.Desc: The id of the group that defines the tab pane.

Item.Name: UpdateVP
Item.Description: Updates the specified viewport: a dirty viewport, whose render type is other than wireframe, will be re-rendered.
Item.ShortDesc: Updates the specified viewport: a dirty viewport, whose render type is other than wireframe, will be re-rendered.

Item.Name: GetMarkerPopupSelectedItem
Item.Description: This is a deprecated function. Use GetMarkerChoice instead.[[BR]][[BR]]Returns the 1-based index number of the selected item in the specified marker popup menu item. If return value is 8, a custom marker is selected.
Item.ShortDesc: This is a deprecated function. Use GetMarkerChoice instead.

Param.Name: componentID
Param.Desc: ID of the marker popup item

Param.Name: style
Param.Desc: On return, indicates the style of the selected marker. Valid styles:[[BR]]0 - kFilledArrowMarker[[BR]]1 - kEmptyArrowMarker[[BR]]2 - kOpenArrowMarker[[BR]]3 - kFilledBallMarker[[BR]]4 - kEmptyBallMarker[[BR]]5 - kSlashMarker[[BR]]6 - kCrossMarker[[BR]][[BR]]

Param.Name: angle
Param.Desc: On return, indicates the angle of the selected marker, for arrow markers

Param.Name: size
Param.Desc: On return, indicates the size of the selected marker

Item.Name: CreateMarkerPopup
Item.Description: Creates a popup control that displays the various marker styles available in Vectorworks and allows the user to choose one. Markers are the adornments at the endpoints of line objects and consist of styles like arrow, circle, cross, etc.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a marker popup control.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] result :INTEGER;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Untitled Dialog', FALSE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateMarkerPopup(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);
