Item.Name: CreateInterpolatedSurface
Item.Description: Creates an interpolated surface with the specified degrees and number of points. The resulting surface passes through each of the interpoliation points. If a handle to a NURBS surface is provided, the interpolated surface will approximate that surface. If the handle is NULL, it creates a rectangular surface.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates an interpolated surface with the specified degrees and number of points.
Item.Result: Handle to the new interpolated surface object.

Param.Name: surfaceHandle
Param.Desc: Handle to a NURBS surface to approximate

Param.Name: numUPts
Param.Desc: Number of interpolation points in the U parametric direction. Must be greater than uDegree.

Param.Name: numVPts
Param.Desc: Number of interpolation points in the V parametric direction. Must be greater than vDegree.

Param.Name: uDegree
Param.Desc: Degree of the surface in the u parametric direction

Param.Name: vDegree
Param.Desc: Degree of the surface in the v parametric direction

Item.Name: ExtendNurbsCurve
Item.Description: Extends a curve by a given distance at the start or the end. The extension can either be linear or can match the curvature of the existing end.
Item.ShortDesc: Extends a curve by a given distance at the start or the end. The extension can either be linear or can match the curvature of the existing end.
Item.Result: Returns a handle to the extended curve.

Param.Name: bStart
Param.Desc: True to extend the curve at the beginning, false to extend it at the end.

Param.Name: bLinear
Param.Desc: True for linear, false to match curvature of existing end.

Item.Name: ExtendNurbsSurface
Item.Description: Extends a surface by a given distance at the start or the end of the U direction or V direction.
Item.ShortDesc: Extends a surface by a given distance at the start or the end of the U direction or V direction.
Item.Result: Returns a handle to the extended surface

Param.Name: bStart
Param.Desc: True to extend from the beginning, false to extend from the end.

Param.Name: bLinear
Param.Desc: True for linear, false to match curvature of existing surface.

Param.Name: bUDir
Param.Desc: True extends the surface in the u parametric[[BR]]direction, otherwise extends it in the v parametric direction.

Item.Name: RevolveWithRail
Item.Description: Creates a NURBS surface or a group of surfaces by revolving a profile about an axis and following a rail guide curve on a plane perpendicular to the plane containing the axis and the profile.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a NURBS surface or a group of surfaces by revolving a profile about an axis and following a rail guide curve.
Item.Result: Handle to resulting NURBS surface.

Param.Name: profileH
Param.Desc: Handle to a NURBS curve to be used as the profile object.

Param.Name: railH
Param.Desc: Handle to a NURBS curve to be used as the rail guide object

Param.Name: axisH
Param.Desc: Handle to a linear NURBS curve about which the[[BR]]profile would be revolved

Item.Name: EvaluateNurbsSurfacePointAndNormal
Item.Description: Determines the point and normal on the NURBS surface at the given u/v value.
Item.ShortDesc: Determines the point and normal on the NURBS surface at the given u/v value.

Param.Name: surfaceHandle
Param.Desc: Handle to NURBS surface being evaluated

Param.Name: u
Param.Desc: parameter value of the point on the surface being evaluated

Param.Name: v
Param.Desc: parameter value of the point on the surface being evaluated

Param.Name: point
Param.Desc: Coordinate of the point on the surface

Param.Name: normal
Param.Desc: normal vector of the surface computed at the point

Item.Name: UpdateThumbnailPreview
Item.Description: For a given Vectorworks resource (i.e. Hatch, Texture, Symbol/PIO, etc...), this function will create or update it's thumbnail preview.
Item.ShortDesc: For a given Vectorworks resource (i.e. Hatch, Texture, Symbol/PIO, etc...), this function will create or update it's thumbnail preview.
Item.Result: This function returns true if the operation was successful, false otherwise.

Item.Name: GetVPGroupParent
Item.Description: Gets the viewport that is the parent of specified viewport group.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets viewport parent of specified viewport group.
Item.Result: Returns a handle to the viewport object (type 122) that is the parent of the specified group, or nil if unsuccessful.

Param.Name: groupHandle
Param.Desc: handle to a viewport group (crop, annotation, etc)

Item.Name: IsVPGroupContainedObject
Item.Description: Determines if specified object is contained within a viewport group, and if so which type of group.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Determines if specified object is a viewport group-contained object.
Item.Result: true if object is contained within a viewport group

Param.Name: groupType
Param.Desc: Type of group containing the object: (1 = Crop, 2 = Annotation, 3 = Cache, 4 = Section)

Item.Name: IsVPCropObject
Item.Description: Determines if specified object is a viewport crop object.
Item.ShortDesc: Determines if specified object is a viewport crop object.

Item.Name: SetLBSelection
Item.Description: Selects the specified range of items within a List Browser dialog control.
Item.ShortDesc: Selects the specified range of items.
Item.Result: True for success, false otherwise.

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: id of the dialog that contains the list browser

Param.Name: componentID
Param.Desc: id of the list browser control

Param.Name: firstItemIndex
Param.Desc: the first row of the range to select

Param.Name: lastItemIndex
Param.Desc: the last row of the range to select

Item.Name: IsPluginFormat
Item.Description: Determines if the format node is used for the parameters of a plug-in object, plug-in tool or plug-in menu command.
Item.ShortDesc: Determines if the format node is used by a plug-in for its parameters.
Item.Result: Returns true if format is used by a plug-in and false if it is a regular format that may have been created by the user.

Param.Name: theFormat
Param.Desc: Handle to the format node in question.

Item.Name: SetLayoutDialogPosition
Item.Description: This function moves the dialog window to the given location. Call this function to override the default automatic positioning of the dialog window. The dialog will be pinned so that it is at least partly onscreen.[[BR]][[BR]]This function can be useful for displaying a dialog in a position in which it was placed during prior use.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Set the screen location for the top left corner of the dialog window, in pixels.
Item.Result: true - success - the dialog window was moved.[[BR]]false - failure - the dialog window was not moved, likely because it does not currently exist, or the dialogID is invalid. The dialog window will exist anytime between the Setup message and OK/Cancel message.

Param.Name: left
Param.Desc: Location of left edge of dialog in pixels.

Param.Name: top
Param.Desc: Location of top edge of dialog in pixels.

Item.Name: GetLayoutDialogPosition
Item.Description: This function will retrieve the screen location of the dialog window, in pixels.[[BR]][[BR]]This function can be useful for displaying a dialog in a position in which it was placed during prior use.
Item.ShortDesc: Get the screen location of the dialog window, in pixels.
Item.Result: true - success - the location of the dialog window was retrieved.[[BR]]false - failure - the location of the dialog window was not retrieved, likely because it does not currently exist, or the dialogID is invalid. The dialog window will exist anytime between the Setup message and OK/Cancel message.

Param.Name: left
Param.Desc: Location of left edge of dialog, in pixels.

Param.Name: top
Param.Desc: Location of top of dialog, in pixels.

Param.Name: right
Param.Desc: Location of right edge of dialog, in pixels.

Param.Name: bottom
Param.Desc: Location of bottom edge of dialog, in pixels.

Item.Name: CreateSwapControl
Item.Description: Create a swap control within a dialog. [[BR]][[BR]]This control manages multiple overlapping groups of controls, of which a single group of controls is displayed at a time. The script is able to control which group is displayed based on other data in the dialog. For example, a dialog may present a scrolling list of items on the left, and a swap control on the right. As the user selects items in the list, different sets of controls are enabled on the right. This can be used for a settings (preferences) style dialog or when there are too many choices to use a Tab control effectively.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a swap control.
Item.Comments: The swap control is analogous to a tab control, except without the tabs. Thus, the script switches panes, not the user.

Item.Name: CreateSwapPane
Item.Description: Creates a swap pane within the specified swap control. Within a swap control, only one swap pane is visible at a time.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a swap pane within the specified swap control.
Item.Comments: The function is analogous to CreateTabPane.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE dialog1_Main;[[BR]]CONST[[BR]] kOK = 1;[[BR]] kCancel = 2;[[BR]] kTabControl = 4;[[BR]] kTabPane_1 = 5;[[BR]] kTabPane_2 = 6;[[BR]] kSwapControl_1 = 7;[[BR]] kSwapControl_2 = 8;[[BR]] kSwapPane_11 = 9;[[BR]] kSwapPane_21 = 10;[[BR]] kSwapPane_12 = 11;[[BR]] kSwapPane_22 = 12;[[BR]] kButton_11 = 13;[[BR]] kButton_21 = 14;[[BR]] kButton_12 = 15;[[BR]] kButton_22 = 16;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE dialog1_Setup;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Tabs and Swaps', False, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateTabControl (dialog1, kTabControl);[[BR]] CreateGroupBox (dialog1, kTabPane_1, 'Tab Pane 1', True);[[BR]] CreateGroupBox (dialog1, kTabPane_2, 'Tab Pane 2', True);[[BR]] CreateSwapControl (dialog1, kSwapControl_1);[[BR]] CreateSwapControl (dialog1, kSwapControl_2);[[BR]] CreateGroupBox (dialog1, kSwapPane_11, '', True);[[BR]] CreateGroupBox (dialog1, kSwapPane_21, '', True);[[BR]] CreateGroupBox (dialog1, kSwapPane_12, '', True);[[BR]] CreateGroupBox (dialog1, kSwapPane_22, '', True);[[BR]] CreatePushButton (dialog1, kButton_11, 'Button 1');[[BR]] CreatePushButton (dialog1, kButton_21, 'Button 3');[[BR]] CreatePushButton (dialog1, kButton_12, 'Button 2');[[BR]] CreatePushButton (dialog1, kButton_22, 'Button 4');[[BR]][[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, kTabControl);[[BR]] CreateTabPane (dialog1, kTabControl, kTabPane_1);[[BR]] SetFirstGroupItem (dialog1, kTabPane_1, kSwapControl_1);[[BR]] CreateSwapPane (dialog1, kSwapControl_1, kSwapPane_11);[[BR]] SetFirstGroupItem (dialog1, kSwapPane_11, kButton_11);[[BR]] CreateSwapPane (dialog1, kSwapControl_1, kSwapPane_12);[[BR]] SetFirstGroupItem (dialog1, kSwapPane_12, kButton_12);[[BR]] CreateTabPane (dialog1, kTabControl, kTabPane_2);[[BR]] SetFirstGroupItem (dialog1, kTabPane_2, kSwapControl_2);[[BR]] CreateSwapPane (dialog1, kSwapControl_2, kSwapPane_21);[[BR]] SetFirstGroupItem (dialog1, kSwapPane_21, kButton_21);[[BR]] CreateSwapPane (dialog1, kSwapControl_2, kSwapPane_22);[[BR]] SetFirstGroupItem (dialog1, kSwapPane_22, kButton_22);[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE dialog1_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1_Setup;[[BR]] IF RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, dialog1_Handler) = 1 then BEGIN[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(dialog1_Main);[[BR]]

Param.Name: swapControlID
Param.Desc: the ID of the swap control

Param.Name: newGroupID
Param.Desc: the ID of the group to be inserted into swap control as a swap pane.

Item.Name: DisplaySwapPane
Item.Description: Causes the specified swap pane to be displayed within the specified swap control. [[BR]][[BR]]This is called from the dialog's event handling routine.
Item.ShortDesc: Causes the specified swap pane to be displayed within the specified swap control.
Item.Comments: Note that pane indeces are 1-based in VectorScript, and 0-based in the SDK. Swap panes are numbered sequentially in the order that they were inserted into the control.
Item.Example: Procedure DialogProc(VAR item: LONGINT; data: LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CASE item OF[[BR]] SetupDialogC:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] result := 0;[[BR]] END;[[BR]][[BR]] 100: DisplaySwapPane(dlogID, 10, 1); { Display pane 1 }[[BR]] 101: DisplaySwapPane(dlogID, 10, 2); { Display pane 2 }[[BR]] 102: DisplaySwapPane(dlogID, 10, 3); { Display pane 3 }[[BR]][[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]

Param.Name: swapControlID
Param.Desc: the ID of the swap control

Param.Name: groupNumber
Param.Desc: 1-based index of the swap pane to be displayed

Item.Name: SetDocumentDefaultSketchStyle
Item.Description: Sets the document default sketch style. Set [[p:1]] to 'No Sketch' to set the document default sketch to 'No Sketch'.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the document default sketch style.

Item.Name: GetDocumentDefaultSketchStyle
Item.Description: Returns the document default sketch style. Returns the string 'No Sketch' if the current sketch style is 'No Sketch'.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the document default sketch style.

Item.Name: CreateStandardIconControl
Item.Description: Creates a standard icon control, which is used to display the application icon or an alert icon. Valid values for iconNumber are:[[BR]]0 - Vectorworks application icon[[BR]]1 - Informational icon[[BR]]2 - Stop icon[[BR]]3 - Exclamation mark (warning) icon[[BR]]4 - Question icon
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a standard icon control, which is used to display the application icon or an alert icon.
Item.Comments: Should show image of each icon.
Item.Example: dlog := CreateLayout('Untitled Dialog', False, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]][[BR]] CreateStandardIconControl(dlog, 4, 0);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dlog, 4);[[BR]][[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dlog, EventHandler);[[BR]][[BR]]

Param.Name: iconControlID
Param.Desc: ID of the control within the dialog

Param.Name: iconNumber
Param.Desc: Constant, listed above, indicating which icon to display.

Item.Name: CreateImageProp
Item.Description: Create an image prop from the options specified. [[BR]][[BR]]The texture resource and optional symbol created will use names derived from the propName parameter. If those names are being used then unique names will be assigned. If enforceImageAspectRatio is true, depending on deriveWidthFromHeight the prop width/height will be derived from the prop height/width and the texture's image aspect ratio. Otherwise the height and width can be set independently of the texture's image aspect ratio.
Item.ShortDesc: Create image prop

Item.Name: ShowItem
Item.Description: Sets the visibility of the referenced dialog control.
Item.ShortDesc: Shows or hides a dialog item.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE dialogID_Main;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialogID :INTEGER;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE dialogID_Setup;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialogID := CreateLayout('Example Dialog', FALSE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateRadioButton (dialogID, 4, 'Option One');[[BR]] CreateEditReal (dialogID, 5, 1, 0.0, 16);[[BR]] CreateRadioButton (dialogID, 6, 'Option Two');[[BR]] CreateEditReal (dialogID, 7, 1, 0.0, 16);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialogID, 4);[[BR]] SetRightItem (dialogID, 4, 5, 0, 0);[[BR]] SetBelowItem (dialogID, 4, 6, 0, 0);[[BR]] SetRightItem (dialogID, 6, 7, 0, 0);[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE dialogID_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CASE item OF[[BR]] SetupDialogC:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] SetItem(4, TRUE);[[BR]] ShowItem(dialogID, 7, FALSE);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] 4:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] ShowItem(dialogID, 5, TRUE);[[BR]] ShowItem(dialogID, 7, FALSE);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] 6:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] ShowItem(dialogID, 7, TRUE);[[BR]] ShowItem(dialogID, 5, FALSE);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialogID_Setup;[[BR]] IF RunLayoutDialog(dialogID, dialogID_Handler) = 1 then BEGIN[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(dialogID_Main);[[BR]]

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: ID of the currently executing dialog.

Param.Name: item
Param.Desc: Item ID of dialog control to show or hide.

Param.Name: show
Param.Desc: New visibility state of dialog control.

Item.Name: CreateResizableLayout
Item.Description: Creates a new resizable Layout Manager dialog.[[BR]][[BR]]Resizable dialogs raise the ResizeDialogC event when resized.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new resizable Layout Manager dialog.
Item.Comments: The parameters are the same as CreateLayout, except for widthResizable and heightResizable, which specify that the width and height, respectively, be resizable. A dialog ID is returned by the function.

Item.Name: SetEdgeBinding
Item.Description: Binds edges of a dialog control to its parent. This function sets bindings to be fixed. To change any of them to be proportional, use SetProportionalBinding.
Item.ShortDesc: Binds edges of a dialog control to its parent.
Item.Comments: Binding to an edge indicates that the control will maintain a predictable distance from one of its sides to the corresponding side of its parent. Bindings can be either fixed or proportional. Fixed bindings maintain a constant distance from their parent. Proportional bindings maintain a distance that is a ratio of the initial position to the width (or height, as appropriate) of the parent.

Item.Name: SetProportionalBinding
Item.Description: Sets a dialog control's bindings to be proportional. Proportional bindings maintain a distance that is a ratio of the initial position to the width (or height, as appropriate) of the parent. To change a control's bindings to be fixed, use SetEdgeBinding.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets a dialog control's bindings to be proportional.

Item.Name: GetLayoutDialogSize
Item.Description: Retrieves a Layout Manager dialog's size, in pixels.
Item.ShortDesc: Retrieves a Layout Manager dialog's size, in pixels.

Item.Name: SetLayoutDialogSize
Item.Description: Sets a Layout Manager dialog's size, in pixels.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets a Layout Manager dialog's size, in pixels.

Item.Name: SetLayoutOption
Item.Description: Set options for a specific Layout Manager dialog. For use by certain alert dialogs that want centered "OK" button.
Item.ShortDesc: Set options for a specific Layout Manager dialog.

Item.Name: ResizeDialogC
Item.Description: This constant is passed to the event handler routine to signal the dialog has been resized.
Item.ShortDesc: This constant is passed to the event handler routine to signal the dialog has been resized.
Item.Comments: Added 1/7/05 by Jeff Geraci.

Item.Name: AlertInform
Item.Description: Displays an alert dialog which provides the user with information about the result of a command. It offers no user choices.
Item.ShortDesc: Displays an alert dialog which provides the user with information about the result of a command.
Item.SeeAlso: AlertQuestion, AlertCritical, AlertInformDontShowAgain, AlertQuestionDontShowAgain, AlertCriticalHLink, AlertInformHLink, AlertInformHLinkN
Item.Comments: Created by TTF 1/18/2005
Item.Example: AlertInform('That item is not a valid item', '',isMinorAlert);

Param.Name: advice
Param.Desc: The text to be added in a smaller font under the main information message.

Param.Name: minorAlert
Param.Desc: The severity of the alert: minor(true) or major(false).

Item.Name: AlertQuestion
Item.Description: Displays an alert dialog which alerts the user to a condition or situation that requires the user's decision and input before preceding; such as an impending action with potentially destructive or irreversible consequences. The message should be in the form of a question. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Alerts the user to a condition that requires the user's decision.
Item.Result: Return Values[[BR]]0: the negative button was hit[[BR]]1: the positive button was hit[[BR]]2: custom button A was hit[[BR]]3: custom button B was hit
Item.SeeAlso: AlertInform, AlertCritical, AlertInformDontShowAgain, AlertQuestionDontShowAgain, AlertCriticalHLink, AlertInformHLink, AlertInformHLinkN
Item.Comments: Created by TTF 1/18/2005
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] AlrtDialog('AlrtDialog');[[BR]] AlertInform('AlertInform', 'advice', FALSE);[[BR]] AlertCritical('AlertCritical', 'advice');[[BR]] Message(YNDialog('YNDialog'));[[BR]] Message(AlertQuestion('question', 'advice', 1, 'ok', 'cancel', 'a', 'b'));[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: advice
Param.Desc: The text to be added in a smaller font under the main information/message

Param.Name: defaultButton
Param.Desc: Specifies which button is to be made the default[[BR]]0: the negative button is the default[[BR]]1: the positive button is the default[[BR]]2: custom button A is the default [[BR]]3: custom button B is the default

Param.Name: OKOverrideText
Param.Desc: Specifies a string to use in overriding the 'OK' string

Param.Name: CancelOverrideText
Param.Desc: Specifies a string to use in overriding the 'Cancel' string

Param.Name: customButtonAText
Param.Desc: Specifies a string to use for an optional custom button A

Param.Name: customButtonBText
Param.Desc: Specifies a string to use for a second optional custom button B

Item.Name: AlertCritical
Item.Description: Informs the user of a serious problem that requires intervention or correction before work can continue.
Item.ShortDesc: Informs the user of a serious problem that requires intervention or correction before work can continue.
Item.SeeAlso: AlertInform, AlertQuestion, AlertInformDontShowAgain, AlertQuestionDontShowAgain, AlertCriticalHLink, AlertInformHLink, AlertInformHLinkN
Item.Comments: Created by TTF 1/18/2005

Param.Name: advice
Param.Desc: The text to be added in a smaller font under the main information message.

Item.Name: CreateSymbolDisplayControl
Item.Description: Creates a new symbol display control in the dialog layout. The control displays the specified symbol in the specified rendering mode and view. The actual size of the symbol is not relevent; it is shown as large as possible in the given height and width (the height to width ratio of the symbol is always preserved). To show a blank SymbolDisplay control, use an empty string as the symbolName parameter.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:SymbolDisplayControlRenderModesTable]][[BR]][[BR]][[note:SymbolDisplayControlViewsTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new symbol display control in the dialog layout.
Item.Example: CreateSymbolDisplayControl( 5, 6, 'Chair', 350, 200, 5, 11, 9 );[[BR]][[BR]]This creates a dialog control that displays the symbol called "Chair." The control is 350 pixels high and 200 pixels wide, with a margin of 5 pixels. The symbol is rendered in OpenGL mode and displayed in a right isometric view.[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] int :INTEGER;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE dialog1_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Example', TRUE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateSymbolDisplayControl(dialog1, 4, 'Symbol-1', 128, 128, 0, 11, 9);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] int := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, dialog1_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The ID of the dialog in which to create the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The item ID of the control.

Param.Name: symbolName
Param.Desc: The name of the symbol to display.

Param.Name: height
Param.Desc: The height of the control in pixels.

Param.Name: width
Param.Desc: The width of the control in pixels.

Param.Name: margin
Param.Desc: The margin bewteen the border of the control and the symbol in pixels.

Param.Name: renderMode
Param.Desc: The render mode in which to display the symbol.

Param.Name: view
Param.Desc: The view in which to display the symbol.

Item.Name: UpdateSymbolDisplayControl
Item.Description: Updates a pre-existing symbol display control in the dialog with a new symbol, rendering mode, or view. The dialog ID and item ID must refer to symbol display control created with CreateSymbolDisplayControl. To show a blank SymbolDisplay control, use an empty string as the symbolName parameter.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:SymbolDisplayControlRenderModesTable]][[BR]][[BR]][[note:SymbolDisplayControlViewsTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Updates a symbol display control in the dialog layout with a new symbol, rendering mode, or view.
Item.Example: CreateSymbolDisplayControl( 5, 6, 'Chair', 350, 200, 5, 11, 9 );[[BR]]{Other code}[[BR]]UpdateSymbolDisplayControl( 5, 6, 'Chair', 0, 3 );[[BR]][[BR]]This creates a dialog control that displays the symbol called "Chair." The control is 350 pixels high and 200 pixels wide, with a margin of 5 pixels. The symbol is rendered in OpenGL mode and displayed in a right isometric view. It then later updates the control to display the same symbol rendered in Wireframe in a front view.

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The ID of the dialog in which to create the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The item ID of the control.

Param.Name: symbolName
Param.Desc: The name of the symbol to display.

Param.Name: renderMode
Param.Desc: The render mode in which to display the symbol.

Param.Name: view
Param.Desc: The standard view in which to display the symbol.

Item.Name: SetSavedSetting
Item.Description: Writes a value to the saved settings file. This can be used to remember various user settings between running sessions of Vectorworks. For example, a script may want to remember a dialog's position or a font settings. The saved settings should not be used for critical information, but rather for convenience settings.
Item.ShortDesc: Writes a value to the saved settings file.

Item.Name: GetSavedSetting
Item.Description: Reads a value from the saved settnigs file. This can be used to remember various user settings between running sessions of Vectorworks. For example, a script may want to remember a dialog's position or a font settings. The saved settings should not be used for critical information, but rather for convenience settings. [[BR]][[BR]]If the settings file is lost or damaged the script should revert to a reasonable default value, and typically this would not warrant an alert dialog.
Item.ShortDesc: Reads a value from the saved settings file.
Item.Result: Returns true is the requested setting is found and read from the saved settings file, false otherwise.

Item.Name: FindFileInPluginFolder
Item.Description: Searches for filename in all plug-in folders. Returns TRUE if the file is found, FALSE otherwise. If found, the result is returned in the path parameter.
Item.ShortDesc: Searches for filename in all plug-in folders. Returns TRUE if the file is found, FALSE otherwise. If found, the result is returned in the path parameter.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] filename, path :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] filename := 'Callout.vso';[[BR]] IF FindFileInPluginFolder(filename, path) [[BR]] THEN AlrtDialog(path)[[BR]] ELSE AlrtDialog('Could not find file.');[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: BuildResourceList
Item.Description: Creates an implicit list of resources of a specified type, and returns an ID for the list. Values in the list can be retrieved using GetNameFromResourceList.[[BR]][[BR]]If the Display Default Content preference (#130) is on and folderIndex is not 0, it will also include all the resources of the specified type in all the files in the selected folder. [[BR]][[BR]]If folderIndex is positive, the list will include all the resources of that type from the current document, as well as from the specified folder. If folderIndex is 0, only the resources in the current document will be in the list. If folderIndex is negative, only the resources in the specified folder will be in the list. [[BR]][[BR]][[note:ObjTypeNote]][[BR]][[BR]][[note:FolderPath]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a list of all the resources of the specified type in the current file and, if a preference is on, in the specified folder. Returns list ID.
Item.Example: const[[BR]]kHatch = 66;[[BR]]kDefHatchFolder = 105;[[BR]]var[[BR]]listID, numItems: LONGINT;[[BR]]begin[[BR]]{ Create a resource list of hatches from the current document and } [[BR]]{ the default hatch folder. }[[BR]]listID := BuildResourceList(kHatch, kDefHatchFolder, '', numItems);[[BR]]

Param.Name: type
Param.Desc: the type of resource to put in the list

Param.Name: folderIndex
Param.Desc: the index of a VW folder.

Param.Name: subFolderName
Param.Desc: the name of a subfolder inside the folder specified by folderIndex. This can also be a partial path. Use an empty string to request the resources from all files in the folderIndex folder.

Param.Name: numItems
Param.Desc: the number of items in the list built

Item.Name: GetResourceFromList
Item.Description: Returns the indicated resource from the indicated resource list, if the resource is in the current document. Otherwise it returns nil.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the indicated resource from the specified resource list, if the resource is in the current document. Otherwise it returns nil.
Item.Example: hatch := GetResourceFromList(listID, index);[[BR]]if (hatch = NIL) then[[BR]] hatch := ImportResourceToCurrentFile(listID, index);[[BR]]

Param.Name: listID
Param.Desc: an ID for a resource list created by the BuildResourceList command.

Item.Name: DeleteResourceFromList
Item.Description: Deletes the indicated object in the specified resource list.
Item.ShortDesc: Deletes the indicated object in the specified resource list.
Item.Example: hatchName := GetNameFromResourceList(listID, index);[[BR]]if (pos('P', hatchName) = 1) then[[BR]] DeleteResourceFromList(listID, index)[[BR]]

Param.Name: listID
Param.Desc: an ID for a resource list created by the BuildResourceList function.

Item.Name: ResourceListSize
Item.Description: Returns the number of items in the specified resource list.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of items in the specified resource list.
Item.Example: { Update numItems as the number of items in the resource list has }[[BR]]{ changed. }[[BR]]numItems := ResourceListSize(listID);

Param.Name: listID
Param.Desc: an ID for a resouce list created by the BuildResourceList function.

Item.Name: GetNameFromResourceList
Item.Description: Returns the name to display of the indicated item in the specified resource list. If the list has items with the same name from different files, the display name will have the filename added to it in parentheses.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the display name of the indicated item in the specified resource list which includes the appended file name for resources with the same name.
Item.Comments: To get the actual name use GetActualNameFromResourceList.
Item.Example: hatchName := GetNameFromResourceList(listID, index);[[BR]]if (pos('P', hatchName) = 1) then[[BR]] DeleteResourceFromList(listID, index)[[BR]]

Param.Name: listID
Param.Desc: an ID for a resouce list created by the BuildResourceList function.

Item.Name: InsertImagePopupResource
Item.Description: Inserts the indicated item of the specified resource list into the indicated image popup and returns the image popup index of the inserted item.
Item.ShortDesc: Inserts the indicated item of the specified resource list into the indicated image popup and returns the image popup index of the inserted item.
Item.Example: { Add all items in the resource list to the image popup. }[[BR]]for index:=1 to numItems do[[BR]] index := InsertImagePopupResource(dialogID, kImagePopupID, listID, index);[[BR]]

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: index to the dialog layout that contains the image popup component.

Param.Name: componentID
Param.Desc: index to a specific image popup component.

Param.Name: listID
Param.Desc: an ID for a resource list created by the BuildResourceList function.

Item.Name: ImportResourceToCurrentFile
Item.Description: Imports the indicated resource from the specified list to the current file, if it is not already in the current file, and returns the handle to the resource.
Item.ShortDesc: Imports the indicated resource from the specified list to the current file, if it is not already in the current file. It returns the resource.
Item.Example: hatch := GetResourceFromList(listID, index);[[BR]]if (hatch = NIL) then[[BR]] hatch := ImportResourceToCurrentFile(listID, index);

Param.Name: listID
Param.Desc: an ID for a resource list created by the BuildResourceList command.

Item.Name: DisplayTabPane
Item.Description: Causes the specified swap pane to be displayed within the specified swap control. [[BR]][[BR]]This is called from the dialog's event handling routine.
Item.ShortDesc: Causes the specified tab pane to be displayed within the specified tab control.
Item.Comments: Note that pane indeces are 1-based in VectorScript, and 0-based in the SDK. Tab panes are numbered sequentially in the order that they were inserted into the control.
Item.Example: Procedure DialogProc(VAR item: LONGINT; data: LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CASE item OF[[BR]] SetupDialogC:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] result := 0;[[BR]] END;[[BR]][[BR]] 100: DisplaySwapPane(dlogID, 10, 1); { Display pane 1 }[[BR]] 101: DisplaySwapPane(dlogID, 10, 2); { Display pane 2 }[[BR]] 102: DisplaySwapPane(dlogID, 10, 3); { Display pane 3 }[[BR]][[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]

Param.Name: tabControlID
Param.Desc: the ID of the swap control

Param.Name: groupNumber
Param.Desc: 1-based index of the swap pane to be displayed

Item.Name: GetActivePane
Item.Description: Returns the currently displayed tab or swap pane in the specified tab or swap control. [[BR]][[BR]]This is called from the dialog's event handling routine.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the currently displayed tab or swap pane in the specified tab or swap control.
Item.Comments: Note that pane indeces are 1-based in VectorScript, and 0-based in the SDK. Panes are numbered sequentially in the order that they were inserted into the control. This applies to both tab and swap controls.
Item.Example: Procedure DialogProc(VAR item: LONGINT; data: LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CASE item OF[[BR]] SetupDialogC:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] result := 0;[[BR]] END;[[BR]][[BR]] 100: DisplaySwapPane(dlogID, 10, 1); { Display pane 1 }[[BR]] 101: DisplaySwapPane(dlogID, 10, 2); { Display pane 2 }[[BR]] 102: DisplaySwapPane(dlogID, 10, 3); { Display pane 3 }[[BR]][[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]

Param.Name: tabControlID
Param.Desc: the ID of the swap control

Item.Name: AddResourceToList
Item.Description: Adds the indicated resource to the specified resource list, if it is of the same type as the items already in the list. Returns the index of the resource in the list or 0.
Item.ShortDesc: Adds the indicated resource to the specified resource list. Returns the index of the resource in the list.
Item.Example: { Create a new hatch and add it to the resource list. }[[BR]]hatchName := 'Hatch-1';[[BR]]BeginVectorFillN(hatchName, true, false, 0);[[BR]]AddVectorFillLayer(0, 0, 1, 1, .25, -.25, .7, 3, 255);[[BR]]EndVectorFill;[[BR]]newHatch := GetObject(hatchName);[[BR]]index := AddResourceToList(listID, newHatch);[[BR]]

Param.Name: listID
Param.Desc: an ID for a resource list created by the BuildResourceList command.

Param.Name: resource
Param.Desc: a resource to add to the resource list.

Item.Name: SetLayerTransparency
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] assigns a transparency percentage value to the active design layer. If a sheet layer is active, the procedure has no effect. The transparency value must be between 0.0 and 100.0, inclusive.[[BR]][[BR]]The design layer will only be imaged with transparency on systems which support it, like Quartz on the Mac. Setting the transparency to a value greater than 0, when the current transfer mode is Copy (i.e. 8, Paint mode), will also automatically change the layer transfer mode to OR (i.e. 9, Overlay). Similarly, setting the transparency to 0, when the current transfer mode is not set to Copy, will also automatically change the layer transfer mode to Copy. This is to approximately preserve the appearance of the drawing when imaging on systems that don't support transparency, like Windows.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the transparency percentage of the active design layer
Item.Comments: Sets the transparency percentage of the active design layer[[BR]]Valid transparency values are between 0.0 and 100.0, inclusive.[[BR]]This procedure may also set the layer transfer mode to approximate the given transparency on systems that don't support transparency.

Item.ShortDesc: Get current choice for a line weight dialog control. The value is in mils.

Item.ShortDesc: Create a line weight popup dialog control to display list of line weights available in current document.

Item.ShortDesc: Create a dialog control that displays both line style and line weight choices available in the current document.

Original description was: The linestyle it used to use was a dash list index that no longer exists. Line types are used nstead.

Item.Name: CreatePatternPopup
Item.Description: Create a pattern popup dialog control that displays all fill patterns available in current document.
Item.ShortDesc: Create a pattern popup dialog control that displays all fill patterns available in current document.

Item.Name: SetPatternData
Item.Description: Set current choice and colors for the pattern popup dialog control.
Item.ShortDesc: Set current choice and colors for the pattern popup dialog control.

Item.Description: Get current choice for pattern popup dialog control, and the displayed foreground and background color indexes.
Item.ShortDesc: Get current choice for pattern popup dialog control, and the displayed foreground and background color indexes.

Item.Name: CreateColorPopup
Item.Description: Create a color popup dialog control that displays the 256 color palette associated with the active document. [[BR]][[BR]]The widthInStdChar argument specifies the width of the control. Pass -1 to request the default size, which will be consistent with other attribute controls (currently defaults to 14). This argument allows for special circumstances like a small popup for the Fore and Back color associated with the Pattern attribute control.
Item.ShortDesc: Create a color popup dialog control that displays the 256 color palette associated with the active document.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] result :INTEGER;[[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CASE item OF[[BR]] SetupDialogC:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] SetColorChoice(dialog1, 4, 1242);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] 1:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] GetColorChoice(dialog1, 4, result);[[BR]] AlrtDialog(Concat('color index: ', result));[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Example Dialog', FALSE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateColorPopup(dialog1, 4, 24);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: widthInStdChar
Param.Desc: The width of the displayed text in standard character count. See GetDlgCtrlWidthStdCh.

Item.Name: SetColorChoice
Item.Description: Sets the choice for the color popup dialog control to the specified color index.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the choice for the color popup dialog control to the specified color index.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] result :INTEGER;[[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CASE item OF[[BR]] SetupDialogC:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] SetColorChoice(dialog1, 4, 1242);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] 1:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] GetColorChoice(dialog1, 4, result);[[BR]] AlrtDialog(Concat('color index: ', result));[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Example Dialog', FALSE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateColorPopup(dialog1, 4, 24);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: GetColorChoice
Item.Description: Get current choice for color popup dialog control.
Item.ShortDesc: Get current choice for color popup dialog control.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] result :INTEGER;[[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CASE item OF[[BR]] SetupDialogC:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] SetColorChoice(dialog1, 4, 1242);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] 1:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] GetColorChoice(dialog1, 4, result);[[BR]] AlrtDialog(Concat('color index: ', result));[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Example Dialog', FALSE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateColorPopup(dialog1, 4, 24);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: SetMarkerChoice
Item.Description: OBSOLETE procedure for VW2008[[BR]][[BR]]Set current choice for Marker popup dialog control. Index is the standing position of marker; it is -1 for customized, otherwise 1-based index.[[BR]]Style is the chosen shape of arrow head . Style is zero-based. The angle parameter must be in range 0 to 90 degrees, depending on the style. Size is per Inches. Style, angle and size may be changed by user in VW preferences.[[BR]]Further, the function can find a specific Index , given the right Style, Angle & Size. In such case index should be set to -1. If the given properties correspond to one of indecies, then -1 is replaced with that specific index.[[BR]]When using pre-defined arrow heads, style & angle & size may be passed zero and just fill in the proper index to set the current.
Item.ShortDesc: Set current choice for Marker popup dialog control - OBSOLETE procedure for VW2008, use SetMarkerValue instead.
Item.Comments: OBSOLETE procedure for VW2008, use SetMarkerValue instead.[[BR]]Set current choice for Marker popup dialog control.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE dialog1_Main;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] int, dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] index, style, angle, size :INTEGER;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE dialog1_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CASE item OF[[BR]] SetupDialogC:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] index := 1;[[BR]] style := 2;[[BR]] angle := 3;[[BR]] size := 4;[[BR]] SetMarkerChoice(dialog1, 4, index, style, angle, size);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] 5: [[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] GetMarkerChoice(dialog1, 4, index, style, angle, size);[[BR]] AlrtDialog(Concat('index: ', index, Chr(13), 'style: ', style, Chr(13), 'angle: ', angle, Chr(13), 'size: ', size));[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Test', False, 'OK', '');[[BR]] CreateMarkerPopup(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] CreatePushButton(dialog1, 5, ' Display Values ');[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] SetBelowItem(dialog1, 4, 5, 0, 2);[[BR]] int := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, dialog1_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(dialog1_Main);[[BR]]

Item.Name: GetMarkerChoice
Item.Description: OBSOLETE procedure for VW2008[[BR]]Get current choice for Marker popup dialog control.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets Marker Values from Dialog MarkerPopupControl - OBSOLETE procedure for VW2008, use GetMarkerValue
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] int, dialogID :INTEGER;[[BR]] index, style, angle :INTEGER;[[BR]] size :REAL;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CASE item OF[[BR]] SetupDialogC:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] index := 1;[[BR]] style := 2;[[BR]] angle := 3;[[BR]] size := .125;[[BR]] SetMarkerChoice(dialogID, 4, index, style, angle, size);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] 5: [[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] GetMarkerChoice(dialogID, 4, index, style, angle, size);[[BR]] AlrtDialog(Concat([[BR]] 'index: ', index, Chr(13), [[BR]] 'style: ', style, Chr(13), [[BR]] 'angle: ', angle, Chr(13), [[BR]] 'size: ', size));[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialogID := CreateLayout('Test', False, 'OK', '');[[BR]] CreateMarkerPopup(dialogID, 4);[[BR]] CreatePushButton(dialogID, 5, ' Display Values ');[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialogID, 4);[[BR]] SetBelowItem(dialogID, 4, 5, 0, 2);[[BR]] int := RunLayoutDialog(dialogID, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: DisplayOrganizationDialog
Item.Description: Displays the organization dialog with the specified integer as the initially slected tab.[[BR]]0: The most recently displayed tab is selected[[BR]]1: The Classes tab is selected .[[BR]]2: The Design Layers tab is selected.[[BR]]3: The Sheet Layers tab is selected.[[BR]]4: The Viewports tab is selected.[[BR]]5: The Saved Views tab is selected.[[BR]]

Item.Name: InsertNewComponent
Item.Description: Deprecated - will generate error. Use InsertNewComponentN instead.
Item.ShortDesc: Deprecated - will generate error. Use InsertNewComponentN instead.
Item.Comments: Deprecated - will generate error. Use InsertNewComponentN instead.[[BR]]The dash style it used no longer exists. Line types are used instead. Original description was: Inserts a new component in an object.

Param.Name: object

Item.Name: SetCustomObjectCntrlPtVis
Item.Description: Sets the control point of objectHand specified by the one-based index controlPtIndex to the visibility specified by setVisible.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the control point of objectHand specified by the one-based index controlPtIndex to the visibility specified by setVisible.

Item.Name: SetWSRowHeight
Item.Description: Sets the height of a row in the referenced worksheet.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] allows height to be set for a range of rows. To set the height of a single worksheet row, specify identical values for the top/bottom row range boundaries.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] also allows the lock state of a row to be set. Set 'TRUE' to lock or 'FALSE' to unlock the row height. If the height is locked, the row will not automatically resize to fit the contents of the cells when text is entered.[[BR]][[BR]]If the "updatePalette'" parameter is set to FALSE, the applied changes will not automatically be updated in the worksheet palette.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the specified height for the specified worksheet rows.
Item.Comments: Note:[[BR]]updatePalette - input - specifies whether or not to update the worksheet palette[[BR]]lockHeight - input - specifies whether or not to lock the height for the specified rows.[[BR]] If 'true' the height will be locked and the row will not automatically be resized when text is entered in a cell.
Item.Example: {Sets and locks the height of all rows from row 3 to row 9 to 22 pixels and update the changes in the worksheet palette }[[BR]]SetWSRowHeight(sheet,3,9,22,TRUE,TRUE);

Param.Name: height
Param.Desc: Row height to be set (in pixels)

Param.Name: lockHeight
Param.Desc: Row height lock state to be set

Item.Name: GetWSRowHLockState
Item.Description: Returns the lock state of a row in the referenced worksheet[[BR]][[BR]]Note: If a row height is locked, the row will not automatically resize to fit the contents of the cells when text is entered.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the lock state of a row in the referenced worksheet
Item.Example: {Gets the lock state of the fifth row in the specified worksheet}[[BR]]GetWSRowHLockState(sheet,5,lockstate);

Param.Name: lockState
Param.Desc: Row Height lock state ( returns TRUE is row height is locked ; FALSE otherwise)

Item.Name: AutoFitWSRowHeights
Item.Description: Auto fit the height of rows to the content of the cells in the referenced worksheet.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] allows height for a range of rows to be auto fitted to the contents of cells. To auto fit the height of a single worksheet row, specify identical values for the top/bottom row range boundaries.
Item.ShortDesc: Auto fit the height of rows to the content of the cells in the referenced worksheet
Item.Example: {Auto resizes the height of all rows from row 1 to row 4} [[BR]]AutoFitWSRowHeights(sheet,1,4};

Item.Name: SetWSCellVertAlignment
Item.Description: Sets the vertical alignment of cells in the referenced worksheet.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] allows a vertical alignment to be set for a range of cells. To set the vertical alignment of a single cell, specify identical values for the top/bottom and left/right range boundaries.[[BR]][[BR]]Note:[[BR]]Vertical alignment constants:[[BR]]top = 1[[BR]]center = 3[[BR]]bottom = 5
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the vertical alignment of cells in the referenced worksheet.
Item.Comments: Vertical alignment constants:[[BR]]top = 1[[BR]]center = 3[[BR]]bottom = 5

Param.Name: vAlignment
Param.Desc: Vertical alignment index value to be set

Item.Name: GetWSCellVertAlignment
Item.Description: Returns the vertical alignment setting of a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the vertical alignment setting of a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.Comments: Vertical alignment constants:[[BR]]top = 1[[BR]]center = 3[[BR]]bottom = 5

Param.Name: row
Param.Desc: Row index of cell to be queried

Param.Name: column
Param.Desc: Column index of cell to be queried

Item.Name: SetWSCellWrapTextFlag
Item.Description: Sets the wrap text state of cells in the referenced worksheet.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] allows wrap text to be set for a range of cells. To set wrap text in a single cell, specify identical values for the top/bottom and left/right range boundaries.[[BR]]If the wrap text flag is "TRUE" in a cell, text will wrap at the cell border
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the wrap text state of cells in the referenced worksheet.

Param.Name: wrapTextFlag
Param.Desc: Wrap text flag to be set

Item.Name: GetWSCellWrapTextFlag
Item.Description: Returns the wrap text state of a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the wrap text state of a cell in the referenced worksheet.

Param.Name: row
Param.Desc: Row of cell to be queried

Param.Name: column
Param.Desc: Row of cell to be queried

Item.Name: SetWSTextAngle
Item.Description: Sets the text angle of a cell the referenced worksheet.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] allows text angle to be set for a range of cells. To set the text angle for a single cell, specify identical values for the top/bottom and left/right range boundaries.[[BR]][[BR]]Note:[[BR]]VW12 supports only horizontal text (0 degree) and vertical text (90 degrees).
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the specified text angle for the specified worksheet cells.
Item.Comments: Note:[[BR]]VW12 supports only horizontal text (0 degree) and vertical text (90 degrees). So, the input of any angle different from 0 will be handled as 90 degrees in VW12.

Item.Name: GetWSCellTextAngle
Item.Description: Returns the text angle of a cell in the referenced worksheet
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the text angle of a cell in the referenced worksheet

Param.Name: row
Param.Desc: Row of cell to be queried

Param.Name: column
Param.Desc: Column of cell to be queried

Item.Name: SetWSCellTextColor
Item.Description: Sets the text color of a cell in the referenced worksheet[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] allows text color to be set for a range of cells. To set the text color for a single cell, specify identical values for the top/bottom and left/right range boundaries.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the specified text color for the specified worksheet cells

Param.Name: color
Param.Desc: Text color index value to be set

Item.Name: GetWSCellTextColor
Item.Description: Returns the text color of a cell in the referenced worksheet
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the text color of a cell in the referenced worksheet

Param.Name: row
Param.Desc: Row of cell to be queried

Param.Name: column
Param.Desc: Column of cell to be queried

Item.Name: SetWSCellFill
Item.Description: Sets the fill style and color of a cell in the referenced worksheet[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] allows cell fill style and color text to be set for a range of cells. To set fill style and color for a single cell, specify identical values for the top/bottom and left/right range boundaries.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the specified fill style and color for the specified worksheet cells
Item.Comments: bgcolor - cell background color (0 if none)[[BR]]fgcolor - cell foreground color (0 if none)[[BR]]fillpattern - cell fill pattern index (-1 if none)[[BR]][[BR]]Fill style constants:[[BR]]no fill = 0[[BR]]solid fill= 1[[BR]]pattern fill= 2[[BR]][[BR]]

Param.Name: style
Param.Desc: Cell fill style to be set

Param.Name: bgcolor
Param.Desc: Cell background color index value to be set

Param.Name: fgcolor
Param.Desc: Cell foreground color index value to be set

Param.Name: fillpattern
Param.Desc: Cell pattern index value to be set

Item.Name: GetWSCellFill
Item.Description: Returns the fill style and color of a cell in the referenced worksheet
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the fill style and color of a cell in the referenced worksheet
Item.Comments: bgcolor - cell background color (0 if none)[[BR]]fgcolor - cell foreground color (0 if none)[[BR]]fillpattern - cell fill pattern index (-1 if none)[[BR]][[BR]]Fill style constants:[[BR]]no fill = 0[[BR]]solid fill= 1[[BR]]pattern fill= 2

Param.Name: row
Param.Desc: Row of cell to be queried

Param.Name: column
Param.Desc: Column of cell to be queried

Item.Name: SetWSCellBorders
Item.Description: Sets the borders of cells in the referenced worksheet[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] allows borders to be set for a rectangular range of cells. To set the border formatting of a single cell, specify identical values for the top/bottom and left/right range boundaries.[[BR]][[BR]]Note:[[BR]]A rectangular range of cells is formatted as a single block of cells. If you apply a right border to the range of cells, the border is displayed only on the right edge of the cells. [[BR]][[BR]]The borders will be created with default values ( solid style, black color, standard weight).
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the borders of cells in the referenced worksheet.
Item.SeeAlso: SetWSCellOutlineBorder, SetWSCellInsideVertBorder, SetWSCellInsideHorizBorder, SetWSCellTopBorder, SetWSCellLeftBorder, SetWSCellBottomBorder, SetWSCellRightBorder
Item.Comments: OulineInside defines the ouline, inside horizontal amd inside vertical borders.[[BR]]Available constants:[[BR]]0 : outline = false, inside horizontal = false, inside vertical = false[[BR]]1 : outline = true, inside horizontal = false, inside vertical = false[[BR]]2 : outline = false, inside horizontal = true, inside vertical = false[[BR]]3 : outline = true, inside horizontal = true, inside vertical = false[[BR]]4 : outline = false, inside horizontal = false, inside vertical = true[[BR]]5 : outline = true, inside horizontal = false, inside vertical = true[[BR]]6 : outline = false, inside horizontal = true, inside vertical = true[[BR]]7 : outline = true, inside horizontal = true, inside vertical = true
Item.Example: { Sets the inside horizontal and vertical borders for the specified rectangular range of cells}[[BR]][[name]](sheet,2,4,1,5,FALSE,FALSE,FALSE,FALSE,6);[[BR]][[BR]]{ Sets an outline border for the specified rectangular range of cells}[[BR]][[name]](sheet,2,4,1,5,FALSE,FALSE,FALSE,FALSE,1);[[BR]]{or}[[BR]][[name]](sheet,2,4,1,5,TRUE,TRUE,TRUE,TRUE,0);

Item.Name: GetFileInfo
Item.Description: This function gets the attributes of a file.
Item.ShortDesc: This function gets the attributes of a file.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] fileName :STRING;[[BR]] fullReadPath, fullWritePath :STRING;[[BR]] readFileExists, writeFileExists, locked, hasReadPermission, hasWritePermission, hasFolderPermission :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] fileName := Concat(GetFolderPath(1), 'ADINIT.DAT');[[BR]] GetFileInfo(fileName, fullReadPath, fullWritePath, readFileExists, writeFileExists, locked, hasReadPermission, hasWritePermission, hasFolderPermission);[[BR]] ReWrite('Output.txt');[[BR]] WriteLn('fileName: ', fileName);[[BR]] WriteLn('fullReadPath: ', fullReadPath);[[BR]] WriteLn('fullWritePath: ', fullWritePath);[[BR]] WriteLn('readFileExists: ', readFileExists);[[BR]] WriteLn('writeFileExists: ', writeFileExists);[[BR]] WriteLn('locked: ', locked);[[BR]] WriteLn('hasReadPermission: ', hasReadPermission);[[BR]] WriteLn('hasWritePermission: ', hasWritePermission);[[BR]] WriteLn('hasFolderPermission: ', hasFolderPermission);[[BR]] Close('Output.txt');[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: CreateDuplicateObject
Item.Description: Duplicates the specified object and inserts the new object into the container. If container is nil, the new object will be inserted in the active container.
Item.ShortDesc: Duplicates the specified object and inserts the new object into the container. If container is nil, the new object will be inserted in the active container.
Item.Comments: This should be used inplace of a SetParent.

Param.Name: containerHandle
Param.Desc: The container to the newly duplicated object

Item.Description: Prepares some other related object for a change thats about to occur.

Item.Comments: This call adds an eBeforeModify primitive to the specified object provided that the undo system is currently building an undo event.

Param.Name: objectAboutToBeChange
Param.Desc: The object to be prepared for a change

Item.Name: CreateIconPushButton
Item.Description: Creates an icon push button with the specified icon ID and width in characters.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates an icon push button with the specified icon ID and width in characters. This call has been deprecated, use "CreateImagePushButton" instead.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] result :INTEGER;[[BR]] boo :BOOLEAN;[[BR]] [[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]END;[[BR]] [[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] boo := SetVSResourceFile('IP Resources');[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Example Dialog', FALSE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateIconPushButton(dialog1, 4, 11021, 20);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: nIconID
Param.Desc: the index of the ICN# resource in the currently open rsrc file (or qtr on Windows)

Param.Name: widthInStdChar
Param.Desc: The width of the displayed text in standard character count. See GetDlgCtrlWidthStdCh.

Item.Name: BeginContext
Item.Description: Use this function in conjuction with EndContext to starts logging changes that are made until the EndContext is reached.
Item.ShortDesc: Use this function in conjuction with EndContext to starts logging changes that are made until the EndContext is reached.
Item.Comments: If you do not use this construct and you create a temporary plug-in object that itself creates a new class, the new class will remain even after you delete the temporary plug-in object.

Item.Name: EndContext
Item.Description: Use this function in conjuction with BeginContext to have VW automatically accept or reject any changes that were made during the Begin/End block.
Item.ShortDesc: Use this function in conjuction with BeginContext to have VW automatically accept or reject any changes that were made during the Begin/End block.
Item.Comments: If you do not use this construct and you create a temporary plug-in object that itself creates a new class, the new class will remain even after you delete the temporary plug-in object.

Param.Name: acceptOrReject
Param.Desc: Specify 0 to reject changes or 1 to accept changes

Item.Name: ObjArea
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the area of the referenced object.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the area of the referenced object. The value will be in the current Area Units.

Item.Name: ObjSurfaceArea
Item.Description: Function [[name]] calculates the surface area of the referenced solid object. The function supports only valid solids objects.
Item.ShortDesc: Calculates the surface area of the referenced solid. The value will be in the current Area Units.
Item.Comments: Calculates the surface area of the given object if a valid solid.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] volume, area: REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] IF FSActLayer <> NIL THEN BEGIN[[BR]] volume := CalcVolume(FSActLayer);[[BR]] area := CalcSurfaceArea(FSActLayer);[[BR]] Message('Volume ', volume, ', surface area ', area);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: ObjVolume
Item.Description: Function [[name]] calculates the volume of the referenced solid object. The function supports only valid solids objects.
Item.ShortDesc: Calculates the volume of the referenced solid object. The value will be in the current Volume Units.
Item.Comments: Calculates the volume of the given object if a valid solid.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] volume, area: REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] IF FSActLayer <> NIL THEN BEGIN[[BR]] volume := CalcVolume(FSActLayer);[[BR]] area := CalcSurfaceArea(FSActLayer);[[BR]] Message('Volume ', volume, ', surface area ', area);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: CriteriaArea
Item.Description: Returns the area of an object. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the sum of all the matching object areas.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the area of the objects matching the search criteria. The value will be in the current area units.
Item.Example: totalA:=Area((C='Plywood')and(L='First'));[[BR]]{returns the area of all objects in class 'Plywood' on layer 'First'}

Item.Name: CriteriaSurfaceArea
Item.Description: Returns the surface area of the items matching the specified criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the sum of all the surface areas of the matching objects will be returned. [[BR]][[BR]][[name]] will return only return areas on objects which support the solids modelling functions.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the surface area of the items matching the current criteria. The value will be in the current Area units.
Item.Comments: This function returns the surface area of the items matching the current criteria. It will return 0 for any objects that will not work with the solids modeling functions.

Item.Name: CriteriaVolume
Item.Description: Returns the volume of the items matching the specified criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the sum of all the volumes of the matching objects will be returned. [[BR]][[BR]][[name]] will return only return volumes on objects which support the solids modelling functions.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the volume of the items matching the current criteria. The value will be in the current Volume units.
Item.Comments: This function returns the volume of the items matching the current criteria. It will return 0 for any objects that will not work with the solids modeling functions.

Item.Name: Split2DObjectByLine
Item.Description: Splits objectHd along a line defined by the two points.
Item.ShortDesc: Splits objectHd along a line defined by the two points.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] polyHandle :HANDLE;[[BR]] lineHandle :HANDLE;[[BR]] resultHandle :HANDLE;[[BR]] begPt :VECTOR;[[BR]] endPt :VECTOR;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CallTool(-204); polyHandle := FSActLayer;[[BR]] CallTool(-201); lineHandle := FSActLayer;[[BR]] GetSegPt1(lineHandle, begPt.x, begPt.y);[[BR]] GetSegPt2(lineHandle, endPt.x, endPt.y);[[BR]] Split2DObjectByLine(polyHandle, begPt.x, begPt.y, endPt.x, endPt.y, resultHandle);[[BR]] resultHandle := CreateDuplicateObject(resultHandle, NIL);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: AcquireExportPDFSettingsAndLocation
Item.Description: Asks the user for the Export PDF settings and the PDF file name (or folder name if the parameter is true). This is intended to support Batch PDF Export.
Item.ShortDesc: Asks the user for the Export PDF settings and the PDF file name (or folder name if the parameter is true). This is intended to support Batch PDF Export.

Item.Name: OpenPDFDocument
Item.Description: Begins the export to a PDF document. You must call AcquireExportPDFSettingsAndLocation before calling this function. This is intended to support Batch PDF Export.
Item.ShortDesc: Begins the export to a PDF document. You must call AcquireExportPDFSettingsAndLocation before calling this function. This is intended to support Batch PDF Export.

Item.Name: ExportPDFPages
Item.Description: This will export the current document to PDF. You must call OpenPDFDocument before calling this function. This is intended to support Batch Export to PDF.
Item.ShortDesc: This will export the current document to PDF. You must call OpenPDFDocument before calling this function. This is intended to support Batch Export to PDF.

Item.Name: ClosePDFDocument
Item.Description: This will finish creating the PDF document that you started with OpenPDFDocument. This is intended to support Batch Export to PDF.
Item.ShortDesc: This will finish creating the PDF document that you started with OpenPDFDocument. This is intended to support Batch Export to PDF.

Item.Name: CreateWallStyle
Item.Description: Creates a new Wall Style of the give name. If the name is already in use, the next available name will be used.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new Wall Style of the given name. If the name is already in use, the next available name will be used.
Item.Result: Returns a handle to the new Wall Style.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]CONST[[BR]] wallStyleName = 'Example Wall Style';[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] wallStyleHandle :HANDLE;[[BR]] wdth :REAL;[[BR]] fill :LONGINT;[[BR]] pwLeft, pwRight, psLeft, psRight :INTEGER;[[BR]] boo :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] wallStyleHandle := CreateWallStyle(wallStyleName);[[BR]] wdth := 1";[[BR]] fill := 1; {solid white}[[BR]] pwLeft := 14; {in mils}[[BR]] pwRight := 14; {in mils}[[BR]] psLeft := 2; {solid black}[[BR]] psRight := 2; {solid black}[[BR]] boo := InsertNewComponent(wallStyleHandle, 1, wdth, fill, pwLeft, pwRight, psLeft, psRight);[[BR]] SetName(wallStyleHandle, wallStyleName); {Reset the wall style name.}[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: wallStyleName
Param.Desc: The name of the new Wall Style. If the name is already in use, the next available name will be used.

Item.Name: SetMarkerValue
Item.Description: Sets MarkerPopup value in dialog (replaces MarkerPopup procedures prior to VW2008).
Item.ShortDesc: Sets MarkerPopup value in dialog (replaces MarkerPopup procedures prior to VW2008).
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] int, dialogID :INTEGER;[[BR]] style, angle, thicknessBasis :INTEGER;[[BR]] width, length, thickness :REAL;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CASE item OF[[BR]] SetupDialogC:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] style := 130;[[BR]] angle := 0;[[BR]] width := .125;[[BR]] length := .125;[[BR]] thickness := 0;[[BR]] thicknessBasis := 0;[[BR]] SetMarkerValue(dialogID, 4, style, angle, width, length, thicknessBasis, thickness);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] 5: [[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] GetMarkerValue(dialogID, 4, style, angle, width, length, thicknessBasis, thickness);[[BR]][[BR]] AlrtDialog(Concat([[BR]] 'style: ', style, Chr(13), [[BR]] 'angle: ', angle, Chr(13), [[BR]] 'width: ', width,Chr(13),[[BR]] 'length: ', length, Chr(13),[[BR]] 'thickness: ', thickness, Chr(13),[[BR]] 'thicknessBasis: ', thicknessBasis));[[BR]][[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialogID := CreateLayout('Test', False, 'OK', '');[[BR]] CreateMarkerPopup(dialogID, 4);[[BR]] CreatePushButton(dialogID, 5, ' Display Values ');[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialogID, 4);[[BR]] SetBelowItem(dialogID, 4, 5, 0, 2);[[BR]] int := RunLayoutDialog(dialogID, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: ID of the marker popup control

Item.Name: GetMarkerValue
Item.Description: Gets MarkerPopup value in dialog (replaces MarkerPopup procedures prior to VW2008).
Item.ShortDesc: Gets MarkerPopup value in dialog (replaces MarkerPopup procedures prior to VW2008).
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] int, dialogID :INTEGER;[[BR]] style, angle, thicknessBasis :INTEGER;[[BR]] width, length, thickness :REAL;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CASE item OF[[BR]] SetupDialogC:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] style := 130;[[BR]] angle := 0;[[BR]] width := .125;[[BR]] length := .125;[[BR]] thickness := 0;[[BR]] thicknessBasis := 0;[[BR]] SetMarkerValue(dialogID, 4, style, angle, width, length, thicknessBasis, thickness);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] 5: [[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] GetMarkerValue(dialogID, 4, style, angle, width, length, thicknessBasis, thickness);[[BR]][[BR]] AlrtDialog(Concat([[BR]] 'style: ', style, Chr(13), [[BR]] 'angle: ', angle, Chr(13), [[BR]] 'width: ', width,Chr(13),[[BR]] 'length: ', length, Chr(13),[[BR]] 'thickness: ', thickness, Chr(13),[[BR]] 'thicknessBasis: ', thicknessBasis));[[BR]][[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialogID := CreateLayout('Test', False, 'OK', '');[[BR]] CreateMarkerPopup(dialogID, 4);[[BR]] CreatePushButton(dialogID, 5, ' Display Values ');[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialogID, 4);[[BR]] SetBelowItem(dialogID, 4, 5, 0, 2);[[BR]] int := RunLayoutDialog(dialogID, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: ID of the marker popup control

Param.Name: style
Param.Desc: On return, indicates the style of the selected marker

Param.Name: angle

Item.Name: CreateClassPullDownMenu
Item.Description: Creates a Layout Manager class pull down menu control.

Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] result :INTEGER;[[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]END;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Example Dialog', FALSE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateClassPullDownMenu(dialog1, 4, 24);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: widthInStdChar

Item.Name: CreateTreeControl
Item.Description: Creates a Layout Manager tree control.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a Layout Manager tree control.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] result :INTEGER;[[BR]] widthInStdChar, heightInLines :INTEGER;[[BR]] root1, root2, child1, child2 :INTEGER;[[BR]][[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] CASE item OF[[BR]] SetupDialogC:[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] root1 := InsertTreeControlItem(dialog1, 4, 'root1', -1, 0);[[BR]] child1 := InsertTreeControlItem(dialog1, 4, 'child1', root1, 0);[[BR]] child2 := InsertTreeControlItem(dialog1, 4, 'child2', root1, child1);[[BR]] root2 := InsertTreeControlItem(dialog1, 4, 'root2', -1, root1);[[BR]] child1 := InsertTreeControlItem(dialog1, 4, 'child1', root2, 0);[[BR]] child2 := InsertTreeControlItem(dialog1, 4, 'child2', root2, child1);[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Example Dialog', FALSE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] widthInStdChar := 28;[[BR]] heightInLines := 8;[[BR]] CreateTreeControl(dialog1, 4, widthInStdChar, heightInLines);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: widthInStdChar
Param.Desc: The width of the displayed text in standard character count. See GetDlgCtrlWidthStdCh.

Item.Name: GetWSSubrowActualCellString
Item.Description: Returns the actual string in a database subrow cell.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the actual string in a database subrow cell.
Item.Comments: Gets the specified worksheet subrow cell's actual string.[[BR]]WARNING: Because database subrow cells and their contents are dynamically created based on the current database of objects and the current critieria string any return values from this function are not guaranteed to be correct beyond this function call. Use this function carefully and at your own risk.

Param.Name: subrow
Param.Desc: Index of subrow cell to be queried.

Item.Name: ForEachObjectAtPoint
Item.Description: Performs an action for each object at the specified point in the drawing. This call was implemented to get past the practical limitations of PickObject, which only finds the topmost object. This call will find all of the objects at a given point.[[BR]][[BR]]"actionFunc" should actually be a function, not a procedure as the declaration indicates.[[BR]][[BR]]If the callback function returns FALSE, ForEachObjectAtPoint will not process any more objects at the specified point.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ForEachObjectAtPoint]]
Item.ShortDesc: Performs an action for each point in an object.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] gx1, gy1 : REAL;[[BR]][[BR]]FUNCTION DoIt(h1 :HANDLE) :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] DSelectAll;[[BR]] SetSelect(h1);[[BR]] Redraw;[[BR]] Wait(1);[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetPt(gx1, gy1);[[BR]] ForEachObjectAtPoint(DoIt, 0, 0, gx1, gy1, 5);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);
Item.SpecialOverride: CHECKFEOATPOINT(procForEachObjectAtPoint, MP_FEOAtPoint, userProcMode, intMode, intMode, globPtMode, realMode);

Item.Name: DisplayContextualHelp
Item.Description: Using the identifier string for a GUI element given by the Contextual Help Manager displays the associated contextual help. This could be a WebWorks webpage, a Internet webpage or even a local file.
Item.ShortDesc: Using the identifier string for a GUI element given by the Contextual Help Manager displays the associated contextual help. This could be a WebWorks webpage, a Internet webpage or even a local file.

Item.Name: ModelVecToScreenVec
Item.Description: Takes Data from one space to another.
Item.ShortDesc: Transforms a vector from world coordinate to the screen coordinates in plan rotation. The transformation ignores translation and just takes into account rotation.
Item.Comments: This routine transforms a given vector from model(object) to VCS.

Item.Name: ScreenVecToModelVec
Item.Description: Takes data from one space to another
Item.ShortDesc: Transforms a vector from screen coordinate in plan rotation to the model coordinates. The translation part of the transformation is ignored and only rotation is taken into account.
Item.Comments: This routine transform a given point from VCS(object) to Model. Ignores the translation of the plan rotation matrix. Just takes into account the rotation

Item.Name: SetCustomObjectColor
Item.Description: Store/Set an auxilary color index in 'objectHand' so GetCustomObjectColor can access it later. Application will preserve the color mapped to inTagID.
Item.ShortDesc: Store/Set an auxilary color index in 'objectHand' so GetCustomObjectColor can access it later. Application will preserve the color mapped to inTagID.
Item.Result: Returns TRUE if the operation was successful.

Item.Name: GetCustomObjectColor
Item.Description: Get an auxilary color index stored in'objectHand' previously with SetCustomObjectColor . Aplication will preserve the color mapped to inTagID.
Item.ShortDesc: Get an auxilary color index stored in'objectHand' previously with SetCustomObjectColor . Aplication will preserve the color mapped to inTagID.
Item.Result: Returns TRUE if the operation was successful.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] objName :STRING;[[BR]] objHand, recHand, wallHand :HANDLE;[[BR]] colorIndexBefore, colorIndexAfter :INTEGER;[[BR]] boo :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] IF GetCustomObjectInfo(objName, objHand, recHand, wallHand) THEN BEGIN[[BR]] RGBToColorIndex(pRed, pGreen, pBlue, colorIndexBefore);[[BR]] Rect(0, 0, 1, 1);[[BR]] SetFillBack(LNewObj, colorIndexBefore);[[BR]] IF SetCustomObjectColor(objHand, 1, colorIndexBefore) THEN BEGIN[[BR]] boo := GetCustomObjectColor(objHand, 1, colorIndexAfter);[[BR]] AlrtDialog(Concat('before: ', colorIndexBefore, Chr(13), 'after: ', colorIndexAfter));[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Item.Name: NumColors
Item.Description: Returns the last used color index in the current document.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the last used color index in the current document.
