Item.Name: RemoveCustomObjectColor
Item.Description: Deletes an auxilary color index stored in 'objectHand' previously with SetCustomObjectColor.
Item.ShortDesc: Deletes an auxilary color index stored in 'objectHand' previously with SetCustomObjectColor.

Item.Name: FOpacityByClass
Item.Description: Returns whether the global attributes are set to use the opacity of the default class.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns whether the global attributes are set to use the opacity of the default class.
Item.Comments: Returns whether the global attributes are set to use the opacity of the default class.[[BR]][rl 8/30/07]

Item.Name: GetProjection
Item.Description: Returns the projection index from the specified layer.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the projection index from the specified layer.

Param.Name: theyLayer
Param.Desc: Layer which the projection is returned for.

Item.Name: GetLBHeaderTextWidth
Item.Description: Produces the width in pixels that will show the given string without truncation in a listbrowser column header. This will provide a guaranteed appropriate width for InsertLBColumn.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the pixel width that will show the given string without truncation in a listbrowser column header. This will provide a guaranteed appropriate width for InsertLBColumn.

Item.Name: SetDefaultTexMap
Item.Description: Set the object to have default texture mapping info. Texture resource being used is set with SetTextureRef. Similar to SetDefaultTextureSpace except that routine has been superseded in version 2009.
Item.ShortDesc: NOTE: Use SetDefaultTexMapN with version 2010 and above.

Item.Name: SetTexMapBool
Item.Description: Set map info for specific part of object. partID is texture part, overall is 3. Selector: init:1, flip:2, repH:3, repV:4, long edge:5, worldZ:6, auto align:7
Item.ShortDesc: NOTE: Use SetTexMapxxxN with version 2010 and above.

Item.Name: GetTexMapBool
Item.Description: Get map info for specific part of object. partID is texture part, overall is 3. Selector: init:1, flip:2, repH:3, repV:4, long edge:5, worldZ:6, auto align:7
Item.ShortDesc: NOTE: Use GetTexMapxxxN with version 2010 and above.

Item.Name: GetTexMapInt
Item.Description: Get map info for specific part of object. partID is texture part, overall is 3. Selector should be1, to return the texture map type integer.
Item.ShortDesc: NOTE: Use GetTexMapxxxN with version 2010 and above.

Item.Name: SetTexMapInt
Item.Description: Set map info for specific part of object. partID is texture part, overall is 3. Selector should be 1 to set the map type integer.
Item.ShortDesc: NOTE: Use SetTexMapxxxN with version 2010 and above.

Item.Name: SetTexMapReal
Item.Description: Set map info for specific part of object. partID is texture part, overall is 3. Selector: offsetX:1, offsetY:2, scale2D:3, rotate2D:4, radius:5, matrix mat00 through mat32: 6-17
Item.ShortDesc: NOTE: Use SetTexMapxxxN with version 2010 and above.

Item.Name: GetTexMapReal
Item.Description: Get map info for specific part of object. partID is texture part, overall is 3. Selector: offsetX:1, offsetY:2, scale2D:3, rotate2D:4, radius:5, matrix mat00 through mat32: 6-17
Item.ShortDesc: NOTE: Use GetTexMapxxxN with version 2010 and above.

Item.Name: CreateRWBackground
Item.Description: Creates a Renderworks Background resource using the image from an existing Image resource. Width and height are set to default sizes relative to the page size.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a Renderworks Background resource using the image from an existing Image resource. Width and height are set to default sizes relative to the page size.

Item.Name: GetCustomObjectSelectionGroup
Item.Description: Access the handle to selection group. This group contains geometry that defines the selection and pre-selection indication of this object.
Item.ShortDesc: Access the handle to selection group. This group contains geometry that defines the selection and pre-selection indication of this object.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the selection group.

Item.Name: SetCustomObjectSelectionGroup
Item.Description: Set selection indication geometry for a parametric object.
Item.ShortDesc: Set selection indication geometry for a parametric object.
Item.Result: Returns TRUE if the operation was successful.

Param.Name: selGroup
Param.Desc: Handle to object or group that contains geometry for selection indication.

Item.Name: GetCustomObjectWallHoleGroup
Item.Description: Access the handle to wall hole group. This group contains geometry that defines the opening that will be cut into the wall for this parametric object.
Item.ShortDesc: Access the handle to wall hole group. This group contains geometry that defines the opening that will be cut into the wall for this parametric object.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the wall hole group.

Item.Name: SetCustomObjectWallHoleGroup
Item.Description: Set wall hole geometry for a parametric object.
Item.ShortDesc: Set wall hole geometry for a parametric object.
Item.Result: Returns TRUE if the operation was successful.

Param.Name: holeGroup
Param.Desc: Handle to object or group that contains geometry for wall hole.

Item.Name: ZCenter
Item.Description: Returns the z-coordinate value of the center of an object matching the search criteria
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the z-coordinate value of the center of an object matching the search criteria

Item.Name: WallArea_Gross
Item.Description: Returns the average of the gross area of the interior and exterior face of the wall. The gross area ignores holes in the wall.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the average of the gross area of the interior and exterior face of the wall. The gross area ignores holes in the wall.

Item.Name: WallArea_Net
Item.Description: Returns the average of the net area of the interior and exterior face of the wall. The net area is adjusted for holes in the wall.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the average of the net area of the interior and exterior face of the wall. The net area is adjusted for holes in the wall.

Item.Name: WallAverageHeight
Item.Description: Returns the average height of walls, including wall peaks and different starting and ending heights.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the average height of walls, including wall peaks and different starting and ending heights.

Item.Name: WallThickness
Item.Description: Returns the thickness of walls that meet the criteria.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the thickness of walls that meet the criteria.

Item.Name: SlabThickness
Item.Description: Returns the thickness of slab objects that meet the criteria.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the thickness of slab objects that meet the criteria.

Item.Name: RoofArea_Total
Item.Description: Returns the total area along the slope of roofs or roof faces that meet the criteria.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the total area along the slope of roofs or roof faces that meet the criteria.

Item.Name: RoofArea_Heated
Item.Description: Returns the heated (interior) area along the slope of roofs or roof faces that meet the criteria.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the heated (interior) area along the slope of roofs or roof faces that meet the criteria.

Item.Name: RoofArea_TotalProj
Item.Description: Returns the total area projected on the ground plane of roofs or roof faces that meet the criteria.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the total area projected on the ground plane of roofs or roof faces that meet the criteria.

Item.Name: RoofArea_HeatedProj
Item.Description: Returns the heated (interior) area projected on the ground plane of roofs or roof faces that meet the criteria.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the heated (interior) area projected on the ground plane of roofs or roof faces that meet the criteria.

Item.Name: GetWSSubrowHeight
Item.Description: Return the height of a database subrow in the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Return the height of a database subrow in the referenced worksheet.
Item.Result: Return the height of a database subrow in the referenced worksheet.

Param.Name: subrow
Param.Desc: The database subrow to be queried

Param.Name: height
Param.Desc: Output parameter. Return the height (in pixels)

Item.Name: SetHeight
Item.Description: Set height of the passed object.
Item.ShortDesc: Set height of the passed object.

Param.Name: value
Param.Desc: The new height of the object.

Item.Name: SetWidth
Item.Description: Set width of the passed object.
Item.ShortDesc: Set width of the passed object.

Param.Name: value
Param.Desc: The new width of the object.

Item.Name: SetAngle
Item.Description: Set angle of the passed object.
Item.ShortDesc: Set angle of the passed object.

Param.Name: value
Param.Desc: The new rotation angle of the object. Angle in degrees (-180;180] measured from (1,0) vector.

Item.Name: GetPrefRGB
Item.Description: Procedure GetPrefRGB return the RGB color components of the specified preference item. The RGB values are in the range of 0 - 65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Procedure GetPrefRGB return the RGB color components of the specified preference item.

Item.Name: SetPrefRGB
Item.Description: Procedure SetPrefRGB return the RGB color components of the specified preference item. The color must be specified using the RGB components of the desired color. The RGB values are in the range of 0 - 65535.
Item.ShortDesc: Procedure SetPrefRGB sets the RGB color components of the specified preference item.

Item.Name: EnableDrawingWorksheetPalette
Item.Description: Enables/disables drawing for the specified worksheet or all displayed worksheet palettes if worksheet is nil.[[BR]][[BR]]To improve speed and avoid flickering, it is highly recommended to disable drawing in worksheet palettes before performing several write operations in an opened worksheet. [[BR]]Enable drawing back when the operations are completed. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Enables/disables drawing for worksheet palettes.
Item.Example: {Disable drawing in all displayed worksheet palettes.}[[BR]]EnableDrawingWorksheetPalette(false, nil);[[BR]][[BR]]{Write it worksheets ....}[[BR]]...[[BR]]...[[BR]]...[[BR]][[BR]]{Enable back drawing in all displayed worksheet palettes.}[[BR]]EnableDrawingWorksheetPalette(true, nil);

Param.Name: enable
Param.Desc: Specifies if worksheet palettes' drawing should be enabled or disabled.

Param.Name: worksheet
Param.Desc: Handle to specific worksheet for which to enable/disable drawing; Set it to nil to enable/disable drawing in all displayed worksheet palettes.

Item.Name: GetWSAutoRecalcState
Item.Description: Gets the AutoRecalc state for the specified worksheet.[[BR]][[BR]]When the AutoRecalc flag is on for a worksheet, it automatically recalculates every time a cell is edited.[[BR]][[BR]]In order to improve speed when editing mutiple cells one after the other or in a loop, it is highly recommended to turn this flag off prior to the edits and restore it, then recalculate the worksheet when all the edits are completed.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the AutoRecalc state for the specified worksheet.
Item.Example: {Save the current AutoRecalc state}[[BR]]state := GetWSAutoRecalcState(h);[[BR]][[BR]]{Turn off worksheet Auto Recalculation}[[BR]]SetWSAutoRecalcState(h,false);[[BR]][[BR]]{Execute worksheet edit operations ....}[[BR]][[BR]]{Restore AutoRecalc state}[[BR]]SetWSAutoRecalcState(h, state);[[BR]][[BR]]{Recalculate the worksheet}[[BR]]RecalculateWS(h);

Item.Name: SetWSAutoRecalcState
Item.Description: Sets the AutoRecalc flag for the specified worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the AutoRecalc flag for the specified worksheet.
Item.Example: {Save the current AutoRecalc state}[[BR]]state := GetWSAutoRecalcState(h);[[BR]][[BR]]{Turn off worksheet Auto Recalculation}[[BR]]SetWSAutoRecalcState(h,false);[[BR]][[BR]]{Execute worksheet edit operations ....}[[BR]][[BR]]{Restore AutoRecalc state}[[BR]]SetWSAutoRecalcState(h, state);[[BR]][[BR]]{Recalculate the worksheet}[[BR]]RecalculateWS(h);

Item.Name: GetVersionEx
Item.Description: Returns version information about the Vectorworks application. Parameter [[p:1]] returns the major version number of the application. Parameters [[p:2]] and [[p:3]] return minor version information. Parameter [[p:4]] returns the OS platform on which Vectorworks is running (1 = Macintosh, 2 = Windows).[[BR]]Parameter [[p:5]] returns the build number of the version.[[BR]][[BR]]Vectorworks 2008 has version major number 13, 2009 - 14 and so on.[[BR]][[BR]]For example:[[BR]][[BR]]Vectorworks 2010.0.1 running on a Macintosh would return:[[BR]][[BR]][[p:1]]: 15[[BR]][[p:2]]: 0[[BR]][[p:3]]: 1[[BR]][[p:4]]: 1[[BR]][[p:5]]: 95668[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Returns extended version information on Vectorworks.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR [[BR]] osMajor, osMinor, osIncr, buildNum :LONGINT; [[BR]] appMajor, appMinor, appMaint, platform :INTEGER;[[BR]] platformStr :STRING;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetVersionEx(appMajor, appMinor, appMaint, platform, buildNum);[[BR]] GetOSVersion(osMajor, osMinor, osIncr);[[BR]] IF (platform = 1) [[BR]] THEN platformStr := 'MacOS'[[BR]] ELSE platformStr := 'Windows';[[BR]] Message('Vectorworks ', appMajor, '.', appMinor, '.', appMaint, ' build ', buildNum, ' running on ', platformStr, ' ', osMajor, '.', osMinor, '.', osIncr);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: major
Param.Desc: Returns major version number of application.

Param.Name: minor
Param.Desc: Returns minor version number of application.

Param.Name: maintenance
Param.Desc: Returns maintenance version number of application.

Param.Name: buildNum
Param.Desc: Returns the build number of application.

Item.Name: ConvertHSF2PosixPath
Item.Description: Machintosh only![[BR]][[BR]]Converts HSF (using ':' as delimiter) file path to Posix (using '/' as delimiter) file path.
Item.ShortDesc: Machintosh only! Converts HSF (using ':' as delimiter) file path to Posix (using '/' as delimiter) file path.
Item.Result: Returns true if the conversion succeeds. False if it fails.[[BR]]The resulted Posix path will be the same as the passed HSF path if the function fails.

Param.Name: HSFPath
Param.Desc: The HSF path that is to be converted.

Param.Name: outPosixPath
Param.Desc: Output parameter. Returns the converted path. If the function does not succeed the returned value is the passed 'HSFPath' value.

Item.Name: ConvertPosix2HSFPath
Item.Description: Machintosh only! [[BR]][[BR]]Converts Posix (using '/' as delimiter) file path to HSF (using ':' as delimiter) file path.
Item.ShortDesc: Machintosh only! Converts Posix (using '/' as delimiter) file path to HSF (using ':' as delimiter) file path.
Item.Result: Returns true if the conversion succeeds. False if it fails.[[BR]]The resulted Posix path will be the same as the passed Posix path if the function fails.

Param.Name: PosixPath
Param.Desc: The Posix path that is to be converted.

Param.Name: outHSFPath
Param.Desc: Output parameter. Returns the converted path. If the function does not succeed the returned value is the passed 'PosixPath' value.

Item.Name: TrackObject
Item.Description: Interactively, including highlighting, allows the user to select one object meeting the specified criteria.[[BR]][[BR]]The callback function (any of these depending on what info is needed):[[BR]][[BR]]FUNCTION Callback(h : HANDLE): BOOLEAN;[[BR]]FUNCTION CheckObjCallback(h : HANDLE; px, py : REAL) : BOOLEAN;[[BR]]FUNCTION CheckObjCallback(h : HANDLE; px, py, pz : REAL) : BOOLEAN;[[BR]][[BR]]is used to let the user filter the object that can be returned from the function.[[BR]][[BR]]The parameteri px,py,pz pass into the function information about current cursor position in document units.[[BR]][[BR]]This callback function is called when tracking over an object; also when click happens over an object.[[BR]][[BR]]The callback function return true if the passed handle can be returned.
Item.ShortDesc: Interactively, including highlighting, allows the user to select one object meeting the specified criteria.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Test;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h : HANDLE;[[BR]] x, y, z : REAL;[[BR]] [[BR]] FUNCTION CheckObjCallback(h : HANDLE) : BOOLEAN;[[BR]] {or FUNCTION CheckObjCallback(h : HANDLE; px, py : REAL) : BOOLEAN;}[[BR]] {or FUNCTION CheckObjCallback(h : HANDLE; px, py, pz : REAL) : BOOLEAN;}[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] {any object is ok}[[BR]] CheckObjCallback := true;[[BR]] END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] TrackObject( CheckObjCallback, h, x, y, z );[[BR]] SetSelect( h );[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN( Test );[[BR]]

Param.Name: callback
Param.Desc: The callback that will be called to check if an object meets the requrements to be tracked. See remarks.

Param.Name: outObj
Param.Desc: Returns handle of the object for which the callback returned TRUE.

Item.Name: GetPt3D
Item.Description: Procedure GetPt3D switches the cursor to 3D selection mode and allows the user to select a point in a VectorWorks document. This cannot be used if there is a function anywhere in the calling chain.
Item.ShortDesc: Procedure GetPt3D switches the cursor to 3D selection mode and allows the user to select a point in a VectorWorks document. This cannot be used if there is a function anywhere in the calling chain.

Param.Name: useWPOnly
Param.Desc: TRUE if the returned point have to be on the active Working Plane. Snapping to arbitrary 3D geometry will produce vertical projection result on the WP; FALSE if the point can be arbitrary 3D point (produced, for example, by snapping to a 3D geometry)

Item.Name: GetPtL3D
Item.Description: Procedure GetPtL3D creates a temporary "rubberband" 3D line from a specified point to the user selected end point. This cannot be used if there is a function anywhere in the calling chain.
Item.ShortDesc: Procedure GetPtL3D creates a temporary "rubberband" 3D line from a specified point to the user selected end point. This cannot be used if there is a function anywhere in the calling chain.

Param.Name: useWPOnly
Param.Desc: TRUE if the returned point have to be on the active Working Plane. Snapping to arbitrary 3D geometry will produce vertical projection result on the WP; FALSE if the point can be arbitrary 3D point (produced, for example, by snapping to a 3D geometry)

Item.Name: GetLine3D
Item.Description: Procedure GetLine3D returns two user selected points, and draws a temporary "rubberband" 3D line when prompting for the second point. This cannot be used if there is a function anywhere in the calling chain.
Item.ShortDesc: Procedure GetLine3D returns two user selected points, and draws a temporary "rubberband" 3D line when prompting for the second point. This cannot be used if there is a function anywhere in the calling chain.

Param.Name: p1
Param.Desc: Returns coordinates of first user click.

Param.Name: p2
Param.Desc: Returns coordinates of second user click.

Param.Name: useWP
Param.Desc: TRUE if the returned point have to be on the active Working Plane. Snapping to arbitrary 3D geometry will produce vertical projection result on the WP; FALSE if the point can be arbitrary 3D point (produced, for example, by snapping to a 3D geometry)

Item.Name: GetRect3D
Item.Description: Procedure GetRect3D draws a temporary "rubberband" 3D rectangle on the working plane. The user defines the rectangle by selecting two points which define the top left and bottom right of the rectangle. This cannot be used if there is a function anywhere in the calling chain.
Item.ShortDesc: Procedure GetRect3D draws a temporary "rubberband" 3D rectangle on the working plane. The user defines the rect by selecting two points - top left and bottom right. This cannot be used if there is a function anywhere in the calling chain.

Param.Name: p1
Param.Desc: Returns coordinates of first user click.

Param.Name: p2
Param.Desc: Returns coordinates of second user click.

Param.Name: useWP
Param.Desc: TRUE if the returned point have to be on the active Working Plane. Snapping to arbitrary 3D geometry will produce vertical projection result on the WP; FALSE if the point can be arbitrary 3D point (produced, for example, by snapping to a 3D geometry)

Item.Name: RunTempTool
Item.Description: Runs a temp tool. The call waits until the tool has finished. The callback function is notified for the tool events.
Item.ShortDesc: Runs a temp tool. The call waints until the tool has finished. The callback function is notified for the tool events.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Test;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] pt1, pt2 : POINT;[[BR]][[BR]] FUNCTION TempToolCallback(action, msg1, msg2 : LONGINT) : LONGINT;[[BR]] VAR pt : POINT;[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] TempToolCallback := 0;[[BR]] CASE action OF[[BR]] 3: BEGIN {kOnToolDoSetupEventID}[[BR]] vstSetHelpString ( 'Just click once.' );[[BR]] END;[[BR]][[BR]] 103 : BEGIN {kToolDrawEventID}[[BR]] vstGetCurrPt2D( pt.x, pt.y );[[BR]] vstDrawCoordLine( pt.x, pt.y, pt1.x, pt1.y );[[BR]] vstDrawCoordLine( pt.x, pt.y, pt2.x, pt2.y );[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]] END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] pt1.x := 0; pt1.y := 0;[[BR]] pt2.x := 100mm; pt2.y := 100mm;[[BR]] RunTempTool( TempToolCallback, FALSE );[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN( Test );

Param.Name: toolCallback
Param.Desc: Procedure that will be called with the tool events.[[BR]]FUNCTION ToolCallback(action, msg1, msg2 : INTEGER) : INTEGER;

Param.Name: initialScroll
Param.Desc: For experts. Pass FALSE if you want a simple temp tool. Setting it to TRUE will add one extra point (0,0) before the tool runs. This will make the tool scroll before the first click. This means that your tool handler must recognize and skip that extra fir

Item.Name: AlertInformDontShowAgain
Item.Description: Displays an alert dialog which provides the user with information about the result of a command with an option to not show the dialog again. It offers no user choices.[[BR]][[BR]]The parameter 'arrOptions' is of type ARRAY [1..3] OF STRING;[[BR]]arrOpt[1] - Saved setting category to save checkbox value[[BR]]arrOpt[2] - Saved setting item to save checkbox value [[BR]]arrOpt[3] - Specify the string to use in overriding the default 'Dont show this dialog again' checkbox string
Item.ShortDesc: Displays an alert dialog which provides the user with information about the result of a command with an option to not show the dialog again.
Item.SeeAlso: AlertInform, AlertQuestion, AlertCritical, AlertQuestionDontShowAgain, AlertCriticalHLink, AlertInformHLink, AlertInformHLinkN
Item.Comments: Created by TTF 1/9/2009
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]][[BR]]VAR[[BR]] arrayText : ARRAY[1..3] OF STRING;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] arrayText[1] := 'DontShowDialogAgainCategory';[[BR]] arrayText[2] := 'DontShowDialogAgainItem'; {Should be unique for every AlertInformDontShowAgain}[[BR]] arrayText[3] := '';[[BR]][[BR]] AlertInformDontShowAgain('This is an invalid item.', '', false, arrayText);[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: advice
Param.Desc: The text to be added in a smaller font under the main information message.

Param.Name: minorAlert
Param.Desc: The severity of the alert: minor(true) or major(false).

Param.Name: arrOptions
Param.Desc: ARRAY [1..3] OF STRING; arrOpt[1] - Saved setting category to save checkbox value arrOpt[2] - Saved setting item to save checkbox value arrOpt[3] - Specify a string to use in overriding the default 'Dont show this dialog again' checkbox string

Item.Name: AlertQuestionDontShowAgain
Item.Description: Displays an alert dialog which alerts the user to a condition or situation that requires the user's decision and input before preceding; such as an impending action with potentially destructive or irreversible consequences with the option to always do the selected action and not show the dialog again. The message should be in the form of a question.[[BR]][[BR]]The parameter 'arrOptions' is of type ARRAY [1..3] OF STRING;[[BR]]arrOpt[1] - Saved setting category to save checkbox value[[BR]]arrOpt[2] - Saved setting item to save checkbox value [[BR]]arrOpt[3] - Specify a string to use in overriding the default 'Always do the selection action' checkbox string
Item.ShortDesc: Alerts the user to a condition that requires the user's decision with an option to not show the dialog again.
Item.Result: Return Values[[BR]]0: the negative button was hit[[BR]]1: the positive button was hit[[BR]]2: custom button A was hit[[BR]]3: custom button B was hit
Item.SeeAlso: AlertInform, AlertQuestion, AlertCritical, AlertInformDontShowAgain, AlertCriticalHLink, AlertInformHLink, AlertInformHLinkN
Item.Comments: Created by TTF 1/9/2009
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]][[BR]]VAR[[BR]] result :INTEGER;[[BR]] arrayText : ARRAY[1..3] OF STRING;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] arrayText[1] := 'DontShowDialogAgainCategory';[[BR]] arrayText[2] := 'DontShowDialogAgainItem'; {Should be unique for every AlertQuestionDontShowAgain}[[BR]] arrayText[3] := '';[[BR]][[BR]] result := AlertQuestionDontShowAgain('Do you want to continue?', '', 0, 'Yes', 'No', '', '', arrayText);[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: advice
Param.Desc: The text to be added in a smaller font under the main information/message

Param.Name: defaultButton
Param.Desc: Specifies which button is to be made the default[[BR]]0: the negative button is the default[[BR]]1: the positive button is the default[[BR]]2: custom button A is the default [[BR]]3: custom button B is the default

Param.Name: OKOverrideText
Param.Desc: Specifies a string to use in overriding the 'OK' string

Param.Name: CancelOverrideText
Param.Desc: Specifies a string to use in overriding the 'Cancel' string

Param.Name: customButtonAText
Param.Desc: Specifies a string to use for an optional custom button A

Param.Name: customButtonBText
Param.Desc: Specifies a string to use for a second optional custom button B

Param.Name: arrOptions
Param.Desc: ARRAY [1..3] OF STRING; arrOpt[1] - Saved setting category to save checkbox value arrOpt[2] - Saved setting item to save checkbox value arrOpt[3] - Specify a string to use in overriding the default 'Always do the selection action' checkbox string

Item.ShortDesc: Set map info for specific part of object. partID is texture part, overall is 3. Selector: init:1, flip:2, repH:3, repV:4, long edge:5, worldZ:6, auto align:7

Item.ShortDesc: Get map info for specific part of object. partID is texture part, overall is 3. Selector: init:1, flip:2, repH:3, repV:4, long edge:5, worldZ:6, auto align:7

Item.ShortDesc: Set map info for specific part of object. partID is texture part, overall is 3. Selector: offsetX:1, offsetY:2, scale2D:3, rotate2D:4, radius:5, matrix mat00 through mat32: 6-17

Item.Name: GetTexMapRealN
Item.Description: Get map info for specific part of object. partID is texture part, overall is 3. Selector: offsetX:1, offsetY:2, scale2D:3, rotate2D:4, radius:5, matrix mat00 through mat32: 6-17
Item.ShortDesc: Get map info for specific part of object. partID is texture part, overall is 3. Selector: offsetX:1, offsetY:2, scale2D:3, rotate2D:4, radius:5, matrix mat00 through mat32: 6-17

Item.Description: Returns number of texture layers (base + decals) for the specified part.

Item.Name: SetStaticTextStyle

Item.Name: RegisterDialogForTimerEvents
Item.Description: Register the dialog so that it can receive events periodically using the given time delay. Using the command will make Vectorworks send the event 'DialogTimerEventMessageC' to the dialog handler on the specified time interval.
Item.ShortDesc: Register the dialog so that it can receive events periodically using the given time delay.

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: the dialog identifier given by CreateLayout or CreateResizableLayout

Param.Name: timerDelayInMilliseconds
Param.Desc: The amount of time in milliseconds between each event DialogTimerEventMessageC that is going to be sent to the dialog handler function.

Item.Name: DeregisterDialogFromTimerEvents
Item.Description: Removes the dialog from the timer event registry system.
Item.ShortDesc: Removes the dialog from the timer event registry system.

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: the dialog identifier given by CreateLayout or CreateResizableLayout

Item.Name: DialogTimerEventMessageC
Item.Description: This constant represents the message that is sent periodically to a dialog handler after it has been registered to receive timer events.
Item.ShortDesc: This constant represents the message that is sent periodically to a dialog handler after it has been registered to receive timer events.

Item.Name: SetObjectAsCornerBreak
Item.Description: Sets an object's corner break flag in it's corner break record. [[BR]][[BR]]Setting the flag to TRUE will force the object into the closest end of the wall and set the offset position of the break record to reflect this.[[BR]][[BR]]Setting the flag to FALSE will unset the corner flag, but no further updating to the object will occur.[[BR]][[BR]]The oject (objH) must be contained in wall (wallH) for the setting to succeed.
Item.ShortDesc: Set an object's break record Corner Break flag.
Item.Result: True or False upon successfull setting of the flag.[[BR]][[BR]]False can occur for the following conditions:[[BR]]objH is null.[[BR]]wallH is null.[[BR]]objH is not contained in wallH.[[BR]]

Param.Name: objH
Param.Desc: The handle of the object to update.

Param.Name: wallH
Param.Desc: The handle of the wall cotainting the object referenced in objH.

Param.Name: cornerBreak
Param.Desc: Boolean value to set or unset the cornerBreak flag for the object.

Item.Name: SetObjectWallOffset
Item.Description: Sets an object's offset value in it's break record. [[BR]][[BR]]The oject (objH) must be contained in wall (wallH) for the setting to succeed.
Item.ShortDesc: Set the offset for the object within the wall.
Item.Result: True or False upon successfull setting of the flag.[[BR]][[BR]]False can occur for the following conditions:[[BR]]objH is null.[[BR]]wallH is null.[[BR]]objH is not contained in wallH.

Param.Name: objH
Param.Desc: Handle of object to set a new offset value for.

Param.Name: wallH
Param.Desc: Handle of wall containing the object refernces in objH.

Param.Name: offset
Param.Desc: Value of new offset for object within wall.

Item.Name: GetWallCapAttributesType
Item.Description: Gets the wall cap attributes type of a wall or round wall. The wall cap attributes type determines whether the wall caps have the wall line attributes or the component lines attributes. If they have the component lines attributes, each wall component is capped with its own left line attributes.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the wall cap attributes type of a wall or round wall.
Item.Result: The wall cap attributes type.[[BR]][[BR]]0 - The wall cap attributes are the wall line attributes[[BR]]1 - The wall cap attributes are the wall component lines attributes

Param.Name: wall
Param.Desc: The handle to the wall or round wall.

Item.Name: SetWallCapAttributesType
Item.Description: Sets the wall cap attributes type of a wall or round wall. The wall cap attributes type determines whether the wall caps have the wall line attributes or the component lines attributes. If they have the component lines attributes, each wall component is capped with its own left line attributes.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the wall cap attributes type of a wall or round wall.

Param.Name: wall
Param.Desc: The handle to the wall or round wall.

Param.Name: wallCapAttributesType
Param.Desc: The wall cap attributes type.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]0 - The wall cap attributes are the wall line attributes[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]1 - The wall cap attributes are the wall component lines attributes

Item.Name: GetCoreWallComponent
Item.Description: Gets the core wall component of an object.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the core wall component of the object.
Item.Result: The index of the core wall component. If it is 0, there is no core wall component.

Param.Name: object
Param.Desc: The object. Can be a wall, round wall, Wall Style, or the Wall Preferences.

Item.Name: SetCoreWallComponent
Item.Description: Sets the core wall component of an object.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the core wall component of an object.

Param.Name: object
Param.Desc: The object. Can be a wall, round wall, Wall Style, or the Wall Preferences.

Param.Name: coreWallComponent
Param.Desc: The index of the core wall component. 0 will cause there to be no core wall component.

Item.Name: GetWallHoleTexturePart
Item.Description: Gets the wall texture part of an object in the wall hole group of a symbol definition or plug-in object. This is the wall texture part given to faces of the wall that are created by cutting a hole in the wall with the object.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the wall texture part of an object in the wall hole group of a symbol definition or plug-in object.
Item.Result: The wall texture part.[[BR]][[BR]]0 - The wall Holes texture part[[BR]]1 - The wall Left texture part[[BR]]2 - The wall Right texture part

Param.Name: object
Param.Desc: The handle to the cutting object in the wall hole group of a symbol definition or plug-in object.

Item.Name: SetWallHoleTexturePart
Item.Description: Sets the wall texture part of an object in the wall hole group of a symbol definition or plug-in object. This is the wall texture part given to faces of the wall that are created by cutting a hole in the wall with the object.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the wall texture part of an object in the wall hole group of a symbol definition or plug-in object.

Param.Name: object
Param.Desc: The handle to the cutting object in the wall hole group of a symbol definition or plug-in object.

Param.Name: part
Param.Desc: The wall texture part.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]0 - The wall Holes texture part[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]1 - The wall Left texture part[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]2 - The wall Right texture part

Item.Name: CreateWallFeature
Item.Description: Creates a Wall Feature in the wall from the profile object. The Wall Feature can be a projection from the wall or a recess in the wall.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a Wall Feature in the wall from the profile object.
Item.Result: The handle to the created Wall Feature.

Param.Name: wall
Param.Desc: The handle to the wall in which to create the Wall Feature.

Param.Name: profile
Param.Desc: The handle to the object to use as the Wall Feature profile.

Item.Name: SetTempToolHelpStr
Item.Description: Sets a text to be used as help string for temp tool calls: RunTempTool, TrackObject, GetPt, GetPtL, GetPt3D, and GetPtL3D.[[BR]][[BR]]This function should be called prior to calling the tool.[[BR]][[BR]]The help string will be used for subsequent temp tool runs until changed.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets a text to be used as help string for temp tool calls: RunTempTool, TrackObject, GetPt, GetPtL, GetPt3D, and GetPtL3D
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Test;[[BR]]VAR h : HANDLE;[[BR]] [[BR]] FUNCTION CheckObjCallback(h : HANDLE) : BOOLEAN;[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] {any object is ok}[[BR]] CheckObjCallback := true;[[BR]] END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]SetTempToolHelpStr( 'Select any object' );[[BR]]TrackObject( CheckObjCallback, h );[[BR]]SetSelect( h );[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN( Test );

Param.Name: helpString
Param.Desc: The help string for the next temp tool.

Item.Name: GetCurrentLocalization
Item.Description: Get the Vectorworks language in the ISO 639-3 draft standard Language ID and sublanguage is unused and will be the empty string reserved for future use for a regional dialect.[[BR]][[BR]]Currently this will always return the same language for a given installation of Vectorworks.
Item.ShortDesc: Get the Vectorworks language in the ISO 639-3 draft standard Language ID and sublanguage is unused and will be the empty string ..

Param.Name: language
Param.Desc: Output parameter. Returns language in ISO 639-3 draft standard Language ID.

Param.Name: subLanguage
Param.Desc: Output parameter. Unused. Returns empty string.

Item.Name: RGBToColorIndexN
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] converts the Vectorworks palette colors from its' red, green, and blue component values to the Vectorworks color index. Parameters [[p:1]], [[p:2]], and [[p:3]] return the color components of the swatch, and parameter [[p:4]] is the Vectorworks color index. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535. Parameter [[p:5]] specifies whether the black background preference should be ignored. If set to TRUE, black and white indexes will not be inverted in black background.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ColorTableNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Converts RGB values to color palette index.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] red, green, blue :LONGINT;[[BR]] colorIndex :INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] GetPenFore(FSActLayer, red, green, blue);[[BR]] RGBToColorIndexN(red, green, blue, colorIndex, TRUE);[[BR]] Message(colorIndex);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example)

Param.Name: ignoreBlackBackground
Param.Desc: Ignore black background preference setting or not.

Item.Name: ColorIndexToRGBN
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] converts the Vectorworks palette colors from the colors' palette position index to its red, green, and blue component values. RGB values are in the range of 0~65535.Parameter [[p:5]] specifies whether the black background preference should be ignored. If set to TRUE, black and white indexes will not be inverted in black background.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ColorTableNote]]
Item.ShortDesc: Converts a color palette index to RGB values.
Item.Example: [[name]](257,r,g,b,TRUE);[[BR]]{returns the color value components of the color index 257 (black)}[[BR]]{Because ignoreBlackBackground is set to TRUE, the result }[[BR]]{will always be black RGB color regardless of the black background }{preference setting.}

Param.Name: ignoreBlackBackground
Param.Desc: Ignore black background preference setting or not.

Item.Name: NumSelectedObjects
Item.Description: Returns the number of selected objects in all working layers.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of currently selected objects in all working layers.

Item.Name: Flip3DObj
Item.Description: This function will flip a 3D object either horizontally or vertically. Its main use is for withing plugin objects when building their geometry and there is a need to mirror a piece.[[BR]][[BR]]The supported types are: Extrude, Sweep, MultiExtrude, Symbol, Mesh and CSGNode.
Item.ShortDesc: Flip a 3D object on its X or Y.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE FlipTest;[[BR]]{This script will create an extrude, dupicate it and then flip it horizontally}[[BR]]VAR h1, h2 : HANDLE;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]][[BR]]ClosePoly;[[BR]][[BR]]BeginXtrd(0', 4');[[BR]] BeginPoly;[[BR]] AddPoint( -5', 3' );[[BR]] AddPoint( 0, 3' );[[BR]] AddPoint( 0, 6' );[[BR]] AddPoint( 5', 0 );[[BR]] AddPoint( 0, -6');[[BR]] AddPoint( 0', -3');[[BR]] AddPoint(-5', -3');[[BR]] EndPoly;[[BR]]EndXtrd;[[BR]][[BR]]h1 := LNewObj;[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]Move3DObj( h1, 5', 0 , 0 );[[BR]]h2 := CreateDuplicateObject( h1, NIL );[[BR]][[BR]]Flip3DObj( h2 , TRUE );[[BR]]Move3DObj( h2, -5', 0, 0 );[[BR]][[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]Run(FlipTest);

Param.Name: h
Param.Desc: The handle of the 3D object to flip.

Param.Name: horiz
Param.Desc: TRUE for a horizonal flip, FALSE for a vertical flip.

Item.Name: GetLBItemPatternIndex
Item.Description: Gets the specified list browser item's pattern index.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the specified list browser item's pattern index.

Item.Name: GetDashStyleIndex
Item.Description: Deprecated - will generate error. Use GetDashStyleIndexN instead.
Item.ShortDesc: Deprecated - will generate error. Use GetDashStyleIndexN instead.
Item.Comments: Deprecated - will generate error. Use GetDashStyleIndexN instead.

Item.Name: SetDashStyleN
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a new linestyle in a Vectorworks document. Parameter name defines the name of the linestyle, parameter swt defines whether the linestyle will be scaled with thickness, and parameter numPairs specifies the number of length pairs defining the linestyle.[[BR]][[BR]]The linestyle is defined by up to five black/white length pairs, which are specified in parameters b1,w1 through b5,w5. The minimum length of any given black or white parameter is 1 point, or 1/72 of an inch, and the line specification must be in pairs.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new active linestyle.

Item.Name: RedrawSelection
Item.Description: This will update selection indication without redrawing the drawing.
Item.ShortDesc: This will update selection indication without redrawing the drawing.

Item.Name: LeftButtonC
Item.Description: This constant is used as a control ID when a button must appear in the lower left corner of a dialog.
Item.ShortDesc: This constant is used as a control ID when a button must appear in the lower left corner of a dialog.
Item.Comments: Added 10/30/09 by Adam Petrone.

Item.Name: DeleteSymbolDefinition
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] deletes the referenced symbol definition from the document. If bCompletely is TRUE, all corresponding symbol instances will be deleted completely; otherwise, the symbol instances will be replaced with loci.
Item.ShortDesc: Deletes the referenced symbol definition.

Param.Name: bCompletely
Param.Desc: Determines whether to replace the corresponding symbol instances with loci or delete the instances completely.

Item.Name: SetEntityMatrix
Item.Description: Sets the matrix of the plane for a planar object. If there is already a plane in the document with that matrix, the object will be set to be in that plane. Otherwise a new plane will be added to the document.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the matrix of the plane for a planar object.
Item.Result: Returns true if the object passed is a planar object.

Param.Name: objectHandle
Param.Desc: The object whose plane is being set.

Param.Name: offset
Param.Desc: The offset of the plane in current document units.

Param.Name: rotationXAngle
Param.Desc: The rotation of the plane about the X-axis in degrees.

Param.Name: rotationYAngle
Param.Desc: The rotation of the plane about the Y-axis in degrees.

Param.Name: rotationZAngle
Param.Desc: The rotation of the plane about the Z-axis in degrees.

Item.Name: GetEntityMatrix
Item.Description: Gets the matrix of the plane for a planar object.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the matrix of the plane for a planar object.
Item.Result: Returns true if the object passed is a planar object.

Param.Name: objectHandle
Param.Desc: The object for which the matrix of its plane is being obtained.

Param.Name: offset
Param.Desc: The offset of the plane in current document units.

Param.Name: rotationXAngle
Param.Desc: The rotation of the plane about the X-axis in degrees.

Param.Name: rotationYAngle
Param.Desc: The rotation of the plane about the Y-axis in degrees.

Param.Name: rotationZAngle
Param.Desc: The rotation of the plane about the Z-axis in degrees.

Item.Name: SetTextAdorner
Item.Description: This function creates a relationship between the specified text block and the text adorner such that when theText Block is scaled in a VP, the text adorner is also scaled. Several objects can be adorned to the same text object.
Item.ShortDesc: This function creates a relationship between the specified text block and the text adorner such that when the Text Block is scaled in a VP, the text adorner is also scaled. Several objects can be adorned to the same text object.
Item.Result: - 'true' if the operation was successful.[[BR]]- 'false' otherwise.[[BR]]

Param.Name: textAdorner
Param.Desc: The object used to adorn the specified text.

Param.Name: p
Param.Desc: The point by which texts will be scaled.

Item.Name: BeginGroupN
Item.Description: May be used to create objects in an existing group by passing a group handle; if a handle initialized to nil is passed a new group is created.

Item.Example: BeginGroupN(groupHandle);[[BR]] Rect(-1,1,0.5,0);[[BR]]EndGroup;[[BR]]{ adds created rect to existing group }[[BR]][[BR]]groupHandle := nil;[[BR]]BeginGroupN(groupHandle);[[BR]] Rect(-1,1,0.5,0);[[BR]]EndGroup;[[BR]]{ creates new group and adds created rect to created group }

Param.Name: groupHandle
Param.Desc: The group handle to be used; if handle is initialized to nil a new group is created.

Item.Name: GetPopUpChoiceIndex
Item.Description: Gets the zero based index of the first choice in the pop-up which has itemText name. If there is no choice named itemText in the pop-up itemIndex is set to -1.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the zero based index of the first choice in the pop-up which has itemText name. If there is no choice named itemText in the pop-up itemIndex is set to -1.

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: the dialog identifier given by CreateLayout or CreateResizableLayout

Param.Name: componentID
Param.Desc: The identifier of the component which choice index will be retrieved from by a given choice name.

Param.Name: itemText
Param.Desc: The name of the choice which index will be obtained.

Param.Name: itemIndex
Param.Desc: The index of the given choice's string in the pop-up. If there are duplicate choice name itemIndex is the index of the first choice having itemText name.

Item.Name: AreaN
Item.Description: Returns the area of an object. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the sum of all the matching object areas.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the area of the objects matching the search criteria.
Item.Example: totalA:=[[name]]((C='Plywood'));[[BR]]{returns the area of all objects in class 'Plywood'}

Item.Name: BotBoundN
Item.Description: Returns the y-coordinate of the bounding box (bottom right corner) of an object matching the search criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the value of the coordinate of the bottommost matching object found.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the y-coordinate value of the bottom right corner of the object matching the search criteria.

Item.Name: LeftBoundN
Item.Description: Returns the x-coordinate of the bounding box (top left corner) of an object matching the search criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the value of the coordinate of the leftmost matching object found.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the x-coordinate value of the top left corner of the object matching the search criteria.

Item.Name: TopBoundN
Item.Description: Returns the y-coordinate of the bounding box (top left corner) of an object matching the search criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the value of the coordinate of the topmost matching object found.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the y-coordinate value of the top left corner of the object matching the search criteria.

Item.Name: RightBoundN
Item.Description: Returns the x-coordinate of the bounding box (bottom right corner) of an object matching the search criteria If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the value of the coordinate of the rightmost matching object found.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the y-coordinate value of the bottom right corner of the object matching the search criteria.

Item.Name: LengthN
Item.Description: Returns the length of an object. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the sum of all the matching object lengths.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the length of the objects matching the search criteria.
Item.Example: LengthValue:=[[name]](C='CrossMembers');[[BR]]{returns the length of all objects in class 'CrossMembers'}

Item.Name: SurfaceAreaN
Item.Description: Returns the surface area of the items matching the specified criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the sum of all the surface areas of the matching objects will be returned. [[BR]][[BR]][[name]] will only return areas on objects which support the solids modelling functions.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the surface area of the items matching the current criteria.

Item.Name: PerimN
Item.Description: Returns the perimeter of an object. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the sum of the matching objects' perimeters.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the perimeter of the objects matching the search criteria.
Item.Example: PerimValue := PerimN(C='Fence');[[BR]]{returns the total perimeter of all objects in the class 'Fence'}

Item.Name: VolumeN
Item.Description: Returns the volume of the items matching the specified criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the sum of all the volumes of the matching objects will be returned. [[BR]][[BR]][[name]] will only return volumes on objects which support the solids modelling functions.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the volume of the items matching the current criteria.

Item.Name: XCenterN
Item.Description: Returns the x-coordinate of the center point of the bounding box of an object matching the search criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the x-coordinate of the average center point of all the matching objects
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the x-coordinate value of the center of the bounding box of an object matching the search criteria
Item.Example: XCenValue:=XCenterN(N='Board');[[BR]]{returns the x-coord of the center of the bounding box the named object 'Board'

Item.Name: YCenterN
Item.Description: Returns the y-coordinate of the center point of the bounding box of an object matching the search criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the y-coordinate of the average center point of all the matching objects
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the Y center coordinate value of the center of the bounding box of the objects matching the search criteria
Item.Example: YCenValue:=YCenterN(N='Board');[[BR]]{returns the y-coord of the center of the bounding box of the named object 'Board'

Item.Name: ZCenterN
Item.Description: Returns the z-coordinate value of the center of the bounding box of an object matching the search criteria. If more than one object matches the search criteria, the function will return the z-coordinate of the average center point of all the matching objects
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the z-coordinate value of the center of the bounding box of an object matching the search criteria
Item.Example: ZCenValue:=ZCenterN(N='Board');[[BR]]{returns the z-coord of the center of the bounding box of the named object 'Board'

Item.ShortDesc: Sets the images for the list browser row, Replaces SetLBMultImageIndexes

Item.Name: CreateThumbnailPopup
Item.Description: Creates a thumbnail popup that can be populated with previews of objects in Vectorworks
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a thumbnail popup that can be populated with previews of objects in Vectorworks

Item.Name: GetNumStories
Item.Description: Returns the number of stories in the file. Stories are used to group layers and are shown on the Story pane of the Organization dialog.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of stories in the file.
Item.Result: Returns the number of stories in the file.

Item.Name: GetNumLayerLevelTypes
Item.Description: Returns the number of layer level types in the file. A layer can be assigned a layer level type, which defines its location within a story.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of layer level types in the file.
Item.Result: The number of layer level types in the file.

Item.Name: GetNumStoryLayerTemplates
Item.Description: Returns the number of story layer templates in the file. Story Layer Templates are used to define what Layers are typically found in a Story. When a Story is created, the user has the option to automatically create the Layers defined by the Story Layer Templates.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of Story Layer Templates in the file.
Item.Result: The number of Story Layer Templates in the file.

Item.Name: GetLayerLevelType
Item.Description: Returns the Layer Level Type of the Layer.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the Layer Level Type of the Layer.
Item.Result: The Layer Level Type of the Layer.

Param.Name: layer
Param.Desc: The Layer whose Layer Level Type is desired.

Item.Name: SetLayerLevelType
Item.Description: Sets the Layer Level Type of a Layer. If the type passed in does not exist or if it already used by another Layer on the same Story, then the operation will fail.
Item.ShortDesc: Set the Layer Level Type of a Layer.
Item.Result: Whether the attempt to set the Layer Level Type was successful.

Param.Name: layer
Param.Desc: The Layer for which the Layer Level Type is being set.

Item.Name: GetStoryLayerTemplateName
Item.Description: Returns the name of the nth Story Layer Template in the file. For example, if 3 is passed in, it will return the name of the 3rd Story Layer Template in the file.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the name of the Story Layer Template with the indicated index.
Item.Result: The name of the nth Story Layer Template.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: The index of the Story Layer Template whose name is desired.

Item.Name: GetStoryOfLayer
Item.Description: Returns the Story that the indicated Layer is associated with. Returns NULL if the Layer is not associated with a Story.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the Story that a Layer is associated with.
Item.Result: The Story associated with the Layer, which may be NULL.

Param.Name: layer
Param.Desc: The Layer for which the associated Story is returned.

Item.Name: GetLayerForStory
Item.Description: Gets the layer with the story and layer level type specified.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the layer with the story and layer level type specified.
Item.Result: The Layer associated with the Story and layer level specified, which may be NULL.

Param.Name: story
Param.Desc: The Story for which the will be looked up for level types.

Param.Name: levelType
Param.Desc: The level type of the story, which associated layer will be returned.

Item.Name: CreateStory
Item.Description: Creates a Story. Stories are used to group layers and are shown on the Story pane of the Organization dialog.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a Story.
Item.Result: Whether the Story was successfully created.

Param.Name: name
Param.Desc: The name of the Story to create.

Param.Name: suffix
Param.Desc: The suffix to be used at the end of the name of a Layer assoiciated with the Story.

Item.Name: CreateLayerLevelType
Item.Description: Creates a Layer Level Type. A Layer can be assigned a Layer Level Type, which defines its location within a Story.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a Layer Level Typel
Item.Result: Whether a Layer Level Type was successfully created.

Param.Name: name
Param.Desc: The name of the Layer Level Type to create.

Item.Name: CreateStoryLayerTemplate
Item.Description: Creates a Story Layer Template in the current file. Sets the index parameter to the index of the new template in the list of templates. Story Layer Templates are used to define what Layers are typically found in a Story. When a Story is created, the user has the option to automatically create the Layers defined by the Story Layer Templates.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a Story Layer Template.
Item.Result: Whether a Story Layer Template is successfully created.

Param.Name: name
Param.Desc: The name of the Story Layer Template.

Param.Name: scaleFactor
Param.Desc: The scale to be assinged to any Layers created from this template.

Param.Name: layerLevelType
Param.Desc: The Layer Level Type to be assigned to any Layers created from this template.

Param.Name: elevationOffset
Param.Desc: The offset of the elevation of any Layer created from this template from the elevation of its Story.

Param.Name: defaultWallHeight
Param.Desc: The wall height to be assigned to any Layer created from this template.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: The index of the new template in the list of templates.

Item.Name: DeleteStoryLayerTemplate
Item.Description: Deletes the nth Story Layer Template from the current file. For example, if 3 is passed in, it will delete the 3rd Story Layer Template in the file.
Item.ShortDesc: Deletes the Story Layer Template with the specified index from the current file.
Item.Result: Whether a Story Layer Template with the indicated index existed in the file.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: Index of the Story Layer Template to delete.

Item.Name: AssociateLayerWithStory
Item.Description: Associates a Layer with a Story. When a Layer is associated with a Story, the Layer's elevation is displayed relative to the Story elevation. If the elevation of the associated Story is changed, the elevation of the Layer changes with it.
Item.ShortDesc: Associates a Layer with a Story.
Item.Result: Whether the Layer was successfully associated with the Story. This will fail if there is already another Layer associated with the Story that has the same Layer Level Type as the Layer passed in.

Item.Name: GetStoryAbove
Item.Description: Returns the Story above the indicated Story. Returns NULL if there is none. If passed a NULL handle, returns the top-most Story in the current drawing.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the Story above the indicated Story.
Item.Result: The Story above the indicated Story, or NULL if there is none. If a NULL handle is passed in, the topmost Story in the current drawing.

Param.Name: story
Param.Desc: The indicated Story for which the Story above it is desired.

Item.Name: GetStoryBelow
Item.Description: Returns the Story below the indicated Story. Returns NULL if there is none. If passed a NULL handle, returns the bottom-most Story in the current drawing.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the Story below the indicated Story.
Item.Result: The Story below the indicated Story, or NULL if there is none. If a NULL handle is passed in, the bottom-most Story in the current drawing.

Param.Name: story
Param.Desc: The indicated Story for which the Story below it is desired

Item.Name: GetStoryElevation
Item.Description: Returns the elevaton of the indicated Story.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the elevaton of the indicated Story.
Item.Result: The elevation of the Story.

Param.Name: story
Param.Desc: The Story whose elevation is desired.

Item.Name: SetStoryElevation
Item.Description: Sets the elevation of the indicated Story. Returns whether the elevation was successfully set. If the elevaton change would cause Layers associated with the Story to overlap Layers associated with another Story, then the change in elevation will be prevented.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the elevation of the indicated Story.
Item.Result: Whether the elevation is successfully changed.

Param.Name: story
Param.Desc: The Story whose elevation is to be set.

Param.Name: elevation
Param.Desc: The elevation to set the Story to.

Item.Name: ShowByClassChoice
Item.Description: Adds a 'By Class' choice to a marker, line style, or color popup control. (Dialog must be running)
Item.ShortDesc: Adds a 'By Class' choice to a marker, line style, or color popup control.

Item.Name: IsClassChoiceSelected
Item.Description: Returns if 'By Class' is the selected choice in a marker, line style, or color popup control.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns if 'By Class' is the selected choice in a marker, line style, or color popup control.

Item.Name: SelectClassChoice
Item.Description: Use to select the class option in a popup that ShowByClassChoice has been called on. This function must be called with FALSE param if the popup currently has the class selection and the script wishes to change to a non-class selection.
Item.ShortDesc: Use to select the class option in a popup that ShowByClassChoice has been called on.

Param.Name: select
Param.Desc: TRUE if setting by class or FALSE if programmatically restoring the value to a non-class setting after class setting was applied

Item.Name: HasObjStoryBounds
Item.Description: Determine if the object has any story bounds.
Item.ShortDesc: Determine if the object has any story bounds.
Item.Result: Return TRUE if the object has any story bounds. Otherwise - FALSE.

Item.Name: HasObjStoryBound
Item.Description: Determine if the object has the specified story bound ID present.
Item.ShortDesc: Determine if the object has the specified story bound ID present.
Item.Result: Retrun TRUE if the story bound ID is present. Otherwise - FALSE.

Param.Name: boundID
Param.Desc: The identifier of the story bound.

Item.Name: GetObjStoryBound
Item.Description: Get the data of the specified story bound of this object.
Item.ShortDesc: Get the data of the specified story bound of this object.
Item.Result: Return TRUE if the operation is successful.

Param.Name: boundID
Param.Desc: The identifier of the story bound.

Param.Name: boundStory
Param.Desc: The story identified by 'boundType' = (2 - Story). If 'boundStory' = 0 then it is this story (the object's story); If 'boundStory' = 1 then it is the story above; If 'boundStory' = -1 then it is the story below.

Param.Name: layerLevelType
Param.Desc: The layer type which defines this bound

Param.Name: offset
Param.Desc: The offset distance from the specified bound story

Item.Name: SetObjectStoryBound
Item.Description: Set the data of the specified story bound of this object.
Item.ShortDesc: Set the data of the specified story bound of this object.

Param.Name: boundID
Param.Desc: The identifier of the story bound.

Param.Name: boundStory
Param.Desc: The story identified by 'boundType' = (2 - Story). If 'boundStory' = 0 then it is this story (the object's story); If 'boundStory' = 1 then it is the story above; If 'boundStory' = -1 then it is the story below.

Param.Name: layerLevelType
Param.Desc: The layer type which defines this bound

Param.Name: offset
Param.Desc: The offset distance from the specified bound story

Item.Name: DelObjStoryBounds
Item.Description: Delete all story bounds for this object.
Item.ShortDesc: Delete all story bounds for this object.

Item.Name: DelObjStoryBound
Item.Description: Delete the specified story bounds from this object.
Item.ShortDesc: Delete the specified story bounds from this object.

Param.Name: boundID
Param.Desc: The identifier of the story bound.

Item.Name: GetObjStoryBoundsCnt
Item.Description: Return the number of story bounds defined for this object.
Item.ShortDesc: Return the number of story bounds defined for this object.
Item.Result: The number of story bounds for this object.

Item.Name: GetObjStoryBoundsAt
Item.Description: Return the story bound ID of the specified story bound index. The index is between 1 and the result of GetObjStoryBoundsCnt.
Item.ShortDesc: Return the story bound ID of the specified story bound index.
Item.Result: Return the story bound ID.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: Index of the story bound which ID will be returned. This index should be between 1 and the result of GetObjStoryBoundsCnt.

Param.Name: botBoundType

Item.Name: Add2DVertex
Item.Description: This procedure will add to a polyline a vertex defined by its position, its type(0 to 4) and the radius if type is 3 or 4. A vertex of type 4 should be followed and preceded by corner vertices. If the type is equal to 4, the point will be a middle point of an arc. In this case if the radius is not given (0) it will be computed.
Item.ShortDesc: This procedure will add a vertex to a polyline.

Param.Name: p
Param.Desc: The vertex to add to a polyline.

Param.Name: vertexType
Param.Desc: The type of the vertex it could be 0, 1, 2, 3 or 4.

Param.Name: arcRadius
Param.Desc: The arc radius if the vertex type is 3 or 4.

Item.Name: GetWSCellStringN
Item.Description: Returns the displayed string value of a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the displayed string value of a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.Comments: Gets the specified worksheet cell's displayed string.[[BR]]If the cell contains a string, the displayed string IS that string.[[BR]]If the cell contains a number, the displayed string is that number PLUS any formatting applied to that number.[[BR]]Use IsWSCellString and/or MP_IsWSCellNumber to determine what type of value the cell actually contains. [[BR]]Use GetWSCellValue to retrieve actual numerical value without formatting from a cell that contains a number.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE WStest;[[BR]] VAR[[BR]] worksheet : HANDLE;[[BR]] inString, outString : DYNARRAY [] OF CHAR;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] worksheet := CreateWS('MyWS', 5, 5);[[BR]] inString := '';[[BR]] outString := '';[[BR]][[BR]] { inserts a formula into a single cell }[[BR]] inString := '=3*2';[[BR]] SetWSCellFormulaN(worksheet, 1, 2, 1, 2, inString);[[BR]][[BR]] { gets string from cell }[[BR]] GetWSCellStringN(worksheet, 1, 2, outString);[[BR]][[BR]] AlrtDialog(outString); { the cell formula }[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(WStest);

Param.Name: row
Param.Desc: Row of cell to be queried.

Param.Name: column
Param.Desc: Column of cell to be queried.

Param.Name: cellString
Param.Desc: The string value contained in the worksheet cell.

Item.Name: GetWSCellFormulaN
Item.Description: Returns the formula from a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the formula from a cell in the referenced worksheet.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE WStest;[[BR]] VAR[[BR]] worksheet : HANDLE;[[BR]] inString, outString : DYNARRAY [] OF CHAR;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] worksheet := CreateWS('MyWS', 5, 5);[[BR]] inString := '';[[BR]] outString := '';[[BR]][[BR]] { inserts a formula into a single cell }[[BR]] inString := '=3*2';[[BR]] SetWSCellFormulaN(worksheet, 1, 2, 1, 2, inString);[[BR]][[BR]] { gets formula from cell }[[BR]] GetWSCellFormulaN(worksheet, 1, 2, outString);[[BR]][[BR]] AlrtDialog(outString); { the cell formula }[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(WStest);

Param.Name: row
Param.Desc: Row of cell to be queried.

Param.Name: column
Param.Desc: Column of cell to be queried.

Item.Name: SetWSCellFormulaN
Item.Description: Inserts a formula into a cell of the referenced worksheet.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] allows a formula to be inserted into a rectangular range of cells. To insert a formula into a single cell, specify identical values for the top/bottom and left/right range boundaries.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] triggers a worksheet recalculation if the AutoRecalc flag is set.[[BR]]It is best to turn off that flag before using [[name]] repeatedly or in a loop and restore the flag after all operations are done (see GetWSAutoRecalcState and SetWSAutoRecalcState). [[BR]]At the end, the worksheet should be recalculated by calling RecalculateWS.
Item.ShortDesc: Inserts a formula into a cell of the referenced worksheet.
Item.Comments: Sets specified formula string in specified worksheet cell(s).[[BR]]If the 0 column is specified, a database row is created and the formula set as the database row criteria.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE WStest;[[BR]] VAR[[BR]] autoRecalcState : BOOLEAN;[[BR]] worksheet : HANDLE;[[BR]] inString : DYNARRAY [] OF CHAR;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] inString := '';[[BR]][[BR]] worksheet := CreateWS('MyWS', 5, 5);[[BR]][[BR]] RectangleN(0, 0, 1, 0, 1, 1);[[BR]][[BR]] {Save the current AutoRecalc state}[[BR]] autoRecalcState := GetWSAutoRecalcState(worksheet);[[BR]][[BR]] {Turn off worksheet Auto Recalculation}[[BR]] SetWSAutoRecalcState(worksheet, false);[[BR]][[BR]] { inserts a formula into a single cell }[[BR]] inString := '=3*2';[[BR]] SetWSCellFormulaN(worksheet, 1, 2, 1, 2, inString);[[BR]][[BR]] { inserts a formula into a range of cells }[[BR]] inString := '<empty>';[[BR]] SetWSCellFormulaN(worksheet, 1, 3, 2, 4, inString);[[BR]][[BR]] { creates a database subrow for the type 'RECT' }[[BR]] inString := '=DATABASE((T=RECT))';[[BR]] SetWSCellFormulaN(worksheet, 3, 0, 3, 0, inString);[[BR]][[BR]] { inserts a formula into a database row cell }[[BR]] inString := '=T';[[BR]] SetWSCellFormulaN(worksheet, 3, 1, 3, 1, inString);[[BR]][[BR]] {Restore AutoRecalc state}[[BR]] SetWSAutoRecalcState(worksheet, autoRecalcState);[[BR]][[BR]] {Now recalculate the worksheet}[[BR]] RecalculateWS(worksheet);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(WStest);

Param.Name: topRow
Param.Desc: Top row of cell insertion range.

Param.Name: leftColumn
Param.Desc: Leftmost column of cell insertion range.

Param.Name: bottomRow
Param.Desc: Bottom row of cell insertion range.

Param.Name: rightColumn
Param.Desc: Rightmost column of cell insertion range.

Param.Name: formula
Param.Desc: Formula to be inserted into cell range.

Item.Name: GetWSSubrowCellStrN
Item.Description: Returns the displayed string in a database subrow cell.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the displayed string in a database subrow cell.
Item.Comments: Gets the specified worksheet subrow cell's displayed string.[[BR]]WARNING: Because database subrow cells and their contents are dynamically created based on the current database of objects and the current critieria string, any return values from this function are not guaranteed to be correct beyond this function call. Use this function carefully and at your own risk.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE WStest;[[BR]] VAR[[BR]] autoRecalcState : BOOLEAN;[[BR]] worksheet : HANDLE;[[BR]] inString, outString : DYNARRAY [] OF CHAR;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] inString := '';[[BR]] outString := '';[[BR]][[BR]] worksheet := CreateWS('MyWS', 5, 5);[[BR]][[BR]] RectangleN(0, 0, 1, 0, 1, 1);[[BR]][[BR]] {Save the current AutoRecalc state}[[BR]] autoRecalcState := GetWSAutoRecalcState(worksheet);[[BR]][[BR]] {Turn off worksheet Auto Recalculation}[[BR]] SetWSAutoRecalcState(worksheet, false);[[BR]][[BR]] { creates a database sub-row for the type 'RECT' }[[BR]] inString := '=DATABASE((T=RECT))';[[BR]] SetWSCellFormulaN(worksheet, 3, 0, 3, 0, inString);[[BR]][[BR]] { inserts a formula into a database row cell }[[BR]] inString := '=T';[[BR]] SetWSCellFormulaN(worksheet, 3, 1, 3, 1, inString);[[BR]][[BR]] {Restore AutoRecalc state}[[BR]] SetWSAutoRecalcState(worksheet, autoRecalcState);[[BR]][[BR]] {Now recalculate the worksheet}[[BR]] RecalculateWS(worksheet);[[BR]][[BR]] { gets subrow display string }[[BR]] GetWSSubrowCellStringN(worksheet, 3, 1, 1, outString);[[BR]][[BR]] AlrtDialog(outString); { the subrow cell display string }[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(WStest);

Param.Name: subrow
Param.Desc: Index of subrow cell to be queried.

Item.Name: GetWSSubrowActualStringN
Item.Description: Returns the actual string in a database subrow cell.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the actual string in a database subrow cell.
Item.Comments: Gets the specified worksheet subrow cell's actual string.[[BR]]WARNING: Because database subrow cells and their contents are dynamically created based on the current database of objects and the current critieria string, any return values from this function are not guaranteed to be correct beyond this function call. Use this function carefully and at your own risk.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE WStest;[[BR]] VAR[[BR]] autoRecalcState : BOOLEAN;[[BR]] worksheet : HANDLE;[[BR]] inString, outString : DYNARRAY [] OF CHAR;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] inString := '';[[BR]] outString := '';[[BR]][[BR]] worksheet := CreateWS('MyWS', 5, 5);[[BR]][[BR]] RectangleN(0, 0, 1, 0, 1, 1);[[BR]][[BR]] {Save the current AutoRecalc state}[[BR]] autoRecalcState := GetWSAutoRecalcState(worksheet);[[BR]][[BR]] {Turn off worksheet Auto Recalculation}[[BR]] SetWSAutoRecalcState(worksheet, false);[[BR]][[BR]] { creates a database sub-row for the type 'RECT' }[[BR]] inString := '=DATABASE((T=RECT))';[[BR]] SetWSCellFormulaN(worksheet, 3, 0, 3, 0, inString);[[BR]][[BR]] { inserts a formula into a database row cell }[[BR]] inString := '=T';[[BR]] SetWSCellFormulaN(worksheet, 3, 1, 3, 1, inString);[[BR]][[BR]] {Restore AutoRecalc state}[[BR]] SetWSAutoRecalcState(worksheet, autoRecalcState);[[BR]][[BR]] {Now recalculate the worksheet}[[BR]] RecalculateWS(worksheet);[[BR]][[BR]] { gets subrow actual string }[[BR]] GetWSSubrowActualStringN(worksheet, 3, 1, 1, outString);[[BR]][[BR]] AlrtDialog(outString); { the subrow cell actual string }[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(WStest);

Param.Name: subrow
Param.Desc: Index of subrow cell to be queried.

Items with dashes in the string value for the hierarchical column will be displayed hierarchically. This will work on items already entered. When new items are entered, this will need to be called again.

Item.Name: HierLBItemOpened
Item.Description: This function is called when the user clicks on a container item to open it. It wil redisplay items inside the container that were hidden (unless they are inside a lower level container that is closed), but only with the hierarchical name set. If other data needs to be redisplayed, it will need to be done with other functions. numbRedisplItems indicates how many non-container items were redisplayed.
Item.ShortDesc: This function is called when the user clicks on a container item to open it. It wil redisplay items inside the container that were hidden, unless they are insided a lower level container that is closed.

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The id of the dialog containing the list browser.

Param.Name: componentID
Param.Desc: The id of the list browser.

Param.Name: itemIndex
Param.Desc: The index of the item that was clicked on.

Param.Name: recursive
Param.Desc: Indicates whether any subcontainers should also be opened.

Param.Name: numbRedisplItems
Param.Desc: The number of items that were redisplayed.

Item.Name: HierLBItemClosed
Item.Description: This function is called when the user clicks on a container item to close it. It will remove items that are inside the container being closed.
Item.ShortDesc: This function is called when the user clicks on a container item to close it. It will remove items that are inside the container being closed.

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The id of the dialog containing the list browser.

Param.Name: componentID
Param.Desc: The id of the list browser.

Param.Name: itemIndex
Param.Desc: The index of the item that was clicked on.

Param.Name: recursive
Param.Desc: Whether to also close any containers inside the container that was clicked on.

Item.Name: CreateStyledStatic
Item.Description: Creates a new static text field control in a dialog layout. Text will have the indicated style.[[BR]][[BR]]To allow the control to size automatically to the text width, pass -1 as the width parameter of the control.[[BR]][[BR]]0 = eStaticTextTypeRegular[[BR]]1 = eStaticTextTypeCaption[[BR]]2 = eStaticTextTypeBold, [[BR]]3 = eStaticTextTypeReduced[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a static text with one of a set of predefined text styles.
Item.Result: Boolean indicating the control was created successfully.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] result :INTEGER;[[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]END;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Example Dialog', FALSE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateEditText(dialog1, 4, 'default text', 16);[[BR]] CreateStyledStatic(dialog1, 5, 'default text', 16, 2);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] SetBelowItem(dialog1, 4, 5, 0, 0);[[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]]

Param.Name: widthInStdChar
Param.Desc: The width of the displayed text in standard character count. See GetDlgCtrlWidthStdCh.

Param.Name: style
Param.Desc: Type of this static text control. One of: 0 = eStaticTextTypeRegular 1 = eStaticTextTypeCaption 2 = eStaticTextTypeBold, 3 = eStaticTextTypeReduced, 101-116 = Custom size, normal 201-216 = Custom size, bold

Item.Name: TrimNurbsSurface
Item.Description: Trims the NURBS surface by a given NURBS curve.
Item.ShortDesc: Trims the NURBS surface by a given NURBS curve.
Item.Result: Returns TRUE if trimmed the surface, otherwise returns FALSE.
Item.Comments: It returns true if the curve is attached to the surface as trimmed curve.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]][[BR]]VAR[[BR]]surfaceH, curveH :HANDLE;[[BR]]bFlag :BOOLEAN;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]surfaceH := CreateNurbsSurface(3, 3, 1, 1);[[BR]]NurbsSetPt3D(h, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);[[BR]]NurbsSetPt3D(h, 0, 1, 1, 0, 0);[[BR]]NurbsSetPt3D(h, 0, 2, 2, 0, 0);[[BR]]NurbsSetPt3D(h, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0);[[BR]]NurbsSetPt3D(h, 1, 1, 1, 1, 1);[[BR]]NurbsSetPt3D(h, 1, 2, 2, 1, 0);[[BR]]NurbsSetPt3D(h, 2, 0, 0, 2, 0);[[BR]]NurbsSetPt3D(h, 2, 1, 1, 2, 0);[[BR]]NurbsSetPt3D(h, 2, 2, 2, 2, 0);[[BR]][[BR]]curveH := CreateNurbsCurve(0, 0, 0, TRUE, 2);[[BR]]AddVertex3D(nC, 1, 1, 0);[[BR]]AddVertex3D(nC, 2, 0, 0);[[BR]][[BR]]bFlag := TrimNurbsSurface(surfaceH, curveH);[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: surfaceHandle
Param.Desc: Handle to a NURBS surface to trim.

Param.Name: curveHandle
Param.Desc: Handle to a NURBS curve for trimming.

Item.Name: TrackObjectN
Item.Description: Interactively, including highlighting, allows the user to select one object meeting the specified criteria.[[BR]][[BR]]The callback function (any of these depending on what info is needed):[[BR]][[BR]]FUNCTION Callback(h : HANDLE): BOOLEAN;[[BR]]FUNCTION CheckObjCallback(h : HANDLE; px, py : REAL) : BOOLEAN;[[BR]]FUNCTION CheckObjCallback(h : HANDLE; px, py, pz : REAL) : BOOLEAN;[[BR]][[BR]]is used to let the user filter the object that can be returned from the function.[[BR]][[BR]]The parameteri px,py,pz pass into the function information about current cursor position in document units.[[BR]][[BR]]This callback function is called when tracking over an object; also when click happens over an object.[[BR]][[BR]]The callback function return true if the passed handle can be returned.
Item.ShortDesc: Interactively, including highlighting, allows the user to select one object meeting the specified criteria.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Test;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h : HANDLE;[[BR]] x, y, z : REAL;[[BR]] [[BR]] FUNCTION CheckObjCallback(h : HANDLE) : BOOLEAN;[[BR]] {or FUNCTION CheckObjCallback(h : HANDLE; px, py : REAL) : BOOLEAN;}[[BR]] {or FUNCTION CheckObjCallback(h : HANDLE; px, py, pz : REAL) : BOOLEAN;}[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] {any object is ok}[[BR]] CheckObjCallback := true;[[BR]] END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] TrackObjectN( 0, CheckObjCallback, h, x, y, z );[[BR]] SetSelect( h );[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN( Test );[[BR]]
Item.SpecialOverride: CHECKTRACKOBJECTN(procTrackObjectN, MP_TrackObjectN, intMode, userProcMode, handleVarMode, d3PtVarMode);

Param.Name: traverseType
Param.Desc: Specify how to traverse the drawing.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]0 - traverses only the high-level objects (the same as the TrakcObject function);[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]1 - traverses the objects deep (uses GetPickObjectInfo, the 'subH' parameter).[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]2 - traverses the objects shallow (uses GetPickObjectInfo

Param.Name: callback
Param.Desc: The callback that will be called to check if an object meets the requrements to be tracked. See remarks.

Param.Name: outObj
Param.Desc: Returns handle of the object for which the callback returned TRUE.

Item.Name: SubString
Item.Description: Function [[name]] splits the Text string using characters specified in the Delemiters and returns the token located at the Index position. [[BR]]The first token is located at index 1. [[BR]]If there is an error the function returns ''(empty string).[[BR]]If index is less than 1 or grater than max number of tokens the function returns ''(empty string).
Item.ShortDesc: Tokenizes the Text and returns a token located at the Index position.
