Item.Name: BuildResourceList2
Item.Description: Creates an implicit list of resources of a specified type, and returns an ID for the list. Values in the list can be retrieved using GetNameFromResourceList.[[BR]][[BR]]If the Display Default Content preference (#130) is on and folderIndex is not 0, it will also include all the resources of the specified type in all the files in the selected folder. [[BR]][[BR]]If folderIndex is positive, the list will include all the resources of that type from the current document, as well as from the specified folder. If folderIndex is 0, only the resources in the current document will be in the list. If folderIndex is negative, only the resources in the specified folder will be in the list.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ObjTypeNote]][[BR]][[BR]][[note:FolderPath]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a list of all the resources of the specified type in the current file and, if a preference is on, in the specified folder. Returns list ID.

Param.Name: type
Param.Desc: the type of resource to put in the list

Param.Name: folderIndex
Param.Desc: the index of a VW folder.

Param.Name: subFolderName
Param.Desc: the name of a subfolder inside the folder specified by folderIndex. This can also be a partial path. Use an empty string to request the resources from all files in the folderIndex folder.

Param.Name: numItems
Param.Desc: the number of items in the list built

Param.Name: useDefaultContent
Param.Desc: determine if the list should contain default content

Item.Name: PythonExecute
Item.Description: Execute the given python script.[[BR]][[BR]]You can use 'include' in python to run additional code in python files. However, before you execute the script make sure the python file are foundable through the PythonGetSearchPath. Use PythonSetSearchPath to change it.[[BR]][[BR]]Scripts executed via this function should not contain User Interactive functions like GetPt for example.
Item.ShortDesc: Execute the given python script.

Item.Name: PythonGetSearchPath
Item.Description: Return the search path for python files.
Item.ShortDesc: Return the search path for python files.
Item.Result: The result is a string of semicolon delimited paths. The path it similar to the 'Open' function path parameter.

Item.Name: PythonSetSearchPath
Item.Description: Set the search path for python files.
Item.ShortDesc: Set the search path for python files.

Param.Name: pathList
Param.Desc: A string of semicolon delimited paths. The path it similar to the 'Open' function path parameter.

Item.Name: PythonBeginContext
Item.Description: This function creates a context in which PythonExecute scripts are run.[[BR]][[BR]]This function consecutive python scripts to be executed inside the same python environment.
Item.ShortDesc: This function creates a context in which PythonExecute scripts are run.

Item.Name: PythonEndContext
Item.Description: Closes python context previously opened with PythonBeginContext.
Item.ShortDesc: Closes python context previously opened with PythonBeginContext.

Item.Name: GetCWPanelFromPt
Item.Description: Returns information about a panel in a curtain wall from a given point.[[BR]][[BR]]Used for placing objects inside a panel in a curtain wall. When passing the center point of the object in the wall, it will find the panel in the curtain wall and return a new center point and the height and width of the panel.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets Curtain Wall Panel Information from Point in wall
Item.Result: Returns TRUE if hWall is a curtain wall and a panel is found.[[BR]]Returns FALSE is hWall is not a curtain wall or the test point is not found on the wall.

Param.Name: testPt
Param.Desc: Point to test on the curtain wall. Typically the center point of the object to be placed in the curtain wall panel.

Param.Name: includeBottomFrame
Param.Desc: Include the bottom frame in the return height.

Param.Name: centerPt
Param.Desc: Returns the center point of the rectangle in witch to place the object.

Param.Name: width
Param.Desc: The width of the rectangle in which to place the object.

Param.Name: height
Param.Desc: The height of the rectangle in which to place the object.

Item.Name: ExtrudeAlongPath
Item.Description: Creates a new path extrude object in the document. The profile defines the shape of the cross-section, and is extruded along the path to generate the resulting object.[[BR]][[BR]]The path argument must be a handle to a NURBS Curve object (type 111). The profile argument must be a handle to an object of one of the following types: NURBS Curve, Polygon, Polyline, Arc, Rectangle, Rounded Rectangle, Line, Oval.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new path extrude object in the document.
Item.Result: Returns a generic solid HANDLE to the new path extrude if successful, otherwise returns NIL.[[BR]]
Item.Comments: The generic solid can not be edited[[BR]][[BR]]The following objects are supported as profile objects:[[BR]][[BR]]Line 2[[BR]]Box 3[[BR]]Oval 4[[BR]]Polygon 5[[BR]]Arc 6[[BR]]Freehand 8[[BR]]R Rect 13[[BR]]Polyline 21[[BR]]3D Poly 25[[BR]]NURBS Curve 111[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]

Item.Result: A handle to the newly created text style resource will be returned.

Param.Name: name
Param.Desc: The name for the new text style.

Item.Name: GetGradientDataN
Item.ShortDesc: Gets ths sport position, midpoint position, color, and opacity of the specified gradient segment.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]]gradient :HANDLE;[[BR]]segmentIndex :INTEGER;[[BR]]spotPosition, midpointPosition :REAL;[[BR]]red, green, blue :LONGINT;[[BR]]opacity :INTEGER[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]gradient := GetObject('Cyan-Magenta-Yellow');[[BR]]segmentIndex := 3;[[BR]]GetGradientData(gradient, segmentIndex, spotPosition, midpointPosition, red, green, blue.opacity);[[BR]]Message(red, ' ', green, ' ', blue, ' ', opacity);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: segmentIndex
Param.Desc: Segment from which to get the data.

Param.Name: spotPosition
Param.Desc: Position of the segment's color spot relative to left-most point of the gradient.

Param.Name: midpointPosition
Param.Desc: Position of the segment's midpoint relative to color spot immediately to left.

Param.Name: red
Param.Desc: Red component of the color spot's color.

Param.Name: green
Param.Desc: Green component of the color spot's color.

Param.Name: blue
Param.Desc: Blue component of the color spot's color.

Item.Name: SetGradientDataN
Item.Description: Note: you must use a variable, initialized to the segment index, to pass as a parameter. After the data has been set, this variable will contain the index of the segment, which may have changed because of the spot position specified.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the spot position, midpoint position, color, and opacity of the specified gradient segment.

Param.Name: segmentIndex
Param.Desc: Segment for which to set the data.

Param.Name: spotPosition
Param.Desc: Position of the segment's color spot relative to left-most point of the gradient.

Param.Name: midpointPosition
Param.Desc: Position of the segment's midpoint relative to color spot immediately to left.

Param.Name: red
Param.Desc: Red component of the color spot's color.

Param.Name: green
Param.Desc: Green component of the color spot's color.

Param.Name: blue
Param.Desc: Blue component of the color spot's color.

Item.Name: InsertGradientData
Item.Description: A segment consists of a single color spot and the single midpoint immediately to the right of the color spot.
Item.ShortDesc: Inserts a new segment into the gradient and initializes its data to the specified values.
Item.Result: Returns the index of the newly created segment; 0 otherwise. [[BR]]Note: segment indexes begin with 1. [[BR]]
Item.Example: index := InsertGradientData(gradientHandle, 0.35, 0.4, 255, 255, 255, 100);[[BR]]{ inserts a white color spot at position, 0.35, with a midpoint position of 0.4; 100 is max opacity (i.e. opaque) }

Param.Name: gradient
Param.Desc: Gradient into which a segment is to be inserted.

Param.Name: spotPosition
Param.Desc: Position of the segment's color spot relative to left-most point of the gradient.

Param.Name: midpointPosition
Param.Desc: Position of the segment's midpoint relative to color spot immediately to left.

Param.Desc: Red component of the color spot's color.

Param.Name: green
Param.Desc: Green component of the color spot's color.

Param.Name: blue
Param.Desc: Blue component of the color spot's color.

Item.Name: SetGradientOpacity
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the opacity for the spot color of the specified gradient segment.

Param.Name: segmentIndex
Param.Desc: Segment for which to set the data.

Item.Name: SetTextStyleRef
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] sets the text style of an object to the referenced style. Reference 0 means Un-Styled. This procedure will replace by-class styling.

Item.Name: GetTextStyleRef
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the text style for the referenced object. The integer returned is the internal index of the text style used by this object. [[BR]][[BR]]If the text object is using class text style, this returns the effective style. You should use the *TextStyleByClass* functions to check and preserve by-class behavior.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the text style reference of the specified object.
Item.SeeAlso: SetTextStyleRef, GetTextStyleRef, SetTextStyleRefN, GetTextStyleRefN, SetTextStyleByClass, SetTextStyleByClassN, IsTextStyleByClass, IsTextStyleByClassN

Item.Name: SetTextStyleByClass
Item.Description: [[name]] sets the referenced object to use the class text style. To undo this, use SetTextStyleRef on the object.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the referenced object to use the class text style.

Item.Name: IsTextStyleByClass
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] returns whether the class text style is used for the referenced object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns whether the class text style is used for the referenced object.

Item.Name: GetObjectWallOffset
Item.Description: Gets an object's offset value in it's break record. [[BR]][[BR]]The object (objH) must be contained in wall (wallH) to succeed.
Item.ShortDesc: Get the offset for the object within the wall.

Item.ShortDesc: Set the height for the object within the wall.
Item.Result: True or False upon successful setting of the flag.[[BR]][[BR]]False can occur for the following conditions:[[BR]]objH is null.[[BR]]wallH is null.[[BR]]objH is not contained in wallH.

Item.Name: SetDescriptionText
Item.Description: Sets the user-supplied description for an object.[[BR]]Adds the description data node if one does not already exist.

Item.Result: true if text was successfully set; false if error occurred.
Item.Comments: Added for T01363 to add descriptions for classes and layers.

Param.Name: hObject
Param.Desc: Handle of the object for which the description should be set.

Param.Name: descriptionText
Param.Desc: The description text to be set for the object

Item.Name: GetDescriptionText
Item.Description: Retrieves any description text that exists for a specified object and passes it back in the descriptionText argument. The descriptionText argument will be empty if the object has no description text.
Item.ShortDesc: Retrieves any description text that exists for a specified object and passes it back in the descriptionText argument.
Item.Comments: Added for T01363 to add descriptions for classes and layers.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE GetDescExample;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] descriptionTextDyn :DYNARRAY [] of CHAR;[[BR]] tempH : HANDLE;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] tempH := GetObject ('Dimension');[[BR]][[BR]] GetDescriptionText (tempH, descriptionTextDyn);[[BR]][[BR]] IF descriptionTextDyn <> '' THEN [[BR]] Message (descriptionTextDyn)[[BR]] ELSE[[BR]] Message ('no description');[[BR]]END;[[BR]]Run (GetDescExample);

Param.Name: hObject
Param.Desc: Handle of object for which to retrieve the text.

Param.Name: descriptionText
Param.Desc: Object's description text, if any exists.

Item.Name: GetNumDashDataPairs
Item.Description: Deprecated - will generate error. Use GetNumDashDataPairsN instead.
Item.ShortDesc: Deprecated - will generate error. Use GetNumDashDataPairsN instead.
Item.Comments: Deprecated - will generate error. Use GetNumDashDataPairsN instead.
Item.Example: The dash-related functions here have been deprecated and will return errors. [[BR]]PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]]n, numPairs, dashIndex : INTEGER;[[BR]]scaleWThick :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]arrayDashDat : ARRAY[1..5] OF POINT;[[BR]]x,y : REAL;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]][[BR]]dashIndex := GetDashStyleIndex(TRUE, 2, 0.12, 0.18, 0.03, 0.07);[[BR]][[BR]]numPairs := GetNumDashDataPairs(dashIndex,scaleWThick);[[BR]][[BR]]FOR n := 1 TO numPairs DO BEGIN[[BR]] IF (GetDashDataValPairAt(dashIndex, n , x, y)) THEN BEGIN[[BR]] arrayDashDat[n].x := x ;[[BR]] arrayDashDat[n].y := y ;[[BR]] END; [[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: GetDashDataValPairAt
Item.Description: Deprecated - will generate error. Use GetDashDataValPrAtN instead.
Item.ShortDesc: Deprecated - will generate error. Use GetDashDataValPrAtN instead.
Item.Comments: Deprecated - will generate error. Use GetDashDataValPrAtN instead.
Item.Example: The dash-related functions here have been deprecated and will return errors. [[BR]]PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]]n, numPairs, dashIndex : INTEGER;[[BR]]scaleWThick :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]arrayDashDat : ARRAY[1..5] OF POINT;[[BR]]x,y : REAL;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]][[BR]]dashIndex := GetDashStyleIndex(TRUE, 2, 0.12, 0.18, 0.03, 0.07);[[BR]][[BR]]numPairs := GetNumDashDataPairs(dashIndex,scaleWThick);[[BR]][[BR]]FOR n := 1 TO numPairs DO BEGIN[[BR]] IF (GetDashDataValPairAt(dashIndex, n , x, y)) THEN BEGIN[[BR]] arrayDashDat[n].x := x ;[[BR]] arrayDashDat[n].y := y ;[[BR]] END; [[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: dataIndex
Param.Desc: Index fo the data value pair.

Item.Name: SetTextStyleRefN
Item.Description: [[name]] sets the text style of a specified substring of a text object to the referenced style. Reference 0 means Un-Styled. This procedure will replace by-class styling.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the text style of a specified substring of a text object to the referenced style
Item.Result: Returns False if object is not a text object, or if part of the substring is past the end of existing text. Otherwise returns true.
Item.SeeAlso: SetTextStyleRef, GetTextStyleRef, GetTextStyleRefN, SetTextStyleByClass, SetTextStyleByClassN, IsTextStyleByClass, IsTextStyleByClassN

Param.Name: start
Param.Desc: Start position in text string, zero-based.

Item.Name: GetTextStyleRefN
Item.Description: [[name]] returns the text style reference at a specified position within the text object. Reference 0 means Un-Styled.[[BR]][[BR]]If the text object is using class text style, this returns the effective style. You should use the *TextStyleByClass* functions to check and preserve by-class behavior.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the text style reference of one character of a text object
Item.Result: Returns the text style reference id for the requested character postion
Item.SeeAlso: SetTextStyleRef, GetTextStyleRef, SetTextStyleRefN, GetTextStyleRefN, SetTextStyleByClass, SetTextStyleByClassN, IsTextStyleByClass, IsTextStyleByClassN

Item.Name: SetTextStyleByClassN
Item.Description: [[name]] sets a specified substring of a text object to use the class text style. To undo this, use SetTextStyleRef or SetTextStyleRefN on the text.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets a specified substring of a text object to use the class text style.
Item.Result: Returns False if object is not a text object, or if part of the substring is past the end of existing text. Otherwise returns true.
Item.SeeAlso: SetTextStyleRef, GetTextStyleRef, SetTextStyleRefN, GetTextStyleRefN, SetTextStyleByClass, SetTextStyleByClassN, IsTextStyleByClass, IsTextStyleByClassN

Param.Name: start
Param.Desc: Start position in text string, zero-based.

Item.Name: IsTextStyleByClassN
Item.Description: [[name]] returns whether the class text style is used at a specified position within the text object.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns whether the class text style is used for one character of a text object.
Item.Result: Returns True if the requested character postion uses the class text style
Item.SeeAlso: SetTextStyleRef, GetTextStyleRef, SetTextStyleRefN, GetTextStyleRefN, SetTextStyleByClass, SetTextStyleByClassN, IsTextStyleByClass, IsTextStyleByClassN

Item.Name: GetNumLevelTemplates
Item.Description: Returns the number of story level templates in the file. Story Levels contain a level type, elevation, and optional layer to be used to bound objects on stories; Story Level Templates define a generic level that can be added to multiple stories.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of Story Level templates in the file.
Item.Result: The number of Story Level Templates in the document.

Item.Name: GetLevelTemplateName
Item.Description: Returns the name of the nth Story Level Template in the file. For example, if 3 is passed in, it will return the name of the 3rd Story Level Template in the file.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the name of the Story Level Template with the indicated index.
Item.Result: The name of the Story Level Template at 'index',

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: The index of the Story Level Template whose name is to be returned.

Item.Name: SetLevelTemplateName
Item.Description: Sets the name of the Story Level Template at 'index' to be 'name'.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the name of a Story Level Template.
Item.Result: Whether the function succeeded in setting the name.
Item.SeeAlso: GetNumLevelTemplates, GetLevelTemplateName, SetLevelTemplateName, CreateLevelTemplate, DeleteLevelTemplate, GetLevelTemplateInfo

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: The index of the Story Level Template.

Param.Name: name
Param.Desc: The new name for the Story Level Template at 'index'.

Item.Name: CreateLevelTemplate
Item.Description: Creates a Story Level Template in the current file. Sets the index parameter to the index of the new template in the list of templates. Story Levels contain a level type, elevation, and optional layer to be used to bound objects on stories; Story Level Templates define a generic level that can be added to multiple stories.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new Story Level Template.
Item.Result: Whether the Story Level Template was successfully created.

Param.Name: layerName
Param.Desc: The layer name for the new Story Level Template. This can be blank, meaning that layers will not be created for instances of the new Story Level Template.

Param.Name: scaleFactor
Param.Desc: The scale factor for the (optional) layer associated with this Story Level Template.

Param.Name: levelType
Param.Desc: The level type for the new Story Level Template. There may be multiple Story Level Templates with the same level type, as long as they have different elevations.

Param.Name: elevation
Param.Desc: The elevation of the Story Level Template, relative to the height of the story in which the level is used.

Param.Name: wallHeight
Param.Desc: The wall height for (optional) layers created when using this Story Level Template in a Story. If the layer name is empty, this parameter is unused.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: After the function is called, this parameter contains the index of the new Story Level Template.

Item.Name: DeleteLevelTemplate
Item.Description: Deletes the nth Story Level Template from the current file. For example, if 3 is passed in, it will delete the 3rd Story Level Template in the file.
Item.ShortDesc: Deletes a Story Level Template at the indicated index.
Item.Result: Whether the Story Level Template at 'index' was found and deleted successfully.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: The index of the Story Level Template to be deleted.

Item.Name: GetLevelTemplateInfo
Item.Description: Used to access the properties of the Story Level Template at 'index'. The name, scaleFactor, levelType, elevation, and wallHeight parameters of the requested Story Level Template will be returned in the appropriate parameters.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the details of the Story Level Template at 'index'.
Item.Result: Whether the Story Level Template at 'index' was found and valid.
Item.SeeAlso: GetNumLevelTemplates, GetLevelTemplateName, SetLevelTemplateName, CreateLevelTemplate, DeleteLevelTemplate, GetLevelTemplateInfo

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: The index of the desired Story Level Template.

Param.Name: layerName
Param.Desc: The layer name associated with the Story Level Template at 'index'. If this is empty, the corresponding Story Level Template does not use or create a layer.

Param.Name: scaleFactor
Param.Desc: The scale of the layer associated with the Story Level Template at 'index'. If this layer name is blank, this parameter has no use.

Param.Name: levelType
Param.Desc: The level type of the Story Level Template at 'index'.

Param.Name: elevation
Param.Desc: The elevation of the Story Level Template at 'index'.

Param.Name: wallHeight
Param.Desc: The wall height of the Story Level Template at 'index'. If the layer name is blank, this parameter has no meaning.

Item.Name: AddStoryLevel
Item.Description: Adds a new Story Layer to the Story pointed to by 'storyHandle'. There must not be another story level in this story that matches 'levelType' or 'elevation', or the function will fail. If the layer 'layerName' already exists, it will be associated with the new Story Level.
Item.ShortDesc: Adds a Story Level to the specified Story.
Item.Result: Whether the new Story Level was created and added.

Param.Name: storyHandle
Param.Desc: The handle of the story that the new level should be added to.

Param.Name: levelType
Param.Desc: The level type of the new Story Level. This cannot be blank.

Param.Name: elevation
Param.Desc: The elevation of the new Story Level in the story.

Param.Name: layerName
Param.Desc: The name of the layer to associate with the new Story Level. This is optional.

Item.Name: RemoveStoryLevel
Item.Description: Removes the Story Level matching 'levelType' from a Story. If 'bDeleteLayer' is true and the Story Level has an associated layer, the layer will be deleted as well.
Item.ShortDesc: Removes a Story Level from a Story, optionally deleting associated layers.
Item.Result: Whether a Story Level with 'layerType' was found in the Story and successfully removed.

Param.Name: storyHandle
Param.Desc: The handle of the story we want to deleted a Story Level from.

Param.Name: levelType
Param.Desc: The level type of the Story Level we want to remove from 'storyHandle'.

Param.Name: bDeleteLayer
Param.Desc: If this is true, and the requested Story Level has a layer associated with it, the layer will be deleted as well.

Item.Name: AddLevelFromTemplate
Item.Description: Adds a new Story Layer to the Story pointed to by 'storyHandle', using the Story Level Template at 'index' as a template. The story must not already contain a Story Level with the same level type or elevation as the template. If the template has a layer name set, a new layer will be created and associated with the new Story Level.
Item.ShortDesc: Adds a Story Level to the specified Story, using a Story Level Template.
Item.Result: Whether the Story Level was successfully created.

Param.Name: storyHandle
Param.Desc: The handle of the Story to add the new Story Level to.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: The index of the Story Level Template to use when creating the Story Level.

Item.Name: SetLevelElevation
Item.Description: Sets the elevation of a Story Level relative to its Story.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the elevation of a Story Level relative to its Story.
Item.Result: Whether the Story Level was found and successfully updated.

Param.Name: storyHandle
Param.Desc: The handle of the Story with the desired Story Level.

Param.Name: levelType
Param.Desc: The level type of the Story Level to change the elevation of.

Param.Name: newElevation
Param.Desc: The new elevation for the Story Level.

Item.Name: GetLevelElevation
Item.Description: Gets the elevation of a Story Level, relative to its containing Story.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the elevation of a Story Level, relative to its containing Story.
Item.Result: The elevation of the requested Story Level.

Param.Name: storyHandle
Param.Desc: The handle of the Story containing the Story Level we would like to know the elevation of.

Param.Name: levelType
Param.Desc: The level type of the Story Level that we would like to know the elevation of.

Item.Name: ResetDefStoryLevels
Item.Description: Clears default story levels and repopulates the list from XML data files on disk.
Item.ShortDesc: Clears default story levels and repopulates the list from XML data files on disk.
Item.Result: Whether clearing the previous default story levels and loading the default list from disk succeeded.

Param.Name: bDeleteExisting
Param.Desc: Whether to delete existing default story levels before reloading the original defaults.

Param.Desc: Returns whether or not the component top is relative to a story.

Item.ShortDesc: Sets whether or not the component top is relative to a story.

Param.Name: object
Param.Desc: The object. Can be a wall, round wall, Wall Style, or the Wall Preferences.

Param.Name: topIsRelativeToStory
Param.Desc: Whether or not the component top is relative to a story.

Item.ShortDesc: Gets whether or not the component bottom is relative to a story.

Param.Name: bottomIsRelativeToStory
Param.Desc: Returns whether or not the component bottom is relative to a story.

Item.Description: Sets whether or not the component bottom is relative to a story.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets whether or not the component bottom is relative to a story.

Param.Name: object

Param.Name: bottomIsRelativeToStory
Param.Desc: Whether or not the component bottom is relative to a story.

Item.Description: Gets the components of the object.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the components of the object.

Item.Description: Shows or hides header row for a list browser control in a dialog
Item.ShortDesc: Shows or hides header row for a list browser control in a dialog

Item.Description: Gets the start points of a wall component.

Item.Name: ImportImageFileN
Item.Description: Import the specified image file as an Image object in Vectorworks. This function allow controlling the options when importing the image.
Item.ShortDesc: Import the specified image file as an Image object in Vectorworks. This function allow controlling the options when importing the image.
Item.Result: Return the imported image handle, or NIL if the import failed.

Param.Name: mode
Param.Desc: Import mode: 0 - import using import option dialog; 1 - import using the last options. If the call was never made with option dialog, then the first time it will show the options dialog.

Item.Name: GetCWFramesFromPt
Item.Description: Returns information about the frames in a curtain wall from a given point.[[BR]][[BR]]Used for placing objects inside a panel in a curtain wall. When passing the center point of the object in the wall, it will find the panel in the curtain wall and return information about the surrounding frames.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets Curtain Wall Frame Information from Point in wall
Item.Result: Returns TRUE if hWall is a curtain wall and frames are found.[[BR]]Returns FALSE is hWall is not a curtain wall or the test point is not found on the wall.

Param.Name: testPt
Param.Desc: Point to test on the curtain wall. Typically the center point of the object to be placed in the curtain wall panel.

Param.Name: panelThickness
Param.Desc: This is the thickness of the panel as it subtracts from the frames. It is a property of the panel

Param.Name: panelOffset
Param.Desc: This is the dimension from the center of the panel to the center of the wall

Param.Name: frameInsetTop
Param.Desc: The frame inset is the distance the panel extends into and subtracts from the frame.

Item.Name: SetObjectAsSpanBreak
Item.Description: Sets an object's span wall flag in it's break record.[[BR]][[BR]]Setting the flag to TRUE will force the object the center of the wall and set the offset position of the break record to reflect this.[[BR]][[BR]]Setting the flag to FALSE will unset the span wall flag, but no further updating to the object will occur.[[BR]][[BR]]The oject (objH) must be contained in wall (wallH) for the setting to succeed.
Item.ShortDesc: Set an object's break record Span Wall flag.
Item.Result: True or False upon successfull setting of the flag[[BR]][[BR]]False can occur for the following conditions:[[BR]]objH is null.[[BR]]wallH is null.[[BR]]objH is not contained in wallH.

Param.Name: objH
Param.Desc: The handle of the object to update.

Param.Name: wallH
Param.Desc: The handle of the wall cotainting the object referenced in objH.

Param.Name: spanWallBreak
Param.Desc: Boolean value to set or unset the span wall flag for the object.

Item.Name: WSScript_GetObject
Item.Description: This function must be used inside a worksheet script called by 'RunScript' worksheet formula.
Item.ShortDesc: This function must be used inside a worksheet script called by 'RunScript' worksheet formula. Returns the object currently being processed by the worksheet criteria at the time of the script execution.
Item.Result: Returns the object currently being processed by the worksheet criteria at the time of the script execution.

Param.Name: resultCellValue

Item.Name: ClipSurfaceN
Item.Description: Creates a new surface object by subtracting the intersection of surfaces [[p:1]] and [[p:2]] from [[p:1]].
Item.ShortDesc: Same as original ClipSurface procedure except returns the resulting object handle

Item.Name: CreateShell
Item.Description: Creates a shelled solid from a NURBS surface.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a shelled solid from a NURBS surface

Item.Name: CnvrtToGenericSolid
Item.Description: Converts Solid objects to generic solids. Removes solid history saving memory.
Item.ShortDesc: Converts Solid objects to generic solids. Removes solid history saving memory.

Item.Name: IsPlanarObj
Item.ShortDesc: Tests if an object is a planar object.

Param.Name: NewParam
Param.Desc: If object is planar, returns the planar refID of its plane

Item.Name: GetCharColor
Item.Description: Function GetCharColor returns the color of a character at a specified position in the given text object.[[BR]]The position is in a range between 0 and 32767, representing a character position in the text string. An index of 0 refers to the first character in the string.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the color of a character at a specified position in the given text object.

Param.Name: position
Param.Desc: Position of the character in the text string (0-based)

Item.Name: WSScript_SetResImage
Item.Description: This function must be used inside a worksheet script called by 'RunScript' worksheet formula.[[BR]][[BR]]Set the result of the worksheet script to the object to be used as image in the cell.
Item.ShortDesc: This function must be used inside a worksheet script called by 'RunScript' worksheet formula. Set the result of the worksheet script to the object to be used as image in the cell.

Param.Name: h
Param.Desc: The handle of the object that will be used for image in the cell.

Item.Name: CreateTaperedExtrd2
Item.Description: Creates a new tapered extrude object in the document. This function returns a "general solid" object while the other function, CreateTaperedExtrude, produces a bunch of NURBS surfaces.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new tapered extrude object in the document.
Item.Result: Returns a HANDLE to the new tapered extrude if successful, otherwise returns NIL.

Param.Name: profileH
Param.Desc: Handle to object defining profile geometry.

Item.Name: SetEntityMatrixN
Item.Description: Sets the matrix of the plane for a planar object. If there is already a plane in the document with that matrix, the object will be set to be in that plane. Otherwise a new plane will be added to the document.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the matrix of the plane for a planar object.
Item.Result: Returns True if data was set successfully, False otherwise.

Param.Name: objectHandle
Param.Desc: The object whose plane is being set.

Param.Name: u
Param.Desc: The X, Y and Z values of the plane's u-vector in current document units.

Param.Name: v
Param.Desc: The X, Y and Z values of the plane's v-vector in current document units.

Param.Name: w
Param.Desc: The X, Y and Z values of the plane's w-vector in current document units.

Param.Name: offset
Param.Desc: The X, Y and Z offsets of the plane in current document units.

Item.Name: GetOriginInDocUnits
Item.Description: Procedure GetOriginInDocUnits returns the current origin location relative to the center of the page in current units. It fixes the problem existing for GetOrigin (see remarks). The behavior is the same while used during objects reset and in commands.
Item.ShortDesc: Procedure GetOriginInDocUnits returns the current origin location relative to the center of the page in current units.

Item.Name: GetProjectFullPath
Item.Description: Gets the path and filename of the Project File for Project Sharing.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the path and filename of the Project File for Project Sharing.
Item.Result: Returns True on success, False on failure or if not Project Sharing

Item.Name: IsProjectOffline
Item.Description: Checks if current document is a Working File operating in Offline Mode.[[BR]][[BR]]Offline Mode is when the Working File is opened and the Project File cannot be found.
Item.ShortDesc: Checks if current document is working in Offline Mode.
Item.Result: Returns True if current document is a Working File operating in Offline Mode.[[BR]]Returns False on failure or not Project Sharing file, or not in Offline Mode.

Item.Name: GetProjectUserNames
Item.Description: Get a list of userids that are part of the current project.
Item.ShortDesc: Get a list of userids that are part of the current project.
Item.Result: True on success, false on failure or not Project Sharing file.

Item.Name: GetProjectUser
Item.Description: For a given userid in the current Project, get their full name and permission level.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:ProjectSharingPermissions]]
Item.ShortDesc: Get details of a user in the current project.
Item.Result: True on success, false on failure or not Project Sharing file.

Item.Name: GetCheckoutsComment
Item.Description: Get the comment that will be used for checkouts and commits.
Item.ShortDesc: Get the comment that will be used for checkouts and commits.
Item.Result: True on success, false on failure or not Project Sharing file.

Item.Name: SetCheckoutsComment
Item.Description: Set the comment that will be used for checkouts and commits.[[BR]][[BR]]The Enter Comment dialogs will still be shown when a checkout or commit is done; the dialog will be prepopulated with the comment set with this command.
Item.ShortDesc: Set the comment that will be used for checkouts and commits.
Item.Result: True on success, false on failure or not Project Sharing file.

Param.Name: comment
Param.Desc: The comment to replace any currently in use.

Item.Name: GetWorkingFileId
Item.Description: Get the unique id for this Working File. This is not a filename.[[BR]][[BR]]Every Working File has a unique identifier. When layers are checked-out, they are reserved for not just a particular user, but also for a particular Working File Id.[[BR]][[BR]]The reserved layer can then only be edited in that specific Working File. If the user creates a second Working File and looks at the layer status, it will show in the second Working File as unavailable for checkout or edit, until it has been committed or released in the first file. [[BR]][[BR]]The specific value of the Working File Id is not meaningful, so it is not directly visible in any of the dialogs. It is used for the color highlighting of layer names in dialogs that show layer ownership.
Item.ShortDesc: Get the unique id for this Working File. This is not a filename.
Item.Result: True on success, false on failure or not Project Sharing file.

Param.Name: uuid
Param.Desc: Unique id for this working file

Item.Name: GetCurrentUserId
Item.Description: Get the user id for the current user.
Item.ShortDesc: Get the user id for the current user.
Item.Result: True on success, false on failure

Item.Name: GetLayerProjectInfo
Item.Description: Retrieves values similar to the Layers tab of the Project Sharing dialog.[[BR]][[BR]]Timestamps are measured in seconds since January 1, 1904. The value 0 has special meaning depending on the timestamp.
Item.ShortDesc: Retrieves values similar to the Layers tab of the Project Sharing dialog.
Item.Result: True on success, false on failure or not Project Sharing file.

Param.Name: masterLayer
Param.Desc: Is this layer a Master Layer, which requires higher permission to edit?

Param.Name: modificationDate
Param.Desc: Timestamp of last commit. 0 means layer is unchanged since initial creation of the Project File.

Param.Name: checkoutDate
Param.Desc: Timestamp of current checkout. 0 means layer is not currently checked out.

Param.Name: checkoutOwner
Param.Desc: Userid that currently has the layer checked out. Empty string if not checked out.

Param.Name: workingFileId
Param.Desc: Working File Id that currently has the layer checked out. Empty string if not checked out. This is not a filename.

Param.Name: comment
Param.Desc: Comment for the checkout Empty string if not checked out.

Param.Name: outOfDate
Param.Desc: If True, there is a newer version of the layer in the Project File that can be brought in with a Refresh.

Item.Name: IsAWorkingFile
Item.Description: Returns True if the current document is a Project Sharing Working File. Otherwise returns False.
Item.ShortDesc: Tests whether the current document is a Project Sharing Working File.
Item.Result: Returns True if the current document is a Project Sharing Working File. Otherwise returns False.

Item.ShortDesc: Export the objects into a STL file.
Item.Result: Return TRUE if successful.

Param.Name: exportObjectsOptions
Param.Desc: 0 -- export visilble objects selected 1 -- export visible objects in activeLayer 2 -- export visible objects in all Layer

Param.Name: FeedbackGroup

Param.Name: ParametricHandle
Param.Desc: The parametric object to which the feedback group was added.

Param.Name: FeedbackGroup
Param.Desc: The feedback group that was attached to the Parametric Object.

Item.Name: CallToolWithMode

Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active tool with mode. When finished, returns to the previously active tool.

Item.Description: Activates the specified Vectorworks tool for use with specified tool mode. The tool remains selected as the active tool after use.

Item.Name: Mirror
Item.Description: Reflect an object across an axis.[[BR]][[BR]]For a 2D reflection, the axis is a line containing arbitrary point p and extending along vector v.
Item.ShortDesc: Mirrors a 2D object
Item.Result: The reflected object (this will be the same as the input object if dup is false).

Param.Name: dup
Param.Desc: If false, transform the original object to the new position. If true, create a new object

Param.Name: p1
Param.Desc: An arbitrary point on the mirror axis

Param.Name: p2
Param.Desc: A second arbitrary point on the mirror axis

Item.Name: GetOpacityN

Param.Desc: Output parameter. Return the object's pen opacity as percentage value in range [0-100].

Param.Desc: Output parameter. Return the object's fill opacity as percentage value in range [0-100].

Item.ShortDesc: Sets the default pen and fill opacity to document.

Item.ShortDesc: Gets default values for Pen and Fill opacity.

Item.ShortDesc: Gets ByClass values for Pen and Fill opacity.

Item.ShortDesc: Sets the specified byClass to use the class opacity on the object.

Item.ShortDesc: Sets the default pen and fill opacity to use the current class pen and fill opacity.

Item.Name: GetDefOpacityByClsN
Item.ShortDesc: Returns By class values of default fill and pen opacity values of document.

Item.Name: GetClOpacityN
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the Fill and Pen Opacity values of the specified class.

Item.Name: SetCLOpacityN
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the fill and pen opacity of the specified class.

Item.Name: OpacityN
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the active fill and pen opacity.

Item.Name: OpacityByClassN
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the document default settings to the opacity of the active class.

Item.Name: RemoveCustomTexParts
Item.Description: This routine removes all custom texture parts from the object.
Item.ShortDesc: This procedure removes all custom texture parts from the object.

Param.Name: obj
Param.Desc: The object from which to remove custom texture parts.

Item.Name: AddCustomTexPart
Item.Description: This procedure adds a custom texture part with the specified ID and name to the object. Use partID starting at 100 to avoid conflicts with existing texture parts.
Item.ShortDesc: This procedure adds a custom texture part with the specified ID and name to the object.

Param.Name: obj
Param.Desc: The object to add a custom texture part to.

Param.Name: partID
Param.Desc: The texture part ID. Start at 100 to avoid conflicts with existing texture parts.

Param.Name: partName
Param.Desc: The texture part name, which will be shown in the texturing UI.

Item.Name: GetObjWallInsertMode
Item.Description: Returns the insertion mode for an object in a wall.[[BR]][[BR]]0 - Insert on the center of the wall[[BR]]1 - Insert on the left edge of the wall[[BR]]2 - Insert on the right edge of the wall[[BR]]3 - Insert on the center of the wall core component[[BR]]4 - Insert on the left edge of the wall core component[[BR]]5 - Insert on the right edge of the wall core component[[BR]][[BR]]The object (objH) must be contained in wall (wallH) to succeed.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the insertion mode for an object in a wall.
Item.Result: True or False upon successful retrieving of the insertion mode.[[BR]][[BR]]False can occur for the following conditions:[[BR]]objH is null.[[BR]]wallH is null.[[BR]]objH is not contained in wallH.

Item.Name: SetObjWallInsertMode
Item.Description: Set the insertion mode for an object in a wall.[[BR]][[BR]]0 - Insert on the center of the wall[[BR]]1 - Insert on the left edge of the wall[[BR]]2 - Insert on the right edge of the wall[[BR]]3 - Insert on the center of the wall core component[[BR]]4 - Insert on the left edge of the wall core component[[BR]]5 - Insert on the right edge of the wall core component[[BR]][[BR]]The object (objH) must be contained in wall (wallH) to succeed.
Item.ShortDesc: Set the insertion mode for an object in a wall.
Item.Result: True or False upon successful setting of the insertion mode.[[BR]][[BR]]False can occur for the following conditions:[[BR]]objH is null.[[BR]]wallH is null.[[BR]]objH is not contained in wallH.

Item.Name: GetObjWallBreakMode
Item.Description: Returns the break mode for an object in a wall.[[BR]][[BR]]1 - Full Break with Caps[[BR]]2 - Full Break no Caps[[BR]]3 - Half Break[[BR]]4 - No Break[[BR]][[BR]]The object (objH) must be contained in wall (wallH) to succeed.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the break mode for an object in a wall.
Item.Result: True or False upon successful retrieving of the break mode.[[BR]][[BR]]False can occur for the following conditions:[[BR]]objH is null.[[BR]]wallH is null.[[BR]]objH is not contained in wallH.

Item.Name: SetObjWallBreakMode
Item.Description: Set the break mode for an object in a wall.[[BR]][[BR]]1 - Full Break with Caps[[BR]]2 - Full Break no Caps[[BR]]3 - Half Break[[BR]]4 - No Break[[BR]][[BR]]The object (objH) must be contained in wall (wallH) to succeed.
Item.ShortDesc: Set the break mode for an object in a wall.
Item.Result: True or False upon successful setting of the break mode.[[BR]][[BR]]False can occur for the following conditions:[[BR]]objH is null.[[BR]]wallH is null.[[BR]]objH is not contained in wallH.

Item.Name: CustomTexPartExists
Item.Description: Returns true if object has the specified partID custom texture part.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns true if obj has the specified custom texture part.

Item.Name: ApplyCustomTexPart
Item.Description: Applies the src objectâs custom texture part partID to dest Overall part. For example apply PIO texture partID 100 to extrudeâs Overall part. If the dest object does not support the src map type then a default mapping is used.
Item.ShortDesc: Applies the src custom texture part with partID to the dest object.

Param.Name: srcObj
Param.Desc: The source object from which to get the texture assignment and mapping.

Param.Name: destObj
Param.Desc: The dest object to apply the texture and mapping to. The texture and mapping are applied to destObjâs Overall texture part.

Param.Name: partID
Param.Desc: The custom texture part ID to apply from the src to the dest object.

Item.Name: EnableDropShadow
Item.ShortDesc: Toggles DropShadow to enable or not.

Item.Name: IsDropShadowEnabled
Item.ShortDesc: Returns if DropShadow is enabled or not.

Item.Name: GetCLDrpShadowData
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the DropShadow of the class. Make sure to confirm if DropShadow is enabled by using CLDropShadowEnabled() function also.

Item.Name: SetCLDrpShadowData
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the Drop Shadow data on the class. Make sure to confirm if DropShadow is enabled by using CLDropShadowEnabled() function also. Use EnableCLDropShadow(..) function to enable it as needed.

Item.Name: EnableCLDropShadow
Item.ShortDesc: Enables the DropShadow as specified.

Item.Name: CLDropShadowEnabled
Item.ShortDesc: Returns if the DropShadow is enabled on this class or not.

Item.Name: GetDropShadowByCls
Item.ShortDesc: Returns DropShadow By Class value.

Item.Name: SetDropShadowByCls
Item.ShortDesc: Sets DropShadow by Class value.

Item.Name: GetDropShadowData
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the DropShadow data. Make sure to use IsDropShadowEnabled(HANDLE) function also to confirm if it is enabled.

Item.Name: SetDropShadowData
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the DropShadow data on the object. Make sure to use EnableDropShadow(HANDLE, BOOLEAN) function also to enable DropShadow as required.

Item.Name: EnableDefDropShadow
Item.ShortDesc: Sets default DropShadow as enabled/disabled.

Item.Name: DefDrpShadowEnabled
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the value of DropShadow is enabled or not.

Item.Name: DocDropShadowByCls
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the value of Document - DropShadow By Class.

Item.Name: SetDocDrpShadwByCls
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the Doc DropShadow by class flag.

Item.Name: GetDocDrpShadowData
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the DropShadow data of the active document.

Item.Name: SetDocDrpShadowData
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the DropShadow data of the active document.

Item.Name: GetPluginStyleSymbol
Item.Description: Retrieves the handled to a symbol that defines the plug-in style for a given plug-in object.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Get the handle for the symbol defining a plug-in style.
Item.Result: TRUE if the object is styled.[[BR]]FALSE if the object is uynstyled.

Param.Name: hSymDef
Param.Desc: Hanlde to a symbol definition that contrains the plug-in style associated with hObject.

Item.Name: GetParamStyleType
Item.Description: Returns the style type (by instance or by style) for a parameter.
Item.ShortDesc: Retruns the style type of a parameter in a plug-in style definition
Item.Result: 0 = Parametrer is an instance parameter[[BR]]1 = Parameter is a style parameter.[[BR]][[BR]]If the object in unstyled or the parameter name if not found 0 will be returned and should be treated as an instance parameter.

Param.Name: hStyle
Param.Desc: Handle to a symbol containing a plug-in style.

Param.Name: paramName
Param.Desc: Universal name of a parameter to check for style type.

Item.Name: SetParamStyleType

Item.Name: SetDefGenStoryBound

Item.ShortDesc: Sets default generic PIO story bound.
Item.Result: TRUE if successful. FALSE will be returned if input object isn't a format or isn't associated with a plugin that has the kObjXPropSupportGenericStoryLevel property set.

Param.Name: boundStory
Param.Desc: The story for the bound. If 'boundStory' = 0 then it is the object's story. If 'boundStory' = 1 then it is the story above. If 'boundStory' = -1 then it is the story below.

Param.Name: layerLevelType
Param.Desc: The layer type which defines this bound (e.g. "Ceiling").

Param.Name: offSet
Param.Desc: The offset distance from the specified bound story.

Item.Name: GetDefGenStoryBound
Item.Description: This will get the default story bound for a plugin that has the kObjXPropSupportGenericStoryLevel property.[[BR]]The bound information returned is only valid when the return value of the function is TRUE.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets default generic PIO story bound information.
Item.Result: Returns TRUE if the default bounds were obtained; FALSE if the input format was not a format associated with a plugin that supports the generic PIO bound (i.e. has the kObjXPropSupportGenericStoryLevel property set).

Param.Name: boundStory
Param.Desc: The story for the bound. If 'boundStory' = 0 then it is the object's story. If 'boundStory' = 1 then it is the story above. If 'boundStory' = -1 then it is the story below.

Param.Name: layerLevelType
Param.Desc: The layer type which defines this bound (e.g. "Ceiling").

Param.Name: offset
Param.Desc: The offset distance from the specified bound story.

Param.Name: story
Param.Desc: The story relative to which to get the strings. Nil gets a generic list of strings.

Param.Name: boundSelection
Param.Desc: Type of bounds strings being requested: 0 for Top Bound; 1 for Dual Bound (combines both top and bottom); 2 for Bottom Bound.

Item.Name: BeginFolderN
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] creates a new resource folder of the indicated type in a Vectorworks document. Any resource or folder of that type created after the current call to [[name]] will be nested inside the new folder. A call to EndFolder will complete the creation of the folder, which is then generated in the Vectorworks document.[[BR]][[BR]]To name the new folder, precede [[name]] with a call to NameObject.[[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new resource folder in a Vectorworks document.
Item.Example: const[[BR]]kSymbolDefinitions = 16;[[BR]]NameObject('Object Symbols');[[BR]]BeginFolder(kSymbolDefinitions);[[BR]] BeginSym('Oval Symbols');[[BR]] PenSize(14);[[BR]] PenPat(2);[[BR]] FillPat(1);[[BR]] FillFore(0,0,0);[[BR]] FillBack(65535,65535,65535);[[BR]] PenFore(0,0,0);[[BR]] PenBack(65535,65535,65535);[[BR]] Oval(-1/4",1/4",3/4",-3/4");[[BR]] EndSym;[[BR]]EndFolder;[[BR]]{creates the symbol folder 'Object Symbols', which contains a symbol}

Param.Name: type
Param.Desc: the type of resource the folder will contain

Item.Name: AddToPIOStyleEdit
Item.Description: Adds an item to a plug-in style's default edit list. This is only used by objects that use the default edit style dialog.[[BR]][[BR]]By default, only those parameters shown in the object info palette will be listed in the edit style mapping dialg. Pass the following values to add or remove an item this list.[[BR]][[BR]]Values:[[BR]]1 - Add to the edit style map dialog.[[BR]]2 - Remove from the edit stkyle map dialog.[[BR]][[BR]][[BR]]To remove an entry from this list use RemovePIOStyleEdit.[[BR]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Add an item to the edit plug-in style map dialog.
Item.Result: TRUE if key is added to the list.[[BR]][[BR]]FALSE if hObj is NULL; if hObj is not a styled plug-in object or plug-in style[[BR]]FALSE if item already appear in list. Use RemoveFromPluginStyleEditList first.

Param.Name: hObj
Param.Desc: Handle to a plug-in object or plug-in object style

Param.Name: keyName
Param.Desc: Universal name of parameter or iother item to add to the edit style map list

Param.Name: editType
Param.Desc: 1 - Add to edit list 2 - Remove from edit list

Param.Name: displayName
Param.Desc: The display name to use in the style map dialog. If an empy string is passed the keyName will be used.

Item.Name: RemovePIOStyleEdit

Item.ShortDesc: Remove an item from the edit plug-in style map dialog.

Param.Name: hObj
Param.Desc: Handle to a plug-in object or plug-in style

Param.Name: keyName
Param.Desc: Name of item to remove from list.

Item.Name: ReadBin
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] will read binary data from a currently open file. The variable length parameter list returns the read data in the specified parameters. [[BR]][[BR]]Supported data types include INTEGER (2-bytes), REAL (8-bytes), LONGINT (4-bytes), CHAR (1-byte) or STRING/DYNARRAY OF CHAR (see remarks). [[BR]][[BR]]The bytes will be written as little-endian. [[BR]][[BR]]Strings will require additional INTEGER parameter to specify encoding: 0 â mac; 1 â win; 2 â system; 3 â UTF8; 4 â UTF16.
Item.ShortDesc: Reads data from the currently open binary file. Strings will require additional INTEGER parameter with encoding: 0 â mac; 1 â win; 2 â system; 3 â UTF8; 4 â UTF16

Item.Name: WriteBin
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] outputs the specified data to a binary file. The variable length parameter list specifies the data to be written to the file. [[BR]][[BR]]Supported data types include INTEGER (2-bytes), REAL (8-bytes), LONGINT (4-bytes), CHAR (1-byte) or STRING/DYNARRAY OF CHAR (see remarks). [[BR]][[BR]]The bytes will be written as little-endian. [[BR]][[BR]]Strings will require two additional INTEGER parameters: symbol count and encoding: 0 â mac; 1 â win; 2 â system; 3 â UTF8; 4 â UTF16.
Item.ShortDesc: Writes data to a binary file file. Strings will require two additional INTEGER parameter: output symbol count and encoding: 0 â mac; 1 â win; 2 â system; 3 â UTF8; 4 â UTF16

Item.Name: LenEncoding

Item.ShortDesc: Returns the length of the specified value in the specified encoding: 0 â mac; 1 â win; 2 â system; 3 â UTF8; 4 â UTF16

Param.Name: encoding
Param.Desc: 0 â mac; 1 â win; 2 â system; 3 â UTF8; 4 â UTF16

Item.Name: SetDashLineTypeName
Item.Description: Sets the dash style name for the specified dash style using its negated internal index.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the dash style name for the specified dash style using its negated internal index.
Item.Result: 'true' if the operation was successful.[[BR]]'false' otherwise.
Item.Comments: This replaces SetDashStyleName.

Param.Name: DashStyleIndex
Param.Desc: The negated internal index of the dash style to be named.

Param.Name: DashStyleName
Param.Desc: The new name of the line type.

Item.Name: GetDashLineTypeName
Item.Description: Retrieves the dash style name for the specified dash style using its negated internal index.
Item.ShortDesc: Retrieves the dash style name for the specified dash style using its negated internal index.
Item.Result: Name of the dash style specified by the index.
Item.Comments: This replaces GetDashStyleName

Param.Name: DashStyleIndex
Param.Desc: The negated internal index of the dash style.

Item.Name: GetDashStyleN
Item.Description: Function [[name]] searches for the pattern specified by the parameters. If it exists, then the negative value of the dash pattern's internal index is returned. If it does not exist, then it is added to the document and the negative value of the dash pattern's internal index is returned.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the negative value of the dash pattern's index.
Item.Comments: Searches for the pattern specified by the parameters. If it exists, then the negative value of the dash pattern's internal index is returned. If it does not exist, then it is added to the document and the negative value of the dash pattern's internal index is returned.

Item.Name: GetDashStyleIndexN
Item.Description: Function [[name]] searches for the pattern specified by the parameters. If it exists, then the negative value of the dash pattern's internal index is returned. If it does not exist, then it is added to the document and the negative value of the new dash pattern's internal index is returned.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the negative value of the dash pattern's internal index.

Item.Name: GetDashDataValPrAtN
Item.Description: Function [[name]] gets the dash data for the specified dash style. The dash data is a dash/gap value pair. [[name]] returns false if the dash style or dash data doesn't exist. Dash styles support up to 5 dash/gap value pairs.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the dash data for the specified dash style. The dash data is a dash/gap value pair.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]]n, numPairs : INTEGER;[[BR]]dashIndex : LONGINT;[[BR]]scaleWThick :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]arrayDashDat : ARRAY[1..5] OF POINT;[[BR]]x,y : REAL;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]][[BR]]dashIndex := GetDashStyleIndexN(TRUE, 2, 0.12, 0.18, 0.03, 0.07);[[BR]][[BR]]numPairs := GetNumDashDataPairsN(dashIndex,scaleWThick);[[BR]][[BR]]FOR n := 1 TO numPairs DO BEGIN[[BR]] IF (GetDashDataValPrAtN(dashIndex, n , x, y)) THEN BEGIN[[BR]] arrayDashDat[n].x := x ;[[BR]] arrayDashDat[n].y := y ;[[BR]] END; [[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: dashStyleIndex
Param.Desc: The negative value of the dash pattern's internal index.

Param.Name: dataIndex
Param.Desc: Index of the data value pair.

Item.Name: GetNumDashDataPairsN
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns the number of dash/gap value pairs defined for the specified dash style. The "scale with thickness" setting is also returned. Dash styles support up to 5 dash/gap value pairs.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the number of dash/gap value pairs defined for the specified dash style.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]]n, numPairs : INTEGER;[[BR]]dashIndex : LONGINT;[[BR]]scaleWThick :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]arrayDashDat : ARRAY[1..5] OF POINT;[[BR]]x,y : REAL;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]][[BR]]dashIndex := GetDashStyleIndexN(TRUE, 2, 0.12, 0.18, 0.03, 0.07);[[BR]][[BR]]numPairs := GetNumDashDataPairsN(dashIndex,scaleWThick);[[BR]][[BR]]FOR n := 1 TO numPairs DO BEGIN[[BR]] IF (GetDashDataValPrAtN(dashIndex, n , x, y)) THEN BEGIN[[BR]] arrayDashDat[n].x := x ;[[BR]] arrayDashDat[n].y := y ;[[BR]] END; [[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: dashIndex
Param.Desc: The negative value of the dash pattern's internal index.

Item.Name: SetWSCellTopBN
Item.Description: Sets a top border with the specified attributes in specified worksheet cells.[[BR]][[BR]][[name]] allows borders to be set for a rectangular range of cells. To set the border formatting of a single cell, specify identical values for the top/bottom and left/right range boundaries.[[BR]][[BR]]Note:[[BR]]A rectangular range of cells is formatted as a single block of cells. If you apply a top border to the range of cells, the border is displayed only on the right edge of the cells. [[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Sets a top border with the specified attributes in specified worksheet cells.

Param.Name: worksheet

Param.Name: bottomRow

Param.Desc: Right column of range to set.

Param.Name: style
Param.Desc: Border line style to be set.(0 = None; 2 = Solid; for dashed, use negative value of Internal Index of dash line type

Param.Name: weight
Param.Desc: Border line weight to be set. (in Mils)

Param.Name: color
Param.Desc: Border line color to be set. (color index: 0..255)

Item.Name: GetPseudoIndFromDash
Item.Description: Supplies a pseudo index for a dashed style. The returned index is not guaranteed to produce the same line type from file to file, nor even in the same file if line types change.[[BR]]Returns TRUE if successful.

Item.Description: Gets the dash style that corresponds to the pseudo index and returns the style's internal index. Returns TRUE if successful.[[BR]][[BR]]

Item.Name: CreateSymDispCtrlN
Item.Description: Creates a new symbol display control in the dialog layout. The control displays the specified symbol in the specified rendering mode and view. Specified image component is used. The actual size of the symbol is not relevant; it is shown as large as possible in the given height and width (the height to width ratio of the symbol is always preserved). To show a blank SymbolDisplay control, use an empty string as the symbolName parameter.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:SymbolDisplayControlRenderModesTable]][[BR]][[BR]][[note:SymbolDisplayControlViewsTable]][[BR]][[BR]][[note:SymbolDisplayComponentsTable]]
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new symbol display control in the dialog layout.

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The ID of the dialog in which to create the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The item ID of the control.

Param.Name: symbolName
Param.Desc: The name of the symbol to display.

Param.Name: width
Param.Desc: The width of the control in pixels.

Param.Name: height
Param.Desc: The height of the control in pixels.

Param.Name: margin
Param.Desc: The margin bewteen the border of the control and the symbol in pixels.

Param.Name: view
Param.Desc: The view in which to display the symbol.

Param.Name: renderMode
Param.Desc: The render mode in which to display the symbol.

Param.Name: scaleByZoom
Param.Desc: Whether the sizing is done by zoom or layer scale.

Item.Name: UpdateSymDispCtrlN
Item.Description: Updates a pre-existing symbol display control in the dialog with a new symbol, rendering mode, view or image component. The dialog ID and item ID must refer to symbol display control created with CreateSymDispCtrlN. To show a blank SymbolDisplay control, use an empty string as the symbolName parameter.[[BR]][[BR]][[note:SymbolDisplayControlRenderModesTable]][[BR]][[BR]][[note:SymbolDisplayControlViewsTable]][[BR]][[BR]][[note:SymbolDisplayComponentsTable]][[BR]]
Item.ShortDesc: Updates a pre-existing symbol display control in the dialog with a new symbol, rendering mode, view or image component.

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The ID of the dialog in which to create the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The item ID of the control.

Param.Name: symbolName
Param.Desc: The name of the symbol to display.

Param.Name: view
Param.Desc: The view in which to display the symbol.

Param.Name: renderMode
Param.Desc: The render mode in which to display the symbol.

Param.Name: scaleByZoom
Param.Desc: Whether the sizing is done by zoom or layer scale.

Item.Name: CreateSearchEditBox
Item.Description: Creates a search field control in a dialog layout.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a search field control in a dialog layout.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] result :INTEGER;[[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]END;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Example Dialog', FALSE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateSearchEditBox(dialog1, 4, 'search', 16);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Name: itemID
Param.Desc: The index that will identify the control item.

Param.Name: promptText
Param.Desc: The default prompt text for the search control.

Param.Name: widthInStdChar
Param.Desc: The width of the displayed text in standard character count. See GetDlgCtrlWidthStdCh.

Item.Name: CreateEditPassword
Item.Description: Creates an password text field control in a dialog layout.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates an password text field control in a dialog layout.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] dialog1 :INTEGER;[[BR]] result :INTEGER;[[BR]]PROCEDURE Dialog_Handler(VAR item :LONGINT; data :LONGINT);[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]]END;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] dialog1 := CreateLayout('Example Dialog', FALSE, 'OK', 'Cancel');[[BR]] CreateEditPassword(dialog1, 4, 16);[[BR]] SetFirstLayoutItem(dialog1, 4);[[BR]] result := RunLayoutDialog(dialog1, Dialog_Handler);[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);[[BR]][[BR]]

Param.Name: dialogID

Item.Name: GetDrawingArea
Item.Description: Gets the drawing area of the active layer, as in Page Setup dialog. If Other is selected returns an empty string as outDrawingArea and true for outIsOther.If One Printer Page is Selected, returns empty string for outDrawingArea and true for outIsOnePrinterPage. Otherwise, returns the drawing area name (ISO A3, US ARCH A, etc.)
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the drawing area as in Page Setup dialog.

Param.Name: outDrawingArea
Param.Desc: Returns the paper size name of the active layer, if it is found in the predefined paper sizes from DwgSizes-Universal.txt.

Param.Name: outIsOther
Param.Desc: Returns true, if the paper size of the active layer is not one of the predefined sizes from DwgSizes-Universal.txt.

Param.Name: outIsOnePrintedPage
Param.Desc: Returns true, if One Printer Page was selected in Page Setup dialog and the page area is the same as the selected from the printer page area.

Item.Name: CreateDuplicateObjN
Item.Description: Duplicates the specified object and inserts the new object into the container. If container is nil, the new object will be inserted in the active container (Functionlaity of CreateDuplicateObject). This functions add an extra input paramer to maintain height relative to the specified layer.
Item.ShortDesc: Mimics the functionality of CreateDuplicateObject also adding an extra input paramer to maintain height relative to the specified layer.

Param.Desc: The height in pixels of the image this function will save of the saved view. This should be close to the height of the reference image.

Item.Name: AlertCriticalHLink
Item.Description: Informs the user of a serious problem that requires intervention or correction before work can continue. Provides a hyperlink (HLink) to further help the user resolve the problem.
Item.ShortDesc: Informs the user of a serious problem that requires intervention or correction before work can continue.
Item.SeeAlso: AlertCritical, AlertInform, AlertQuestion, AlertInformDontShowAgain, AlertQuestionDontShowAgain, AlertInformHLink, AlertInformHLinkN
Item.Comments: Created by KAS 8/14/2019
Item.Example: AlertCriticalHLink('Serious Problem with X', 'Please visit', 'our website', 'https://www.vectorworks.net', 'for more information on how to resolve the problem with X.');

Param.Name: adviceBeforeLink
Param.Desc: The text to be added in a smaller font under the main information message and above the hyperlink.

Param.Name: linkTitle
Param.Desc: The clickable text of the hyperlink to be added under the adviceBeforeLink text and above the adviceAfterLink text. The text to be added will be in the same smaller font as the adviceBeforeLink text.

Param.Name: linkURL
Param.Desc: The URL that a user will be directed to when the user clicks on the linkTitle text.

Param.Name: adviceAfterLink
Param.Desc: The text to be added under the hyperlink. The text to be added will be in the same smaller font as the adviceBeforeLink text.

Item.Name: AlertInformHLink
Item.Description: Displays an alert dialog which provides the user with information about the result of a command. It offers no user choices. It provides a hyperlink (HLink) to further help the user.
Item.ShortDesc: Displays an alert dialog which provides the user with information about the result of a command.
Item.SeeAlso: AlertInform, AlertQuestion, AlertCritical, AlertInformDontShowAgain, AlertQuestionDontShowAgain, AlertCriticalHLink, AlertInformHLinkN
Item.Comments: Created by KAS 8/14/2019
Item.Example: AlertInformHLink('That item is not a valid item', 'Please visit', 'our website', 'https://www.vectorworks.net', 'for more information on what is a valid item.', false);

Param.Name: adviceBeforeLink
Param.Desc: The text to be added in a smaller font under the main information message and above the hyperlink.

Param.Name: linkTitle
Param.Desc: The clickable text of the hyperlink to be added under the adviceBeforeLink text and above the adviceAfterLink text. The text to be added will be in the same smaller font as the adviceBeforeLink text.

Param.Name: linkURL
Param.Desc: The URL that a user will be directed to when the user clicks on the linkTitle text.

Param.Name: adviceAfterLink
Param.Desc: The text to be added under the hyperlink. The text to be added will be in the same smaller font as the adviceBeforeLink text.

Param.Name: minorAlert
Param.Desc: The severity of the alert: minor(true) or major(false).

Item.Name: AlertInformHLinkN
Item.Description: Displays an alert dialog which provides the user with information about the result of a command with an option to not show the dialog again. It offers no user choices. It provides a hyperlink (HLink) to further help the user.[[BR]][[BR]]The parameter 'arrOptions' is of type ARRAY [1..3] OF STRING;[[BR]]arrOpt[1] - Saved setting category to save checkbox value[[BR]]arrOpt[2] - Saved setting item to save checkbox value [[BR]]arrOpt[3] - Specify the string to use in overriding the default 'Dont show this dialog again' checkbox string
Item.ShortDesc: Displays an alert dialog which provides the user with information about the result of a command with an option to not show the dialog again.
Item.SeeAlso: AlertInform, AlertQuestion, AlertCritical, AlertInformDontShowAgain, AlertQuestionDontShowAgain, AlertCriticalHLink, AlertInformHLink
Item.Comments: Created by KAS 8/14/2019
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]][[BR]]VAR[[BR]] arrayText : ARRAY[1..3] OF STRING;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] arrayText[1] := 'DontShowDialogAgainCategory';[[BR]] arrayText[2] := 'DontShowDialogAgainItem'; {Should be unique for every AlertInformDontShowAgain}[[BR]] arrayText[3] := '';[[BR]][[BR]] AlertInformHLinkN('This is an invalid item.', 'Please visit', 'our website', 'https://www.vectorworks.net', 'for more information on what is a valid item.', false, arrayText);[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: adviceBeforeLink
Param.Desc: The text to be added in a smaller font under the main information message and above the hyperlink.

Param.Name: linkTitle
Param.Desc: The clickable text of the hyperlink to be added under the adviceBeforeLink text and above the adviceAfterLink text. The text to be added will be in the same smaller font as the adviceBeforeLink text.

Param.Name: linkURL
Param.Desc: The URL that a user will be directed to when the user clicks on the linkTitle text.

Param.Name: adviceAfterLink
Param.Desc: The text to be added under the hyperlink. The text to be added will be in the same smaller font as the adviceBeforeLink text.

Param.Name: minorAlert
Param.Desc: The severity of the alert: minor(true) or major(false).

Param.Name: arrOptions
Param.Desc: ARRAY [1..3] OF STRING; arrOpt[1] - Saved setting category to save checkbox value arrOpt[2] - Saved setting item to save checkbox value arrOpt[3] - Specify a string to use in overriding the default 'Dont show this dialog again' checkbox string

Item.Name: EnableLBExternalSort
Item.Description: Enables/disables external sorting.
Item.ShortDesc: Enables/disables external sorting.

Param.Name: dialogID
Param.Desc: id of the dialog that contains the list browser

Param.Name: componentID
Param.Desc: id of the list browser control

Param.Name: enable
Param.Desc: specifies whether to enable or disable external sorting

Item.Name: GetObjMaterialName
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the name of an object's referenced material. Returns true if successful; false otherwise.

Item.Name: GetObjMaterialHandle
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the handle to an object's referenced material, if any.

Item.Name: SetObjMaterialHandle
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the specified material handle as the specified object's referenced material. Returns true if successful else returns false.

Item.Name: GetMaterialTexture
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the internal index of the material's texture if it exists; 0 otherwise.If it is a Compound material, the fill style for the primary sub-material is returned.

Item.Name: SetMaterialTexture
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the material's texture. Only a simple material may have its texture set. Returns true if successful; false otherwise. If textureIndex is invalid it sets the texture to None.

Item.Name: CreateMaterial
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a BuildingMaterialType node of the specified type, either Simple or Compound. The type of the node may not be changed after creation.

Item.Name: IsMaterialSimple
Item.ShortDesc: Determines if the specified material's type is Simple or Compound.

Item.Name: GetMaterialFillStyle
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the internal index to the material's fill style. If it is a Compound material, the fill style for the primary sub-material is returned.

Item.Name: SetMaterialFillStyle
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the material's fill style. Only a simple material may have its fill style set. It also sets Fill style by class to false; Returns true if successful; false otherwise. If fillStyle is invalid it sets the fill style to None;

Item.Name: IsMtrlFillStyleByCls
Item.ShortDesc: Determines if the material fill should be by class. If it is a Compound material, the fill style for the primary sub-material is returned.

Item.Name: SetMtlFillStyleByCls
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the material's fill style.Only a simple material may have its fill style set. It also sets the fill style to None. Returns true if successful; false otherwise.

Param.Desc: Name of record to be updated.

Param.Desc: Option to set, specifying this field as empty data for the Data Manager.

Param.Desc: Output the flag for data linked value used by the Data Manager.

Item.Name: GetComponentMaterial

Item.ShortDesc: Gets the material of a component in an object.

Param.Name: object
Param.Desc: The object. Can be a wall, round wall, slab, roof face, roof, Wall Style, Slab Style, Roof Style, the Wall Preferences, the Slab Preferences, or the Roof Preferences.

Param.Name: material
Param.Desc: Returns the material of the component.

Item.Name: SetComponentMaterial

Param.Desc: The handle of an object to be added

Item.Name: AddSubMtrlToMtrl
Item.Description: Adds a Simple material to a Compound material. Sets the fraction of the Simple material as a relation to the whole. Fraction can have value between 0.0 and 1.0. "Primary" material is a simple material which carries the graphical attributes to be used by the compound material.
Item.ShortDesc: Adds a Simple material to a Compound material. Sets the fraction of the Simple material as a relation to the whole.
Item.Result: Returns true if successful; false otherwise. Function fails if the simple material already was added.

Param.Name: subMtrlName
Param.Desc: Name of a Simple material to be added

Param.Name: makePrimary
Param.Desc: True if this Simple material should become the primary material of the Compound material

Item.Name: RemoveSubMtrlFromMtl
Item.Description: Removes a Simple material from a Compound material.
Item.ShortDesc: Removes a Simple material from a Compound material.
Item.Result: Returns true if successful; false otherwise. Returns false if the simple material is not found.

Param.Name: subMtrlName
Param.Desc: Name of a Simple material to be deleted

Item.Name: UpdateSubMtrlInMtrl
Item.Description: Updates a Simple material which is a part of a Compound material. Sets new values for its fraction and whether it should be the primary material. Fraction can have value between 0.0 and 1.0. "Primary" material is a simple material which carries the graphical attributes to be used by the compound material.
Item.ShortDesc: Updates a Simple material which is a part of a Compound material. Sets new values for its fraction and whether it should be the primary material.
Item.Result: Returns true if successful; false otherwise. Returns false if the simple material was not found.

Param.Name: subMtrlName
Param.Desc: Name of a Simple material to be updated

Param.Name: makePrimary
Param.Desc: True if this Simple material should become the primary material of the Compound material

Item.Name: ActSymDefN
Item.Description: Function [[name]] returns a handle to the currently active symbol.[[BR]][[BR]]If the active symbol is not in the active document, it will be imported, unless there is a conflict and the allowConflictDlg parameter is set to FALSE. After being imported, the imported symbol will be returned.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the active symbol of the document.

Param.Name: allowConflictDlg
Param.Desc: Whether to show a conflict dialog if the active symbol is not in the active document, and a conflict would need to be resolved to import it. If there is a conflict and allowConflictDlg is set to FALSE, [[name]] will return NULL.

Item.Name: CreateResourcePopup
Item.Description: Creates a text popup similar to a pulldown menu that opens a Resource Manager window.[[BR]][[BR]]This is basically the same as the Thumbnail popup but the control only displays the name of the selected item (it does not display its thumbnail), resembling a pulldown menu control.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a text popup similar to a pulldown menu that opens a Resource Manager window.

Param.Name: nDialogID
Param.Desc: The index of the dialog layout containing the control.

Param.Desc: The index that will identify the control item.

Param.Name: nWidthInChars
Param.Desc: The width of the displayed text in standard character count. See GetDlgCtrlWidthStdCh.

Item.Name: WSScript_GetEdit
Item.Description: This function must be used inside a worksheet script called by 'RunScriptEdit' worksheet formula. It will tell the script when a value has been change and what's the value. Use 'WSScript_GetEditObj' to get the value.
Item.ShortDesc: This function must be used inside a worksheet script called by 'RunScriptEdit' worksheet formula. It will tell the script when a value has been change and what's the value. Use 'WSScript_GetEditObj' to get the value.
Item.Result: Return true if the cell is being edited.

Param.Name: outNewValue
Param.Desc: The new value for the cell as inputted by the user.

Item.Name: WSScript_GetEditObj
Item.Description: This function must be used inside a worksheet script called by 'RunScriptEdit' worksheet formula. It will return the object being edited when 'WSScript_GetEdit' returns that the script is in edit mode.
Item.ShortDesc: This function must be used inside a worksheet script called by 'RunScriptEdit' worksheet formula. It will return the object being edited when 'WSScript_GetEdit' returns that the script is in edit mode.
Item.Result: Return FALSE and NIL or vs.Handle() if the index is outside the range.

Param.Name: objIndex
Param.Desc: Index to the object to be returned as the script can be called for a set of objects. Will return FALSE if no such object.

Param.Name: outObj
Param.Desc: Output the object that is being edited.
