Item.Name: PopupGetChoices
Item.ShortDesc: Return popup field values.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]][[BR]]FUNCTION TestFunc(h :HANDLE) :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]]arrayText : ARRAY[1..3] OF STRING;[[BR]]CurPopUpInfo : ARRAY[ 1..100 ] OF STRING; [[BR]]numPopUpValues : INTEGER;[[BR]]i : INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] {create new record}[[BR]] NewField( 'Format-1', 'FieldNamePopUp', '22222', 17, 0 );[[BR]][[BR]] arrayText[1] := '11111';[[BR]] arrayText[2] := '22222';[[BR]] arrayText[3] := '33333';[[BR]] [[BR]] {add new popup values to FieldNamePopUp}[[BR]] PopupSetChoices( 'Format-1', 'FieldNamePopUp', arrayText );[[BR]][[BR]] {get popup values and print them}[[BR]] PopupGetChoices( 'Format-1', 'FieldNamePopUp', numPopUpValues, CurPopUpInfo );[[BR]] [[BR]] FOR i:=1 TO numPopUpValues DO[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] AlertInform ( CurPopUpInfo[ i ], '', FALSE );[[BR]] END;[[BR]] [[BR]] {clear popUp values}[[BR]] {NewField( 'Format-1', 'FieldNamePopUp', '22222', 17, 0 );}[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] ForEachObjectInLayer(TestFunc, 0, 0, 4);[[BR]][[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: recName
Param.Desc: Name of record in which field is.

Item.Name: PopupSetChoices
Item.ShortDesc: Assigns a new popup value to an existing popup field of a record attached to the referenced object.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]][[BR]]FUNCTION TestFunc(h :HANDLE) :BOOLEAN;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]]arrayText : ARRAY[1..3] OF STRING;[[BR]]CurPopUpInfo : ARRAY[ 1..100 ] OF STRING; [[BR]]numPopUpValues : INTEGER;[[BR]]i : INTEGER;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] {create new record}[[BR]] NewField( 'Format-1', 'FieldNamePopUp', '22222', 17, 0 );[[BR]][[BR]] arrayText[1] := '11111';[[BR]] arrayText[2] := '22222';[[BR]] arrayText[3] := '33333';[[BR]] [[BR]] {add new popup values to FieldNamePopUp}[[BR]] PopupSetChoices( 'Format-1', 'FieldNamePopUp', arrayText );[[BR]][[BR]] {get popup values and print them}[[BR]] PopupGetChoices( 'Format-1', 'FieldNamePopUp', numPopUpValues, CurPopUpInfo );[[BR]] [[BR]] FOR i:=1 TO numPopUpValues DO[[BR]] BEGIN[[BR]] AlertInform ( CurPopUpInfo[ i ], '', FALSE );[[BR]] END;[[BR]] [[BR]] {clear popUp values}[[BR]] {NewField( 'Format-1', 'FieldNamePopUp', '22222', 17, 0 );}[[BR]]END;[[BR]][[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] ForEachObjectInLayer(TestFunc, 0, 0, 4);[[BR]][[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: recName
Param.Desc: Name of record to which field will be added.

Item.Name: MirrorN
Item.Description: Reflect an object across an axis.[[BR]][[BR]]For a 2D reflection, the axis is a line containing arbitrary point p and extending along vector v.[[BR]][[BR]]The difference with Mirror, when preserveMatrix is set to true, is that this function preserves the matrix of the objects that have one, which leads to better visual results.
Item.ShortDesc: Mirrors a 2D object by multiplying the mirror matrix with the original matrix.
Item.Result: The reflected object (this will be the same as the input object if dup is false).

Param.Name: dup
Param.Desc: If false, transform the original object to the new position. If true, create a new object

Param.Name: p1
Param.Desc: An arbitrary point on the mirror axis

Param.Name: p2
Param.Desc: A second arbitrary point on the mirror axis

Param.Name: preserveMatrix
Param.Desc: When this parameter is set to false, then this function works exactly the same as Mirror. Otherwise, objects that have matrices, such as Symbols and PIOs, get their matrices updated correctly with the mirror matrix, leading to better visual results.

Item.Name: ObjSurfAreaInWorldC
Item.Description: Function [[name]] calculates the surface area of the referenced solid object. The function supports only valid solids objects.
Item.ShortDesc: Calculates the surface area of the referenced solid. The value will be in WorldCoords (sq mm).
Item.Comments: Calculates the surface area the given object if a valid solid.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] volume, area: REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] IF FSActLayer <> NIL THEN BEGIN[[BR]] volume := CalcVolume(FSActLayer);[[BR]] area := ObjSurfaceAreaInWorldCoord(FSActLayer);[[BR]] Message('Volume ', volume, ', surface area ', area);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Item.Name: IsResourceReferenced
Item.Description: Returns whether a resource is workgroup referenced, and if so, the path to the source document is returned.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns whether a resource is workgroup referenced, and if so, the path to the source document is returned.
Item.Result: Returns true if the resource is referenced, false otherwise.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE DoIt(h :HANDLE);[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] pathname: STRING;[[BR]] isref: BOOLEAN;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] isref := IsResourceReferenced(h, pathname);[[BR]] IF (isref) THEN Message(pathname);[[BR]]END;

Param.Name: pathname
Param.Desc: On return, a string containing the path to the source document

Item.Name: CreateDataVisPDMenu
Item.Description: Creates a Layout Manager data visualization pull down menu control.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a Layout Manager data visualization pull down menu control.

Param.Name: widthInStdChar
Param.Desc: The width of the displayed text in standard character count. See GetDlgCtrlWidthStdCh.

Item.Name: AddStoryLevelN
Item.Description: Adds a new Story Layer to the Story pointed to by 'storyHandle'. There must not be another story level in this story that matches 'levelType' or 'elevation', or the function will fail. If the layer 'layerName' already exists, it will be associated with the new Story Level.
Item.ShortDesc: Adds a Story Level to the specified Story.
Item.Result: Whether the new Story Level was created and added.

Param.Name: storyHandle
Param.Desc: The handle of the story that the new level should be added to.

Param.Name: levelType
Param.Desc: The level type of the new Story Level. This cannot be blank.

Param.Name: elevation
Param.Desc: The elevation of the new Story Level in the story. The elevation is in document units.

Param.Name: layerName
Param.Desc: The name of the layer to associate with the new Story Level. This is optional.

Item.Name: CreateLevelTemplateN
Item.Description: Creates a Story Level Template in the current file. Sets the index parameter to the index of the new template in the list of templates. Story Levels contain a level type, elevation, and optional layer to be used to bound objects on stories; Story Level Templates define a generic level that can be added to multiple stories.
Item.ShortDesc: Creates a new Story Level Template.
Item.Result: Whether the Story Level Template was successfully created.

Param.Name: layerName
Param.Desc: The layer name for the new Story Level Template. This can be blank, meaning that layers will not be created for instances of the new Story Level Template.

Param.Name: scaleFactor
Param.Desc: The scale factor for the (optional) layer associated with this Story Level Template.

Param.Name: levelType
Param.Desc: The level type for the new Story Level Template. There may be multiple Story Level Templates with the same level type, as long as they have different elevations.

Param.Name: elevation
Param.Desc: The elevation of the Story Level Template, relative to the height of the story in which the level is used. The elevation is in document units.

Param.Name: wallHeight
Param.Desc: The wall height for (optional) layers created when using this Story Level Template in a Story. The wall height is in document units. If the layer name is empty, this parameter is unused.

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: After the function is called, this parameter contains the index of the new Story Level Template.

Item.Name: GetLayerElevationN
Item.Description: Gets the elevation and thickness of the specified layer in document units.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the elevation and thickness of the specified layer.
Item.Example: PROCEDURE Example;[[BR]]VAR[[BR]] h :HANDLE; [[BR]] baseElev, thickness :REAL;[[BR]]BEGIN[[BR]] h := FLayer;[[BR]] WHILE h <> NIL DO BEGIN[[BR]] GetLayerElevationN(h, baseElev, thickness);[[BR]] thickness := thickness / (25.4 / GetPrefReal(152));[[BR]] AlrtDialog(Concat('layer name: ', GetLName(h), ', baseElev: ', baseElev, ', thickness: ', thickness));[[BR]] h := NextLayer(h);[[BR]] END;[[BR]]END;[[BR]]RUN(Example);

Param.Name: baseElev
Param.Desc: Base elevation of the layer in document units.

Param.Name: thickness
Param.Desc: Thickness of the layer in document units.

Item.Name: SetLayerElevationN
Item.Description: Sets the elevation and thickness of the specified layer.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the elevation and thickness of the specified layer.

Param.Name: baseElev
Param.Desc: Base elevation of the layer in document units.

Param.Name: thickness
Param.Desc: Thickness of the layer in document units.

Item.Name: GetStoryElevationN
Item.Description: Returns the elevaton of the indicated Story. The elevation is in document units.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the elevaton of the indicated Story.
Item.Result: The elevation of the Story in document units.

Param.Name: story
Param.Desc: The Story whose elevation is desired.

Item.Name: SetStoryElevationN
Item.Description: Sets the elevation of the indicated Story. Returns whether the elevation was successfully set. If the elevaton change would cause Layers associated with the Story to overlap Layers associated with another Story, then the change in elevation will be prevented.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the elevation of the indicated Story.
Item.Result: Whether the elevation is successfully changed.

Param.Name: story
Param.Desc: The Story whose elevation is to be set.

Param.Name: elevation
Param.Desc: The elevation to set the Story to. The elevation is in document units.

Item.Name: GetLevelElevationN
Item.Description: Gets the elevation of a Story Level, relative to its containing Story. The elevation is in document units.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the elevation of a Story Level, relative to its containing Story.
Item.Result: The elevation of the requested Story Level in document units.

Param.Name: storyHandle
Param.Desc: The handle of the Story containing the Story Level we would like to know the elevation of.

Param.Name: levelType
Param.Desc: The level type of the Story Level that we would like to know the elevation of.

Item.Name: SetLevelElevationN
Item.Description: Sets the elevation of a Story Level relative to its Story.
Item.ShortDesc: Sets the elevation of a Story Level relative to its Story.
Item.Result: Whether the Story Level was found and successfully updated.

Param.Name: storyHandle
Param.Desc: The handle of the Story with the desired Story Level.

Param.Name: levelType
Param.Desc: The level type of the Story Level to change the elevation of.

Param.Name: newElevation
Param.Desc: The new elevation for the Story Level. The elevation is in document units.

Item.Name: GetLevelTmpltInfoN
Item.Description: Used to access the properties of the Story Level Template at 'index'. The name, scaleFactor, levelType, elevation, and wallHeight parameters of the requested Story Level Template will be returned in the appropriate parameters.
Item.ShortDesc: Gets the details of the Story Level Template at 'index'.
Item.Result: Whether the Story Level Template at 'index' was found and valid.
Item.SeeAlso: GetNumLevelTemplates, GetLevelTemplateName, SetLevelTemplateName, CreateLevelTemplateN, DeleteLevelTemplate, GetLevelTemplateInfoN

Param.Name: index
Param.Desc: The index of the desired Story Level Template.

Param.Name: layerName
Param.Desc: The layer name associated with the Story Level Template at 'index'. If this is empty, the corresponding Story Level Template does not use or create a layer.

Param.Name: scaleFactor
Param.Desc: The scale of the layer associated with the Story Level Template at 'index'. If this layer name is blank, this parameter has no use.

Param.Name: levelType
Param.Desc: The level type of the Story Level Template at 'index'.

Param.Name: elevation
Param.Desc: The elevation of the Story Level Template at 'index'. The elevation is in document units.

Param.Name: wallHeight
Param.Desc: The wall height of the Story Level Template at 'index'. The wall height is in document untis. If the layer name is blank, this parameter has no meaning.

Item.Name: HideSelectedObjects
Item.Description: Sets the object visibility of all selected objects to "invisible". Hidden objects can be made visible with Show or UnHideObjects commands.
Item.ShortDesc: Makes all selected objects invisible.

Item.Name: UnHideObjects
Item.Description: Changes the object visibility to "visible" for all objects hidden with Hide, HideSelectedObjects and ShowOnlySelected commands. The object will only become visible if it is also on a visible layer and class.
Item.ShortDesc: Unhides all previously hidden objects.

Item.Name: ShowOnlySelected
Item.Description: Sets the object visibility of all unselected objects to "invisible". Hidden objects can be made visible with Show or UnHideObjects commands.
Item.ShortDesc: Makes all unselected objects invisible.

Item.Name: IsLocked
Item.Description: Returns is the object locked for edit.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns is the object locked for edit.
Item.Result: Returns is the object locked.

Item.Name: ReplaceText
Item.Description: Procedure ReplaceText replace the oldText with the newText of the referenced text object.
Item.ShortDesc: Replace the oldText with the newText.

Param.Name: replaceAll
Param.Desc: Flag whether to replace all oldTexts or first found text.

Param.Name: isCaseSens
Param.Desc: Flag whether to be case sensitive.

Item.Name: GetModifierFlags
Item.Description: Returns the state of option/alt, cmd/ctrl, shift keys.
Item.ShortDesc: Returns the state of option/alt, cmd/ctrl, shift keys.
Item.Result: Returns the state of option/alt, cmd/ctrl, shift keys.

Param.Name: optionFlag
Param.Desc: The state of the option/alt key.

Param.Name: cmdFlag
Param.Desc: The state of the cmd/ctrl key.

Param.Name: shiftFlag
Param.Desc: The state of the shift key.

Item.Name: RefreshResManager
Item.Description: Procedure [[name]] updates the Resource manager palette. It refreshes Libraries specified by the parameters.
Item.ShortDesc: Updates the Resource manager.

The coordinate origin (0,0) of a custom dialog box is the top left corner of the dialog box pane with x values increasing to the right, and y values increasing in a down direction.

The string passed into the parameter name argument should use the parameter constant syntax, not the actual parameter name. The string should have the prefix character 'P', and should have all spaces replaced with underscore characters. For example, a parameter Jamb Depth would have a constant declared as PJAMB_DEPTH and therefore the parameter name argument to this function should be the string 'PJAMB_DEPTH'.

Note.Text:
If the filename includes a fully qualified path, the path has to use the appropriate notation for the local operating system:
[[BR]]Macintosh HD:Applications:Vectorworks:Plug-Ins:Data:Notes.txt[[BR]]C:\Program Files\Vectorworks\Plug-Ins\Data\Notes.txt[[BR]]If the filename includes a path relative to the location of the Vectorworks executable, the subfolder delimiters have to be backslashes:
[[BR]]Plug-Ins\Data\Notes.txt[[BR]]If the filename does not include a path, the file is assumed to exist in the same folder as the Vectorworks executable.
Fill patterns and their associated constants can be found in the VectorScript Appendix.[[BR]]

Calculating the Scale

[[BR]]To calculate the scale parameter from an architecural scale, the following formula may be used :

[[BR]][[BR]]

denominator/numerator * true size(in inches) = ActualSize

[[BR]][[BR]]For example, to calculate a scale of 3/8"=1'-0", the scale parameter would be 8/3 *12 = 32.[[BR]]
Please refer to the VectorScript Appendix for specific tool ID values.[[BR]]
Note.Comment: Table of identifiers for SetTool and CallTool(TDEF resource IDs)
